An interesting thing happens when people ask for restaurant recommendations in the Castro:  They're steered away from Castro Street itself and you can see them pointing back down the street with a questioning look on their face saying "nothing in that direction?"  

Nothing in that direction.  

Starbelly fills a void in the 'hood that's seemingly missing from Castro Street itself.  Brunch, lunch, and dinner are served 7-days per week (though not round-the-clock) in an upscale, "now" environment.  Think light wood furnishings, a menu written entirely in lower case font, and plates featuring Prather Ranch burgers, Little Gem salads, dishes with added aged-cheddar, and house-pickled jalapeños.  The fact that you recognize this menu as being from the time we live in is what distinguishes it from some other open-all day places directly on Castro.  

At any time I'd say the place to dine here is the back patio.  In fact, for a recent weekday lunch I walked through an essentially empty restaurant to reach that attractive (and packed) al fresco spot.  On a beautiful day, everything will look better from here.  

My waiter approached with big, full bottles of still and sparkling water and my table opted for both.  I was relieved to learn that there was no upsell here.  Even sparkling water, which they apparently carbonate themselves on-site, was provided free of charge. 

My salad (Bibb lettuce, grilled chicken, bacon, cherry tomatoes, & green goddess dressing, $13) was presented beautifully and was well-priced for a filling lunchtime meal in such an attractive setting.  Could the salad have benefited from crispier bacon and more ample and flavorful dressing?  It could have, but the fact that it didn't wasn't a dealbreaker.

I think that Starbelly is a great (though far from recent) addition to the neighborhood: Good food, reasonable pricing, free and ample sparkling water.  When people ask, I will happily and confidently point them away from Castro Street and towards Starbelly's patio for an enjoyable experience.
author: Tracey A.

description: Best fried chicken sandwich in town! Served with jalapeño and coleslaw.  Great beer on top as well!
author: Michelle G.

description:
It is difficult to pick ONE PLACE to be your favorite brunch spot in San Francisco but Starbelly is definitely in my top two! Their prices are a bit high but the unique quality of the cuisine is worth the price. Every person I've taken here has raved about their food. 

This is a GREAT LOCATION for large parties. 

Also, this moved to the top of my list recently when I found out they actually TAKE RESERVATIONS for brunch?! On Sundays!!! 

And their adorable chalkboard always warrants a photo for the check-in! 

Now, just trying not to eat here every.single.weekend. is the only problem:)
author: Clyde V.

description:
Do not arrive here at 3:45 because though the Lunch menu says it goes until 5, it does not.  There is apparently a "fine print" button to click called the "afternoon menu" and it is heavily abbreviated. 
I was so absolutely disappointed.  I had researched the reviews and had an idea what I wanted but they were on the lunch menu and not on the afternoon snack menu.  So I left.  Scour their site before coming because I missed it and am left jilted because the lunch menu did not go to 5 like the site said it would.
author: Mich B.

description: Just ordered from Starbelly...Brown lettuce.. $13 salad for this? What a joke! Also asked for dressing on the side.... sopping! Didn't eat because um I don't want to get sick! Also the French fries were clearly from two days ago and re heated. You would think a salad and fries wouldn't go wrong...
author: Kaitlyn B.

description:
Happy stars in my belly! This place was so great in many levels - good price, takes reservations, good service, fair portions, delicious cocktails and scrumptious food!


We ordered the patê (def recommend), salumi platter, Brussels sprouts (hell yes!) and the starbelly salad. Things tasted pretty fresh and the ambiance was nice.
author: Juliana P.

description: This place is pretty cool nice music which create good vibes! Oh and the food is excellent
author: Marvin E.

description: Incredible food and service! They helped me arrange a surprise breakfast brunch for my dad's birthday and made him feel special. Thanks again for the great food!!!
author: Maya L.

description:
My friend and I came here today for brunch after our SoulCycle class. Both of us were starving and were really happy that we got in without a wait. We did have to sit outside, but they have heaters so even in the misty San Francisco morning, we were not freezing. The inside space looked really cute so hopefully we can sit there next time.

Now for the food. The one thing we noticed is that there were very few non-meat items on their brunch menu which, for my friend who doesn't eat red meat, left her with only 2 real options. I was really craving a salad but Starbelly's 3 salad options seemed very plain and not worth the money. We both ended up ordering the Italian Eggs ($14) and my friend had the Lavender Lemonade ($4). It took about 20 minutes for us to get our food, which was fine but if we had waited much longer, I think we would have started to eat the table. 

The eggs were really good. They were served on top of a marinara sauce with zucchini and 2 pieces of toasted bread. The portion was the right amount of food-not too big and not too small. We both really enjoyed it and would order it again. My friend also enjoyed her lemonade. With tax and tip, the meal came out to ~$40 which is a little high but still doable. Overall, I would come back but I cannot say I would rave about this meal to anyone.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Ambience: This place is a cute open indoors with high ceilings and a pretty big patio space. I was pretty hesitant to sit outside since it was cloudy and rainy day but there was enough heaters to keep the place warm. Plus, the noise level was not issue and it wasn't too loud.

Customer service:  We waited about 15 min to sit at our table even though the hostess quoted about 45 minutes. The waitress didn't have that much of a light-hearted spirit but rather was there just to take our order and leave. She didn't really check back on us every now and then. So when we needed her for something it took, like what felt like 10 minutes, to flag her down. Our beer and sangria came after our actual meals arrived. 

Food: We had the fries and trio dip (2 special sauces and just plain ketchup) the fries were well cooked and crispy. The actual cut of the fries were short and small.  I definitely got my fingers wet. The special sauces were really delicious though. I ordered the chilaquiles for my entree which wasn't bad. I had a side of runny eggs over it which was worth with the extra $5. My boyfriend has the mushroom, onion, gruyere cheese pizza. Good large portion. It was a pretty tasty pizza. I'm not sure if it's the cheese or the actual pizza but it tasted a little salty for me but my boyfriend enjoyed it. The sangria was on the stronger side and you can definitely taste the alcohol than the sweetness. I definitely wouldn't mind coming back to try the dinner menu.
author: Carleen C.

description:
Outdoor/covered patio? +10 points just for that.

My faves here are:

Fries with dipping sauce trio

Spaghetti, no bacon. Fresh jalapeño, al dente amazingness, tomato sauce, basil, Grana Padano. YUM.

I had the warm toffee cake with mascarpone and medjool dates the last time I dropped in for lunch. WOW.

Green tea. You get your own little French press action. Pour away. 

For brunch, I've enjoyed the pizzas (solid) and the chilaquiles (nice take on the original).

Service is great.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
I got here on a Monday right around noon and it was pretty empty, or maybe everyone was in the back, but I got seated immediately for two. The vibe is unassuming and quite nice. Service was quick right at the beginning, but when we needed to look the menu over a bit longer, it felt like we were forgotten about for a while and had to actively wave someone down to order. 

I ordered the chilaquiles. It was served with a side house salad which was good as a side. Simple, and easy. The chilaquiles were quite good. A nice crunch a covered in flavor, though I did kinda want more sour cream everywhere or maybe a lime as it could've used a bit more acidity. Still quite good. 
I had a taste of my friend's Loco moco and it was a very interesting play on the Hawaiian dish. The sauce (usually gravy) was light and tangy. It caught me off guard, so I'm not sure if I really liked the variation. Honestly the burger patty wasn't that impressive either. 

All in all, a good experience. Not the best brunch in town, but at least the food was sold and there was no wait at all.
author: Bryant C.

description:
We started out with :TWO" orders of the house-made **Chicken Liver Pâté, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard. The birthday girls said she could just eat one herself. One for her and 1 for the 6 other girls. haha! It was super yummy. Very seasoned and smooth. Really enjoy my meal here. Service was good and the atmosphere was cozy. Reservation recommended. Outside seating available with heating lamps. 

The others small plates we got was their **pan roasted black mussels, Mexican chorizo, market chili & cilantro. I'm not a big fan of mussels but the broth was to die for. I use their bread to soak up the broth. YUM! I'm a french fries lover therefore we got an order of the **house cut fries & three dips and a salad, **regular green salad with cheese. The fries was pretty good, crispy. 

As for entress, their fresh spaghetti is the best i ever had. Its different, not traditional. With their starbelly bacon, jalapeño, tomato sauce, basil & shaved grana. It's so freaken DELICIOUS!!. The jalapenos and bacon gave it an amazing taste, full of flavor. We ordered 2 pizzas, their **starbelly bacon, jalapeño, arugula & green goddess dressing. Taste like the pasta. Still pretty good. Thin crust and crispy. The arugula added a good fresh touch to it. We also order the **market mushrooms, cave aged gruyere, thyme & roasted onions. I really like this one. Not as much savory taste but i like the way its different mushrooms. Different not a tomato base pizza. My vegetarian friend got their **veggie burger, dried pea & quinoa patty, cucumbers, white bean puree, LTO & curry yogurt. She said it was good. Lots of flavor to her burger.
author: Sandy B.

description: Cute cute cute place on Market in SF. I ate the cauliflower with yogurt as an appetizer, first time I've ever had that and it was delish! Also tried the fried with dipping sauces which were pretty good as well. I ordered the mushroom pizza which was amazing! So tasty and the extra crispy crust was nice although there was more crust than pizza on some slices it seemed. I sampled a few bites of pasta which they make in house, it was tasty as well! Definitely recommend this place.
author: Stacie S.

description: Had brunch with friends on Sunday, must say was very delicious. I got the Sunnyside Joes platter and a glass of OJ. The meal was really good just the right size and the freshly squeezed OJ was arguably the best juice I've drank. A friend had ordered the loco moco and ordered his beef patty medium but while eating is was quite evident the meat was undercooked. The waitress kindly took the meal back and brought out a fresh plate cooked to perfection. Overall a great dining experience with good food and friendly staff. We sat outside on a beautiful day which was really nice. Great place would recommend to anyone looking for a delicious brunch
author: Peter L.

description:
I have been for lunch and dinner and both are equally amazing. This review is for their restaurant week lunch menu. What a deal! Got the charcuterie platter, I do believe this to be the best pate in the city, the friend chicken sandwich, and pot de creme dessert. Fried chicken sandwich was good, a tad on the dry side but close to perfect. Would have preferred a little more mayo since I am a sauce lover and the chicken wasn't ultra moist. The slaw included jalapeños and I must credit this restaurant for adding fresh jalapeños in the best way. They do this with their spaghetti on the dinner menu also  topping it with hunks of bacon. Honestly out of this world. 
Had two cocktails, the starbelly was heavy on the bubbles and the cactus blossom which was light and refreshing for a lunch cocktail. The dessert was caramel pot de creme with a ginger cookie. Honestly the meal was perfect with the appetizer pate platter and the sandwich, I could do without the dessert but all three courses were $25 for restaurant week, if you didn't take advantage of this tis tis tis.
author: Morgan S.

description:
This place broke my heart.

I fell completely in love with 1) the fact that you can make reservations and 2) the seriously cozy and adorable heated patio out back, but the food is just painfully mediocre. I enjoy the vast majority of food that I eat, but everything we ordered fell flat. 

Our party of three shared a small plate of burrata, a side of roasted garlic and brie mac and cheese, mushroom/gruyere pizza, and creamed spinach. I was expecting some pretty interesting flavors, but everything we had was incredibly bland, almost as though all of the flavors were intentionally tempered down.

I still think Starbelly is worth checking out--if only for the beautiful patio--but I can't say I was similarly impressed with the food.
author: Kelly R.

description: Dined here for brunch and they were super accommodating of my large group! The food and drinks were delicious - I had the fried chicken po'boy and it was outstanding. The covered patio is great. This is a prime brunch destination in Castro!
author: Ali W.

description:
It had been a while since I ate dinner at Starbelly, so I was really looking forward to the experience when I went for dinner this past Friday. And Starbelly did not disappoint - we had a fantastic meal! We started off with the Butternut Squash dumplings (which were divine!) and the White Bean Puree with the delicious flatbread. The crown course of the evening followed - Garlic Crab Noodles!!! These were delectable beyond compare - a perfect balance of rich, and buttery but not overpowering. Yum!

The ambience of the restaurant was perfect for a long catchup with a great friend, and our waitress Desiree equally as perfect! She was friendly, attentive and helpful with recommendations when we needed, all with a warm smile on her face. 

We definitely will be back!
author: David M.

description:
Dinner at Starbelly is a nice surprise. There isn't many places in SF that can accommodate a party of 10 or more - but Starbelly can, and some. 

The restaurant is elegant and modern - with an outdoorsy element to it. The food, drinks and staff were all friendly, informative and on point with the service. 

I got a reservation here for a party of 12-ish; was seated fairly quickly upon our arrival. 

The fries and the sauces that it came with really blew me away. It was intensely good. 



This place has the works: Great food and fairly cheap with Lots of good drink and beer selections, Plus can accommodate a large party. If you're in SF with a large party - Starbelly is the way to go.
author: -Johnson- N.

description: So delicious! My girls and I pow wowed here for lunch after a long over due catch up. We made reservations for 1pm Sunday, good thing we did, place was crowded and we were seated upon arriving on time :) service was great, staff super friendly and most importantly the food was delicious! I'm usually the one asking for bites off my friends plates and I can truly say everything was yummy! I ordered the fried chicken and waffles, juiciest chicken i've had in ages. Us gal pals will be returning very soon. You'd never really know this gem exists as its tucked away in the castro. Hunt it down and dine there, you won't regret it.
author: Parasto S.

description:
Starbelly is a great spot to grab dinner even on the weekends. Not always super crowded and waits aren't as long which is a great start.

They have great standard American comfort food. The burger is really good and comes with several optional toppings. Their pizzas are interesting as well. We had the roasted corn pizza and add chorizo to it. It was fantastic.

They don't actually have a full liquor license so they have a cocktail menu which is based on wines and beers. The cocktails are actually pretty good.

Definitely recommended!
author: Farid V.

description: the staff here was SOOOO friendly.  We came around 7p on a Saturday night and were seated on the patio right away.  It was pretty cold and we had to keep our winter jackets on but we survived.  Our waitress even brought me a cup of hot water just to hold to keep my hands warm, which was much appreciated.  We got the starbelly bacon pizza and the garlic crab noodles.  Both were to die for!!  Some of the best food we had all weekend in the city
author: Geena G.

description:
Starbelly isn't the best brunch (or dinner) in town, but with a varied, high quality menu that doesn't break the bank and lines that aren't out the door, I'm a fan. 

Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?

With a combination of long tables and more intimate pair seating both indoors and quasi-out, Starbelly is a great spot for brunch. Service is fast and friendly, and in this case my party of eight had a really great time even when we not so gracefully spilled mimosa all over the place (sorry). Star Granted. 

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

I'll admit I was a tad bit nervous upon sitting down that I'd be forking over $20+ for each entree, but my nerves were appeased when my Starbelly Bacon Pizza pictured below, which was quite substantial (enough for two) came to only $16.00. Other dishes were priced accordingly, and all in all there was good value all around. Star Granted. 

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

First and foremost: if you don't know, now you know that Arugula is the new Kale, and my Bacon (thick cut) and arugula pizza was very, very good. While initially a tad bit put off at the sheer quantity of arugula in the mix (take a look at the pic), whatever sauce was on this beezy turned it into a straight masterpiece, and the crunch of the bacon, the slight crunch of the arugula, and the softer crust and jalapenos for a kick came together in a great way. 

My smoked chicken and mushroom chowder was a bit less impressive (it all came across as being very segmented as opposed to a cohesive chowder, and the chicken didn't have much flavor), but all in all everyone in my group left happy and full. Single Star Granted. 

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

Again, Starbelly isn't what I would necessarily call elite in San Francisco, but it's so varied and consistently good that I honestly could come here daily. Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description:
Starbelly has delicious food, friendly and warm staff. Megan is always attentive and hardworking. Ian has all the best advice for my next comic to read. Becca knows all the best hiking trails. Greg is extremely knowledgeable with wines. Ben is excellent at local spots to catch the best films. Jasper is stylish and hip. Janina always makes me laugh. Bree is a seasoned pro at pairings. Dylan has a great taste in music. Desiree has the best makeup tips. Adam is the best day server and is by far the cutest man in the Castro. James is also cute and is also very attentive. Jose Luis is fabulous and also quite stylish. Jessica is stylish as well as funny. Chloe is a sweetheart and is a mind reader of sorts. Angilee, Janelle, and Alana are all amazing hosts. Ashleigh is very nice and also knows a lot about where the best dance classes are. Saul, Jose, and Felipe are a force to be reckoned with as help staff. Overall I have to say. Each person at Starbelly is an outstanding human being and a hard worker. 

Don't forget the patio! :)
author: Seanna L.

description:
Starbelly is getting only 1 star! For the (sudden) courteousness by the table host. And that's about it!!

The food was ok, nothing extraordinary. The Butternut squash pizza was tasteless, served (read as over dosed) with pine nuts. The fries were ok.

The water glasses had rim stains.

The worst of all - a about 4" long black rat scurried back and forth by the vertical garden, in the back patio area, almost slipped on to the shoulder of my friend due to the overgrown succulents!!!!

Even the table hostess saw this cause she was taking our order. Somehow, right after, she seated us inside (cause we would have shrieked if Mr. Rat went by for the third time)!!!! 

No apologies were offered. No courtesies were extended. Nada! 

We are never going back there!
author: Me Iz S.

description: This is the only halfway decent place to eat in the Castro.  It's especially good if you want small plates vs. a full meal. I had the homemade tomato soup with a small grilled cheese and it was perfect. Atmosphere is lively. Servers are very nice and gave a nice wine recommendation.  They serve beer and wine only, so if you crave a classic cocktail you won't find it here, although they come up with some interesting concoctions. Would definitely come back after seeing a movie at the Castro Theatre.
author: Dina J.

description: One of my go-to SF restaurants. Always fresh, delicious food, and great service. Great if you have a lot of vegetarians in your group too.
author: Cindy M.

description: Amazing service very nice server and house manager. Burger was good and salted caramel mousse with rosemary biscuits was a well put together dessert full of sweet and savory.
author: Corey K.

description: Great service and friendly atmosphere.  I ordered the cheeseburger and wanted it medium and but came out fairly medium rare. I'm not the biggest fan of a soggy bun. But other than that, an overall good experience.
author: Rene N.

description:
As many of the Yelpers have mentioned, Starbelly is a place where you feel like you've got your money's worth. and more.

I came to Starbelly during SF's restaurant week. The place was listed as one of the restaurants where you get the most value, and its easy to see why. The $15 lunch menu is a three course meal. 

Appetizer:
House made chicken liver pate ($10) or starbelly salad ($7)

Entree:
Fried chicken po'boy ($10) or mixed Mediterranean plate (normally $15)
 
Dessert: 
Salted caramel pot de creme and cornmeal rosemary cookie ($6)

I choose the chicken liver pate, mediterranean plate, and salted caramel pot de creme. I would strongly recommend picking this combination. The portions were huge and the food was quite delicious. It wasn't the best meal I had but for the price and the quality, Starbelly absolutely deserves 4 stars. The pate was my favorite part of the meal. Service was excellent. 

I don't think reservations are at all necessary although it would only take about two minutes to make one.
author: Nicole J.

description: Great vibes and decor in this place.  The dumplings were delicious but very small/overpriced.  The starbelly bacon and arugula pizza was amazing--highly recommend ! A lot of the tables are so close together it's practically communal style, so don't count on being able to have a private conversation.  Good date night!
author: Mariah S.

description: Came here for a company dinner and I had a really good time. The servers were great and I really like the lay back atmosphere of the spot. I tried several dishes while I was here and they were all very good. I had the steak which was really good and tasty. We had salad and French fries with several dips. I also tried the cat fish which was absolutely fantastic! Topped it all off with spaghetti with bacon that was just a perfect pairing. All this with some wine and it was a night to remember. I would definitely come back to this spot in the future with my girlfriend.
author: James R.

description: Awesome location with a good wine menu. Sitting outside on the back patio is a must. Great food and good service.
author: Wade W.

description:
First time experience here at Starbelly! And oh mylanta .. SPAGHETTI is a must try!
Despite the heat and no AC, I still enjoyed my dinner!
author: Mare C.

description:
Ah yes, Starbelly. The very fact that it is now one of the longest standing/operating restaurants (under the same name) is a testament unto itself. Finding a decent restaurant in The Castro is a chore. One can literally count the good ones on ONE HAND - if you highlight those creating dishes that are truly "crave-able" there are fewer. 
Starbelly always has seating, and the meal doesn't disappoint. They have a decent wine list and a great beer menu. This is usually the preference of my "vegan friends." There are quite a few #yummy vegan items from which to choose.
author: Nick S.

description: Wonderful wonderful chilaquiles and a perfectly strong mimosa to pair ! Cute atmosphere, great service, delicious food. This place is an easy pick and a must come back.
author: Rachel P.

description:
This was the first time I tried SF restaurant week and I picked Starbelly because it had such a good deal. A three course lunch for only $15!! What a steal! 

I didn't realize this restaurant was only a block away from Ike's and kitchen story, so I never noticed it before. It didn't look too fancy from the outside, but once you walk in you notice that there's an outside in the inside! What I mean to say is that as you walk towards the back of the restaurant, they have this greenhouse part to the restaurant. I definitely recommend sitting outside. The design of the exterior made you feel just at home. It definitely gave off a comfortable feeling.

The water came in cool wine bottles. The first dish I had was the chicken liver pate. It was different from what I had expected and experienced as chicken liver before. However, it was paired very well with grain mustard. Next, was the chicken po'boy. The veggies were a bit more bitter than expected but the fried chicken was very good. Last, of course, was their famous salted caramel pot de creme. I didn't know what I was expecting but this definitely exceeded my expectations. It is basically a salted caramel flavored creme brûlée paired with a ginger snap cookie. I'm not a big fan of ginger but it helped with the sweetness of the pot de creme. It was the perfect dessert that just melts in your mouth leaving you wanting more.

I'm not sure if I would get all three plates when it's not restaurant week anymore because of the price, but I would definitely come back again for the food.
author: Tina P.

description: This place is a hidden gem; such great ambience and staff! High quality food, innovative drinks are worth a try.
author: Nikita A.

description: Food was great! We had the spaghetti with bacon and jalapeño, and the burger. Presentation was stellar. Warm, cozy ambiance and friendly staff! Would definitely come back!
author: Eyes O.

description:
Kind and efficient service. We were with a crowd of people celebrating a show. The restaurant did their best to accommodate my husband and I. ( the only vegans) with flatbread and white bean hummus that  was bland and unappealing and Undressed salad, almost bare pizza, with tasteless crust, and my husband said his pasta tasted like chef boyardee from a can. 
Disappointed.
author: GiGi a.

description: We went without booking a table and were seated immediately. The design of the place is really nice. We got a pizza and the sunnyside joe eggs. I don't really understand why we can't swipe the potatoes for fried instead...but well...went with it. Overall it was good. The pizza could have used a little more cheese and the potatoes some salt. Good brunch place.
author: Morea P.

description: Such an amazing rest. Hipster decor and music. Starbelly pizza is a must. Michelada was meh. Got there without reservation on a sat night and they were cool and got table right away.
author: Yunel A.

description: Awesome food. Awesome service. Beautiful  restaurant. This is something that should not be missed in the Castro district. Much love and care taken in this restaurant. Thanks all.
author: Dr. Skip H.

description:
Came here for a Saturday evening dinner with my girlfriend. This is definitely a place to book a reservation for, it was really busy throughout the night! Our table took a long time to get ready, our reservation was at 7:30pm but at 8 we still were not seated. Thankfully the manager on duty was very attentive and once the table was ready sat us immediately and sent us a complimentary appetizer for the wait! We were able to sit outside which I loved. 

The food was pretty good overall! Started with the white bean purée that came with grilled flatebread. Probably the second best thing I had that night. Flavor was great and the flatbread was fresh and fluffy, highly recommend this dish!
Next we ate burrata di Stefano. The dish was not what I expected but none the less it was great! Also recommend this dish.
Last on our appetizers was the complementary chicken liver pâté. It was free so no complaints here! Not sure if I would order it normally but my gf really enjoyed it.

For our entrees we decided to go with 2 pizzas!
Starbelly Pizza no question you HAVE to get this if you come here or you did yourself a disservice. Ton of bacon, covered in arugula, spice of the jalapeño all topped off by the tasty dressing, favorite part of my meal.
Market mushroom pizza, cannot say this is something I would get again. It had such a bold butter flavor that was hard for me to get past. Very salty as well. Not sure if it was strange going back and forth from starbelly pizza to this but I had one slice and did not want anymore of it unfortunately. Reheated it at home the next day and still unfortunately didn't do it for me even being a huge mushroom fan.

Overall I would recommend it! Other than some seating mishaps and the mushroom pizza I had a pleasant evening and went home full and happy, can't ask for more.
author: Josue V.

description: So many things to rave about for Starbelly. We went for lunch and everything was perfect and exceeded our expectations. Service was great, patio seating was wonderful, food was fantastic. Go here, you won't regret it. The spaghetti with bacon is delicious and the Mediterranean plate is refreshing and filling. Will definitely be back!
author: Lauren W.

description: The pizzas are really good! I always look forward to sharing a couple of different kinds with my husband. They serve both sparkling and regular water out of wine bottles...very nice touch! This restaurant is definitely a slow social experience meant for an afternoon of chatting and catching up with old friends so don't be in a rush!
author: Ryan W.

description:
My boyfriend and I came to this place after seeing a picture on Instagram of their fried chicken and waffle! He is a huge fried chicken fan so we decided to stop by this place on our day off together. The location is in the Castro area, since it was a weekday parking wasn't too shabby.

We decided to sit in their back patio where all the other people were because it was a beautiful sunny afternoon! We ordered the chicken and waffles of course (too bad they didn't have dark meat, only breast meat) and the Starbelly pizza topped with arugula and their green goddess sauce! We def made the write choices because the food was awesome! Two entrees were good enough for us since we wanted to explore other eateries. Will come back for more!
author: Alice Z.

description: Awesome food and a great patio for larger brunch groups. Everything here was good quality and the location is great for a day enjoying the Castro.
author: Brenna L.

description:
Made a reservation for 2 @6.30pm on Friday. When we arrived we were walked through the half empty restaurant and taken to a table outside. Yes they have heaters but on Friday it was in the low 30°s and it was super cold. We asked if we could sit inside and we were told no as all the tables were reserved... hold on... but we too had reserved!?! 
If you want to come here,  be warned,  they seem to think its fine to reserve you a table outside in freezing temperatures, without mentioning it at the time of booking. 
Oh.... but instead of an apology, you do get offered a 'glass of hot water ' as a way to keep warm!?!? Seriously. 
I suggest some of the staff need to be sent back for some refresh customer service training. The food quality has significantly dropped too.
Just lost a long term customer.
author: Chris L.

description:
I always seem to be the happiest when I'm in the beautiful city . To me, San Francisco is not only liberal, but also a judgement free zone , a place where you can find amazing and unique types of cuisine, and a place where you can experience winter during the summertime . 

One of my favorite places would have to be star belly . Sure, it can easily be mistaken for a place only hipsters would go to but, trust me! The food will distract you and put you in a daze . 

The first time I had it was when we got into town pretty late and my cousin wanted to take us out for a late dinner.  She raved about how she and her gfs often go there during lunch breaks and how the docs way burger was featured on a food network show . Mm burgers always sound like a good idea ! 

We arrived around 10 P.M. with no sight of a packed restaurant . That's always a good sign, imo. We got seated right away, and were given sparkling waters upon request . Believe it or not, sparkling water really clears the palette better than regular agua :) after seeing their drink menu , I was really intrigued by their lavender lemonade . I don't think I could ever get tired of lavender . It's in my diffuser at home , it puts me in a relaxed mood, and thanks to Starbelly it's one of my favorite drinks ! We all shared a kale Caesar and bacon pizza to start . The reason why it took me so long to review this place is because I was in food heaven this whole time and just recently came back . Sorry, guys ! 

Let me just say that you can never go wrong with the menu items that contain " bacon jalapeño " here at Starbelly . The pizza contains a tasty red sauce , bacon , cheese, and fresh arugula sprinkled on top . A for presentation and a plus for the taste . All of that yummy stuff sat on a thin cracker crust which allows you to soak up all the great flavors of the toppings instead of getting too overwhelmed if it were to have a thick doughy crust . They definitely compliment each other like colors ;) The kale Caesar wasn't too heavy as they were pretty easy on the dressing and cheese . Their dressing is made in house and they use Dino kale ! Pretty fresh and vibrant . My boyfriend ordered the docs way burger and it did not disappoint whatsoever ! I was able to take a bite and understand why it was featured on television. The duck pate on the burger is out of this world ! MUST. TRY.!  

Review PT 2: 

Just last night , my friends from the city wanted to catch up and have a celebratory dinner for my friend and I. ( it was my friends one year post brain surgery anniversary and my 3 week post surgery anniversary ) it was my turn to choose where to eat so, I chose star belly ! Making a reservation for 7 was quick and easy . We immediately got seated and Annie, our server took our drink orders right away . After raving about their lavender lemonade, my girls decided to order it that night .

Since my picky little cousins joined us too, we ordered the house cut fries appetizer for them, and a customized pizza . Something very close to a pepperoni pizza, please ! No problem at all, they were able to do it :) My boyfriend and I were still very full from off the grid so we ended up sharing a kale Caesar and bacon jalapeño spaghetti . According to Rodney H, their spaghetti is famous lol . Those spaghetti noodles were cooked to al dente perfection ! That dish is tdf! Oh so warm and comforting ! I was in all " mmmmmms." That night . My friend ordered it too and had the same feelings about it . 

After inhaling all our delicious meals, we had a sweet tooth and decided on ordering three types of dessert to share . We opted for : warm toffee cake, a scoop of the secret breakfast ice cream, and the rice pudding . The toffee cake won my heart that night . As my friends said " it was an orgasmic virginal experience " whoops! Inappropriate! Lol the secret breakfast was divine ! I'd have it for breakfast every morning if I could . The rice pudding was rich, creamy, and tart from the cherries . It was a very comforting dish . We ended up all leaving with smiles on our faces and parties in our tummys. Thanks for the night to remember , belly of a star !
author: Monica C.

description: Their outside area is great for sitting even on gloomy cold days. It's heated and covered, so you feel like you're inside. They are accommodating for large crowds, especially in the outside dining area. Four stars because they were out of a few things at prime brunch time on a Sunday and our server seemed to not be very knowledgable on the menu. Would come back again, but now know what to expect.
author: Samantha E.

description: Our group of four were unimpressed with all of the food  - pizza, burgers, etc. It took 50 minutes for our food to come out. Service was only ok. Disappointed because when I was last there, a few years back, it was a good experience and I enjoy this group of restaurants.
author: Vicki L.

description:
If you check out the below, I really do love this place but I loved this place more before. I don't think it's a bad place, but in the recent times I haven't had as an amazing time as I did before. 

The last time I came here, it looked like our main server was being shadowed by someone new or something, it would have been nice to know since randomly there would be a lady behind him. 

Food was good but just as not pretty played as I'd remembered it being. Not a bad thing, but I like to eat pretty food. 

Overall, still one of my favorite places to go to in the Castro, just now making food at home is just good sometimes. 

Pro tip: check out my previous reviews for my faves here.
author: Nina Y.

description: Such a great place to bring anyone for any occasion! I have come here multiple times and each time has something new to offer. I love the seasonal menus, and the staff is always full of great, genuine people. Definitely will be back - with friends!
author: Susan F.

description:
Yummy comfort food, and a cute ambiance in the Castro with a fun back outdoor patio seating option. 

The hubby and I came here on a fine Saturday afternoon to satiate our brunch cravings and satiate we did! We ordered the fried chicken & waffles and the loco moco, and were thoroughly impressed! The fried chicken was crispy and juicy, and the loco moco was filled with a deliciously sweet soy based sauce that kept us wanting more. 

However, the service was quite slow, and the white sangria that I ordered was way too sweet and almost undrinkable. So I had to dock a star. 

On your next brunching excursion in the Castro, be sure to check out Starbelly for some yummy comfort food!

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
The crew at Starbelly are the best! Attentive, fun and always there to make sure you have a great meal. The tomato soup in the fall is always my favorite. And the Locomoco, too! The atmosphere is comfortable; a good place to meet a friend or take a date! :-)

The Dynamo donuts on the weekend are a treat! And let's not forget the Humphry Slocombe ice cream. Lord, please save my waistline!

Adam, Tessa, Danny, Megan, Adam and to everyone else whose name I forget (I'm sorry!), thanks! Here's to many more great meals, great company and great memories!
author: Rich B.

description:
I live in the area and probably have been here at least 20 times over the last 8 years.  First of all I'll be honest, I give this place a 3.8 stars.  But I just can't believe that the other places nearby are getting, 4 or 4.5 stars making it look like this is one of the worst food options in the area so bumping up to 5 to balance things out (are all these Yelpers crazy?! What-- castro republic, kitchen story, phinn town, la mediteranee, amasia, sushi time all has better food?! I thinks NOT).  It has better decor than all of these, a lovely covered/heated patio, and better service than most.

I don't think of this as "brunch" spot even if they do it on weekends, as their egg and griddle options aren't extensive, but they do a solid burger, fried chicken sando, and of course their pizzas (my favorite is their bacon, jalepeno,arugula with green goddess dressing). They make their bacon and sausage in house and I personally like their take on sphagetti with bacon and jalepeno over home made noodles. Other favorites are the chicken peas fritters with a sort of cumin infused yogurt dipping sauce (5 year old daughters favorite), mussels with chorizo, and their roasted chicken when they have it.  They rotate in and out enough new dishes and there is enough variety of options to keep most groups happy, even after repeat visits.  

So stop hating on my neighborhood spot, come by give it a try... and maybe don't order the loco-moco (seriously, who orders this here expecting it to be out of this world !? get yourself to a proper hawaiin joint-- aina or huli-huli).
author: Robert K.

description: The food was great! Why one star? The receipt really infuriated me with the handwritten "20% = $13" (see pic). First of all, you really should print that on the receipt - that's a lot more professional. Secondly, you are calculating wrong - should trick people to tip upon the taxes. Anyway, how can anybody beg people for money like this nowadays?...
author: Han Y.

description: Great customer service. I was treated to a complimentary donut by my server. Nice relaxing Sunday vibes on the outdoor patio.
author: Cali B.

description:
Starbelly.  My first time.  Recommended by Tracey A.  I was in hopes of getting pork belly at Starbelly and my enthusiasm waned when she cheerfully said, "They got great salads there!"  For me, that's the kiss of death.  Just say the words, "Great salad."  (My idea of a great salad is a rare 16 oz. beef steak with a parsley garnish.)

First I wanted their Starbelly pizza... but No!  They have hamburgers with Marin County blue cheese!  Ohhhh!  I so love blue cheese slathered on my burgers.  Then I picked up a pro tip from Tracey:

The waiter came to the table to take our orders and I was ready to blurt out, "Blue cheese with the hamburger!!!" - when Tracey flashes her trademark smile and says, "What things on the menu do you enjoy best?"

Wow!  What a simple way to cut to the chase!

"I like the Starbelly Pizza, Chicken & waffles and...." - my brain had an overload.   Electronic signals from my ears raced to my stomach and back to my brain.  A massive desire for chicken and waffles exploded in that section of the brain that drives motor skills!

I never had chicken and waffles before, but after seeing a photo of the chicken and waffles my daughter-in-law ate, it's been a priority for me.  I was not disappointed.  The buttermilk crust on the chicken breasts slipped in between the perfectly cooked waffles and the maple syrup were heavenly.  I loved seeing the juice in those pieces of chicken as I sliced them with my knife and tasting the waffle, maple syrup and chicken war against each other in my mouth to make a case for "I'm better!".  For this case, 1+1+1 =  10!  If you have not had chicken and waffles, you must put this on your list.

Starbelly is very popular.  We had to wait 45 minutes for a table.  It was a good crowd there.  Someone had a birthday and his friends sang "Happy Birthday" to him in such trained harmony they could have been the Gay Men's Chorus.  It seemed so appropriate to hear perfect singing with such delicious food.

Our table was in the front and it was noisy and crowded.  I generally do not like that sort of thing, but if you serve me chicken and waffles such as I enjoyed at Starbelly, you could put my table over hot coals and it would be okay with me!
author: Steve S.

description: Quickly becoming my favorite restaurant in the city. Everything I have tried has been simply phenomenal. The margarita pizza and the Joe's Sunrise were particularly delicious. I'll need to keep coming back here so I can try all the drinks on their menu I haven't tried yet. The ambience is killer too, try to get a spot on the heated back porch if you can! All in all, a very classy place.
author: William A.

description:
Dinner review. 

Chicken liver pate - 4/5 - 7x7
Split pea fritter - 3/5
Pumpkin dumplings - 3/5
Pork sugo - 4/5
Burger - 3/5
Cherry rice pudding - 2/5

Overall, "I'm a fan" of the pork sugo and liver pate.
author: Mark O.

description: I have never felt more comfortable than I did at this restaurant. We felt as though we were in the womb. The outdoor seating is perfectly shaded while still allowing a wondrous flow of sun and warmth. The food was left us feeling absolutely satisfied. Great food at a great price. Our waiter was extremely lenient with the allowance of separate checks. With leave this review with great appreciation for the exquisite service and divine dining. We thank you for the experience. Xoxoxoxox
author: Alisha L.

description:
I came to Starbelly recently with my brother and his friends for brunch.  I think it is located near or in the Castro (don't hate the visitor....lol). 

Our party was immediately seated upon entering.  We were seated in the entrance area.  There appears to be a larger seating area in the back which looks good for larger groups (I.e more than 6 individuals). 

The brunch menu to me looked a little small for choices to choose from.  However, they did have fried chicken and waffles and a Hawaiian loco moco.  My LA side wanted me to order the fried chicken and waffles.  My Hawaiian side wanted me to order the loco moco.   Was a tough choice.   I ended up ordering the loco moco.   For those who have not had a loco moco before, it is a beef patty with egg and gravy over rice.  In Hawaii, it is a big dish.   Starfish's version was not.   The loco moco had all the elements to make it except it was only with one scoop rice and one egg.  I am accustom to 2 scoops rice and 2 eggs which is the norm in Hawaii.   Thus, my expectations got the best of me.  

The beef patty was cooked well as I ordered it and my egg was sunny side up.   It was good, but it can't beat the original from Hawaii.    

I was chatting to the lady next to me and she ordered the chicken and waffles.   She said it was good.  It consisted of deep friend lightly breaded chicken breasts served with 2 waffles.   It looked good and I wanted to take a pic of it but felt awkward since it would be disturbing her while she was eating. 

The service here is good.   I will give them credit for customer service as one of our parties order did not arrive with the rest of the orders and came out late.  They comped their mistake.   

The drinks looked good here.
author: Dean N.

description:
I have been on a hipster Indian craze lately and thought I would switch it up with something a little more generic and Starbelly was a great choice with a lot of different options in terms of food for vegetarians. Keep in mind that many of the plates are relatively small so you are going to want to get more than the 2-3 plates you usually get if you want to fill yourself up. 

To start, I got the split pea fritters, which were amazing. I am not a huge fan of peas but the crunchiness of the fritter and the cool yogurt were a good compliment. After the snack portion, we got the pumpkin dumplings which were amazing, especially the pumpkin seeds. Once again, I wish there was another piece because it was really good, but to split between two people you just wish you had one more bite to enjoy. For our main course we split the cornmeal gnocchi, which in my opinion was the worst of the dishes I tasted. It was a tad undercooked but still somewhat flavorful, but no where near the deliciousness of the appetizers we had. I regret not taking a picture of the menu because I can't seem to find the dessert menu on the website, but I got the cookies with the caramel in the jar. The name is escaping me, but I thought it was scrumptious. My partner on the other was not a fan, and gave me the cookies to nibble on for myself. 

However, the best part of the meal were the drinks. Although my Starbelly was good, I don't think there is a better bang for your buck drink than the Michelada. I have a sweet spot for garam masala, and when mixed with alcohol it just gives it a great pop. Don't go in expecting the most delicious beer in the world (Just a Modelo), but the spices give it the extra kick. 

I really enjoyed this place and think it is a great date restaurant with a neighborhood vibe. Unfortunately a friend who came after us told us that the best thing she had was one of their flat breads which we didn't try. I will definitely come back just for that because the ambiance and service were great!
author: Vaibhav S.

description:
"Hey Starbelly....Get in my belly."

That's what came to mind when I joined a friend for dinner at Starbelly, an adorable gastropub-style joint just off the main drag in the Castro.  

The place exudes a relaxing vibe, with the indoor dining room melting into the outdoor patio thanks to a glass wall.  Despite it being the end of May, it was still freezing outside (thanks SF), so we sat indoors.

We began with a round of drinks.  I tried the Pimm's cup, which was light, refreshing, and extremely easy to drink.  

The cocktails were a perfect accompaniment for the first course -- chicken liver pâté with buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade, and whole grain mustard.  The chicken liver was fabulous and took me back to when I was a little kid and the stuff on the reg.  The onion marmalade made is seem modern.  The serving was quite generous too.

We followed this up with roasted mushroom and onion pizza.  Honestly, I wasn't a fan of this pizza.  The flavor was definitely there, but the crust was was a bit hard, and the mushrooms seemed undercooked and greasy.  I did enjoy picking off and nibbling on the onions, so there's that.

Service was friendly and fast.  We were in a bit of hurry to get to a party on time, so the speed didn't bother me.  I saw plenty of other people lingering over another cocktail or two.

But not us -- we paid the check and were out of there, lickety-split.
author: David G.

description:
Tucked away in the Mission is this little place.  It's less than a mile away from 16th St. Bart.  Several of us were going to get dinner together and we were a party of seven.  It was chilly that day and we were seated in the very back in the tented area.  Fortunately, there were blaring heat lamps that made it very warm and comfy.  I even had to take off several layers.  This restaurant is a little cramped, but by extending it using the bungalow-type arrangement, it increases space by a ton. It has a cute, classy, yet organic pub feel - very SF. 

I ordered the Timberline to start and it was delicious and topped with rosemary.  Because I had eaten a late lunch, I decided to order the mussels.  Though it's an appetizer, it's pretty large (but still smaller than a main entrée). It is pan fried and cooked with chorizo, which flavored the dish oh so well.  It was the perfect amount for me.  I also tried some of Boyfriends steak.  It was so soft and delicious.  Definitely would recommend (though it's a little pricy).  The pizza that some others had gotten was large, but had a very thin crust (think pieology thin). 

Don't have any complains really.  We did notice that the heat lamps got to be a bit too warm, but I would rather that than be too cold. 

Very cute place! Definitely would want to try to come back if I'm in the area and I would recommend to friends.

Ambiance: 4/5
Food and Drink: 4.5/5
Service: 4/5
Overall Experience: 4/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Such a treat to be able to sit on a patio on a warm San Francisco night! The patio in the back is so relaxing and feels like a departure from the city. We made a reservation and requested to sit back there, but when we arrived there wasn't a seat. The wait staff were so sweet and seated us in the front where we ordered drinks and appetizers and as soon as a patio table opened they moved us right away. (Shoutout to the super sweet waitress from Detroit shared horror stories with me since I used to work there)

We ordered the pate, broccoli, and the sweet corn pizza. The broccoli was a little too spicy for my taste, but everything else was delicious, especially the pizza. We added Starbelly bacon to it which I definitely recommend. It was such a unique combination of flavors and textures and was rich and creamy. Perfect amount for three people if you include the other two small plates. Prices were very reasonable especially given the great location. I'd definitely recommend it for anything ranging from date night to group dinner 

Looking forward to coming back! I've heard from friends that brunch is amazing
author: Sophie S.

description: We had a great time on New Years Day at brunch! We really enjoyed our server, Clyde. The food was delicious and prompt. The chilaquiles are so yummy as are their cocktails. The restaurant was packed so very happy we decided to make a reservation early
author: Katie M.

description: Starbelly is just so damn delicious; especially for brunch. But lunch and dinner are equally fantastic. I love a place where I have trouble ordering because there's so many good choices. And the staff is always super friendly and attentive without being solicitous or annoying. Sometimes there's a wait but it's never outrageous and worth it for all the tasty eats.
author: Chris O.

description:
This was my second time at the restaurant in nearly 3 years. It was again, delightfully delicious with great service.

We sat in the heated patio for a simple and elegant date. Our server, Ashley, was welcoming, kind and easy going. And the most surprising part of the night... The house-made pate turned my liver-hating husband into a pate appreciator! It was a life-changing meal!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I've been going to this place since it opened. The food is still fantastic. The staff are nice. 
My usual are the fries, Starbelly salad and the bacon pizza. The community table is fun. 
If you want good food and nice service, this is it. A good place for business lunch or date night.
T would like this place!
author: Victor Y.

description: Not a place I'd dine on a regular basis, but is a nice place to bring friends. Food is always fresh, and delicious. The bacon pizza was suburb.
author: Joey A.

description:
Tonight was my second time at this place and will be the last.   My friend and I came in and had dinner. When we arrived at the door the rude hostess was just that.  Rude !  I had asked if they had AC because it felt cooler inside. She said no. She said we can sit out on the patio but it might be hotter out there.  Which it was. We asked if we could just sit inside. Rolling her eyes with a stone face she brought in and we sat at a table.  the wobbled like a spinning top. But it was the attitude and eye roll that set the stage.  My friend took noticed too.  
   After we ordered our salads with the waiter we sat and sat and sat for roughly 30-45 minutes.  The waiter finally came back and said "sorry for the wait.  The tape ran out in the back and I'll have your salads out in two seconds."  Well another 20 minutes goes by and the salads arrived.   
   The salad was good but the waiter was non existent for the remainder of the meal.  After we finished about 30 or so minutes goes by until we flagged a bus boy to get out check. 
  I'm curious, why the rude attitude with the eye roll and a NON existent waiter??  Was it because his ticket was not a 150 dollar dinner?  If this is what is expected when you come here I'll pass.  Very disappointed to say the least.  The one star option is the only way this review could be written.  
   I live both here and Laguna Beach and have yet to be greeted with attitude and a eye roll where ever we have gone.  I eat out most days in the week.
author: Jack O.

description: Love the ambiance, a little pricey but great food! Had the butternut squash pizza which was delicious and a nice glass of wine! Service was great!
author: Lauren G.

description: Delicious, great service (Megan!) and a great atmosphere. The burger and steak were top notch. Would happily come again, and again.
author: Missy N.

description: Cold, old fries and poor quality food. When I read the menu, I was really excited. As soon as I saw what they brought me, I knew I was in for trouble. The fries were refried and cold. All the hot dishes were cold. My burger was terrible, it was worse than the one time I ate at Applebee's. Poor poor quality. Starbelly is Coldsmelly! Just awful!
author: James L.

description: Cannot recommend more highly! We ordered the steak, spaghetti, and meat plate appetizer (sopressata, mortadella, finocchiona) and it was all delicious. The ambiance was also perfect, felt somewhat similar to Beretta, another spot I love. Overall a great experience, I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
My fave Kirby powers were definitely
Throw - hurl enemies
Freeze - make 'em into ice cubes
Hammer - smash stuff
Stone - turn into a rock
Mike - death by karaoke

And then there was UFO
in a class of its own.
Charge up the cannon
you can shoot a star
at some enemy's belly.
They'll never forget it
unlike my forgettable meal.
author: Dan B.

description: The pizzas here were delicious for dinner. We also came for brunch and while it wasn't as great as dinner, it was still worth trying out. The ambiance is always great, the portions were good, and the prices aren't terrible for SF-- I would definitely come back.
author: Sheena P.

description:
Starbelly is a go-to brunch spot for me - but decent / consistent food in a pretty space is only worth about 3-4 stars in my book.

There's just nothing on this menu I love.  I know that it won't offend anyone and I can count on the food being very consistent every time I come...but there's nothing I crave here.

The greek yogurt parfait is good but VERY easy to make at home for MUCH less.  They use the cheapest fruit - most of which makes no sense in greek yogurt / yogurt parfait.  Huge chunks of pineapple and orange?  Then also green and purple grapes?  AND blueberries and strawberries?  I much prefer some kind of logical fruit "theme" or creative fruit toppings - like a homemade compote or chutney, for example.

The pizzas are all totally good and fine.  The chicken and waffles is WAY massive and, again, fine - but not revelatory.  Their cocktails are OK but not memorable.  The coffee is very average.

Service is usually pretty scatterbrained and harried.  You usually have to ask for the same thing repeatedly, but at least everyone is friendly.

Again, this is a place I'll keep coming to periodically, but not because I'm trying to wow myself or show off San Francisco's culinary scene to anyone.
author: Tay H.

description: The chilquiles was generous and not too much sauce-good flavor and spice. The homemade slaw and pickled jalapeño have a nice touch to the fish tacos! Their Michelada and Mister Expresso coffee were both tasty ways to wash down the tasty dishes. Heads up, no liquor license-but the sake Sabe Blanco seemed to be a nice alternative to the traditional tequila. We went for the Michelada instead-but may opt to try the sake inspired cocktails next time!
author: Melissa L.

description:
For a place that's always packed, I was more than underwhelmed.

Honestly the food wasn't that bad, but the service made the whole experience meh. The server paid almost no attention to our table and only at times that it benefitted her. When the table declined any alcoholic drinks, she made a scowl and visibly showed us she was unhappy. She came by a second time asking for drink orders and again no one ordered. We were ready to order our food, and our server was nowhere to be found. I finally had to flag down another server, who was very surprised when I mentioned we had been sitting for about 15 minutes and our server hadn't been by to take food orders. We got an assortment for the table, and I ended up splitting the chicken and waffles and the goddess dressing pizza.

Throughout our wait, I couldn't help but notice our original server shooting menacing looks at our table. I swear I wasn't imagining things; I even felt too intimidated to ask for a water refill. The other server that helped us was much nicer, and I was so happy when she came by to serve our food.

Presentation was spot on. Our pizza was beautiful, perfectly dressed and with great color. I thought the flavors could've been a bit stronger; the bacon barely came through. Our chicken and waffles was definitely the superstar. The chicken was crispy, not crunchy, and because it was very moist, paired really well with the waffles. The syrup was also applied lightly, allowing the maple flavor and moisture to seep in without making it too sweet.

If I had to wait for the table, I definitely would've had worse things to say. The fact that the food was decent and we were seated quickly made up (not fully) for the service.
author: Ben W.

description: Visiting for Southern California. This places has the friendliest people. Quick service and awesome drinks. The pizza was amazing. This is a place to go to!
author: David P.

description:
People are often extra critical of 3.5 Yelp rated restaurants on Yelp. To be honest, I have alot of favorite 3.5 star rated restaurants; I also dislike alot of 4-5 star restaurants and think they're overrated.

Bottom line: 3.5 STARS for Starbelly - they have some good eats and are reasonably priced! I would definitely return for a few items and recommend you give it a shot yourself. They have a nice heated outdoor patio which I imagine is perfect for brunch. Reservations are easy online, and it's good for big groups. I have walked by on weekend mornings and noticed there was no line either.

As for the food, there were highlights and low lights at Starbelly, and overall I think that the value and taste it was really good. 

* TIMBERLINE ($7) - 3.5 STARS:
Well, I admit I'm a cocktail snob. This one was pretty, and tasted nice with a strong rosemary note, but wasn't as tasty as a few of my other favorite restaurant cocktail bars. Namely: Beretta, Locanda, Range. In the Castro however, I haven't found a good restaurant cocktail bar yet. What a steal though - only $7 - unheard of prices!

* PATE ($12) - 4 STARS:
house made chicken liver pâté, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard
This pate is done right. It's a little harder and more crumbly than some but served as a thick slice and with a few pieces of toasted sliced bread.

* MUSSELS ($12) - 3 STARS:
pan roasted black mussels, Mexican chorizo, market chili & cilantro
This is a small bowl of very tiny mussels. The broth was uninspiring.

* BURRATA ($9) - 4 STARS:
burrata di stefano, blistered cherry tomato & basil puree
I love burrata and this was no exception. 

* Side of: CAULIFLOWER ($6) - 3 STARS:
marinated mixed cauliflower, chili flakes, shaved red onion & chives
Tasted very vinegary, but fresh, simple, and homemade. A somewhat small portion and not unique so I would not order again.

* BAVETTE STEAK ($25) - 3.5 STARS:
Very nicely cooked (requested medium rare, but the chef recommends medium), tender and flavorful. The sauce/marinade was not my cup of tea.

* CRAB GARLIC NOODLES ($21) - 4 STARS:
local Dungeness crab, garlic noodle & garlic bread
Really decadent and rich crab sauce with a fresh made doughy noodle. Really delicious and filling.

* SEA SALT POT DE CREME ($8) - 4 STARS:
A decent portion of creamy luscious sea salt pot de creme, served with 2 rosemary shortbread cookies. I was not a huge fan of the cookies, they were thin and crumbly and didn't have enough butter, but I really enjoyed the pot de creme. It was smooth and not especially thick, yet still very creamy.
author: Jess C.

description: Excellant food. Great staff. Yummo!!! Definitely hit this place up if your down in sf market and 16th
author: Rosanna B.

description:
Good location, and nice vibe but the food was...fine.  

We started with the split pea fritters, which were dry. Then I had the Butternut Squash pizza.  It was incredibly sweet (not in a good way).  It was mainly a heap of squash, little cheese and balsamic reduction in lieu of sauce.  The leftovers were salvaged by adding a little Cholula, and a lot more goat cheese.  The Starbelly pizza was much better, but still not amazing.

They serve wine and beer, so all their cocktails are made with vermouth.  I had a spicy/sweet vermouth cocktail that was pretty interesting.  That part is creative, making cocktails without a liquor license.
author: Kelly E.

description:
Almost three years later and Starbelly is still one of my go-to spots in the Castro. I mean the name itself just draws you in...

This time around, it was a rainy Thursday evening. I wanted something warm and comforting after a long day. And of course, some wine.

Pizza comes out piping hot and the crust is nice and crispy. Scarfed down a Margarita and two glasses of red wine in less than an hour. In just the right amount of time to catch a movie down the street nonetheless.
author: Abby S.

description: Had a really special meal with an old friend here last Friday night. The ambiance was lively, but intimate enough for us to catch up without straining to hear each other. The food was amazing and our server, Desiree, made really amazing suggestions for food and timed out our courses perfectly to allow us plenty of time to enjoy each other and our meal. Her recommendation for the garlic crab noodles was our favorite dish of the night. Overall, such a wonderful evening!
author: Faryl C.

description: Had brunch before I left town yesterday. My brother and I ordered drinks at the bar while we waited for our table. Friendly hostess and staff. I had a cocktail called the Painted Lady. It was delicious! Rose water, rose wine, earl grey tea and some lemon. Really good. We ordered fries with trio of dips. Fries were good but dips were nothing exciting. I have the wild mushroom pizza and it was fantastic. I would make it a point to go back next time I visit.
author: T F.

description:
I tried this place with some friends that recommended it. It's a nice place and pretty quiet if you go around 3-4pm, after that it gets a little busy.

I suggest the White Sangria, it's a little sweet and tart at the same time, just how I like it.
Tried the pea fritters and they're so good! Also the Greek pizza they have with Arugula and Bacon! So yummy!

It's a little pricy, but if you go with a small group of 4 and order some small appetizers and then share 1 main dish, it's great, if you're just looking for a little something to eat and nothing so heavy. 

Would love to come back and try a main dish on my own though. 

Friendly service and don't be afraid to sit outside in the tent! They have some strong heaters that warm up the whole place.
author: Courtney F.

description: I finally got to eat here this past weekend for brunch and I loved it! The ambiance was great; next time I want to sit outside in their cute outdoor area. I can't stop thinking about the salmon toast we ordered--I highly recommend this dish! I will definitely be returning to check out their dinner menu.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Did not think it was possible, but this place deserves 10 stars. Service, food, ambiance... All on par.
Came late on Friday after constantly moving my reso back because I'm not an accurate time keeper and every time the Hostess was very kind on the phone and in person about my forgetfulness. 
Our server (DAMN what was his name 'cause I want him every time! He had glasses and was short??) got our bottle of wine in a flash (great recommendation too!) and never felt a lag time at all even though it was a crazy Friday night. 
Brussel Sprouts: so good, we ordered an extra round. The gassiness is worth it the next day. WORTH IT.
Chicken Liver Pate: Heaven. Huge portion. Heaven.
Mushroom Pizza: I don't even like pizza... And I ate this. That should say enough. Get extra cheese!
Starbelly, you are my Star.
author: Kelly T.

description: I ALWAYS enjoy coming to Starbelly. On this visit I got to talk in Portuguese with a couple of members of the staff and even tried a new drink (yum yum). The food is delicious and the service is impeccable.
author: Cristóbal José Indigo P.

description:
My boyfriend and I visited for an early dinner on a Saturday and were seated with no problems. The front side area outlooks the Castro. The inside of the restaurant and outside patio provides a home-like ambience.

Service staff is great and attentive.

The mussels were very tasty and the crostini worked perfectly with the jalepeno sauce. 

The steak was very tender, however the kale was my personal favorite on the plate.

The spaghetti is amazing! Fresh spaghetti, succulent savory bacon and the jalapeño gives it a great kick.

Would recommend!
author: Linh N.

description: I've been here multiple times now and every time I come it gets better and better! The food is spectacular and the service is wonderful! The chicken and waffles is probably my favorite, but their other meals are amazing, too! The ones I recommend are the sunny side joes, housemade chorizo and egg pizza, and the fried chicken Po boy. All really good!
author: Samantha M.

description: With so many good places in sf, I don't see this place lasting very long. I hate that they choose to save money on these fuzz releasing napkins. I found white looking fuzz all my plate, cup, and pants. The food was mediocre at best. Service was also not very special. The only pro to this place is the quick seating and back patio area.
author: Cornelius V.

description:
I've eaten at Starbelly a few times and always feels like it's a pleasant surprise since I often forget  it's here because of the way it's located on 16th and Castro. As a venue, it's a great location on a sunny day with  it's back section as well as few front tables. Inside you have tables of two's and fours as well as a community table down the center line. The food is an eclectic mix of retro, hipster, queer, tourist, hetero, gal-pal/gay-boy, lesbian chic chaos and the food is  reflective of the of Community mix. 

On this sunny Saturday in early spring we did our own retro mix with fried chicken and waffles and a creamy salad with chicken & bacon. 

For me the quality of a restaurant is in how the fried food tastes.  Is the oil fresh? Am I tasting fish fry products not meant to be on my meat etc. Starbelly really knocked hard on this by producing a dish that offered a crisp hard bite with hot and steamy chicken inside. They totally nailed it on Saturday.  Also offered a nice presentation with Napoleon style layering of waffle, chicken, waffle, chicken. Another dish was a creamy salad with chicken and bacon well good and crispy chicken rice and flavored bacon of course was great the dressing was creamy but a little bit bland I would have liked some more herbs or punch to it or maybe a bite of lemon in the dressing something that just woke it up some. 
Overall it's a great place if you haven't tried it,  it's definitely worth a try. It can get busy on the weekends, but you can score a table if you go little bit later on a Saturday afternoon around 1:30 to 2 seems to be a natural quiet time which is a good idea because indoors it can be a little loud and chaotic when it's at full capacity.
author: Frank S.

description: I will be back.  Wonderful service and interesting food in a fun fast enviro.
author: Drusilla B.

description: Decent brunch. Had the fried eggs which were a bit undercooked. So were my son-in-law's eggs.  Decor was OK - service was friendly, but not overly efficient. Mimosa was very ordinary. Otherwise it was fine. Probably will try somewhere else for brunch next time when I am in SF.
author: Rob C.

description: Pizza Margherita was decent and food was filling. The servers are really nice. The environment was noisy but seems normal for a Friday night. Overall it was great even though we waited for an hr.
author: Eric Y.

description: The place looked really nice, and we were seated in the patio area in the back. My fiancé's and friends loco moco portions were so small.... But my fiancé really liked his food, so can't really complain beyond the size. The chilaquiles were decent, but it definitely wasn't a pretty dish like the loco moco was, it definitely was a lot more filling. Our server was nice, but food got to our table a little slow, it looked like they might've been short staffed, so we didn't make a big deal about it. Overall, it was average, nothing stuck out to us though.
author: Aiko H.

description:
This place felt so trendy and lively and had a nice little back patio which seemed a little more relaxed. I had a wonderful meal here mid-December. It was a very busy night but service was efficient and my server was pretty friendly.  I ordered three things, which all came out at the same time, but they were small plates so it wasn't that big of a deal. I did have to eat a little fast so things wouldn't get cold, or maybe I was just starving :-) I also ordered a nice glass of wine.

I had the white bean puree with grilled flatbread which was really tasty and the bread was nice and warm and yummy. The split pea fritters were quite good and came with a curried yogurt dip.  The pumpkin dumplings were divine.  I also loved the warm toffee cake with mascarpone & medjool dates for dessert.  

There were so many things on their menu that looked delicious and I liked how they had so many vegetarian options.  I just wished I could have tried more! 

I thought the prices were very reasonable and if I lived closer I would definitely return!
author: Catherine B.

description:
Came here for Saturday brunch, it was a sunny day so sat in the outside patio. Unfortunately it was covered and very cold!

The pizza was great, the fish tacos and chicken sandwich were good too. The service however was slow since it seemed like there was only one server covering all the outside tables.

A nice vibe for a weekend brunch.
author: Ghazal S.

description:
The 3.5 star rating for Starbelly belies how good of an option their brunch really is. With one shot, this restaurant has made it's way into my regular brunch rotation with the likes of Park Tavern, Tipsy Pig, Padrecito, etc. Why wait for hours outside Mission Beach Cafe, Zazie, Nopa, and all those other good-but-way-too-popular places when you can make a reservation at Starbelly and the food is damn good?

Our group had the: Italian eggs, chicken & waffles, french toast, and wild mushroom pizza ... and everything was damn tasty. How often does that happen? I tasted the Italian eggs and immediately swore I'd go back just so I wouldn't feel like I missed out.

FYI, expert tip coming up, my chicken and waffles were delightful with a tiny bit of Sriracha to add some spice to the crunch and sweet.

One small issue, they don't have a full liquor license, so their cocktails are somewhat limited. Normally I'd be unhappy about not having a bloody mary, but the food was good enough that I forgot about the libations.
author: Akash K.

description: Yogurt w honey was delicious, as were the Italian eggs! The outdoor patio seating is lovely!
author: Molly B.

description:
I went to Starbelly with my sister, and we had a stellar experience there! My sister ordered Mac & Cheese- which was surprisingly tasty- and bread and oil (why charge for bread and oil?).

I went with the spaghetti, just because I heard so many wonderful things about it! I also ordered the goat cheese dumplings, just because I had never had dumplings stuffed with goat cheese. The portion was definitely on the small side- I think I only got 3 or 5 dumplings- they were definitely really tiny.

Nonetheless, great place for eating! The ambiance is amazing, and the back is certainly super nice :)

Overall, expect to spend between 25 or 35 dollars for dinner and leave with a happy stomach!
author: Anders Z.

description: Service is impeccable.  Food is remarkably perfect and unique.  We tried the Tots -perfectly mildly overlooked and crispy with aioli delight.  Mushroom pizza is very fresh and light but fills the need.  Chilaquiles were a little spicy (Mexican spice) but perfect bundle and balance of chips/chorizo and sour cream.  The morning joes egg and beef skillet is good, quite good but i should've asked for it a bit less runny, It had spinach with brought it all together. Chicken (boneless) and waffles were balance of savory and sour.
author: David C.

description: Excellent spot for brunch, great outside seating in the back. The place is great for sharing. The mushroom pizza was delicious and it was enough to share. Their grapefruit juice was so refreshing. The bibb salad also came with a few kinds of dipping sauce. Pretty light dressing went well with cherry tomatoes, grilled chicken, and bacon. The chilaquiles came with great homemade chorizo and a small side salad. All of the dishes were very flavorful and the pizza was my favorite. The service was quite attentive and you can choose still or sparkling water. It was quite packed and we were enjoying our conversation for quite some time but our server didn't rush us at all.
author: Norases V.

description: One of the best brunch spots in the Castro. Definitely order the Burger as it's one of the best choices on the menu.
author: Olivia H.

description:
Looking for a delicious dinner spot to accommodate large groups in the Castro area? Come to Starbelly! I came here for a friend's birthday dinner (rolling deep with about 16 ppl) on a Saturday night and we sat at 2 tables in the patio out back.

My ultimate FAVORITE dish was the appetizer, CHICKEN LIVER PATE. Don't be put off by the liver and don't knock it til you try it! The pate paired so well with the buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade, and spicy grain mustard. I could probably polish off the entire dish by myself next time.

I also really enjoyed the PAN ROASTED BLACK MUSSELS with chorizo sausage. The heat of the chorizo and chilis went very well along with the citrusy tomato based sauce. The mussels were also very fresh and had no sand inside.

Along with the food I had the most Instagram-worthy drink here...the PIMMS CUP. It was delicious, refreshing, and very pretty.

For DESSERT, my table split the Warm Toffee Cake, Maple Banana Bread Pudding, Raspberry Sorbet (seasonal), and Salted Caramel Pot De Creme. All were delicious but my favorite was the salted caramel pot de creme...so decadent with the rich caramel. And thanks Starbelly for giving us a FREE DESSERT for my friend's birthday.

Other members of the party enjoyed the pizzas and the burger. Overall the food and drinks here impressed us very much! I'd definitely come back again for another group dinner.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: Starbelly is a great neighborhood restaurant! We eat here or get take out at least once a week. The spaghetti with jalapeño and thick cut bacon is my favorite dish for dinner. They also make a great loco moco for brunch. We also really enjoy the heated back patio for brunch year round.
author: Gianna S.

description:
