I came here with a big group for brunch, and despite having 10 people, the staff had no trouble seating us all together at a long table in the middle of the restaurant.

This place does a terrific job with both brunch and lunch food. I had the chicken and waffles. The waffles were fluffy and light, and the chicken was boneless and well-spiced. The maple syrup with honey mustard was a great combination. Also, if you want a little snack to add to your meal, the homemade donuts were decent, though they didn't blow my mind.

Other things worth getting are the fried chicken po-boy and the French toast, though the French toast isn't that filling. 

The service was attentive and prompt. I was particularly struck with how reasonable the prices were considering this was a packed brunch spot in the middle of San Francisco. I'll definitely come back here when I come back to the Castro.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Had a girls' dinner here and was impressed that they managed to seat 10 giggly girls without much hassle. 

I enjoyed my bavette steak cooked medium at the chef's suggestion even though I love my meat rare. I also shared an order of the mussels and it was pretty standard. I rarely eat desserts but I actually liked the sea salt pot de creme. It was creamy and decadent without being too heavy.
author: Xinxin W.

description:
Do NOT go here for groups!!  They have a fixed menu for big groups- and the food is actually fine  (salad could have been a little more dressed, but other than that, pretty standard)- but the service, the portions, the wait time is ridic.  We had a family style meal, for around 20 people, which we each had to pay $40 each for, but we probably got food equivalency for $10 each.  They literally gave us 2 small bowls of spaghetti, which was considered one of our entrees, to be split amongst 20 people.  Most of the other stuff, we got 4 bowls of, which was okay, but that's a pretty small amount to be getting for 40 bucks!  All the plates were licked clean bc we all were willing to take anything we could get.  Also, they were extremely slow in serving us wine and water, so we couldn't even fill our empty stomachs with drinks!

Overall, there is unfortunately no way I would come back.  I understand serving large groups is always hard, but since there are so very many restaurants in this town, I will definitely opt for a different one next time.
author: Sonia S.

description:
I cannot judge the food, as I only came in for a few drinks with my friends but it was a Saturday night, around 8pm and the place was very slow. Even though there were only 2 tables the service was confusing.

Honestly, I am not impressed with the menu and the drinks were ok but overpriced. 
I shall come back to have a proper dinner, but so far it's a 3-star for me.
author: Fernanda S.

description:
The ambiance is cool, food was just ok. We came here because it was on the Michelin Gourmand list. I got the butternut squash pizza, which to our surprise was sweet (and not in a pleasant) way. I wouldn't order it again.

All of their cocktails are wine or beer based, which I thought was cool. The setting and ambiance was also nice. Probably won't come back though, better food elsewhere.
author: Tabitha S.

description:
Pimm's Cup, YAAAAAAAS. Why oh why do more places not have this cocktail? It's so refreshing and I love the cucumber addition!

Now let's talk about that Mushroom Pizza. Hot damn! After seeing that sizzlin' pizza pie I saw all eyes briefly acknowledge they should have ordered the exact same thing.

Well how is the location, you ask? It is divine. I love the outdoor patio- it's so tranquil and charming. Additionally, Starbelly is a great place to go for brunch because you can make reservations (shocking, I know). 

Overall, wonderful spot! Deserves a way better overall rating than 3 stars.
author: Nicole W.

description:
Great spot for vegetarians! Love appetizer/sides selection but especially like the  pizza. 

I ordered the Butternut squash, garlic, goat cheese, pumpkin seed pizza and the mushroom, gruyere pizza. Both great picks! 

Bonus: Adorable outdoor patio.  Definitely a gem in the Castro.
author: Shilpa R.

description: Maybe we ordered the wrong things, (I ordered the caesar salad and added fried chicken), but the food was bland and the service was just okay. Our server didn't check on us once the food had arrived, and because the food was bland (so bland that we actually needed to add salt) we had to go in search of our own salt shaker because there wasn't one on the table. There are too many other yummy restaurants in the area to return here.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
Starbelly is a go-to for brunch and dinner for my friends and me. The food is great, the staff is nice, and the atmosphere is perfect. 
For brunch, I highly recommend trying the chicken & waffles.
For dinner, splitting a bunch of small plates always seems to be the way my friends and I like to do it. Last night, we ordered two orders of the pork belly, the chef's cheese and meat pairings, a tomato basil pizza, and two orders of the pumpkin dumplings. Everything was spectacular and it was the right amount of food for the evening. 

If only they served liquor, this would be my go-to place every night! The wine/beer-inspired cocktails are delicious, though!
author: Mike D.

description: We popped our heads into Starbelly before having dinner. I just had some small dishes. I would want to back to this place another time. It seems like a fun place. Had the olive oil and bread, lamb meatballs with yogurt with a glass of red. The lamb meatballs with yogurt was delicious...a tasty small bite. Yum!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description: i picked starbelly for brunch this past weekend since it's one of the few brunch places around that accepts reservations and we all hate waiting. even though some of us in the group will always be late, at least the punctual ones can sit down at a table and enjoy a beverage. it was my second time at starbelly and i remember the pizza being pretty enjoyable on the back patio the first time, so why not give it a second shot? my gf's and i each ordered different items, and shared the french toast and chocolate dynamo donut to end. i got the burger ($13), added grilled onions ($2) and fries ($2).  i should've added some more salt flavor via a cheddar or blue cheese, but i will likely opt for the chicken sandwich that looked so bomb at the table next to us.  the burger was all right, i think my fave part of the plate was the french fries - thin and crispy and just the right amount of salt.  the sangria was very delicious though! so i was happy about that :)
author: Christina L.

description: I owe Starbelly this review since Oct. 2017. Where do I start... Starbelly as a whole is just amazing! From their food, to their staff, their chef/owner and vibe.. everything and everyone is GREAT! We had our intimate reception here after our wedding on 10/18/17. Former manager Tessa has been so welcoming the first day we did our food tasting that we just fell in love with the place, people, and food right away! Shannon, the manager that took over, has been just as amazing if not more! They have been so helpful with the meetings prior to the big day when it came to food selections and getting to try them, drink selections and getting to try A LOT of them, table arrangements and decor, menus, program/time. Shannon was just the best in coordinating everything for our reception. Their staff helped with putting up/setting up decorations that we provided. They even made it work to fit a sweetheart table for us! They always made time for us and eased our worries by telling us their plans/suggestions and executing them flawlessly on our big day! I also heard our cake from a diff vendor arrived bare and undecorated and owner/chef Adam decorated it with beautiful flowers from the florist nearby! He made that cake beautiful!! The food was amazing, everyone loved the picnic style and the fact that the food was actually great!! We had people visit from the East Coast so being in Castro was a nice and new experience for them as well. They are also able to serve food for people with special/strict dietary needs! The staff was always available, we (newly weds) and our guests felt so special and taken care of! Oh also when we went back a different day to have dinner, Chris (asst. manager?) remembered us and again, made us feel so special with a round of champagne. I have nothing but great things to say about Starbelly. It's our favorite place to take people to. WE LOVE YOU, STARBELLY! Thank you for making our big day EXTRA special!
author: JOANNIE A.

description:
We went in around 4p on a Saturday and were seated immediately. They had the afternoon menu which had some appetizers, the burger and the pizzas. 
I am on a low salt diet so I ordered a Margherita pizza with burrata. It was great and not very salty!
My cocktail was really tasty. 
Service was great. 
We'll be back.
author: A A.

description:
Great fresh cocktail and brunch menu.

Menu changes daily.

Good service & food.

Also love that they serve brunch until 4PM, what can I say ...I get a late start sometimes :)
author: Raj K.

description: Everything about this place looked great. The ambience, the service, the ratings. I must have ordered the wrong thing. The medium rare burger I asked for was well done and dry. The bread was so dense and greasy that I removed the top part and ate the burger with one piece. There wasn't even sauce to go with the burger. For $13 I expected something better and it was the worst burger I've had in recent memory.
author: Si W.

description:
Our lunch reservation was at 3:30pm but they went ahead and took us at 3, so accommodating. The host was extremely friendly and personable as well. We decided to dine on the patio, temps were in the low 70s so we couldn't skip an al fresco opp on a beautiful day like that! 

Starting with the food, we ordered a pizza and sandwich to share. We opted for the fried chicken po'boy and starbelly bacon pizza. Both were DELICIOUS. The goddess dressing on that pizza really set it off for us. The arugula was a bit overpowering so we took a little off the top, but it didn't detract from the taste at all. The po'boy was excellent all around, no complaints!

We had three rounds of drinks, starting with the white sangria, then to the pimm's cup, and lastly the sunset in seville. All were great except the sangria, it was really watered down for me. My favorite was definitely the pimm's cup, yummy! My friend loved the sunset in Seville. 

Overall, our experience at starbelly was amazing. My friend works at a sister restaurant and she would constantly tell me to get over to upper market and give this place a try, so glad I finally did. I'll definitely be back, and I won't hesitate to send my guests here (I'm a concierge). Thanks again starbelly staff!
author: Evin C.

description:
Service was nice, cheese selections was pretty lacking IMO for a wine spot.  However winning item is their burrata appetizer with the baked tomatoes and pesto... Delicious!!

Ambiance is cute, overall a decent spot for wine and appetizers for me.
author: Priscilla C.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday dinner in a group of eight people on a weeknight. We had a reservation, but i imagine this place can get busy during weekends. It's not super big, but there is a cute outdoor area at the back of the restaurant with additional tables. 

We ordered a ton of food and wine to share. In retrospect, I don't think it was that great of an idea to share, but we didn't know how the portions looked beforehand. The pizzas were good for sharing, but that was pretty much it. We ordered two orders of the pumpkin dumplings (definitely not enough for eight people), an order of the mussels (I didn't get to try any), several pizzas (I think around five or six), the brussels sprouts as a side, and a lot of wine (four or five bottles...which is a lot for eight people now that I think about it). 

Food that stood out: butternut squash pizza with goat cheese and pumpkin seeds and the brussels sprouts because of the balsamic honey. 

The dessert was great: salted caramel pot de creme with rosemary cornmeal cookies. It was for my friend's birthday dessert, but I had a bite and it was so good. I think this might've been my favorite part of the meal...

Overall, I thought the food was good, but nothing amazing. I think I came here again, I would get an entree that isn't a pizza. We got the pizzas since we figured it was the easiest thing to share among eight people. Good wine selection - I expect the drink menu to be extensive since I saw a pretty nicely stocked bar. I would give this place another chance, but I don't think I would voluntarily go back here right away since there are so many other great places to eat in this lovely city.
author: Steph V.

description:
What a breath of fresh air to find a Michelin recommendation with Starbelly.  I mean who wouldn't want to come in just for the namesake? Scratch my "Starbelly" why don't ya!

Our dear friend from Chile was visiting that weekend who had quite an expansive palate, I learned. He had two requirements (1) it had to be in Castro and (2) it had be really good food! The only place in Castro or near off that I could think off that was decent (1) Bisou - French, and (2) Destino, Latin American!!  Neither was a hit so thank you Starbelly for saving the day!! 

Once inside, the ambience is trendy and cozy.  The metallic tables and barn like feel reminded me of my visits to Wisconsin - where I got lost driving and all I could see were pasteur of forever greens and barns galore!

As for their dishes, do try the following:

-- (1) white bean puree, black olive tapenade & grilled flatbread.  It will fill your tummy real good but enough so you can continue on.  The white bean was light and not pasty.

-- (2) house made pumpkin dumplings, brown butter, sage, pumpkin seeds & shaved goat cheese. OMG - you must absolutely try this and order at least three!!!  One serving is not enough for three grown men!  Well, at least with us.  We like to pig out without the mess! 

-- (3) fresh spaghetti, starbelly bacon, jalapeño, tomato sauce & basil.  OMG, this should have been my order. I had to bring my fork over and borrow a few noodles and more.  It's like Lucy borrowing sugar from Ethel and she takes the whole bag. The simpleness of this dish made it really standout.  I highly recommend.

-- (4) Santa Maria marinated bavette steak, yucca fries, grilled green onion & salsa verde (it was good but not great).  The steak was a little tough, though they did cook it rare which made our visiting friend gleam with smile like that commercial toothpaste lady with the big mouth!

-- (5) lamb links served with hummus and baby greens. This was my dish and well, it did not kick ass like the spag and pumkin squash, but I wouldn't mind having it for lunch again.

And now for the drinks
--- do try their Calicraft Brewing Co. "Cali Coast" Kolsch, malt, fresh lemon, straw.  It was quite refreshing and quite enjoyed the lemon malt taste to it!

All in all, our experience was memorable. Our visiting friend from Chile had his lashes batting the whole time, flirting with our waiter who reminded me of a dirty blond hair Superman!  He insisted in taking him to go!  Just my luck!  LMAO

Cheerio! :p
author: Edwin R.

description:
Celebrated my friend's 50th Birthday here last Saturday evening and it was a perfect experience. More of Casual style dining. 

They brought us 2 glasses of champagne to start the evening, Eric or Erik was our waiter that night and did a phenomenal job. Personable, knowledgeable, and directed us towards exquisite menu selections. 

We started with a mushroom pizza (gruyere, onions, and thyme) and added bacon - spot on perfection for us. 

Then he had a glass of the Gruner Veltliner which was superb for $13. I would rather pay a couple bucks more for a really good glass of wine than a Gruner that didn't have the layered complexity this one had - really great, good minerality with a nice kick of acidity. I had the Southern French white which was also pleasant. 

Then we got to main courses: He had what he always orders, The Bacon Spaghetti. I decided as a kid that I would never order spaghetti out because it's never going to taste like my Mom's. Well this is an entirely different experience - flavors that I've never had put together before and I would definitely order that Spaghetti!

I had a perfectly cooked piece of Halibut with a delicious sauce and a Fava Risotto!! 
So good is making me hungry right now. 

I chose a bottle of wine with some help from Eric and Mark (the Manager - was very helpful!!). The Ruby Bush Mourvedre from Australia at $42.00. Oh My God this wine was so good I want to buy a case of it. And at 42 dollars - it's a steal. I usually only taste Aussie wines this good when they're closer to a Hundred. 

We finished the meal with some delicious home made ice creams - and then Eric brought out a Caramel Pot de Crème (on the house) with a candle in it. 

A 50th Birthday Truly Celebrated!!
author: Rew C.

description:
I like this place for brunch because you can make reservation and they have a nice patio in the back.

The French toast is really good and you can't go wrong with the eggs!
author: Coralie S.

description: Left my review in the the check in comment section on accident but this place is cute. The decor is cute and there is indoor and outdoor seating here. We came for late night dinner and ordered the Margherita pizza which wasn't as flavorful as I was expecting it be. The lavender lemonade was underwhelming and didn't really taste like either or. If I was ever in San Fran again I might stop by but I don't think I would come out of my way to come here again. The services was great here though.
author: Lindsay T.

description: Love, love, love their food! If I could afford to order everything on the menu, I would!! I ordered the corn meal fish tacos, and my friend ordered the French toast with fried chicken. We were able to taste each other's dishes, and both were equally delish! Our tummies were both full from the food, but next time, we're sure to have dessert, as the people sitting next to us, had our mouths watering when their desserts were being delivered to their tables! Very Good service, and in a quiet residential area. Must come and eat here!
author: Gerri G.

description: Love their outside patio seating especially during the rare warm days in SF! Highly recommend any of their pizza as an appetizer or even a dish. Service was good and the place is close to muni. Parking could be difficult but overall good spot for dates! Can't wait to return to try their brunch
author: Kerry K.

description: Such a cute and lively brunch spot! I got the fried chicken sandwich which was pretty good. The food wasn't orgasmic but it was still good. I really loved the ambiance, make sure you call ahead of time and make reservations! There were so many people waiting, but since I made reservations my wait wasn't too long.
author: Joti L.

description: One of my favs in the hood. Nice back patio. Good fried chicken, loco Moco, pizza, an excellent spaghetti.
author: Leigh S.

description:
We'd come here as part of Taste of the City where first you attend a silent auction at City Hall and then you get chauffeured to a secret restaurant in town. Funny how my almost all LGTB group ended up in the Castro. 

My friend, who had invited me to this event, had bought a table. What exactly that entailed, I don't know, but I guess that she paid a sum of money that will eventually go to charity and that Starbelly also donated a table.

To be quite frank, I wasn't impressed. I understand that because it was basically free food, we were not given big (normal) portions, but the tasting portions we received were not only rather small but taste wise didn't sweep me off my feet either. 

While they were skimpy on the food, they were generous on the wine (oddly enough). Our glasses were filled to the brim, even though at the end of the night no one really managed to finish all three flights of wine. (Oh, and water replacements didn't really make it to our table, unless we asked for it.)

I know, I'm probably being unfair to lament about mediocre food & negligent service when I received the meal for absolutely free. But, I see this as an opportunity for the restaurant to shine and entice me to come back for a more full-fledged experience. Well, this didn't work on me, unfortunately. I am not rushing back...
author: Uli B.

description: We ate at starbelly on our first day of our 6 day trip in San Francisco. We went for brunch and ate the chilaquiles eggs and their banana walnut French toast, it was delicious! We also had their coffee and I have to say that after trying out coffee shops all over San Fran they had hands down the best cup of coffee.. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The restaurants covered back patio was rustic and very pretty. If we ever get to make it back to SF we will be visiting starbelly!
author: Danielle R.

description:
Came here for dinner to meet a long time friend.  I love the ambiance of the place.  Nice and open and airy and wonderful outside seating. The staff are super friendly, warm and welcoming.  The first thing anyone wants is to be greeted by people who are happy you are there and Starbelly gets the prize for that!

Before my friend arrived I was happy to rummage through all the Yelp picks to help me decide what to order :) Everything on the menu had my mouth watering and the pics contributed to my saliva overfill.  

We decided on the fries with the three dipping sauces.  To know me is to know I love to DIP!!!!! So it was no surprise this was a hit for me. The fries were seasoned to PERFECTION and I could have eaten all dips just with my fingers. MMM MMM GOOD!

I was torn between my main entree.  Pizza or the infamous Starbelly Spaghetti.  I decided to ask the server for her suggestion and she said hands down the spaghetti and I decided let's go with the pro!  

OMG...the food was nothing short of FAB-U-LOUS!!!! The Starbelly bacon added a light taste of heaven, the pasta was cooked to perfection and I washed it all down with a lavender lemonade. 

Oh Starbelly...if I only lived in the Castro...I'd have one hell of a BELLY :)
author: Sandra S.

description: It was the very first time my friend and I stopped at Starbelly. There was no a huge queue and we were seated right away. The food is very good, we followed recommendations of our server, which were great. Starbelly is a beautiful cute spot with a very pleasant ambience. The patio deserves a special attention. Our server Jose was super friendly and it was a pleasure to communicate with him throughout the dinner. White sangria is a superb drink in the cocktail list!
author: Mariya D.

description:
Recently I visited my friend Chad C. who lives at the tip-top of the Castro...I was out-of-breath due to the high altitude (or maybe I just shouldn't have attempted that steep, sweaty hill climb). He did reward me with lots of champagne to replace my lost fluids. Then we decided to journey back down the hill for dinner. Chad chose Starbelly because I'd never been there and he was pretty sure we could get a table without a reservation. Luckily he was right, although it was almost full. We were seated in the patio and this being San Francisco, I'm glad they had heat lamps. The ambience is very California coastal casual, laid back and lots of wood everywhere. 

We ordered glasses of wine but quickly upped to a bottle LOL. I was still tipsy from the champagne so I don't remember the name of the wine (very out of character for the wino in me), but noted that Starbelly had a strong wine list and nice variety of California vintages plus wines from around the world.

We both ordered the applewood smoked chicken pot pie with wild mushrooms. This was not Swanson's frozen pot pie. It was huge, made from scratch, full of flavor and hearty! So delicious! At this point I don't remember if we had a pizza too but I doubt it. Things were fuzzy from the wine. I do remember we were so full we passed on dessert. 

So bottom line, if you get the pot pie you might not need anything else. Also make reservations because you may not be as lucky as we were. And go on your birthday because your friend just might treat you! :)
author: Jerry C.

description: Their chicken liver pate dish is so great!!! I dont think other dishes are that great but i can eat chicken liver pate for all 3 Courses
author: Ellie D.

description:
Trendy vibe. Great outdoor patio, although I think they close it early for the neighbors. You pay for what you get. Unlike many places in SF entrees are at or under $20, which is unusual for a place that's so visually appealing. With that being said the food is pretty good, but not mind blowing. Interesting mix of Americana staples. Their menu is extensive enough for everyone to find something. Pizzas are decent. Burger and spaghetti are excellent.

Love the bar staff. Friendly, accommodating, and knowledgable. Great neighborhood spot. Would recommend if your looking for a decently priced meal with a nice atmosphere in the Castro. Thanks Starbelly!
author: Venice P.

description:
Today was an 'off' day @ Starbelly for me.
Waiter so busy chatting up other tables, and finally our table. "Know what you want?" Wasn't the greeting I'd hoped for. Drinks finally appear after 10 minute wait in a non-busy room...and then our food and my Loco Moco is drenched in soy sauce, way too much such that the dish is pretty awful. Move food to slope of serving bowl and hope for best. Later, check comes but waiter never asked about our meal or dessert...we order dessert...
An off day, an off meal...
author: William M.

description: If you want the best fried chicken sandwich, come to Starbelly. Always perfectly made, never dry.
author: Spamricebacon V.

description:
Made the long trek across town from the Richmond District (I jest) to meet some friends who were in town and wanted to meet for dinner. We met at 8 p.m. with a reservation and all was squared away, ready to go. Servers were great, I have no complaints about the service.

Ambiance: warm, despite the chilly night, softly lit (almost so much so that it was hard to tell it was open from across the street, but I like it). A little on the noisy side, but I may be a little noise-sensitive. 

Food is the reason it is 3-stars for me. The white bean dip was amazing, but the rest of our food was sort of ho-hum. My partner and I shared the white bean dip, Starbelly salad, and a vegetarian burger. The starbelly salad was tasty, but could have been developed a bit more in the flavor department (pepitas, perhaps - they were on the cheese plate; finely cut red onion?), and the vegetarian burger, while crunchy (nice!) lacked some flavor and maybe a little salt. Fries were good - house-made, but resulted in some really small pieces which made me self-conscious about shoveling tiny-fries into my mouth, and it was hard to dip in the ketchup provided. 

So - if I were around in the area, I might try it again, but I wouldn't make that lonnnnggggg trek (again, I jest!) from the Richmond over. Le sigh!
author: Sarah A.

description:
Besides some slow service, the food was amazing :)
Went here with two friends and they ordered a pizza and I ordered the chorizo mussels. ALL DELICIOUS (they kept on stealing my chorizo) haha.

It is an only wine and beer restaurant which I honestly don't mind.
Can't wait to come back with more friends.

LOve the cute vibe and the bartender was so nice :)
author: Bori B.

description:
Years ago, when Starbelly opened, a friend wanted to go and we tried... three times. Each time the wait was prohibitively long and we weren't ready to hang out an hour to get in, and we went elsewhere.

So finally, last night when it was recommended from a new friend, I hinged for a second. Then thought about it and realized that after a couple of years, and on a Wednesday night, and relatively early, we likely wouldn't have to wait. I was right. In we went.

The seating was cramped. Now I'm 6'6 so I get it, I'm not the norm. But that said, it was a tiny little table in a tight corner and my (5'6, 135lb.) friend literally had to slide the adjacent two-top a foot right to squeeze in and take his seat. Not sure what we would have done if it were occupied or if that friend were, let's say, 180 lbs. It was a bit too tight, even by urban standards.

The waiter was a bit of a SF cliche. Tight ironic t-shirt and hipster facial hair. Bored expression. Slight attitude. Must've been on his way back from a casting call for "Looking". I lived in LA, I'm used the pretentiousness... but it wasn't a welcome addition to the night, let's just say that.

The aesthetic of the place was perfect. Modern, clean, yet naturalistic and even "woodsy". A+ for that.

The food was delicious as promised. The brussell sprouts were excellent and the pumpkin dumplings were just okay. I enjoyed them, but they were tiny and expensive and just okay. Wouldn't order them again. The butternut squash pizza, on the other hand, is one of the best pizzas I've had.

Overall, gorgeous place, convenient location, delicious food, a bit spendy, and the hipster servers need to stop being a cliche. A good date place, just ask for one of the friendlier servers and sit on the back patio if at all possible.
author: Sean B.

description:
Had a really lovely meal here on a Sunday eve...
Burger was delicious, mussels with chorizo were oily and spicy but I liked 'em like that, the salads were super-fresh and full of goodness. A new favorite spot!
author: Tal R.

description:
I usually enjoy Starbelly. I've been quite a few times and I usually have great, quick and accurate service. However, the last time I went had me questioning my return. 

1) Slower than normal service 
2) They got my order wrong (they graciously fixed it, and allowed our table to keep the wrong item)
3) The $7 broccoli is a joke- it's pretty much 3 small pieces of kind of burnt broccoli with chili flakes
author: Gina H.

description:
On the last night of my San Franciscan adventures, I met up with my cousin Spencer, who suggested we end my trip at Starbelly. Oh, how grateful I am that he did! Starbelly has a wonderful, rustic vibe that reminds me a lot of a more chillaxed Matchbox (for a local reference). We were seated on the back patio which is covered and has heat lamps (since SF is cooooold, man! Even in--especially for--August!), and our waitress was super cool.

We started with a couple drinks -- they focus primarily on beers and wine, so I helped myself to a cider, and then ordered a bunch of things to share since they all sounded so good! They each deserve a soliloquy in their own right, but I'll try to keep this short and sweet for you all (as best I can... we all know my tendency to stray toward the verbose, hahaha).

White Bean Dip with Roasted Eggplant: Like a mild, smooth, creamy hummus, this stuff was delicious and I'm pretty sure it was only a modicum of social decency that prevented my cousin from licking the bowl clean. It's served with two pieces of grilled pita.

Heirloom Tomato Crostini with Burrata: Holy. Mouthgasm. The burrata was SO creamy, SO light, SO incredible, and the tomato underneath and balsamic reduction drizzled on top made it like a crispy bite of caprese salad -- but amped up to the extreme. I HIGHLY recommend this as an app or small plate. Comes with two pieces.

Mushroom Pizza: Again, absolutely delicious. SO many varieties of mushrooms, plus sweet red onion and cheese on top? My cousin indicated that Starbelly's pizzas in particular are very good, and I was NOT disappointed in the slightest. They have a woodfired taste, super crisp crust, and was all-around delicious.

And finally, the Creamed Corn with Mascarpone: I don't really even have words to describe how delicious I found this. It wasn't really so much creamed-creamed corn as you'd think. The corn kernels were all still very visible and weren't cooked into oblivion. There's a dollop of mascarpone right in the middle that melted into the corn and just made the entire thing generally incredible. It's a side dish, and I highly, HIGHLY recommend tacking it onto your meal. You can thank me for it later.

So! All in all, a delicious meal that was actually fairly reasonably priced, too! Between the two of us, I think the bill came to around $70-something? So like $35 per person, And with two drinks each, I think that ends up being pretty damn cheap, really, for the quality of food. I would absolutely return, though I want to try the owner's other two restaurants now, too!
author: Gretchen F.

description:
The food was terrible, BUT the background ambiance really made the night. Sitting there with my parents and having our weekly catch up, it was a fun game to stare into my parents eyes and see if I could tell the moment that they processed the lyrics. 

"Put it in your mouth..."

"Just eat me out..."

Beautiful!

True story! Thankfully I don't think they picked up in it, and the food actually was delicious. Hence 5 stars. They may just want to look into their playlist...
author: Michelle L.

description: Great brunch! Classic dishes with a twist, call ahead if you want to sit on the patio!!!
author: Kathryn J.

description:
Love Love the food here! We came here for dinner after a long day of walking around doing touristy stuff. Starbelly has been on my list of "places to try" since I spied the over easy eggs on their pizza's.  We called ahead and they luckily had a table for us ready upon arrival.

We decided to go the family style route and ordered different dishes to share. I have to say that the food or service did not disappoint.

house cut fries & three dips 6:
Nothing special about the fries. They were the skinny cut crispy kind which you cant go wrong with. The 3 sauces were a nice touch but the kids and most of the adults preferred just plain ketchup.

pan roasted black mussels, Mexican chorizo, market chili & cilantro 10
Oh man this was nomnom. The mussels were fresh and the chorizo along with the chili and cilantro gave it a nice kick! Order this!

house made chicken liver pâté, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard 10
Ok to say I was skeptical about ordering this is an understatement. I am not really a fan of pate. I mean..I think its ok depending on where you eat it and I never go out of my way to order it but the waitress insisted that its one of the most popular dishes on the menu so why not? WOW is an understatement.. the dish came with a slice of their house made pate, dijon mustard, some kind of jam, with toasted sourdough slices. When you add all these ingredients together and take a bite? My friend explained it perfectly when he said "its like a flavor explosion in your mouth' DELICIOUS. YES ORDER THIS! and make sure you smear the pate on the toast then the jam and mustard. It all goes together!

marinated beets, cara cara orange, basil & raw goat's milk feta 6
If you're a beets fan then you will love this dish. Simple just like the description.

starbelly bacon, jalapeño, arugula & green goddess dressing 14 
I had them add a few eggs onto the pizza.. so so so yummy! The freshness of the arugula, the creaminess of the perfectly over easy eggs, the saltiness of the house cured bacon, finished with their green dressing put this pizza over the top!

 fresh spaghetti, starbelly bacon, jalapeño, tomato sauce & basil 12 
We originally ordered one but had to add another order since this was such a hit at the table. The bacon really does it. Their house bacon is cured pork belly.. heavenly with the fresh spaghetti and I love the kick of the jalapeno. Simplistic but everything worked well together. 

Both the hubs and friend had their specialty cocktail called the "Walking Dead" Good but very strong! They both had 2 and had a nice buzz. 

Service was spot on. Thanks to the hostess for finding us a table at the last minute on a friday evening. For the waitress with great recommendations. And the busboys for keeping our water glasses full.

Total bill.. a little over a $104 plus tip. Reasonable prices for fabulous food, how can you go wrong?! 

5 stars
author: Cynthia A.

description: A short and simple review. Came here for date night and their welcoming servers, delicious food and relaxing ambiance hit the nail on the head! Nothing like a great dinner to start off a fun date night. We'll be back!
author: C C.

description:
A Disappointing Return
We used to be fans of Starbelly, but brunch today was a bust. After an unreasonable delay for service, our food arrived with three out of three disappointments. The loco moco ordered "medium well" came rare if not tartare. Hawaiian loco moco is covered in gravy, but theirs was drizzled with soy sauce. The chilaquiles arrived barely warm and without chorizo. Clearly all but the egg had been prepared in advance; the taco chips were soggy and indistinguishable from the flat pieces of chicken, as both were covered with a tasteless chili sauce.  We held out hope for the  bacon/arugula pizza until we tasted the cardboard crust--crispy on top but dense and chewy underneath. The waitress was apologetic, but should have offered to redo the dishes, not just heat up the burger. Apparently changes in the kitchen staff have made what was once a go-to place in the Castro no longer what it was.
author: Bruce L.

description: There was a group of 8 of us that came here for our friend's birthday and we had a great time. We loved the burrata peach toast, goat cheese dumplings, fries, mushroom pizza, and bacon pizza. Wasn't a huge fan of the beet and goat cheese side or the padrone pepper side, but everything else was great, including the wine and service. Also really loved the ambiance, would love to sit out on the patio next time.
author: Shabnam E.

description:
When you walk into this hip, friendly, and relaxing atmosphere, expect great food and a professional staff. I absolutely love the general manager, Jordana, who is super professional and easy to get along with. She is your woman when you want things done right.

The restaurant has indoor and outdoor front/patio seating. There are nice wooden tables, industrial chairs, and a nice interior decor. The outside patio feels like a nice day in San Diego with a 70 degree sunny weather. And yes there are heaters. 

I come back here for the food, and of course Jordana's lovely hairstyle. If you love brussels sprouts, you must get two because you wouldn't want to share this dish with your ex-boyfriend. The pizzas are good, and they are about 12" inches. Also the menu changes every season. The drinks are price decently, but of course tasty. Kudos to the bartenders.

Overall, this place has been around and will still be around until humanity becomes extinct. So if you ever come to Castro and want a great meal, stop by.
author: Vinson H.

description: have sat indoor & outdoor. both are great settings. food is great. always come here when I have family/guests in town.
author: Neil S.

description:
Good: ambiance and sangria
Bad: tiny portions. Salad was a few leaves and not so amazing. Chicken po boy was good but small, need to pay extra for fries. Saw a guy with one of the egg dishes and he finished it in two minutes because it was so small.
author: Luke M.

description: This is usually a great place to enjoy brunch or other things. This past Sunday it wasn't so great. When we were seated at the long communal table someone immediately took our order for mimosas. We placed our food order and waited a really long amount of time for our food to arrive at the table. The server apologized.  It took so long that our mimosas had already been fully consumed. We didn't really have a problem with that, but we did have a problem feeling we were rushed after our food arrived. Three different people tried to take our plates away before we were finished. There is one gentleman who might be the manager but he was also the expediter at the food counter. He asked if we wanted anything else and we said we were finished. Within a few minutes he came back again and asked if we wanted dessert. He was apparently annoyed that having finished our meal we took a few moments to chat. He didn't mind that we waited an inordinate amount of time for our food to arrive.  Beware of going to this place during busy times. The staff gets stressed not knowing how to deal with crowds.
author: Fred S.

description:
Came here with a small party of 3 for a holiday/friendship appreciation dinner (Probably a tradition that will continue in years to come..haha). With a set reservation we were seated in no time! This american new restaurant definitely provides a cool, rustic feel that I appreciate and am a fan of. Our server was very personable and helpful with getting our orders in a timely manner. We had the following:

Drinks:
*Starbelly 75 (9)
*Walking Dead (8)

Food:
*House cut fries and three dips (6)
*House made chicken liver pate (10)
*Pan roasted black mussels (10)
*Starbelly Bacon Pizza (14)
*Fresh Spaghetti (12)

Drink highlights include the Starbelly 75. SO DELICIOUS between the two we tried. Very yummy with the fruity flavors and the alcohol is very subtle.

For the food...I really enjoyed the house made chicken liver pate. It comes with buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard and in my opinion, you have to have it all together to truly enjoy it. The contrasting flavors definitely scintillated my taste buds. 

The pan roasted black mussel was also something I would recommend. The chorizo definitely gives it a little bit of a spicy kick and complimented the mussels well. I ended up dipping the fries into the sauce/broth that was leftover. 

Lastly, the fresh spaghetti needs an honorable mention. The flavor itself tastes much like home, but what's distinct about this dish is the texture and consistency of the actual noodles. I enjoyed the thicker and chewier texture of the spaghetti which made this typically "normal" dish, different.
author: Vincent L.

description: Went for Valentine's Day last minute and got a spot at the community table in less than 10 minutes! Major plus and an extra star for you guys, SB. This was one of those places on my list for a while and it didn't disappoint! I ended up getting a bacon, jalapeño pasta dish and my SO a steak. Both were excellent and an overall good experience.
author: Tina J.

description:
Thank you to my sister Katrina L. for recommending me!

House made pumpkin dumplings $11: brown butter sage crispy pumpkin seeds and shaved goat cheese. Delicious, it includes 2 dumplings, I wish it came in a bigger portion.

Crispy Brussels sprouts $6: balsamic-honey & bacon - yummyyyyy! Wow, best brussels sprouts I have ever had! I think the balsamic-honey is a brilliant combination.

Star belly bacon pizza $14 jalapeño arugula green goddess dressing. The pizza wasn't too thin or thick and it was the perfect crisp.

You also have the option to choose from still or sparkling water.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Great drinks! Great food! Definitely a great place to come and hang out with friends. The French toast was awesome!  Loved the ambience! Very cool and fun place to be in the Castro!
author: Jocelyn S.

description: I came in a large group and we ate most of the menu so a few quick thoughts. The pizza's are pretty good. The dough has some real flavor and the one with arugula and what looks to be fancy ranch along with bacon was my favorite. Other than that, the pasta is ok but not terribly special, ditto for the fries, and steak. I enjoyed the paté greatly, but I really love that dish generally so maybe I'm an easy sell. It's also weird they only have beer and wine. Also, I thought the staff did an excellent job of handling our large group.
author: Misha T.

description:
I FAIL AT LIFE! I don't know why I haven't written a review for this place yet but better late than never, right?

No doubt one of my fav spots for dinner and brunch in the city. Their menu changes seasonally but here's a few must haves (if available):

*Dinner
1. Chorizo cilantro egg pizza (I skip out on the chorizo or you can ask them to place the chorizo on just one side of the pizza), add the roasted onions (extra $2)
2. Roasted butternut squash and black garlic pizza, add the arugula (extra $2)
3. House fries with 3 dips
4. Bread with burrata and preserved lemons
5. Oven roasted beets with goat cheese
6. Arctic char with brussel sprouts and citrus salsa
7. Spaghetti (I ask for no bacon but by all means, get the bacon)

*Brunch
1. Chilaquiles (recommended by many friends)
2. Italian eggs with tomato, peppers, and bread
3. Challah french toast
4. Fish tacos

And fear not my vegans! They have a few vegan items available or they're very accommodating to specific diet restrictions.

Drinks and service are both on par and after your delicious meal, you can walk it off by sightseeing (more like people watching) in the Castro.
author: Jenn K.

description:
Humphry Slocombe recently created a new ice cream flavor:  Bacon Jalapeño.  Unfortunately, it's only available at Starbelly, which is what made me eat here.  I know...sounds silly, right?  But I was intrigued when I heard about the Bacon Jalapeño ice cream.  Lol!

**FOOD & DRINKS**

Pics of the food: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/starbelly-san-francisco?select=wwL1xHm4QAA0MZ1cewHCxw#33HZDvVz9NHIBW7xuwy5wA

Housemade Ginger Lemon Soda ($4) - Refreshing with a bit of tartness

Crispin Hard Apple Cider ($5) - It smelled like beer, but was pretty bland.  It tasted more like apple juice, but diluted with water. 

Starbelly bacon, jalapeño, arugula & green goddess dressing ($14) - This was delicious!  If you love thin crust pizzas (like I do), you'll love this!  I liked that the sauce was piled on cause most of the time it causes the crust to be soggy.  I only wish there were more jalapeños on the pizza.

Blackened catfish,house made tasso, okra, & sweet pepper risotto ($18) - Very fresh and nicely seasoned! I liked that it didn't have the "muddy" taste.  

Salted Caramel Pot de Creme ($8) - The size of the pot de creme was decent.  It was very smooth, but didn't have a strong caramel taste.  

Butter cornbread, Bacon Jalapeño Ice Cream & Jalapeño Jam ($9) - The anticipated dish!  Maybe I had high expectations, but this didn't AMAZE me like I thought it would.  The ice cream was topped with bacon served on a warm grilled cornbread with jalapeño jam.  I was expecting more jalapeño flavor in the ice cream, but didn't get it.  It was tasty, but like I said, I think I had high expectations.  

**SERVICE**

The hostess greeted us when we walked in, which doesn't always happen at restaurants.  I told her we had reservations, but was early.  She asked for my name and looked it up on the computer and said she could seat us now.  I mentioned it was cold today as she was walking us to their patio area to be seated.  She agreed that it was cold today, but that their patio area is covered and there were heated lamps!  Perfect, I thought!  Unfortunately, the heated lamps weren't working.  FAILED!  

Our waitress was friendly and attentive.  Food came out promptly!

**AMBIANCE**

Contemporary and casual!  The lighting in the main dining area is a bit dim. The bar (located in the main dining area)  has a long communal table (think bowling alley long).The patio area is cute and would be nice on a sunny day.  It's relaxing with fresh plants/herbs growing in the back.  


**PROS**

Takes reservations
Good food
Decent pricing
Good for groups

**CONS**

Parking can be difficult
author: Candice H.

description: I love everything about this place! Fast, friendly service, beautiful decor with an awesome covered patio and delicious, interesting food. However, they don't have a liquor license. Some of the delicious things we tried were the arctic char with cous cous (probably my favorite thing we had), goat cheese dumplings, the mac and cheese and the beet and kale salad. We didn't try the pizza, but it looked really good. Definitely coming back here next time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Marla B.

description:
So I am going to admit that I wanted to try another brunch place before we came here but the line looked massive! With hunger and frustration, this little place caught my eye and I said, we're going there! Now! 

Very happy with our choices, I got the croque monniseur (sp) and he got a regular breakfast platter. Croque was amazing! Though they forgot my egg, I knew it could be more amazing, next time :) his eggs were perfectly cooked and the potatoes were delicious on their own, it was weird how good it was :) overall satisfying for our morning, thanks for having a cute name or I wouldn't have stopped !
author: Kimmie L.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday with a party of 10 people total, which translates to being able to try LOTS of different foods family-style. 

House Fries with Three Dips ($6) - Good sharable appetizer for the whole table. Nothing too special, just your standard fries with what tasted like ketchup, mustard, and pesto.

Chicken Liver Pâté with Buttered Bread, Sweet Onion Marmalade, Grain Mustard ($11) - My friends LOVED this appetizer because of the variety of textures and flavors that accompany the pâté. I thought it was alright, but I'll get to my favorite appetizer in a second.

Burrata di Stefano with Cherry Tomatoes and Basil Puree ($9) - Another great sharable appetizer. The waitress said this was a bit like putting together your own bruschetta, which is pretty accurate. 

Crispy Brussels Sprouts with Balsamic-Honey and Bacon ($7) - The pâté is popular, but this is my absolute FAVORITE. We had to order an extra one for the table. If you didn't like brussel sprouts before... you will after this appetizer!

Chorizo Pizza with Sunny Eggs and Cilantro ($15) - The cilantro really pulls this pizza together with the chorizo, and the sunny side up eggs are a nice touch, especially if you get the slice with the exploding egg. Love this one!

Mushroom Pizza with Gruyere, Thyme, Roasted Onions ($16) - This pizza was too mushroomy for my taste, and I could hardly taste anything else on the pizza, so unless you're a huge fan of mushrooms...

Spicy Italian Sausages, Mascarpone Polenta, Roasted Sweet Peppers, Onions, Tomatoes ($19) - My favorite dish of the night. I was looking forward to trying this, and the unity of flavors between the spicy sausages and the creamy polenta was totally worth the wait.

Bavette Steak, Yucca Fries, Grilled Green Onion and Salsa Verde ($25) - I thought I would like this dish more than I did. The yucca fries were good, but the flavor of the steak was a bit underwhelming. Beautifully presented, though.

Last tip is to make a reservation to eat here, especially for a large group of people. And if you arrive early, just grab a drink at the bar. Great service and great place to eat for a slightly upscale (but not too fancy) dining experience!

---

EDIT: I just came here for brunch, and it was just as delightful as dinner! The staff was especially friendly, and wow I did not realize that brunch at Starbelly is popular for families. I ordered the Challah French Toast ($13) with bananas, maple-walnut, and mascarpone, and you can choose between rosemary breakfast links or bacon. I liked the breakfast links. The french toast looked unattractive on the plate, but it was very fresh and tasty, so I approve.

My friend ordered the Chilaquiles ($13) with house made chorizo, corn chips, chile sauce, cilantro, and a house salad. Colorful unlike my dish, but very delicious as well. After sampling both their brunch and dinner menus, I think I like Starbelly better for dinner, but who doesn't love trying out a new brunch place?
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Tried the foie gras flan the other day and I'm happy to say that despite my reservations regarding "flan," it was delicious. The texture reminded me more a mousse. Light and delicious. Only gripe is they only give you 3 pieces of brioche. I don't know what restaurants always skimp on the bread, but you need at least 4 pieces to use up the spread!

Pea fritters are on point as usual. 

Unfortunately, service wasn't the most attentive as we had to try and flag down the waiter whenever possible to ask for things.
author: Aleyna S.

description: Went here for restaurant week. Had their chicken poboy and some pate. The best thing I thought was the caramel cream dessert thing with sea salt sprinkled on top. Rosemary cornmeal cookie was interesting.
author: Matthew P.

description:
so happy we made reservations bc friday night, it was packed with a long wait list. we got seated in the back patio, which was fine bc they had heat lamps so you couldnt feel the cold sf air. my gfs and i shared a bottle of wine and ordered:
- liver pate - so good and a big portion! highly recommend 
- brussel sprouts - got to get your veggies in
- sausage pizza w/egg - thought this pizza was very delish!
- prather ranch burger w/ bacon and cheese - great but not sure it lived up to its hype
author: Jen S.

description: I dropped by at 6:30 pm on Monday 7/4, & it was busy but not insane. A nice server brought sparkling water which was complimentary. Many places charge extra so this was cool. It took a long time to be served. I ordered an entree of bavette (basically flank steak.) it came with fried potatoes not smashed which was not great. And they knew it. So they brought me white bean puree which was tasty. Still a nice baked potato would have been better. This place should try & just put out consistent food. Our server Megan was terrific.
author: Scott F.

description:
Overall I had a great dining experience. We were seated immediately and the server was super sweet and attentive. 

We started with the maple bacon donut which was amazing!  I had a pizza with a farm fresh egg and arugula that was great and my husband was stoked to see they serve Loco Mocos (a Hawaiian egg, meat and rice dish).   They also had a great selection of beer and yummy cocktails. 

We sat inside, but they also have a pretty good sized patio for groups.
author: Brandi D.

description:
The delicious chicken liver pate dish complimented by incredibly soft, tearable bread, generous portions of pate, zesty honey mustard, and sweet onion marmalade. This was $9 of delicious. The spaghetti hit the spot with its juicy chunks of bacon and bursting marinara flavor. I love that when you mix the spaghetti up, steam rises from the layers beneath. So good.

The service here is wonderful. The atmosphere is relaxing. This makes a perfect intimate dinner in the middle of Castro.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
I crashed at my friends' place in the Castro the last time I visited the city, and the next day, when I found myself alone while more useful people were working, I asked Twitter where I should eat. Two of my friends responded almost immediately with Starbelly, assuring me that I'd like the place. Sorry, point of this now long-ass anecdote: Starbelly! It's the place to be when you're hungry and alone in the Castro.

The place was close to empty at three on a Friday afternoon. I walked in with my backpack, sat at the bar, and felt quite comfortable. The restaurant was charming and casual, with a clean, modern look. The bar was great for dining solo. The bartender served as my waitress, and later, my guide to the nearest train station. She was really nice, and I wish I'd taken down her name.

My original lunch plan had been to eat sandwich leftovers that I'd accidentally left in my purse overnight, but my date with self at Starbelly was very pleasant, well worth the $30 I hadn't planned to spend. I ordered a cocktail and the spaghetti, which one of my friends had recommended. I read a Jeff VanderMeer novel, ate and drank slowly.

Starbelly doesn't have a full liquor license. They serve beer and wine, as well as a handful of cocktails made with port, sherry, vermouth, a variety of liqueurs and apertifs. I had The Other Demon, a cocktail of Kina L'Avion, lemon, and charred jalapeño. It was a lovely cocktail, mellow and balanced with an underlying layer of spice.

The spaghetti was delicious, fresh thick ropes of pasta in a chunky tomato sauce with Starbelly bacon, jalapeño, basil, and a few ribbons of cheese melting on top. The bacon was particularly good, substantial and smokey with great texture.

I'd come to Starbelly now and then if I lived in the city, but as it is, I will keep it on my radar for future visits. I know there's a lot to eat in San Francisco, but I enjoyed my lunch here and would not mind trying a few more things on the menu.
author: Steph C.

description:
It's a really cute place! 
Food and service is pretty good! 
Went to a Thursday night at 8pm and was pretty crowded. It's good to make reservation.
author: Kim K.

description: I came for lunch with my two boys and sat in the patio garden. The kids shared a pizza and I had a grilled chicken salad, both were delicious! I ended up eating a couple slices of pizza because the bacon was so tasty. Our server even recommended a cute candy shop around the corner for treats after lunch.
author: Melissa J.

description:
To Everyone who likes dining at Starbelly SF like me, Please review your receipt and your credit card charge because the people in this place committed a fraud and charged my credit card a different amount.

Of all the years I have been dining in the City, it was only at Starbelly where the waiter ended up charging us a different tip. I have my original receipt and the charge on my card for this bill as proof.
author: El R.

description:
Starbelly, what an unique and memorable name! The food, the service, and the ambiance definitely impressed me. On a busy Friday evening and were seated within 30 minutes. 

-Brussel sprouts: in season and deliciously tossed with a special sauce
-Chicken pate: my favorite appetizer where you spread the chicken pate, jam, and dijon mustard onto the bread. 
-Butternut squash pizza: toppings and crust all tasted yummy, not sure if it's the best combination on a pizza though
author: Christina L.

description:
Very disappointing. First of all we were seated - despite the fact that the restaurant was not crowded - in an area with several tables with families and their screaming little kids. We were then reseated in the main dining area but directly next to what I would describe as the Nuremberg Ring - constant server traffic and every time the door was opened,  a blast of cold air. My wife's soup was bland and disappointing and our son had the Hamburger which did not excite. i had the Pate plate which was boring and the slices of bread were too thick and nothing to write home about. The service was surly.

We will not be back. This restaurant has had its better days.
author: Thomas C K.

description:
We finally made it back for a regular dinner, (having previously only been for a "crab feast.")

I made reservations;  my husband, another couple and myself were seated right away.

Unfortunately, we seemed to have been forgotten about for quite awhile after that.

I had a heck of a time FINALLY flagging someone down for water.
(Then we were left with an empty bottle and a full bottle of sparkling, when we had said we wanted still.)

It took a bit for our server to take drink orders and food orders. It also took awhile to get drinks.

My friend has celiac, and while she never makes a fuss, she did ask the server what she would recommend.  She was told the dish she was going to order might 
have breadcrumbs in it. Would have been nice if the server would have gone and checked. 
She was also asked, "How allergic are you?" 
I realize there are tons of people hopping on the gluten free bandwagon, but she actually has CELIAC disease. Not an "allergy", or intolerance".

Anyway....My guy and I shared a burger, which was cooked perfectly, and a margherita  pizza. Almost the entire pizza came home with us, as we were too full.

The desserts sounded awesome, but non of us had any room.

I liked the food, I liked the space, prices are reasonable, BUT, service wasn't great, and our server seemed a bit surly.

I wouldn't go out of my way to return.
author: Amanda G.

description: Pate and brussels are the necessity. Everything else is bonus.
author: Huey N.

description: Go-to spot in the Castro. Great pizzas, burgers, salads, and charcuterie. The salted caramel pudding is not to be missed. I love taking out of town visitors here because of the incredible space in the back with wood paneling, lights, succulents and a veggie garden - favorite outdoorish ambiance anywhere in the city
author: Sara B.

description: I love this place. It's a Castro staple for me every time I'm in SF. Monday I was lucky enough to catch an updated menu with delicious goat cheese dumplings and a grilled corn pizza which was basically Mexican street corn but in pizza form. I prefer to snag a seat at the bar but the entire staff is friendly and personable. Truly can't say enough nice things about this place!
author: Carrie S.

description: Another example of an overrated Castro eatery.   So LOUD i could not talk to my partner -- we literally texted each other across the table.   Food was 3 out of 10 and service was aloof and absent.  Attitude from the door was apathetic.   I would NOT recommend thus restaurant
author: Steven S.

description:
We made a reservation for two on a Friday night. The place was busy inside, but it seemed like they could have handled us if we'd walked in.  It was a hot night, but the interior was mercifully cool. 
We are vegetarian and ordered the grilled fig salad (with blue cheese panna cotta, cress, and almond honey balsamic), the veggie burger (which came with fries), and the roasted corn pizza (with aged cheddar, Aleppo chili, and lime cilantro aioli). We were pleasantly surprised by the rather affordable cocktail menu, and also ordered the Starbelly 75 cocktail (vermouth, ginger, cava, and lemon) which was gingery but not too sweet and very refreshing. Overall, we enjoyed the pizza the most. We were trying to decide between ordering this pizza and their market mushroom pizza, but ultimately went with the roasted corn because the topping combination was one we haven't encountered before and seemed perfect for summer. The crust was about average but the roasted corn and aioli were fantastic. We though the veggie burger, which reminded us of a falafel burger, was just okay-- we were fine eating it, but would probably not order again. The fries were surprisingly dry-- not sure if we got the dregs of an old basket that had been sitting out or what. The grilled fig salad was small but yummy. 

If we were to come back, we'd probably go with their pizza, and order off the "small" and "snacks" sections. 

This place seemed like it could handle a big group as well.
author: T K.

description:
This is a really cute little restaurant. They have some great seating on the patio in front and an open area in the back. Unfortunately despite having reservations and the restaurant being mostly empty we were seated in the middle in a corner next to the bar and had to smell the overwhelming odor of cleaning supplies as each glass was washed. 

Our server recommended the french fries and I'm so glad we had them. Yum! They were served with several different dips to try. We also tried the split pea fritters with curried yogurt. They were really unique but good. We had the pizza with grilled summer corn, white cheddar, fresh mozzarella, grana, cilantro, aleppo & lime aioli. It was good, but given the choice, I'd prefer Delfina. Best part of our visit was the sangria. It was packed full of pineapple and blueberries. Quite delicious!
author: Kari G.

description:
Another okay restaurant in SF.  Our food came way too hot, like steaming, almost burned the tongue hot.  So that's minus one star.  The service is pretty good though.  Restaurant a bit noisy, but that's common.  

We got the butternut squash soup, which is pretty good.  Got the mussels, which were just okay, a bit salty and the mussels are small.  Got the spaghetti with the starbelly pasta, which was again, just okay.  The Italian sausages were really delicious, though.  

Overall, a mediocre restaurant.  Glad I tried it, but probably won't be a frequent or repeat visitor.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
A great little gem of a restaurant. I love this owner (he owned Pasta Pomodoro before it started to suck, he owns Super Duper burgers and a few others)

We had the hummus & the burrata to start. and we shared a mushroom pizza (added egg and they added 2 eggs!) and the star of the evening was a home made spaghetti with jalapeño and some sort of great sausage.

My bf hated that they added the 3% Healthcare surcharge - but I told him (the next morning after he had calmed down, that it WAS on the website and likely on the menu.)

I would love to come back for brunch, this owner is super consistent with great food.
author: Amy W.

description: LOVE everything about this place but most of all the Po' Boy Chicken Sandwich & fries. My colleague and I go here at least twice a month, sit out on their lovely patio and order "the usual". Staff is gracious and accommodating (and adorable). A total gem. Some day I will venture out and try something different on the menu.
author: Marilyn L.

description:
The first time I came was with a group of four, and it was great. Food was great and so was the service. 

The second time around it was just me and one other person. We were seated at the very back which was fine considering it was a bit busy. I will say the food was great. Our server, however, is probably the reason we will never come back to the restaurant. But there was such a distinct discrepancy in the service we were given versus the table of three sitting right next to us.

Right from the start, we both sense some attitude coming from our server. I understand it's a Friday night, and patience might be low towards the end of the night. But the service we got was not the same as the service the people next to us received. Essentially, there really was no service. He just wanted our order and just place food on table. Not once, during the course of our meal did our server ask how our meals were. While our other table was constantly being catered to. I asked for more bread that was never brought, while the table next to us got a free meal for something that was the customers' own mistake. When I asked for the check, he barely acknowledge me, not a word or simple reply was exchange. He went immediately back to catering to the table next to us. When we thanked him for the check there was no reply. The difference in the customer service provided was so blatant, I wouldn't recommend this to any of my colleagues. 

Overall, the food was great. As I've mentioned my first time here was great. After this second experience, I'll definitely consider one of the many other great restaurants around SF.
author: Thea M.

description:
pro: inventive drinks, okay pizza, cheap cake cutting charge, they don't add gratuity for 6+

con: fried chicken subpar and tasted like it was fried in days old oil, we had a big party but thats no reason why we needed to ask for water refills

parking: yes it can be difficult in this part of town
author: Long C.

description:
I took a large group (40) to Starbelly for a corporate dinner - we rented out the back patio. The group had a wonderful time and I got nothing but compliments on the restaurant choice!

The managers and staff made the whole process so easy - they were incredibly accommodating when our group size changed, were very helpful with dietary restrictions, and overall wonderful. The wait staff was professional, quick, easy to work with, and very flexible. 

The food is amazing! Definitely try the pasta with jalapenos and bacon - we asked for the bacon on the side to make it vegetarian-friendly. We ate up every bite of what we were served - there was more than enough food, but it was so tasty we couldn't stop!

Thank you to Starbelly & staff for an awesome night!
author: Anna N.

description: Corn pizza. CORN PIZZA. We ordered a second one because it was so good. Excellent food, quality, service.
author: Trish P.

description: Probably the best restaurant I have eaten at in SF so far. The muscles are amazing, geez everything was amazing.
author: Autumn C.

description: Vibrant atmosphere, very attentive servers, killer toffee cake dessert, and excellent steak entree prepared exactly as requested. I recommend the French press coffee with the toffee cake dessert!
author: Steve K.

description: I was on a food crawl in the Castro with one of my friends and Starbelly was one of our stops. The dining room area was nice, but we ended up sitting in the back patio. We ordered one of their pizzas (Starbelly bacon, jalapeno, arugula and green goddess dressing) and I also ordered a good ol' Pimm's Cup! We didn't have to wait long for our order and we both really enjoyed the pizza. I don't know what makes Starbelly bacon, Starbelly bacon, because it tasted like regular bacon to me. Other than that, the crust was perfect and the green goddess dressing was a nice touch.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
The homemade chicken liver pate with the onion marmalade is amazeballs. The pate is super creamy, yet not overbearing and pairs so perfectly with that marmalade. Freshly toasted bread is the canvas for both items to be spread on.

Starbelly Bacon Pizza with two fresh farm eggs added - The arugula and the sauce they pour over the pizza is sublime. Everything tasted so fresh and not overly seasoned.

Salted Caramel Pot de Creme - I was surprised at how they didn't overly sweeten or overly fatten this dessert. It was pretty much the perfect right of sugar and creaminess. Paired with salted rosemary cookies - this was one of my favorite desserts of the year.
author: Henry W.

description: Incredible. The food is to die for - try the fried chicken sandwich. If you happen to go on a day with nice weather, most definitely sit outside - beautiful spot.
author: Lisa G.

description:
First time at Starbelly and I absolutely loved it!!! We sat outside in the patio under the heaters and it was just perfect. The service was excellent, and the food was simply delicious. Me and my boyfriend decided to share some plates versus getting main entrees and we certainly did not go wrong with our selections. From the brussels sprouts to the pate and everything in between was simply amazing. Can't forget about the mussels with the mexican chorizo was wonderful! 

This will definitely be one of my favorites!!
author: Maria E.

description:
"OMG! Who's that hottie?!?!"
*points at picture*
"Oh, that's my older brother."
*awkward silence*
"Umm, is he adopted?"

Just as I wonder how some people are related, I'm scratching my head as to HOW Starbelly and Beretta are sister restaurants. Whereas the food at Beretta is phenomenal, the food at Starbelly left little to be desired. (My Beretta review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/beretta-san-francisco#hrid:wNvHUyaQCEPTtixDs647Lg)

Last night, my friend and I came to Starbelly for dinner a little before 7 PM. Luckily, there was no wait and we were seated immediately. Same day reservations are not accepted but call ahead seating is available. Um ok?

F O O D
*CHICKEN LIVER PATE w/ Sweet Onion Marmalade ($10) - 4.5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=Uu0mX378MP7sLA-JKNvMyA
Saving this from being a 2 star review was the wonderfully decadent pate which was as smooth as a triple cream butter. Smeared atop the toasted rustic country bread, the pate along with the sweet onion marmalade was pure bliss.

*STARBELLY BACON PIZZA w/ Arugula, Jalapeno & Green Goddess Dressing ($14 + $3): 2 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=Us2JQHhouYzZbgV8_-Ytvw
Incredibly bland from the minimalist toppings (most prominent flavor was the peppery arugula) the pizza crust was crisp around the edges but disappointingly wet and soggy in the middle. Adding an egg was a complete waste as the yolk was overcooked with just a slight ooze. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=ANfKPbmYihqtF3C8tFb27A

*BURGER w/ Bleu Cheese & Avocado ($11 + $2 + $2) - 2 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=wga8Fmi_T1NKBqut-cFDpA
Inside the stale bun was the dry, lukewarm, and flavorless beef patty. Not even a droplet of juice could be detected. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=Wfs7N6D9JvYt9K5oGRSGWw  Sadly, the pungent bleu cheese and buttery avocado couldn't even salvage this burger. The tepid fries were terrible and tasted like cardboard. I would have been more satisfied with a McD extra value meal.

S E R V I C E 
Friendly and attentive, the staff at Starbelly were all smiles which was pleasant. Though it was busy, food service was prompt which is always a plus. 
 
A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Contemporary and casual with communal tables in the main dining room and picnic tables in the outdoor patio with heat lamps. More spacious than Beretta, Starbelly makes it ideal for group dinners. 

P A R K I N G
Very difficult street parking. No nearby parking lots. 

While the food at Beretta is the star, the only star Starbelly has is in its name. Starbelly, don't be jelly, you have...umm...you have. *scratches head* I'll get back to you on that.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I would give Starbelly five stars just based on the fantastic atmosphere and for accommodating so many of us graciously and without any fuss.. but.. and sadly there is a but, the quality of MY food was merely average.  

I have to say, I'm a sucker for a good fried chicken and waffles, but the chicken was tasteless and the waffles were, well, too dry. The presentation, was however fantastic. Although, some people in our party were very happy with their choice. So overall, a great place for big groups in SF with great service, hoping that you get the right thing. Reservations are definitely recommended. Try to see if you can get their semi outdoor area. It's a joy.
author: Nikki J.

description: Another overpriced San Francisco brunch. My wallet hates me, but it's a lovely space with a great patio. Every dish I've had here is above average, and the staff is surprisingly pleasant given how popular and busy the place is. Just this weekend, they seated us when only two out of the five in our party had arrived, and when four of us were finally there, they rushed out the food for my tardy friend. I think the part that bugged the most were their cocktails. Pretty strong drinks, so yay for that, but really not the most tasty or worth $10 apiece. Brunch places don't need bottomless mimosas, but a pitcher of something would be a nice perk.
author: David S.

description: Best bacon EVER. Thank you Adam and KC for everything. Perfect dinner for an amazing night in San Fran. No need to elaborate further. Just go. You wont be disappointed.
author: Terry P.

description: Beautiful backyard. Delicious food! Definetely recommend the lavender lemonade and the fried chicken sandwich. Loved it!
author: Aïcha S.

description: Nice atmosphere and great food for the price. Had their home-made Italian style sausage pizza. Wish I had a bigger belly so I've could have finished it all...
author: Claes J.

description: I went for dinner last week and was pleasantly surprised by this gem!  Comfortable, fresh, well-cooked food for a very reasonable price! I can't believe it took me so long to try this place but I'm glad I did. Friendly staff, good wine, and an awesome patio. I'll definitely be back.
author: Taryn S.

description:
*3.5 Stars*

We went to Starbelly for dinner with friends, and overall it was pretty good. Truth be told, I like the name. They serve beer and wine only (no liquor), but I had a tasty Kir Royale for an aperitif and everyone enjoyed their cocktails.

We split a few things at the table, including the fries with 3 dipping sauces (ketchup, chipotle mayo, avocado), and chicken liver pate with caramelized onions and grilled bread. This was a case of the appetizers being better than the entrees! I loooooved the chicken liver pate with the caramelized onions.. really great flavors.

I shared the mushroom pizza with gruyere and the raviolo with kale and pork sugo. The raviolo was one long large roll of stuffed pasta, and the chunky sauce brought a nice texture. The mushroom pizza was very earthy, but it seemed like it was missing something. Maybe some herbs or pesto would bring it to the next level. My sister-in-law got the blue cheese pizza, but her complaint was the blue cheese overpowered the whole thing. It was not a mozzarella/blue cheese blend, but instead ALL blue cheese.

So overall we enjoyed Starbelly, but I wouldn't say it's a must-try. Just good for a casual dinner with friends.
author: Meghan A.

description: Great food, ambiance, and service. Really enjoy the freshness and the playfulness of their food. Their beer selection is also local and playful. We ordered the cheese plate, the corn pizza, and the sausage pizza (all of them come with their fancy names that I don't remember). Each plate presents their flavors and uniqueness. Parking is also quite accessible, considering this is s place in the city. Hope you enjoy the experience there as well!
author: Maggie L.

description:
Love the back patio. Reminds me of many of my favorite restaurants in LA. It was surprisingly not too crowded on a Saturday morning at 10:30am. Bear in mind, this is July 5, so...people may not yet be awake. In any case, the back patio has many small tables , shaded on one side but the other side letting a lot of natural light in. Perfect for photos!

I got the unlimited coffee, which I availed myself to 3 cups. Delicious. In addition to the maple bacon doughnut (decent, but nothing amazing), I got the Loco moco dish, which was interesting. It was a fried egg over a meat patty, over a scoop of rice lightly drizzled in soy sauce. I liked it, but not sure everything went well together. I would recommend adding an avocado on the side. My friend got the chicken and waffles, which was amazing. But then again, how can you go wrong with that combo?? The French toast was fresh and delicious, although I wished they had some fruit on there. The mushroom and gruyere pizza was good. You can ask for an egg baked into it if you desire a breakfast feel to the pizza. 

This is a perfect joint for a relaxed brunch with a few buddies.
author: James W.

description:
Ah Starbelly, if only you had read my reservation message I'd give you another star or two.

Being hearing impaired I requested a QUIET area as I was making a special visit to celebrate my daughters' birthday...............We were seated in the main dining room and as I gazed out at the heated patio and saw a perfectly good table that would fit our party I started getting annoyed.

When asked if we could switch I was told that NO that table was reserved...............hmmmm.  

We started off with the pea fritters, which were okay- very much like mini falafel.  You get 5 small pieces.

Mussels were very good and SPICY.  Use the bread to clean the sauce up.  

LIVER PATE-------------if you are into chopped liver, you've never eaten it like this.  You get toasted bread slices to spread  the pate on, they you top that with the chutney? and full grain mustard.  The combination is delicious.  I would go back for this alone.
