Our party had the Halibut, veggie burger, spaghetti with bacon and Lamb Merguez............The Halibut won first place and the other dishes were okay.

Would I come here again?  Only if I could be in the back patio...........noise was bouncing off the wall.
author: E A.

description:
We decided to go to Starbelly on a Saturday night without a reservation. After all they proclaim on their website that they only take reservations for 50% so they can accommodate walk ins. 

We were quoted a 20 min wait...so we left for a drink down the street. 30 min later still had not received a text from them so we headed back. We were quoted a 20 min wait again (25 tops). After spending 30 mins watching everyone who walked in (without a reservation) be seated I checked with the hostess who nonchalantly said our table would be available "soon". 

I have personally been to this restaurant at least 3 times previously and I will never go back. I can't comment on the food this time because we left without eating. I left feeling like we were exiled as visitors.
author: Brett H.

description:
The food was fairly good, but nothing spectacular.  The service, though friendly, was extremely slow and our waitress was either forgetful or too busy for the work she had to do.  Our bacon came out soggy and undercooked, and even asking for it to be done "crispy" it came back barely even cooked.  I know we were trying to get a table at about 11am on a Sunday, but the wait was almost an hour and a half, and we were told "30-40 minutes" two or three times throughout the wait, which was odd.

The french toast was delicious and pretty unique.  The donuts were fucking awesome and bumped my review from one and a half stars stars to two stars on their own.

Great decor and location, and a beautiful patio, but nothing super special.
author: Aaron C.

description: Star belly has been my go-to dinner in San Francisco for over 6 years (I think I started going right after they opened.) The steak frites is perfection, the fries with three dips appetizer cannot be beat, and the mussels are always perfection.
author: William P.

description:
I came here years ago with a friend who was familiar with this spot.  I wanted the burger and he insisted I order the spaghetti with jalapenos and bacon.  My first thought, "bacon and jalapenos in spaghetti, what?! Eeew"  I don't like jalapenos, I do love bacon, but never had it with pasta.  He insisted, and was paying, so I went with his recommendation.  This was about 7 years ago and I've come back for this dish over and over and over again.  I've brought several friends, family, and business associates here and I too have insisted they try that same dish and they too end up leaving with a fond experience followed by weird cravings for it later.  I've tried various salads, soups, and desserts and have always been very happy.

The portions are not super huge, but big enough to leave you satisfied.  Their ingredients are fresh, the menu has a mix of both staple and creative dishes that seem to get updated with the seasons.  Service has always been friendly and attentive.
author: Debbie S.

description:
I was out getting lunch with some friends. We sat out back in the patio. 

I ordered the spring gazpacho (avocado, dungeness crab, paprika) for $9. My friends got the dungeness crab po'boy with fries ($14) and the porchetta sandwich with salad ($11) respectively. 

Service was friendly and attentive during our meal. My gazpacho was good but I got tired of it after a while. I wish I had been given bread on the side for it. 

My friend's porchetta was good because it was much less oily compared to the last time I had ordered it. The salad it came with was good because it has goat cheese! 

The dungeness crab po'boy was good. To be specific, the dungeness crab cakes inside were delicious! The rest of the sandwich was average and small in size. The fries it came with were okay. 

We ordered dessert after our meal. I got the warm toffee cake with marscapone and medjool dates ($7). My friends got the scoop of Humphry Slocombe fudgesicle ice sorbet ($4) and the salted caramel pot de creme with rosemary cookies ($6) respectively. 

Humphry Slocombe is one of my favorite ice cream shoppes in the city. The fudgesicle sorbet tastes exactly like a fudgesicle pop but more rich.

The pot de creme was delicious. Creamy and sweet and complimented well by the rosemary cookies.

The toffee cake, though small in size, was delicious! The marscapone made me feel heavy but it's a great dessert. I recommend. 

Good experience. Again, I love the atmosphere more than the food.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Love this place! Went to grab lunch after my first soul cycle class in the Casto area. My 2 friends and I sat at the bar because there was a 30 minute wait in the restaurant. 

The decor was really chic and the ambience was laid back on the quite side. My friends ordered the Italian eggs. I ordered the cornmeal battered fish tacos and they were really good. It reminded me of my mom's fried catfish. It also had an amazing jalapeño slaw and sauce, it was a great spin on the traditional fish taco. I also tried this amazing ginger lemonade soda...I loved it!

I'd definitely go back to this place and try some of there other dishes.
author: Ebonie M.

description: Great atmosphere, really friendly staff but the food was less than exciting. I ordered the fried chicken and buttermilk waffles--I was served an odd and small cut that looked like it came from the bottom of the barrel and it was just barely lukewarm upon arrival. The chilaquiles were served with an odd salad that did not complement the rest of the dish.
author: Jacob W.

description:
Delicious eats. The pate was nicely paired with a mustard and jam side.  Would recommend the butternut squash, goat cheese, black garlic, and sage pizza. Portion was generous so I wasn't complaining for the $17 I spent. 

Service wasn't too bad considering the number of people packed on a Friday evening! Had a great time and will be returning for more.

Also, try the Lavender Lemonade if you're a fan of a slightly floral beverage. Quite enjoyable!
author: Rachel C.

description:
We sat at a table for two against the wood wall nearest the barkeep.  Every once in a while we would get a whiff of what smelled like unwashed nether regions.  It didn't take too long to discover that the wood wall was giving off this odor.  It was distracting and unpleasant.

However, the liver pate was out of this world!  Served with buttered and grilled, hard crusted bread with a side of ground mustard and caramelized onions-- this was one of the tastiest dishes I've had in a long time.  Clap! Clap! Clap!

We shared a Prather Ranch burger with handcut fries.  We added white cheddar to this medium cooked burger and it was excellent.

We also shared a tasteless pizza margherita with added mushrooms.  It looked great and presented well but there was absolutely no taste to the sauce at all--and, the basil leaves were just placed on top after the pizza was cooked.  I looked at all of the other diners that were eating pizza and every single one of them was shaking a jar of red pepper flakes over their pizza.  I guess their pizza needed flavor too.

Service was great.  We ended with the warm toffee cake with mascarpone & medjool dates.  Winner!  The cake was fabulous.
author: Thomas D.

description:
After a disappointing brunch experience the day before, Starbelly saved our brunch weekend :) We arrived at noon on Sunday. Good thing we had reservations, because this place was packed. We were promptly seated in the outdoor patio area. It was a cold rainy day in SF but they had this area covered and had heat lamps so it was great. 

The food was really outstanding. My boyfriend ordered the chorizo pizza. The flavor was delicious and the fresh cilantro completely hit it out of the park. Finally, the eggs on the pizza provided some amazing yolk porn ;)

I had the chicken and waffles and was equally satisfied. The chicken breading was delightfully crunchy and the chicken itself was flavorful. The waffles were fluffy. My only feedback is that I had to ask for syrup and it seemed strange not to automatically include syrup on the side for chicken and waffles. But our waitress brought it quickly so the syrup crisis was instantly averted. 

Maple bacon doughnut was also delicious (I mean it's maple and it's bacon, how could it not be) but not worth $4. A little unreasonable for one doughnut. Stick with the entrees and you will get your money's worth. 

Thanks Starbelly for a great brunch!
author: Anna J.

description:
BEST THIN CRUST GRUYERE CHEESE PIZZA EVER. so good i wrote in all caps.

i was also able to make a reservation for 4 on a Friday night. huge plus points since most places these days think they're too good for that. whatever dude. perfect place.
author: Thao T.

description:
This place is so cute! Went to sit on the back patio for a friends bday. Pretty typical menu. Ordered fritters (ok), burrata and a few other things- then pizzas for dinner (great)! 

AMAZING desserts!

Service was ok. 

Definitely will be back when I'm in the Castro!
author: Heather H.

description:
Went with my parents for Mom's birthday dinner. The check came & they ran Dad's card. Dad signed the check & put a $20 in the fold as part of the tip on a $300 bill. I would be providing the rest of the gratuity, as Dad never lets us kids pay the bill. Our server took the bill fold & must have thought that the $20 tip was all we planned on leaving. She came back, caused a scene & asked "Did I do anything to ruin your experience this evening?" assuming that the transaction was over.

I've worked in the service industry, so I know the frustration when someone stiffs you on a tip. I also know that you NEVER, EVER confront a patron, ESPECIALLY when the transaction isn't even over. We were still at the table drinking! 

Food was pretty good, great bartender. 

Unacceptable. Too many great restaurants in this city to go back. I still left a generous tip.
author: David R.

description:
We had brunch on a Sunday morning, so we had to take a reservation because it gets quite crowded. The place is super cute and they have a cozy terrace.

The menu is short but the quality of the food is good. I order the sunny side up eggs and they were pretty good, we also tried the chicken waffles and the pizza and everything was very tasty. And I loved the caramel pot dessert, it comes with 2 rosemary cookies.

I totally recommend it for a weekend brunch.
author: Helalo B.

description:
Went here for a going away dinner with a large group of friends. This place is a great space right near the castro that is a great venue for large groups.

We started off the meal with their famed corn bread--and boy was it delicious. I did feel like it was a bit overpriced for the amount that we received, but it had high marks for flavor.

Unfortunately, my main meal was not up to par. I ordered a pizza with proscuitto and sausage on it and could barely find any of the toppings. I actually thought that I had the wrong order until I found very small slivers of meat on the pizza.

The pizza itself was decent, but with the prices being $15+ for pizza, I expected a lot more than I received.

Overall, this place has a great vibe and friendly service, but my pizza left me a little unsatisfied.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Seems like this place is slipping. There was a bad smell inside,  and the servers are kind of snotty (at least the two we dealt with).

Maybe we just caught them on a bad day,  since the reviews are mostly positive. 

Food was pretty good.  I just think it's pricey for what you get. 

Still,  I might give them another chance one day. I really get the feeling I hit them on an off night.
author: Victoria W.

description:
Love the name of this eatery in the Castro, in San Fransisco.  I was told it's name comes from a character created by the author Dr. Seuss.  The Star Bellied Sneetches.  But I looked, and from my table I could not find a picture of one Star Belly Sneetch!  Anyway,  the ambience was nice, the service good and the restrooms clean.  Nice lighting, wood tables and a clean modern look made for an enjoyable experience.  
We started our meal with the Domestic Cheese Plate, artisan selection & seasonal accompaniments--pumpkin seeds, almonds, sliced apples.  I had the Starbelly Salad, mixed greens, local goat cheese, market fruit with a salt & pepper vinaigrette.  In addition, I ordered the Market Mushroom Pizza, with cave aged Gruyere , thyme & roasted onions.  I honestly did not care for my pizza, I felt the onions & mushrooms could have been more "roasted". They had an undercooked quality to them, not very appetizing to look at, nor did the flavor of both onions and mushrooms come to full potential.  This would have been great if the toppings were more "caramelized". 
The Salted Caramel Pot de Crème with rosemary cornmeal cookies made up for it though, it was delicious.  
Outdoor seating available also!
author: Winny S.

description:
5 stars for food & seating: it's one of the few places in Mission where you can get awesome brunch and not wait 45 min+. 
Wait time: if you want your own table, you'll have to wait - probably around the classical 40-60 minutes. However, they have "communal" tables, which pretty much means that you sit at a long table where there are other people as well. For me I don't mind that. 
Food: I've been here twice for brunch and once for lunch. I've had their mushroom pizza, the italian eggs and another egg dish (now I don remember, but as per their menu, it's with spinach and ground beef). Being a vegetarian, they are really sweet in shifting if you ask for it - and I did. 
3 stars for service: they're slow. Really really slow. This is a little annoying, but I come back because of the food.
author: Marie V.

description: This restaurant was great. Definitely a well known place and busy. We had made a reservation which I recommend! We got our table on time and ordered appetizers. The chicken liver pate was amazing. The jam and grain mustard with it was perfect. There was only a few pieces of bread and had to ask for more bread twice. We also had the cheese board which was delicious. Again, it only came with 2 pieces of bread and was not enough. The split pea fritters were great as was the burrata. For our mains we had the chorizo pizza, corn pizza, starbelly bacon pizza, and the spaghetti. These all tasted great and had such good, unique flavor. Loved them. Left with a full and happy belly and would definitely recommend!
author: Emily F.

description:
No star for this place 
Don't go
Keep tables for people who don't show up
Very rude hosts 
Straightaway when you walk in tell you there is a three hour wait! 
We will never be back!
author: Victor R.

description:
Made a reservation here for 7:15 a few weeks prior for Valentine's Day dinner with my boo. On the day of we were a tad bit late because finding parking in this area is so difficult! So Tip #1; reserve enough time to look for parking. We were seated right when we got there. If there was one thing out of the whole experience that I would complain about, it would be the seating situation. We were seated right next to the bathroom so there was a lot of traffic going by us all the time, and the thought of being so close to the bathroom is just unnerving. Also, in restaurants like this, I feel like they try to pack as many tables as possible, so the table next to us was awfully close. I like my space and not having to feel like I'm dining with the party sitting next to me. Other than that, I really enjoyed the overall experience of this dinner. My boyfriend and I shared:

Snacks:
House Cut Fries and Three Dips 
Bread & Olive Oil

Small:
Burrata di Stefano

Pizza: 
Market Mushroom

Plates:
Veggie Burger

The bread and olive oil came out first. Nothing really special about it in my opinion- not to say we weren't satisfied though because it is exactly what it says it is. Shortly after, we got the Fries and the Burrata. The dips that the fries came with were ketchup, a basil pesto, and one more that I cannot remember. The fries were delicious, but I am always a big fan of french fries. We ordered the Burrata because I had seen it recommended so many times and needed to try it for myself. I'm not too sure if I would order it again though. Then came the veggie burger. This one I was a little iffy about because I never usually order vegetarian dishes. However, I was very pleasantly surprised by how well it tasted! It might be my favorite dish from the meal. Since we had already ordered the fries and dip, we were able to get a salad with the burger instead of fries. The last thing to come out was the Market Mushroom pizza. It was also really good but we were so full that we took most of the pizza home. Everything we ordered came out to around $55 so I am definitely satisfied.
author: Michelle C.

description:
The food is good but the service was SO SLOW. 

Burgers were okay. Pizza was the best part of the meal. I want to give this place another chance but it doesn't look promising.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Food is mediocre and over priced. It's a kind of restaurant where you know you won't be coming back again.
author: Manuel I.

description:
Overall, I think the food is always perfect at Starbelly. The hamburger and French Fries are always tasty and cooked to perfection. 

My biggest disappointment is that I was from my first table because the staff did not clear my "assigned" table prior to my arrival, and I always get the feeling the staff is trying to quickly turn tables. The check is always presented early and the service quickly diminishes after the dessert menu has been offered.
author: Justin D.

description: Great brunch! Pizza here is very good. I recommend their signature pizza. Kyle was amazing. Sunny side Joe and doughnuts were also great. Get the sangria. Definitely will return!
author: Courtney B.

description:
Food here is decent, but the experience went south when the server, James, thought to overcharge the tip by $2. (If you're wondering, I tipped a bit over 20%, even though he forgot to put one of our items in our order). I called them the night I saw the charge come across my online credit card bill. The hostess was kind enough to apologize and told me the night manager, Tessa, would contact me back that evening to resolve. She never did. I called the next day and was given the same message. This is ridiculous given it's their fault and likely the case of a server looking to increase his tips by upcharging and hoping the patrons wouldn't notice. Wouldn't have been a big deal except that they were so lax in correcting the issue. Normally, I wouldn't care so much, but this was a business expense and receipts need to match. We certainly won't ever go here again and advise anyone else to steer clear.

UPDATE: Within an hour of posting this, I did receive a call from the manager, Tessa, who promptly resolved this issue for me. She was very courteous and handled everything with excellent service recovery.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Peppers, peppers and more delicious peppers -- that's what our night here was all about! Nearly every dish we had included some form of peppers. That will be my introduction. Onto the actual dishes!

The best was a close match, but the winner sizzled because it included bacon in a dish I never thought possible. Their Spagetti with Starbelly Bacon and Jalapeños was so scrumptious that I wanted to pinch myself, to make sure my taste buds weren't playing tricks on me. Jalapeños added a nice kick.

Next in line and also an intriguing mix of ingredients were the Black Mussels and Mexican Chorizo. Never before would I consider to mix chorizo with seafood, but here, they did and it worked! Chorizo works by itself, so I was primarily glad the preparation of the mussels was also decent.

Other lesser dishes we shared included some Grilled Sardines, Shishito Peppers, and Jalapeño Cornbread. They each were decent, just not the standouts. Drinks that evening were a Sunset in Seville cocktail and a glass of Malbec.

We sat at the bar, but were once seated out in their back patio, by the tree, during a previous visit. Hoping for future ones.
author: Garett T.

description:
When people ask for suggestions on where to eat in the city I frequently point them to Starbelly. It's got outdoor seating which always lures me in & of course amazing food. Major points for the menu that changes seasonally. 

I have enjoyed the spaghetti, fries, chicken liver pâté, blistered shishito peppers, chorizo pizza, butternut squash pizza, burger, & butternut squash dumplings.

... from what I can remember. & everything has been superb. I highly encourage ordering any of the butternut squash items if on the menu.
author: J A.

description: Loved the food. The chicken and waffles are really good. Definitely a place to recommend.
author: Lizette A.

description:
Amazing Restaurant!

We split the fires with dips, oh my god! Some of the dips they provide are outstanding, please don't pass this option up, especially if you are an aioli fan!! 
We then split the pizza with Jalapenos, Arugula, and Bacon.... mmmm just thinking about it makes my mouth water!! This one was also very good and very tasty. This was our first restaurant in San Francisco when we visited. 

We sat in the back patio, which I recommend you try to get, however, it feels up rather quickly out there. Make sure you put in reservations because this place does get packed! Also come early so you are guaranteed an out door spot. 

While we waited for our table to open we sat at the bar to get the night rolling with a bang! While there a lady next to use ordered a french pressed coffee that smelled amazing, she said that it was one of the best coffees shes had!
author: Shawna C.

description:
Awesome cocktails, service and brunch! The interior of this place is top notch and the outdoor area is amazing! 

I will be back!
author: Kelly M.

description: Great food, amazing drinks and best music ever! Pizzas are all a hit and you can't go wrong with any cocktail.
author: Kimiya M.

description: I love everything -- soups, fried chicken, po'boy, bavette steak salad -- and the best veggie burger I've ever had. Yum! The outdoor patio is my favorite place to sit. But the bonus specialty.... they serve free sparkling water!
author: Katharine H.

description:
Been wanting to try out Starbelly & because NOPA was being unaccommodating with adding one more person to my Sunday reservation; we came here instead a few weeks ago.

My cousin got the pizza with gruyere, wild mushrooms & onions with prosciutto added ($15 + 3).  I got the much talked about starbelly bacon with arugula, jalapenos & green goddess dressing ($13) & bf got the porchetta ($9) with fries ($2).  The pizza was cooked nicely & wasn't burnt (unlike Zero Zero's).  The first slice of my Starbelly pizza packed flavor and a spicy kick.  However when I moved onto my second slice it sadly was kind of bland.  I did like my cousin's pizza though she said she thought it was a little on the oily side.  He said his Porchetta wasn't bad & I got a little taste of it.  Though it can't compare to Roli Roti's he said that Starbelly does give more meat.  It was nice too that they did serve it with au ju.  And the fries though $2 extra were crispy and well seasoned.  

Overall, an okay place.  My friend loves this place but says I ordered the wrong things.  I think he only comes here for dinner though.
author: Cat C.

description:
Dinner was in order on this night. We were seated in the back covered patio, which is a really nice place to be. Molly, our serve was super friendly and efficient, as were the other service people. So, what did we order? 
Watermelon salad (watermelon, cucumber, pickled red onion, goats feta, mint & coriander) This was an excellent combination of flavors and super fresh, as were all our plates.
Lamb meatballs - grilled lamb merguez meatballs, minted yoghurt & pistachio 
Pizza - Grilled summer corn, white cheddar, fresh mozzarella, grana, cilantro, aleppo & lime aioli.
All of the dishes were very good. My only issue with this evening was that ALL of them were served at the exact same time. No salad first, lamb second, pizza third... It made for a little frustration as we attempted to finish the salad and then the lamb, before the pizza got cold.
Next time I will know that we have to order each in succession.
author: Greg S.

description: Always solid, conveniently located and I can almost always get a reservation. They have a few things that are always on the menu (like always some type of burrata, the amazing starbelly spaghetti) but otherwise items rotate based on seasonal ingredients. I have been for brunch and dinner and both menus are fabulous. Pro tip: ask for a table on the back patio for a particularly charming experience.
author: Molly S.

description: The chicken pobelly was surprisingly good. The country fried potatoes were delicious. The ambience is really friendly and light.
author: Joyeta S.

description: Loooovvve this place! It's a great neighborhood restaurant, has a relaxing patio area in the back, and the food is delicious. We often go for their brunch and love their chicken liver pate, loco moco, italian eggs, and chilaquiles (yes, we've tried it all!) There aren't many places we can take our family of four, and the servers are great at accommodating our little ones 'special' requests. Check it out!
author: Kay S.

description: Wow! Everything we ordered was amazing! The burrata was incredible, the fries were fantastic and the pumpkin dumplings were the best things of the night. The service was also phenomenal!
author: Sarah M.

description:
I chose to have dinner at Starbelly with my large group of friends because Yelp gave 3 1/2 stars for this place and I trusted Yelp. Sadly, I was disappointed and not happy with Starbelly at all.

Our server's name was Katie and she was extremely SLOW with everything. Slow to take our order, food took exceptionally long to come out... You know it takes forever when you're hanging out with your friends but you still wonder where your food is. One of my friends got his food when everyone was almost done with their dishes so I felt awful about that. Katie barely checked on us and took a while to give us our check. Then a million years later she finally gave us back our cards and receipts. The entire dinner was beyond dragged out due to her and we all had other places to go.

The food was just as awful as the service. My friend's chicken was dry and tasteless. I ordered the Prather Ranch Burger Medium to share with my friend but it came out medium rare. My one friend who received his food last also ordered the Prather Ranch Burger Medium Rare, but his came out just rare and bloody. No exaggeration. My other friend ordered his Prather Ranch Burger with avocados, yet they forgot the avocados and charged us for it. Those of us who ordered the Prather Ranch Burger all agreed that it was boring and tasteless, nothing special whatsoever.

I would say the only silver lining to this dinner were their pizzas, which were pretty good. The House Made Chorizo, Sunny Eggs & Cilantro Pizza was good as well as the Pt Reyes Blue Cheese, Market Pears, Roasted Onions, Arugula & Prosciutto Pizza.

The atmosphere and interior design of the restaurant was pleasant, but I would not come back here again nor recommend this place to anyone else.
author: Debra T.

description:
I went here for dinner the other night with a good friend. The back patio area is great, we loved the ambiance. I had the mussels and she had the brussels sprouts (we had about 30 pieces of bread prior to ordering). Everything was super tasty. The ladies next to us ordered the burrata and a pizza - we will definitely go back and try this next time. 

The spot is great and the food is good. Would definitely recommend for a nice date spot or a group.
author: Leona G.

description: We happened to just come across this place as we were walking around Castro Sunday morning. The menu is on the smaller side which made it easier to order. The service was fast and the brunch was very delicious. Would def come back.
author: Sandra S.

description: Visited on a Thursday night.  We were seated right away at the bar.  The bartender was great- very friendly. The place is much larger than I thought it was from the street.  There's even a covered patio in the back.
author: Cass H.

description: Awesome outdoor patio.  Loco moco with a side order of fries was the one. It the best I've had in the bay area,  though,  if I didn't get the fries I think I would still be hungry.  5 for the food,  4 for the portion,  5 for the patio
author: Genica R.

description:
There were 2 parking signs on a pole a block down from the restaurant and we only read one of them which resulted in a $65 parking ticket. There was street cleaning to be done Thursday 12PM-2PM and failed to see that sign. So, make sure you don't get issued that same ticket.

If you come early, you will probably have the opportunity to either sit in the front or the back patio. We chose the front of the restaurant which was nice but retrospectively we should've sat in the back patio. We never actually saw it but everyone who walked in the front door chose to sit at the patio--probably because of the sunny weather outside.

At any rate, you must go with the Chicken Liver Pate (what they're known for). If you're like me, you probably have never had something like this. It's worth trying for the first time and shouldn't bring up gross solid organ taste thoughts (like the liver and onion scene in Doug). It actually sort of reminded of bone marrow because of the texture, appearance, and service with toasty bread and jam. I think the toasty bread makes it taste 10 times better.

We also had some pizza and fries, both delicious, but the real highlight of the meal was the liver pate. It wouldn't be a bad idea to just come here for some liver pate to share as a snack and some microbrew for a drink to segue your day into a yummy Castro meal elsewhere.

The servers were very nice and attentive.
This is probably my favorite brunch spot in the Castro district.
author: Marlon T.

description:
Once again, Starbelly proves to be the best kept secret in the Castro. The roasted brussels sprouts tossed in balsamic reduction are heaven, with their little crunchy outer layers all sweet and salty perfection.  Who knew brussels sprouts could be so good? There's a traditional Italian broccolini, garlic, lemon delight with crushed red pepper. The bavette steak melts in your mouth, served over fried yucca and grilled green onion, which is such a lovely and exciting alternative to potatoes. Blackened catfish with andouille sausage, okra, green peppers and risotto was perfect and made me feel like I was magically whisked away to Mardi Gras. (It's that time of year) The bartenders are really good at recommending wine pairings. I had a Austrian white with the catfish and my husband had a Paso Robles cab with the steak...perfect. 

Last, but not least, the chocolate mousse! Yes! It's served with vanilla cream, roasted hazelnuts and a little pastry twist. We had a nice sweet, crisp riesling with that, per brilliant suggestion and yes! 1,000 times yes! I could eat there every night.

Great atmosphere, excellent service, impeccable food, fantastic wine list. Do yourself a favor and go there.
author: Audra S.

description: Starbelly is totally the kind of place I like, intimate and nice settings, top lighting, young - even a little hip - atmosphere and a menu just sophisticated enough. I ordered a pizza and a salad that I share with my friend. Everything tasted great. Prices are a bit too high for the quantity you get but I guess it is standard for SF. I had a nice evening here and would definitely come back.
author: Laura N.

description:
4.5/5

Starbelly is a cute restaurant located in the Castro...I love the ambiance! It is very relaxing.

[+] Chicken Liver Pate...a must get! It is sooo yummy!! [$10]
[+] Pan seared black mussels...also a must get! [$10]
[+] Cowboy...a delicious drink on the bar menu! It is also a must! Very refreshing ..taste like strawberry lemonade...light and crisp!
[+] Service was awesome..my server checked on us multiple times and was very friendly.

[-] I didn't really like the Spaghetti [$12]....it wasn't soft enough. Probably won't get that again. 

But, I will definitely be coming back to try other items on the menu...STARBELLY thanks for making my belly happy!
author: Tammy F.

description:
A fantastic restaurant. Great food and fantastic cocktails (except for the Cadillac). This is one of the best menus in San Francisco, everything from chicken and waffles to pizza, burgers and more. Everything is done perfectly.

Place is decorated in a very inviting style, the vibe is relax, there's three areas; outdoor tables, the restaurant and a heated patio. The restaurant is lively and good for big groups. 

The place can be a little noise so request a special table if you're interested on bringing a date.
author: Angel J.

description: It takes an exceptional situation for me to walk out of a restaurant, but Starbelly achieved exceptional status. I want to like it, and I certainly know friends that have enjoyed it, and I've had some decent meals there, but on two occasions I've ordered pizza, and the whole system in the restaurant seems to reveal a chasm of profound unknowingness. The first time, I had some sort of cheese pizza (cave aged gruyere, thyme, mushrooms, roasted onions: why can this restaurant across the menu identify beef as "Prather Ranch" and hazlenuts as "Oregon" and Gruyere as "cave aged", but they can't actually tell you what type of mushrooms are on the pizza, well, that's just me), which, after finally getting it, was nauseating. Gruyere is an oily cheese - wonderful in fondue, but on this pizza, perhaps along with the 'roasted' onions (isn't that practically the definition of onions on a pizza), created a slimy mess which literally dripped with oil. The pizza itself was basking in a pool of its own oil. The slimy gruyere and onions happily slid off the slice into the oil pool on the pizza pan when you picked up a slice, meaning you had to kind of re-assemble the pizza with cutlery to actually eat it - don't think of touching the slice. Unfortunately I did so which immediately coated my fingers with unpleasantly fragrant unctuous oil like melted vaseline, I'm sure somehow managing to coat my body like a special effect from "The Matrix". Nauseating. Well, I decided to give the restaurant a second chance, and in another visit tried a different pizza - pizza margherita, with fresh mozzarella and basil. So simple, what could go wrong with tomato and cheese coated bread for $15? I threw caution to the wind, and even asked for chorizo also on the pizza. After waiting too long (should we say something?), out came the pizza. I picked up a slice, and what normally I'd expect to find - a crisp crust with a thin tasty layer of tomato, warm-brown bubbly cheese, some fresh basil and chorizo - was actually apparently a can of tomato soup served on a flat wet bread round with a cheese crust - sort of a tomato version of onion soup gratinee, with the croutons around the soup instead of in it. This was revealed to me when I picked up a slice, and naturally the entire tomato/cheese/chorizo/basil complex slid off with a plop into the pool of tomato soup. I know it's asking a lot, but when you offer pizza on a menu, it would really help to actually be able to serve, you know, edible pizza. My guest and I got up, laughing, and took the pizza to the main cash register, with the poor waiter, and said we had to leave, here was $10 for the ice teas, the pizza was inedble for a second time. They were of course mystified why I didn't find the pizza staggeringly delicious until I pointed out it was actually tomato soup on a flat metal plate disguised as food. When they saw the soup-like pool on the pizza plan, the sad pizza slice echorche (that should have been the menu description), with doe-eyed sadness they bid me adieu with apologies for their inability to serve, well, food. The mystery lies unsolved in my mind. How could the cook get something as elementary as pizza wrong, over and over again in different variations? Did the waiter servicing the pizza not notice the pool of oil/tomato juice on the pizza slopping in the pan? Did patrons not think pizza slice echorche was unacceptable? Had nobody every complained? Did the front-of-house people think that they should not call a manager about pizza soup? Alas.
author: Joe F.

description:
Starbelly was a great pick for a relaxing, quick Sunday dinner with my friend. 

I like the small space feel of this cute restaurant. The food was good. I enjoyed the brussel sprouts, some salad (can't remember, but it was good) and the thin pizza. 

I recommend this place for someone who wants to try out a new restaurant on a casual night.
author: Irina R.

description:
The atmosphere is Great, server was attentive and sweet, and our table was very happy with their food. 

I got the fried chicken po`boy...Delicious. Come here to enjoy good company and enjoy a great bite to eat.,
author: Alexis O.

description:
I truly enjoyed a recent dinner here.

I guess I had bookmarked it so when I had a chance to have dinner in the Castro, this place came up.

My friend and I were seated in the back on a warm day so the tented area was just right. I liked the interior and overall ambiance of the restaurant. A bit modern but for some reason it had a real homey fell to it.

We shared the following:

burrata di Stefano
camarones diablo
grilled sardine
starbelly bacon pizza

Everything was excellent! I was pleasantly surprised. The only bummer was that they only gave us 3 shrimps on the camarones diablo dish. It was good but, really? only three shrimps.

That was the only real downer about the place so more like 4.5 stars. I will be back!
author: Art O.

description: Horrible service from the front of house staff. I have loved coming to Starbelly but this is down right ridiculous! To start, the hostess was incompetent at her job. Placed my name down for a table of two and she had said twenty minutes. Not only did it take half an hour to be seated, multiple servers and waiters kept asking if we wanted to be seated at the communal table which my friend and I had said "no". I had also asked for a burger that was rare and the burger came back drier than the sand in the Sahara. The fries were short ends as if someone had taken the end bits for the fries. Aside from that, when t came time to pay the bill, we were short changed the change! I have no words in how ridiculous the service was.
author: Eric C.

description:
Love Starbelly and love the food. 
If you plan on ordering a meat or cheese plate though, make sure your problem solving skills are on point and that you are completely sober because it is the most confusing and poorly written menu component I have ever seen. It's like trying to figure out the guilty suspect and murder weapon in Clue.
author: Stevie J.

description:
Yum. This was somehow my first visit to Starbelly but definitely won't be my last. We had early reservations at 7 and when we got there the restaurant was pretty quiet so our food came out quickly. We got the Starbelly salad, the steak and the white bean purée and all were balanced and flavorful. I can't remember the name of the drink I had but it was a sparkling white wine cocktail and was fresh and bright. 

Ok, so I had been feeling like I had become a service snob lately but after experiencing the relaxed and attentive service here, I remembered that service could feel smooth and not frustrating. The environment was clean and pleasant to be in. Thank you for the great dining tonight, Starbelly!
author: Michelle R.

description: This is my neighborhood spot. I love the food and the atmosphere. The fries are awesome, as is the bacon pizza. When it's in season, the gazpacho is excellent as well.
author: Mr. B.

description: Great beer/lemonade and other drinks. The pizzas looked awesome and I def will be back to try that. I got the fries, pate, veggies, and burrata dish. They were all very good and we sat outside in the patio with herbs growing around us. The atmosphere was really nice.
author: Lily P.

description:
Open late, which is fantastic for people like myself who are in the castro late (ie, everyone.)

This place was pretty fantastic!  It's a little trendy, but not overly pretentious.  I have to say that I was a little saddened to see electric candles though.  Is it so hard to get real ones?!  You're in the Castro!

For starters we got the mussels with chorizo, which were AMAZING.  Something about seafood and chorizo just clicks, and these people have it down to a tee.  My date and I would have been fighting over it if it wasn't for the portion size, which was quite generous.

Anyway, we were recommended the bacon-arugula-green goddess dressing and it was absolutely delicious.  I don't even like arugula but the bacon was delicious and the greens went perfectly with the dressing.  If I recall correctly, it was well-portioned without being overly expensive too.  

A few things to improve on though -- maybe a larger waiting area?  Even for just a 10m wait, I felt very cramped, especially when the hostess started talking to one of her friends.  Additionally, no one likes to be seated next to the bathroom, especially when there are other tables open.   If service and those freaking electric candles (as you can tell they bother me a lot) were fixed, this place would be 5-star material for sure.
author: Mike P.

description:
Starbelly is one of my go-to places in SF.  

It's consistently amazing food, great service and a fantastic wine selection.  The atmosphere is cozy and comfortable and the patio is a cheerful respite within the foggy walls of San Francisco.

The manager is always a delight to interact with as are the staff members.  I never hesitate to schedule a business lunch here nor fail to recommend it as one of the best places to dine in the Castro vicinity.

As a ammeter of fact, I think I feel a wood fired pizza urge coming on!
author: Ambere S.

description:
Booked a table for dinner here (and am glad I did, as it was very busy). 

Food was delicious and reasonably priced. Great Italian-style pizza and delicious selection of appetizers. 

Corkage is available for a reasonable fee if you bring your own bottle.
author: Kira G.

description: A standby for us... Definitely one of my favorites in the city. Food, patio ambience, all of it. And the spaghetti is, for some reason, one of the most ridiculously delicious things I've ever had.
author: Holly R.

description:
My friend and I ate there the other day for the first time.  For starters we had the mortadella, salami sopressata, serrano ham, crespone bread & olive oil.  I didn't care for it and wouldn't order it again.  I'm sure others may like it, but I didn't.

For dinner we both had the Belgian ale marinated bavette steak, yucca fries, grilled spring onion & salsa verde.  This was better, but still not all that.  It was cute, but I think for $24 it's not worth it.  I think I may have just ordered the wrong food - or maybe not and I don't like it, but I will go back and give them another shot and see if I can find something I like.

The place was clean and the waitress was friendly and nice.  She was also knowledgeable about the menu and some of the ingredients.

I believe I had Valdiguie (Knights Valley, Sonoma) red wine and that was a good time.  I'll have to look into getting that at BevMo!
author: Shaun W.

description:
Amazing chicken liver pate. I loved their mustard and the onion marmalade that accompanied it.

Mushroom pizza was pretty good, but maybe I still prefer the margherita with burratta.

Grilled sardines reminded me of Japanese grilled fish that I would eat regularly growing up.

Burratta with the flatbread.. meh. I could've done without it, and I NEVER say that about burratta. It just lacked flavor...

Salted caramel pot de creme was delicious.

All in all a solid meal. Not sure if it's some place I would rave about, but I'm starting to drool thinking of that pate again...
author: Kazu O.

description:
Delicious lunch spot..plenty of parking @ 12:30

Enjoyed the 2 pizzas:
* starbelly bacon, jalapeño, arugula & green goddess dressing
* roasted butternut squash, black garlic, local goat cheese, sage & pumpkin seeds
Both flavorful, thin crusted pizzas that were both delicious and sharable with 3 other people.

The chicken salad sandwich was ok...would not order again. Ordered the french fries with 3 dipping sauces (one was ketchup! Ugh) along with a 'green goddess' and another which was forgettable....

Outside dining available.
author: Cheryl M.

description: We come here a lot but had a really bad experience....yes a bottle of champagne for two requires an ice bucket...we were promised but never got it.  Overdone soggy fries which are usually not the norm but lost a star for consistency for sure.  Runny scrambled eggs that were lukewarm were after a few bites not edible...bummer since I was craving eggs today.  Asked for well done crispy bacon....was done but definitely not crispy.  Please fix - because I love your outdoor seating but also appreciate decent food as well.
author: Wesley W.

description:
We sat on the back patio for brunch. The weather was beautiful but I think there may have been heat lamps for cooler climates. 

My friend and I had a Mexican-style egg dish that was very good, it was almost like nachos with eggs, chorizo, sour cream and cheese. My other friend got chicken and waffles. I believe he said they were the best he'd ever had. Prices were pretty standard for brunch in SF. 

We had a reservation at 10:30 am and it was pretty quiet at that point. I could see how it could get very busy later in the day though. 

Great service, too. Our waiter was very accommodating when another friend joined us in right after we ordered our drinks.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Great please for-

Drinks with a friend and or friends...

Also a good place to catch up with your partner and enjoy nice food and wine. 

This place is clean and the people that work here are always nice! 

This is a must try place if your in the area.
author: Manuel E.

description: This place was quite a surprise. I went in after work and it was definitely very welcoming. The atmosphere was very laid back in my opinion. I'm not sure if it was because it wasn't that busy. I ordered their Starbelly bacon pizza. It was absolutely delicious. I would have had a bottle of wine but because I was driving I decided not to. Nonetheless, I will go back again and explore the rest of their menu.
author: Hector C.

description: Food was 10/10. Service was below average. The green goddess dressing is super yummy. The chicken and waffles is danky. The cocktails were all trendy and delicious. The service however was pretty poor. Brunch took over 2 hours and the waitress only came to check on us once. Would definitely go back because the food was so good but if you are in a rush this is not the place to go.
author: Danielle B.

description:
I've eaten at Starbelly several times for dinner, but their brunch is so good it prompted me to post this review finally.  

All their menu items are really well done and satisfying.  Their brunch dishes, especially, are fantastic, satisfying, and upscale without being pretentious.
author: Justin W.

description: I love this place, particularly the patio seating. Sometimes being a vegetarian is a bummer but not here!! We have a few favorites we often order and it's always on target. Having a choice of still or sparkling water (gratis) is a nice touch too. The staff is always very friendly and we always leave full and happy!
author: Fifi M.

description:
Starbelly is hands down the best restaurant in the Castro. Everything here just tastes really gourmet. You get a sense of garden freshness paired with well prepared meats and a kick of jalapeño pepper. Menu items are decently priced as most dishes are around and under $15.

The best thing on the menu is the chicken pate. The chicken pate is rich, salty, and fatty which goes great with the accompanying mustard and jam. Just spread it all on a nicely toasted sour dough bread slice and sip it all down with their wine mixed cocktails. Pizzas are pretty good here as well. The crust is a nice soft chewy gourmet texture that is definitely distinct to this restaurant. 

Starbelly is definitely a great date place or special occasions spot. The interior is a nice subtle rustic hipster vibe but by no means pretentious. The patio in the back is one of the hidden gems in the city on a rare sunny sf day. A really great use of space inside and out of the restaurant. The service is attentive, helpful, and attractive. I'm hoping to comeback to try the rest of the menu items.
author: Charlie L.

description:
Came here for a late Thursday dinner with friends and the restaurant was still bustling and alive. The overall atmosphere is fairly dim but is warm with a good noise level.

Ordered the Prather Ranch burger and jalapeno-bacon-arugula pizza for the table.  The burgers were good and decently priced. The pizza was also unique and tasty but the toppings were too wet, resulting in the majority of them sliding off the pizza.

Was a bit disappointed with our dinner for the night but I would certainly come back to try different items.
author: Teresa T.

description: GREAT place. Wonderful ambiance that makes you feel like you are not right in the city, and service with really impressive food. The burrata was to die for (apparently they always have a changing burrata special on the menu) and the brussels sprouts made me want to cry. Sangria was tasty too. Will return for sure when we are back in the city. I highly recommend!
author: Adrienne S.

description: This place is a gem and then some! Everything we ordered was overflowing with flavour. We tried the summer corn pizza, the ricotta dumplings, the grilled peaches burrata and the mussels with a side of house-made lavender lemonade. My compliments to the chef for the interesting dishes and great use of spices and herbs!
author: Aida T.

description: Chicken liver pate with onion marmalade and grain mustard is one of the happiest things I've tasted in my entire life. You get a really generous serving of pate -- I wasn't able to finish it because it was so rich -- and I was a really big fan of the sweet onion marmalade as well as the house-made bread.
author: Em S.

description: Cool brunch spot in the Castro. If Kitchen Story is a disaster to get into (it usually is for brunch), just walk down the street to Starbelly. I was a fan of the fish tacos and many non-egg food options for brunch. The cocktails look delicious (I stuck to ginger beer and will update this review when I try the drinks). I'd also recommend the fries with their dip trio - the chipotle one is too tasty and he aioli dip is super different from the typical options. Large communal seating space isn't right for everyone, but getting a seat is totally doable. Also the staff doesn't rush you to leave which is nice.
author: Irina P.

description: A great neighborhood brunch spot. The staff are super kid friendly, even if some of the patrons seem to think they might have been immaculately conceived, though, by in large, most are friendly and too busy eating the simple, delicious fare and sipping yummy brunch cocktails to worry too much about anything or anyone else. Can't go wrong.
author: Hm S.

description: A great brunch spot! Very friendly staff, smiles all around and very attentive. This morning my friend and I shared the Bibb salad and the chicken and waffles and the maple donut and for drinks, he had the starbelly 75 and I had the Violet Beauregard (drink of the day). Everything was delicious and worth it. Danny our server was CUTE as heck and so nice, it was like we've known him forever. We're coming back to try lunch and dinner. Yay for Starbelly and Danny :)
author: Kia F.

description: The cutest little restaurant in the Castro! Great ambiance and stellar menu! We had the chicken and waffles and the BLT and left with nothing but full bellies and smiles on our faces! The sangria was delicious as well. We sat in the back and loved the hanging bag plants and succulents! Definitely stop here if you are looking for a delicious meal in the Castro!
author: Channing M.

description: Another of my favorite spot for brunch and casual dinner with friend. Love their home made pate, foie gras and hand crafted pizza.
author: Antoine N.

description:
Love the food. The Starbelly salad was so good. Had thinly sliced plum in it. Mushroom pizza was incredible. Did not have any drink. Like the way they put water for each table in a wine bottle.
Staff was friendly and attentive. Only complaint is about the very uncomfortable chairs. Kind of like a metal folding chair.
author: Joe M.

description:
We had a 5:00pm reservation for 6 people, so the place was empty and we got seated immediately. At 5:40 pm I got a call from the hosted to ask me if we are going to keep our reservation. I told her that we were in the restaurant and waived at her. a little disorganized

Service 3 stars, slow and overwhelmed waitress
Food 3 stars, good but not creative
Ambiance 2 stars, nice patio, except it was raining and we kept trying to move in order not to get wet
Price 4 stars, reasonable, $30 PP
Value 3 stars, We got what we paid for
author: None S.

description: Starbelly I love you, but tonight was tiring. I have had such amazing experiences with you since 2009 when you opened. I've been there weekly,monthly and annually. I support you. I love Delarosa, Beretta and of course Super Duper . Starbelly is in an amazing location and I always bring family and friends from out of town (and in town) there ! Also let me be clear I am not a whiner.  I have never written anything such as this. In all honesty I have worked in the restaurant industry for over 15 years in all positions. ALL POSITIONS! Sadly, I begin with my boyfriend and I knowing our orders and telling the wait staff very specifically what we would like for the evening in one conversation. She wrote it all down no questions. We know the menu (we love it). We are friendly and understanding, but our salad came before our beverages. After our salad came we waited waited waited than had to ask our waitress to please check on our beverages. She asked us what they were????? We waited waited waited.... Than the beverages  came along with our entrées . Before we were even half way done with our salad our entree came ???? I had to leave my table and walk up to our wait staff and ask for the third time if we could please have the condiments we had asked for in our first conversation . I am not here to bad mouth Starbelly I love love love this  place. I am so sad about what happen tonight. It wasn't busy. No wait staff looked stressed or in the weeds. I am confused what happen???? One star because it breaks my heart I can not give you one million tonight !!!
author: Heather M.

description:
Wow, such a good, solid restaurant!

Friendly service, decent pricing, and, most importantly, delicious food.  What's not to like?

My friend and I came on a Saturday night around 7pm, and there was no wait.  We ordered the mushroom pizza and added bacon to it, the broccolini, and the pea fritters.  All three were fantastic!  The pizza was $19 ($16 + $3 to add bacon), and although that pricing and environment does make this a shi shi pizza place, I was happy to spend a little more to eat that delicious pizza.  Perfect thin crust, very good gruyere cheese, and generous amount of toppings.  Highly recommended.

The broccolini was flavorful, really good.  The pea fritter tasted a lot like a very well-made falafel; very crispy on the outside, my favorite! 

The environment is nice too; I consider this a pretty nice place, but it's not stuffy or pretentious.  I like it.  Our food came quickly, the waiters and staff were just the right amount of attentive.  The bill came out to about $30 after tax and the SF 3% health care addition, which I thought was super reasonable for a nice meal.

A great place to come, share a few plates of food (another reason why I like this place, I'm a small plates kinda gal), and enjoy!
author: Vivian C.

description: I came here for my friends birthday and I loved the fact that they had heated outdoor patio except it did get a little too hot. I got the bangers and mash and it was good but I think I should have gone for the catfish instead. I did however love their french fries that came with three dips which includes ketchup, bay season aoili, and I believe a basil aoili? I ended up liking the bay season aoili and the fries were crispy and seasoned with a good amount of black pepper. I would say their portions are pretty decent for its price but I think this place I like more for its atmosphere than its food. However, I would probably come here again to try some of their other dishes.
author: Angela S.

description: This is a surprisingly good spot for brunch!  I say surprising, as their menu doesn't have a ton of breakfast-type items. However, what they do have is pretty darn good. The best chicken & waffles I've had in the Bay Area (way better than Brown Sugar, I'm sorry to admit!!). Also they have cava by the glass (winning!).  The courtyard in back is a lovely place to sit - great ambience that works for groups or just for 2. There are 2 bathrooms, both clean, and not long to wait for service. This is a spot I'd definitely visit again!
author: Claudia J.

description: Great pasta, low key environment, very friendly staff, lots of fun.
author: Mars H.

description: A good atmosphere and a friendly staff, Starbelly is well-worth going to if you're in the area and in search of a place to sit and dine alone (or with friends) for a few hours. I live around the corner and go back once every week or two, hooked on their signature spaghetti (and caramel desert).
author: Dalmar H.

description: First tine to this place not a single complaint from the drinks to the food it was phanomanal. Chloe is a excellent waitress and the ranch burger is superb.
author: Ashton M.

description:
5/2/13 Dinner

Starbelly has been a go-to lunch spot (love their fish tacos and curried chicken sandwich) and I have only been here for dinner once. Last night we came here because it was hot (85F) out and they have a/c. Restaurant is cozy. Seated at a high table against the wall. 

I had decided for a lighter dinner when I saw their sample menu online in the afternoon. Pork shoulder has been removed from it and they have lamb chop instead.

*House-cut fries and dips: I dig the pesto aioli. Fries were fresh and crunchy but lots of crumby pieces at the bottom. I feel shortchanged.

*Starbelly salad: Good and refreshing, with leaf lettuces and sliced apples. 

*Margherita pizza: Very bland with little ingredients. Crust is crispy at the edge but flavorless, tomato sauce insipid, skimpy basil. One of the worst I've had.

*Chicken liver pâté: Best item for the night. Buttery and creamy, served on toasted butter rustic bread with the orgasmically tasty onion marmalade and grain mustard.

The table is very small. Pizza served on the rack takes up pretty much all the room. Server never came back to check on us so empty plates were piled up. Overall I'm not impressed with the forgettable food.

If you do come here, I suugest you make a reservation through Urban Spoon unless you want to crash into the crammed communal table. They also have a nice back patio with heater.
author: Matt Y.

description:
I am review #1000. 

We stumbled upon here after finding out Canela was closed for a private event during a weekday evening. *Pout*

We wanted small sides (tapa style) so I ordered pumpkin ravoli which was tasty. The catfish was good too but nothing spectacular. 

*house made pumpkin dumplings brown butter, sage, pumpkin seeds &
shaved goat cheese/ $11
*blackened catfish housemade andouille,okra, & sweet pepper risotto/ $18
warm toffee cake with mascarpone & medjool dates 7

It was busy during a weeknight (options of outdoor, communal, bar seating).

Toffee Cake with mascarpone cheese was my highlight.

Sangria was average.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
We came here for brunch on Labor Day, and I was so excited to order the chicken liver pate, because I adore pate... BUT because of the holiday, they were serving only their special holiday menu items. No pate. I was crushed, but decided to drown my sorrows in a light lunch here anyway. :)

My husband and I shared the following 2 items (and we were stuffed afterwards!): 

- Bibb lettuce salad: Oh my god, this was one of the best salads I have ever had: Soft bibb lettuce, grilled chicken breast (still very juicy), two thick slices of bacon, cherry tomatoes over a luscious but light green goddess dressing! It was mouthwatering, and even my husband adored this salad. 

- Chorizo pizza with cilantro and sunny eggs: Good, but not flavorful enough. The eggs were too wet and when you grabbed a slice of pizza, all the toppings slid off the slice you were holding. So, it was kind of difficult to eat as well as not as flavorful, since the toppings practically had to be eaten separately. 

However, we definitely want come back to try some more goodies at this gem in the Castro! Chicken liver pate, I'm coming for you!
author: Anh D.

description:
Service was great. Server was attentive and helpful, and very patient for serving a party of 16. If it weren't for the service, this place would probably be rated 1 star for the food.

The brussels sprouts were the best thing about this meal. Deep fried and covered in a perfect mixture of balsamic, honey, and crisp bacon, the brussels sprouts were some of the best I've had.

Someone at the table ordered french fries, and they were bad. I can't remember the last time I thought french fries were bad. Half of the fries were a half inch long, like they were trying to make hash browns and decided instead on fries. How do you dip hash browns in fancy organic ketchup and aioli?

The catfish was cooked well. It was fresh and well seasoned, and very flakey. But, while the risotto had at least the standard restaurant toothiness, it was severely underseasoned. I'm guessing they were going for a cajun theme with the blackened catfish, okra, and (not andouille) sausage. It didn't work.

And then the worst item on the menu: the spaghetti. My god, I haven't ever ordered a dish I couldn't finish, until now. It consisted of pork belly chunks, movie theater jalapeño peppers, and a slightly overcooked spaghetti in a worse-than-prego tomato sauce. Please, for the love of Thomas Keller, do not order the spaghetti. It's like someone got high and hungry, and threw together a bunch of leftover shit they found in their pantry.

The fact that they would even serve that spaghetti would warrant giving this restaurant 1 star. But the service and brussels sprouts were good, so I've decided to give them 2 stars.

This goes without saying, but it was overpriced. Would have been overpriced if the spaghetti was anything more than free, let alone $14. I cringe when I think about eating it.
author: Jefferey L.

description:
Lovely Brunch rushed quickly by the fast paced Staff. I came in for brunch with family that I hadn't seen for years & our experience was anything but Relaxing. 

Yes, Their food is quite good. The Chilaquiles were nice, with Choritzo sausage in them. The fried chicken with waffles was quite interesting and the Yoghurt with fresh fruit, granola, and honey was a bit nice for a starter or light breakfast. The pizzas looked quite good. The drinks were the highlight for me. The Sangria was really flavourful with heaps of fruit inside. Very fresh, refreshing, and just lovely. They also have great Mimosas and a lovely Grapefruit cocktail that one would drink in the morning for brunch I suppose. The presentation of the food was quite beautiful.

I am taking 3 stars off for the RUSHED Seating and the slightly RUDE Service which was compromised; I hate the Community Table. It was slightly uncomfortable & awkward. They are really FUSSY about seating. They take Reservations but if you dont have one chances are you might have to sit at this very long and high table shared with other guests. 

The stools are quite high and its a bit risky that one might fall - I had a foot injury at the time and was worried about the improper seating arrangements. I was limping & was worried about sitting on the stools & the, Staff either ignored me or pretended to be too busy to notice although they should pay more attention to customers & those who have special needs.

Also, the food is served quickly and this isn't really a spot for a long breaky/brunch. They want you to eat and get out quickly. The minute I finished my breakfast and put my cutlery down they cleared my plate! Felt very rushed.

There is a back garden area which looked lovely but on a Sunday Late-Morning it was PACKED. The food is also quite Pricey although quite nice.
author: Julian I.

description:
Brunch was ok.
I got the gazpacho which was ok.  It was fresh, but nothing really exciting.  There were very few pieces of seemingly shredded crab and an ok amount of avocado (I would've liked more).

Joe's egg dish was ok.  The potatoes were nicely done. The eggs weren't amazing or anything, and I felt like it was something I could make quickly. But it was tasty.

My friend got the french toast and it looked great.  The bacon was also tasty.
I didn't like the lavender lemonade too much, but I did appreciate the tartness (maybe too tart for some).

I was disappointed it was still the brunch menu at 3pm or so on Saturday--I was looking forward to the liver and other lunch items.

We were seated indoors next to a window, with another couple right by the open window.  I was closer to them than the person I went with, and heard them better than him, which was pretty awkward.
author: Xue H.

description:
Sat there for way too long and no one approached the table. Finally another server,noticing how long we'd been there,  stopped by to let us know our server would be with us in a moment. Our server approached a table of 4 that had just sat down next to us. When we stood up to leave, she said "i'll be right with you". We just said "no thank you" and left. 

This was never a great restaurant, but the menu often had interesting items. We won't be going back.
author: David Z.

description:
Loved sitting out on the outdoor patio!  The service was great.  I ordered the bacon spaghetti, which I enjoyed.  I'm sure this would not be a problem for most, but it was a bit more bacon that I was expecting....it did add to the flavor of the sauce though.

As a note, they only serve beer/wine here.
author: Melly G.

description:
Every year or so I end up at  Starbelly and every year I am reminded how popular boring food and lackluster service is. The food is predictable and even though it's simple, they still manage to have issue with even cooking. The pizzas are bland in the extreme and the crust is cooked uneven.

Sometimes my med-rare burger was cooked to a char sometimes just half of it. 

Service has also been uneven with servers seeming to forget tables like the one next us for a 30 minutes until they said something.

Overall there is nothing special here.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
What happened to this place?!?!

Starbelly used the be the neighborhood restaurant with great service and great food, a place where you could take out-of-town guests for a nice, relaxing SF restaurant experience. 

My last two visits there were complete disappointments! First was brunch with a group friends. Service was super slow, they forgot some of our dishes, and the food took forever to come out. When it did, the eggs were hard and overcooked and everything else was dry from sitting under the warmer for too long.

Even more recent was New Years day dinner. This was the last straw. The hostess tried to seat us in the cold patio area and gave us detached attitude when we requested to sit indoors. Perhaps, she should have asked to begin with instead of assuming we wanted to start the new year by freezing our asses off! Anyway, she tried seating all subsequent parties outside too with about a 25% success rate. 

Our waiter and the timing of food was simply offensive. We sat at our table for a prolonged period before we were finally greeted. The first round of drinks came out ok as did our appetizers. Then I swear it took 45 minutes to get out entrees!!!! The four-top beside is we're able to order their food, get all the drinks, appetizers and entrees from the time our appetizers were cleared and the time our entrees arrived! For god's sake, does it really take that long to cook a burger and a pizza?!?! I was pissed at this point, but it doesn't stop there. To add insult to injury, our server avoided us for the duration of the meal and we were left to sit there with our subpar food until we could finally flag him down for our check. This probably took another 30 minutes, sheesh!

And if anybody cares, the sardines were greasy and the burger was cold and dry. And yet again, you've managed to make your pizza crust flavorless and chalky. Thought you'd like to know because nobody there bothers to ask while you're eating anymore.
author: Vicente G.

description: I wanted to like Starbelly, I really did. The restaurant itself is nestled in a great location, although parking can be tough anywhere in the Castro. The reason for the 2 stars is because I didn't  think I got the value for what I ordered and it seemed like they were skimming on the pizza toppings and salad fixings. Maybe I ordered the wrong things....but still. I came here on a Saturday night and the place was pretty packed. I started with the Starbelly salad. It literally had 2 pieces of persimmons that were sliced so thin, they would probably blow away if you sneezed. The margherita pizza we got also hardly had anything on it. I was pretty disappointed. I'm very reluctant to return. Sorry!
author: Liv A.

description:
Great options and a varied menu. The chicken patté is a gotta have, specially made there.

Service was good; however, missed to bring the wine before the food. A little off all throughout but our server was very pleasant and interactive.
author: Miguel P.

description: We went here for brunch. I had made a reservation, but the place - surprisingly - didn't seem to have much of a wait at all, even on a Saturday morning. Good brunch menu: some expected items along with unique choices. Pretty, well-lit, spacious interior and decor. Back covered patio looked nice.
author: Taylor R.

description:
YUM

Chicken Liver Pate- yum! must get
Fries were good
Mushroom pizza was good, but I've had better
Starbelly pizza was tasty. I love their crust
Burger was disappointing, lack of flavor. I think just the meat itself was low quality.
Brussels sprouts was delish
Desserts were amazing. Had this pot de creme that was super rich, great for sharing. 
Toffee cake was great too, not too sweet and the marscapone went well with it

Fun ambiance, a little loud but not too bad. Service was good.
author: Erica L.

description:
3.5 stars

I have seen Starbelly many times as I pass by the restaurant on my way to eat at other restaurants in the area. I have also seen Starbelly on CBS 5's Eye on The Bay. However, I could only give it 3.5 stars because it was ok on my belly. I had tried their Prather Ranch burger with fries which was $11. The burger itself looked burnt even though I had asked for medium well. For an $11 burger, I expected a burger to be of high quality with hopefully a gourmet twist. Unfortunately, the burger did not even come with mayo or ketchup. Only lettuce, tomato and red onions. The burger was nothing special and trust me, I have eaten tons of gourmet burgers every month.

The fries itself were ok and were just soft and tasted bland. They taste like In N Out fries. If I had knew, I would have told them to make the fries crispier. My friend had the margerita pizza which he thought was ok and was overpriced at $16 for a pizza slightly bigger than a typical small. Other than that, stick with the small plates. The highlight had to be the chicken liver pate with bread. That was incredible. I was telling my friends, the pate would be very good on a Vietnamese sandwich and they agreed. But the service was friendly and the atmosphere was inviting. Warm and cozy, just how I like it.
author: Danster L.

description: Still great pizza and interesting mocktails. Still a great addition to the Castro after all these years. Unfortunately, we were sitting next to 3 princesses from the Marina and a portion of the crowd was definitely not a Castro crowd. :(
author: Scott L.

description:
What a cute little restaurant! My friend made a reservation so we were seated right away - immediately impressed by the cozy decor and great service. 

Pan roasted mussels - can't go wrong with mussels
Liver pate - definitely recommend! one of those things where the side spreads make the dish. Loved the sweet onion marmalade.
Mushroom pizza - I think this is the one we had.. as I'm not a big fan of pizza, this one wasn't bad
Cocktails are fun and well-crafted.

Overall, cute restaurant and I'd recommend for catch-up nights & date nights!
author: Linda X.

description: This place was ok.  The chicken and waffles had no flavor but it seemed to be everyone's favorite looking at the tables around us.  Maybe I have high fried chicken standards but I was not impressed.  The breakfast chorizo pizza was delish though. Mimosas were very strong although it took about half an hour to get them.  The brunch struggle in SF is real,  now I understand why.  There aren't a ton of brunch places with solid food and service.
author: Diana D.

description: Atmosphere is lovely but the food is just disappointing at best. I stick with the burger. It's somewhat safe. Service is non existent at times then overbearing if you are the last in their section. They make no effort to be subtle in wanting you to leave. But, the location and outdoor option is very nice. I suggest white wine and a nibble on a beautiful day in there patio.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
Just walk inside and you will be surprised.  The outside of Starbelly does no justice to the beautiful inside.  Inside brings a great atmosphere, cute decor, and urban hardwood.

The menu is a mix of small plates, pizza, and some entrees.  They have an extensive wine menu and a nice selection of beers, and other drinks.

I enjoyed a wonderful burger with fries.  Most of the menu has great price points, but like most places the small plates are a little high (especially for a few as a meal).

I will definitely be back here.  Starbelly would also make a great date spot!
author: Alan H.

description: Very good food, service and atmosphere.  We walked in as they were switching to dinner for a quick bite and really enjoyed ourselves.
author: Brianna H.

description: I really like this place. It's a strong dinner contender and a great brunch option on the weekend. Cool vibe and consistently strong food. For brunch, try the loco moco (ground beef over rice) or one of the pizzas. Also their creative donuts are awesome. Sometimes it can be a wait to get seated, but you won't be disappointed.
author: Mike D.

description: Really liked the vibe of this place.   There's a great patio out back that I was envious I wasn't sitting in, but the inside of this place is stellar as well.  I've been wanting to come here for a while since I read it was part of a family of restaurants in the city that I am a huge fan of, and Starbelly did not disappoint!  I had the cornmeal crusted fish tacos with fries, both were flavorful.  Starbelly is really conveniently located, just off of Market, and is easily accessible from either the Church or Castro Muni stations.  This is definitely a great place to gather with friends for brunch.  Oh, and staff is awesome! Very friendly, happy crew.
author: Kristen F.

description: If you enjoy rich food, like I do, walk in, sit your ass down, order their house made chicken liver pâté and a glass of Sauvignon Blanc, knock it all back, and then order their spaghetti with big delicious chunks of starbelly bacon, and a glass of Cabernet Sauvignon. When walking out, remember how good life is.
author: Liz M.

description:
The food is good here. The portions are pretty small though for dinner. The lunch seems to be a little bit better. All of the food seems really fresh though. If you're looking for a nice place to go in the Castro, I would recommend this place.

I believe the same people who own Beretta own Starbelly. Prices are about in the same price range. They do have good pizza at both places. They did a really tasty thin crust here.

The atmosphere is also nice. There's even a back patio so on a warm day, it's definitely well worth seeking out.
author: Amy J.

description: Always great food and friendly service. Love sitting in the patio out back! The housemade bacon is a must to add on to a pizza, so delicious!
author: Adriana B.

description: Ate here last night and wasn't disappointed. Easy to make a resi, have an adorable outdoor/covered patio and a very classic trendy inside bar/table area as well. The front of the restaurant can be a little loud but we got a table in the back which was perfect. Great selection of wines by the bottle (bar tender recommended this for the value) and lots of variety on small share plates to start. We got the citrus salad with grilled avo (yes), brussels (order these immediately), and the broccoli, which were all amazing. The burrata pizza was tasty, fresh and crispy (def upgrade the moz for burrata). We also split the artic char which was an interesting combination of things but flavorful, I will probably skip this next time.
author: Michelle R.

description: Stopped by for a friend's birthday dinner. We started with french fries (perfectly seasoned, and comes with 3 sauces!), chicken pate (delicious) and a cheese plate (great variety). (Almost) the whole table ordered the spaghetti. I had heard nothing but good things about the spaghetti, and I was not disappointed. The noodles were cooked perfectly, tossed in a tomato sauce spiced up with jalapeños and chunks of bacon. It was love at first bite.
author: Gina P.

description:
YES. So much yes.  What we ordered: meat + cheese platters (all the meats and all the cheeses), the chicken liver pate, pumpkin dumplings, mussels, mushroom + sopressata pizza, and broccolini.  

Meat + cheese: you can't go wrong. The strawberry jam + the fruit and nuts were a nice touch.

Chicken liver pate: omg, the best I've ever had.  Delicious. And the candied onions were phenomenal.  

Pumpkin dumplings: boyfriend loved them, but I'm not a huge pumpkin fan.  They were light on the pumpkin flavoring, but just kind of so-so in my thought.

Mussels: DAYUM good.  Perfectly cooked, awesomely flavored (like a light tomato-chili-jalapeno broth).  

Pizza: DEEEEEEELICIOUS.  I am usually not a fan of no-sauce/white pizzas, but this one was unbelievable. 

Rice pudding + cherries for dessert: tasty as can be. 

Broccolini: had a very weird bitter taste.  No bueno, but I think that may have been a one time mistake?  Can't really place it, but it just wasn't good.
