Five stars for everything except the dumplings and the broccolini.  Nomssssssss.
author: Shannon B.

description: fave restaurant in the castro. and my favorite pizza crust in the city! i told my partner last time we went i would literally eat it plain. the starbelly bacon pizza is SO DAMN GOOD, and in the summer they have a sweet corn pizza i would rank high on my "last meal" list. and OH the honey/balsamic brussels sprouts with bacon!! the pâté! i've loved everything i've eaten there. cheese plate portions are very small, as are salads (awesome little salads, though). love the vibe of the place, the servers have always been extremely sweet, really well procured beer selection.. wine too, but i'm more beer-y. so glad i live just down the street, but i would make special trips if i didn't.
author: Lisa R.

description:
Even though I literally live down the street, I'm trying it out the first time in 5 months that moved to this neighborhood. There was no wait since its 2:30pm, and the food came out real fast. 

Loco moco: the egg and sauce was really tasty. But the beef patty was just so so. 
Starbelly pizza: OMG love the sauce on this pizza. The crust is light and crunchy. Will definitely come back for this. 
Chilaquiles: it's pretty much like a nacho, fancy and tasty one with a salad. Since I love nachoes I helped myself to my friends a few times. 
Side of apple sausage: it's alright. I think the Costco one tasted better. 

My friends loved the French press coffee and fresh squeezed grape juice. Overall, good experience. Will definitely come back.
author: Lilly W.

description:
Oh, no, no no......

Really, really meh.  We had one ok dish and two bad dishes.  

we had a salad that i remember liking, but, it wasn't memorable enough to, like, remember what it was.

Arancini - came out cold in the middle.  We sent it back.  It came back less cold in the middle.  We just decided to eat the fuckin thing.  

Blue Cheese proscuitto and arugula pizza - DRY.....like eating cardboard.  there was no dressing or moisture of any kind.  No sauce.  No vinegar or oil on the arugula.  It was a too crispy, not very flavorful crust with a bunch of arugula and proscuitto tossed on at the end, and somehow this was supposed to be worth $17.  There are too many good pizza joints in the city to spend time and money on things such as this.

The thing that peeved us was the fact that the waitress didnt take the arancini off the bill.  That and it took a really long time to get our check.....another pet peeve of mine.

Skip it.  There are a lot better places to go to.
author: Christian C.

description: Really enjoyed lunch here. Came on a Saturday afternoon and was immediately seated by the friendly staff. Their patio is beautiful! I highly recommended their burger, the patty is one big piece of delicious meat. Fries are seasoned and crispy. Very good. The location is great. Right on market street and it's also a great place to catch up with someone as its not a loud place.
author: luis m.

description: Love this spot for dinner. Always great service. Pate is on point: must try.
author: Joshua Y.

description:
Came here early in the week for dinner and it was surprisingly pretty packed. Ordered a chorizo pizza because why not? Pizza was so so, bits of chorizo and chili oil or hot sauce on the pizza. Made it a little greasy, nothing special though. Was a margarita pizza otherwise. Not bad, was ok.

Bar is like a half bar, only bitters and some spirits. So don't come here and think you are getting a cocktail that is not on their drink menu. I just ended up getting a beer.
author: Greg G.

description: One of my favorite spots in the city for brunch, I always bring friends visiting the city there and they consistently love it. Wait for the patio if you can. Service is inconsistent and generally slower than average, so go there if you have time to relax and chill. Order a pimm's cup -or two- and wait for the magic to happen.
author: Clara C.

description:
Look this New Yorker has been searching SF and the bay long and hard for a good slice of pizza. It has gotten to the point that I've reverted back to dorm days and started eating pizza rolls (because you know what PIZZA ROLLS WILL NEVER LET YOU DOWN). When a friend suggested Starbelly, I looked at the menu and sighed. No use getting too excited about pizza that will probably make me want to cry. 

But like...this pizza.
This pizza. 
This. Pizza. 

Walking into Starbelly I felt like I had stepped into an all gay male date. Everyone was bearded, well dressed, and well on a date. It was lovely. The hostess and our waitress were both total sweethearts. 

The beer menu is solid. 

The actual menu is brief. And I at first got a little nervous. For I am a picky eater. Me and my partner in crime both landed on the same pizza. The one with the mother fucking onion jam. Like anytime jam is on a menu in a savory way it is the item one should order. Bacon jam? Onion jam? Come on. #jam 

The pizza was da-licious. 

I was also drunk. 

I feel like that doesn't actually matter. But it is worth noting. 

*food is also always better when there is booze in your system. 
**your judgement means nothing here. 

Starbelly is super pretty without being pretentious. Great first date spot. Or somewhere you would go back to with friends or your special someone every few weeks. 

***get drunk.
author: Ryley P.

description: The good restaurants in the Castro are disappearing just as quickly as the cool new cafes are popping up. Anyway, tried this place for the first time. It was packed on a busy Sunday brunch time. Hostess could not have been nicer in accommodating our group of 3. Like most popular places it was very very noisy inside. We opted for the patio which was heated and well lit. The service was pretty good. Food took a bit of time to come out (but we weren't in a hurry). My friends loved their Bibb salad and gourmet burger. I had the french toast. Only issue was that it came out almost cold. Food MUST come out piping hot! The price was not cheap. One glass of sangria and french toast meal was $30! I don't mind paying that in SF as long as it's excellent. When it came back the second time (which took way too much time, considering my friends had already started eating) it was really good. Details count. Definitely worth returning.
author: Bill R.

description:
I came with a group of people so we were able to sample several dishes.
The pluses:
The physical atmosphere is nice
The french fries were fresh and tasty
One friend liked his burger

Negatives:
The entire waitstaff was crabby,  inattentive,  slow and scowling
The salad was miniscule.
The spaghetti was reddened noodles.
The fried chicken came red and raw at the bone and was a very small drumstick and a thigh cut in half.  Undercooked and tasteless.
The sardine smelled so fishy I didn't even want to taste it.
The honey ice cream arrived in a melted pool.

Most of the food we ordered should not have made it out of the kitchen.
I am glad none of us got sick.
author: mi m.

description:
My first outing here was a terrible experience, and you know what everyone has their off days. So I am going to chop that experience up to that. I am glad I went back a second time and since then I have been back several times. This is really one of the best restaurants in the Castro (which isn't saying much, but still). 
Great patio. Great food, and the service has improved greatly. They always have some delicious specials and I always love starting the meal off with a pizza as an appetizer for the table. I feel bad for my first review of this place and I hope this helps.
author: Silvio S.

description: starbelly is good, however, I went last nite and had terrible food poisoning in the middle of the nite following the experience (it was the last meal I had before bed) which obviously leads to an overall bad experience. I'm a bit afraid to return.
author: Christie D.

description: This was our last stop in SF on vacation in January, and it was one of the most memorable. We are from Chicago, so we were excited to be in a city where the sun actually shines and wanted to take advantage. Starbelly has an outdoor patio in the back that is covered. We went for lunch and mentioned our sun issue, and they came over and retracted the patio roof for our table (most other patrons wanted the shade). We thought the service was fantastic even beyond this nice gesture. They also had a nice beer list and this amazing pizza with Starbelly bacon, jalapeño, arugula & green goddess dressing.
author: Heidi B.

description:
A friend and I came for lunch on a Sunday around 1:30 and got a seat right away. The patio was full - it was a nice day - but we were able to sit next to the glass wall inside the restaurant looking out at the patio. The décor is clean and the vibe is good. I immediately liked Starbelly. 

They have the kind of menu I love. Everything sounds good and it only takes about 90 seconds to decide. My friend and I decided to share a Gruyere, mushroom, thyme, onion pizza and the chilaquiles with chorizo. We both ordered beer from the eclectic offerings, trying ones we've never had, and really liked them. The service was great, the food came out quickly and the bill was $45. 

The pizza crust was perfect, thin with just the right amount of flake and chew. We ate every bite of food and were just a tad beyond satisfied. The pizza wasn't as flavorful as I expected but was still good. The chilaquiles were awesome. I don't even know what they are but I could have eaten this dish all day. So delish! Not very spicy but really flavorful. 

Only one unisex bathroom here in the middle of the restaurant so if you need to go, you'll either line up in front of everyone or keep your eye on the door. Either way, not an ideal setup.
author: Angelique L.

description:
If asked to make the difficult choice of choosing my favorite "go to" restaurant in San Francisco, I would choose Starbelly. For me, this place has everything. First of all, the staff is very polite, friendly and engaging. I've never had a bad experience in the bazilion times I've been here. And the food is delicious! For brunch, we had the Chilaquiles and the Fried Chicken and Waffles. Both were absolutely scrumptious! The chicken was nice and moist and the Chilaquiles couldn't have been more flavorful. We sat in the back patio area which has a clean simplistic feel to it. I love this seating area. It's covered so you don't have to worry about getting too much sun (when that's an option). To quench our thirst, we decided on a bottle of the Prosesco. It was so tasty that we ended up letting our nice waiter talk us into ordering an additional bottle after our meal. 

Starbelly you make me happy!
author: H P.

description: Chicken and waffles are good and the egg breakfasts are good. French toast not so good, first time was cold... second time bread was full of cool liquid. They did remove the French toast from bill, but disappointed.....
author: Joe L.

description:
One of my new favorite places to go to.....

Definitely love their wine and their spaghetti with big pieces of BACON!! Put the BACON in my Belly...  

I would love to try their other dishes and get other small plates and seat out by the Patio although it closes exactly at 945 pm

Parking was easy and convenient, I just had to cross the street. But then again it was Monday night. Their service is excellent and great customer service.
author: Claudine V.

description: Good food and great drinks! We had mussels, and a pizza and the craft cocktails were spot on. Service was great initially but kind of slacked through out the meal. Otherwise great place and cool atmosphere.
author: Garet F.

description:
My friend and I went to starbelly on an unusually warm spring day, excited about the prospect of a large, partially covered patio. This part of Starbelly did not fail to deliver. This, along with its candlelit interior, lend a warm, cozy ambiance to this restaurant. Now for the downside: while, admittedly we were 10 minutes late to our reservation, we waited an additional 40 minutes for a table, assured along by constant promises of being seated in "2 minutes." Once we were seated, our waitress was friendly when attending to us, but largely inattentive. The food was mediocre, but we were provided with several free appetizers to compensate for the wait. Drinks were terrific (recommend the High Garden and Pimms Cup)

Long story short: great service by management and bar, mediocre kitchen, mediocre wait staff.
author: Donna B.

description: Excellent brussel sprouts, pumpkin dumplings and homemade sausage! Sit out on the patio, it has several heaters so you can still enjoy it during the colder winter months. My only complaint is that my hard cider was served over a glass full of ice, so it was pretty watered down by the time I got it!
author: Hayley H.

description:
My favorite neighborhood spot for a nice weeknight or low-key Friday evening dinner. It's a great place to take out of town folks (read: parents) because it has something for everyone - you can be a foodie and eat burrata and pate, or get a classic burger or 
roast chicken. That despite having a relatively small menu (which is my preference anyway). Only downside is no liquor license! Beer / wine only, but an ok selection. Service has been phenomenal in the past; the last few months it's been spotty with some pretty distracted / standoffish young female servers joining the ranks of the great folks that have been there for a few years.
author: Rebecca W.

description: Decent vegetarian options here. We got the mushroom pizza and enjoyed it although it needs salt and more toppings.
author: E P.

description:
Crispy brussel sprouts, balsamic-honey & bacon- 5 out of 5 on this one

House cut fries & three dips- Came with ketchup and two other house-made sauces but cannot recall what they were

Fresh spaghetti, starbelly bacon, jalapeño, tomato sauce & basil - pasta was definitely fresh and thick. Bacon was not the typically small-cut bits but rather large and juicy. Great combination along with jalapeno and sauce.
author: Alice C.

description:
I had dinner at Starbelly this Thursday, 10/09. At first glance, I was not sure what to expect, but the staff was very friendly and the decor was very inviting. As for the food (rated *-***** stars): 

1) House made chicken liver pate, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard - ***** stars, Simply delicious
2) Pan roasted black mussels, Mexican Chorizo, market chili & cilantro - ***stars, Nothing special
3) Applewood smoked chicken breast risotto, roasted maitake mushroom, romano beans & shaved granna - *****stars, Delicious 
4) French Cowboy (Cardamaro, strawberrt, sage & lemon)- ****stars

Overall, great experience.
author: Lisa H.

description:
A good, affordable (for SF standards) standby for a pleasant night out.

I always shoot for outdoor seating - the back patio is covered, with heat lamps and a somewhat rustic garden feel.

The waitstaff is hit or miss. Luckily, on my most recent trip, I had a very friendly waiter who was attentive without being overly so. I appreciated that he had recommendations (when I asked), and they were all spot-on!

Favorite dishes:
Homemade chicken liver pate
Starbelly bacon pizza with arugula and green goddess sauce
Salted caramel pot de creme with rosemary cookies - I ADORE this desert, there's a smokiness to the caramel, accented nicely with sea salt - and it goes beautifully with the cookies. I don't always get dessert when I go out, but I order this every time I go to Starbelly!

Excellent drinks:
The Cask of Oloroso: slightly citrusy and spicy, very nicely balanced - perhaps too drinkable! :)
French Cowboy: very refreshing, with a fun combination of strawberry and sage. Not at all too sweet. There's a very slight bitter aftertaste.

Others:
Sunset in Seville: nice and refreshing but not remarkable.
The Declaration: the madeira gives it a bit too much sweetness up front, and I didn't love how the flavors came together.

Cons:
Super crowded inside - even compared to other SF restaurants.
Their wine list isn't reliable.

One time we had a lousy experience (hence the 3 stars), when my husband and I brought a friend for his birthday. We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation, requested outdoor seating (which I had also asked for when I made the reservation), and waited for a table to clear. Three people who arrived about 15 minutes after us and had a reservation for the same time were seated almost immediately outside. We asked about our table, and from the conversation between the hostesses,  it was clear that one of them had completely forgotten about us. They finally sat us inside (after we had waited for 45 minutes), shoved in an unpleasant corner next to the bathroom. They apologized but that was it.

Bottom line: overall good food (some is excellent), great patio, but they won't go out of their way to make it up to you if they make mistakes.
author: Kate Z.

description:
Sunday brunch in the City ::groan:: Lines, lines, and more lines.

Thankfully, at 1pm, Starbelly's open for business without a line in sight. The place is packed, but seats are definitely available. This calls for a "huzzah!"

My friend and I sit down and order a drink: a Michelada (Modelo beer, lemon, spices, and salt with a spicy rim) for me, and a Starbelly 75 (Cocchi Americano, ginger, fresh lemon, prosecco) for her. We are officially happy.

We order:
+ Chilaquiles: house-made chorizo, corn chips, chile sauce, and cilantro with a house salad. Avocado available on the side (half of an avocado; none of this paltry two paper-thin slices silliness).
+ Sunnyside Joe's: Prather Ranch ground beef mixed with aged cheddar, onions, and spinach, with potatoes on the side.

Both dishes were beautiful, delicious, and very filling. Attentive service with a smile. Very pleased with brunch time at Starbelly.
author: Adena B.

description:
I love the food and the atmosphere at Starbelly. Casual, approachable vibe with lots of different places to sit - tables, high-tops, back patio - and DELISH pizza, burgers and appetizers.

But there's a problem that all good places have: it gets *crowded.* That'd be ok if they didn't try to cram as many people in the place as possible. Last night me and the hubs were literally wedged into a teensy two-top about 6 inches from the next table and 3 inches from the waiter/waitress stand. This meant we were listening to the waitstaff and our neighbors the entire meal (and swiped our behinds next to their plates every time we had to get up or sit back down).

Starbelly, you've had a great thing going on for the past 5ish years -- keep it good!
author: Diane B.

description: Just a staple brunch/dinner spot that is always reliably good and a nice atmosphere while not being tough on the wallet.  I'm so happy this place exists and to be honest is t rated highly, bc then it would be stupid crowded like Kitchen Story, which is the definition of overrated.
author: Bud N.

description:
Best.burger.in.sf! 

Get it with the house made pate and onion marmalade. 

Causal yet elegant atmosphere. 

I bring visitors here regularly
author: Carlos M.

description:
Housemade pate= spot on. Pizza came out lukewarm.

The clientele= the Marina East. Full of straight tech-tards.
author: lance l.

description: been back here a couple times since my original post and its still as good and consistent as the first visit. order the chicken liver pate and the caramel pot de creme. IT IS SO, SO GOOD.
author: Amy T.

description: Awesome food and service - and a great selection of beer! Try the Mushroom pizza, it's really delicious.
author: Morten C.

description:
stumble upon here for lunch on a monday. we sat down as we walked in. they have a nice patio outside and some  cute casual decor around the whole resto. we were asked if we wanted sparkling water instead of regular water. the regular water was placed in a bottle that looked like wine. 

i then ordered dried pea & quinoa patty, cucumbers, white bean puree, LTO & curry yogurt for only 10 bucks. and substituted for salad for 2 dollars more and it was so worth it becauae there was  alot of salad like half a plate of it. i chose salad versus french fries which wasnt additional charge i believe. the patty was so fresh and crisp and it was very tasty which i was very surprised and the flavor of the curry yogurt spread  really kicks it off.  for the price of this dish i was very satisfied and can imagine how the other dishes would taste. 

my friend ordered the grilled steak salad. the size of the steak they served in the salad was a big amount. the presentation was very colorful and delicious... i mean it was green and red cherry tomatoes with some white colors which was the feta cheese. and this was only 13 bucks. i just thought they should have given a little bit more salad thought it was a bit skimpy but my friend was happy and no complaints maybe my eyes were bigger than my stomach. 

the service was great and keep on coming back and check and asked if needed anything. i would  come back and try other stuff.
author: Alex T.

description: Food was good. The pizza was bland and needed the basic seasoning. The service was ok, but they took awhile to take our order etc. They were way understaffed. I would try again as the food was tasty with the exception of our pizza.
author: Melinda M.

description: Had a server Becca who was able to breakdown the menu with all the gluten free options and modifications and without skipping a beat. I have Celiacs and it's hard going out to eat because of this but I was visiting SF and it was late at night and we happen to stumble across Starbelly. after Becca ran through the menu and made me feel okay about having to pick apart the menu I was able to have a. Enjoyable dining experience and had the best chorizo mussel app and my BF had a garlic noodle dish that he loved. Would visit again.
author: Mel M.

description:
Do yourself a favor and get the sangria. Bacon is house-made, too.

My best friend Matt and I went to have a proper luncheon, and hot damn were we happy with our food.

He tipped me off to the house made bacon. Mmm. Yes. That's the second time I've mentioned it. Shall I mention it a third? 
BACON.

Pizza was delicious. I wasn't going to drink, but dear god the Sangria was like a siren, beckoning me. And Matt hovered like a vulture until I offered him a sip.

We split fries with three dips that were UNBELIEVABLE. 

And, delicious salad that was crispy and fresh.
Staff were awesome, attentive, and fun.

"I'll be back."
author: Nicole L.

description:
Really like the outdoor patio, but the food was more like a 3.5*'for me

- Split pea fritters were pillowy and quite flavorful. 
- spaghetti with bacon Qs delicious
- pizza was good but not memorable
- fried chicken was not very juicy, flavorful and quite pedestrian

Good neighborhood spot but not sure I'd come across town for dinner
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I was here a little over a week ago for my birthday and booked the first couple of reservations available after they opened for dinner (12 people and I booked it the night before on their reservation site that only allows parties of 4 at a time apparently.)

I was tempted to be like "fuck this place, let's leave" because the hostesses were not very courteous at all and they were super dismissive. One of my friends who has eaten here several times before commented that he's noticed that about the same hostess every time too. I mean, if you're going to be the first person diners deal with when they enter your restaurant, at least FAKE being welcoming. She got all bent out of shape when I asked if it were possible if we could all be seated together. I even went so far as telling her that it's absolutely ok if we can't. She made it happen, but her attitude and body language made it looked like I was totally ruining her day. Then she was like, "I can seat you together, but we have another big party coming in at 6:30." OK... thanks I guess.

We got seated a while later. I was still pretty irritated by the initial encounter, but luckily that went away fast after the great service we received from Keidi and all the delicious food we ordered. For appetizers, we had the pate and the white bean puree, and I think between all of us, we ordered almost all of their entrees on the dinner menu. I had the italian sausage with the mascarpone polenta, which was awesome. 

We double checked about the initial time constraint, which Keidi noted wasn't actually an issue, so we stayed for dessert.

Would be 5 stars if their hostesses were better... hosts. This review is 4.5 stars really, because Keidi was awesome and the food was really good. Hopefully better next time.
author: Jerome R.

description:
OK, despite the assertion in my first review that the place is named after the more privileged Sneetches in Dr. Seuss' identity-challenged world, it is apparently not according to the owners. They just want to highlight the beneficiary of their laid-back comfort food - our bellies. Well, my bulbous belly at least since I finally tried dinner here after a promising dessert experience last September. The Castro is in need of a comfortable place like this, and it definitely wins the award for best use of a former Asqew Grill space. 

What honestly strikes me first is how reasonably priced the menu is. The highest priced entrees are $22 (the lamb chops and the bass). Most everything else is in the mid-teens, the small plates even less. Jamie W. and I were seated in the back right next to the restroom door, so we got quite a view of the customers. It was buzzing with activity but surprisingly not overly loud as you would expect. Just a constant hum of conversation with pockets of laughter.

We started with the $9 Grilled Little Gems, Cara Cara Oranges, Raw Milk Feta and Oregon Hazelnuts - a warmed salad with a nice little bite (see photo). Grilling lettuce would seem like a lost cause, but somehow it worked. The salad was followed by the $11 Dungeness Crab Hush Puppies with Louie Dressing (see photo). It was a trio of deep-fried balls, a bit too dense for my taste as the crab weighed them down considerably, but slathering the Louie dressing helped. The entrees were better, standard diner fare with unexpected touches.

Jamie had the $12 Spaghetti with Starbelly Bacon, Jalapeno, Tomato and Basil. The jalapeno really gave it a kick that you don't quite expect, and the saltiness of the bacon brought it close to carbonara in flavor. I went even more traditional with the $16 Half-Rotisserie Chicken with Warm Potatoes and Winter Spinach Salad, which was as Marie Callendar-like as it sounds except the seasoning was a lot more robust. It was all good stuff and well worth hanging out for a while since it is such a convivial space in a great 'hood. I'm sure my "Check-In" count here will grow in the coming months. 

FOOD - 4 stars...plentiful comfort food, nicely priced for a modest night out 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...I like what I said last time...it is comfortably hip and unapologetically square all at the same time 
SERVICE - 4 stars...better this time perhaps because we ordered a full meal 
TOTAL - 4 stars...yep, I am a Sneetch with a Starbelly...oh, the places I go
author: Ed U.

description: Their chorizo and egg pizza is my spirit animal. Also good mixed drinks and beers.
author: Christina N.

description: This restaurant is an amazing place for large parties! I was looking for a place to host a birthday brunch and easily made a reservation here. They accommodated my request for a table on the cutest patio. The food was great and the service was even better. We loved our waitress - she was amazing! Thank you for a successful brunch :) We'll be back!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I'm still in love with Starbelly for brunch or dinner. Wanted to add that the front desk staff are absolutely the best I've encoutered at a restaurant in a long time. I was early for brunch this past weekend, and they couldn't have been more helpful letting me know what tables might have been available, how long the wait was going to be, etc. 

And, with no attitude whatsoever. Bravo!
author: David G.

description: The food and ambiance were good here, but our waiter was a little distracted. Put ice in my friend's cider... food is good though!
author: Chloe C.

description:
Went for lunch, really loved the Roasted Butternut Squash pizza and the rice pudding! 

Would love to come back again to try other things.
author: Shell J.

description: I love love love love love this place :)!!!  Hella good food and reasonable prices.  The only downside is the reservation thing, sometimes attitude when you don't have one planned and then when you do its discarded like you didn't even need to...?  But the food makes up for it and the environment is modern & chill.  I recommend the Bacon Spaghetti , and or the bacon pizza with Arugula!!! Yum yum yum yum!!!
author: Scott H.

description:
Chicken liver paté, and butternut squash pizza!!!

Also, blackened catfish with risotto and the spaghetti!!! 

So good. Trust me.

Because in yelp we trust.
author: Renno W.

description:
Eating at Star Belly makes me feel like i'm somewhere off in Napa enjoying the freshest foods and drinking good hearty glasses of wine. The bright interior, modern touches, and wooden tables really gave it that homey American feel right in the middle of Castro!

The salumi platter and soft cheese started my dinner off right. We requested more bread to savor it. They were a bit slow on bringing the additional couple of slices but no harm done. I just hope it was because they were cutting a fresh loaf and not because they had to scramble to find an old loaf and toast it up until we coudn't tell the difference! Hah. I digress though..

Can't have enough cheese and bread! Their caprese salad was presented neatly and the tomatoes were sweet. I went for the classic margherita pizza and thought they made a perfect crust. 

It's a restaurant you go to for a laid back, casual dinner!
author: Samantha L.

description: YES. I ordered the Chicken and Waffles but they didn't have waffles so I got French Toast instead. That is the combination that you would not believe. The chicken was cooked perfectly, the taste of sweet and savory was just delicious. Mouth is watering writing this review. Ask them for Chicken and French toast, you will thank me later.
author: Lucas S.

description: it was ok. I was there for brunch. ordered the loco moco. I was expecting gravy, but they put some sweet balsamic thin sauce that kinda ruined it. the service was good. Our server constantly came by to check up on us. Coffee wasn't on the menu so we asked if they served coffee. The 1st server gave us a rude remark saying, "uh yeah its brunch. of course we serve coffee." A simple yes would have sufficed. We only went here because kitchen story had an hour wait and this place was available. Would i come back? probably not.
author: Steven B.

description: We had a great meal!  The foie gras flan was incredible.  And, they were able to accommodate a largish (5 ppl) party relatively last minute.  Try the earl grey toddy and don't miss the toffee cake!
author: Lauralee O.

description:
This was my first time to Starbelly and I will absolutely be back. My friend and I sat at the bar and Jordana took care of us. She was absolutely amazing. She was so curtious and knowledgable it really rounded out a wonderful experience. Request her every time. But rest assured the entire staff was just as great as she was.

Make sure to get the crab and asparagus soup. It will change your life.
author: Jessica T.

description: Typical overpriced SF restaurant with wired menu and okay service. I wouldn't go back unless I had to. Boring and typical.
author: William S.

description:
A great option for brunch in the Castro. I had the chorizo and egg pizza, and I also got to try the loco moco and the french toast. Everything was really good and we also had coffee and beer. It wasn't too crowded on a late Saturday morning, so we basically walked in and sat down.

It's always tough to park in this area, but it's convenient if you're watching a show at the Castro theater. We went to see the Frozen sing a long for a friend's bday. :)
author: Kenny J.

description:
OMG the mussels.  Dear god in heaven...is probably all kinds of jealous, because these are the most delicious mussels on earth.  House-made chorizo, poblano pepper, white wine sauce?  

They should rename them the MUSTLES, because you MUST have them, and sop up the sauce with their fresh baked bread.  

You will thank me later.  You're welcome in advance.

also the house-cured bacon jalapeno pizza.

Pimm's cup, (Comin' atcha like a) White Horse and Sarbelly 75 are good drinks as well.
author: Sada V.

description:
Simply great food.  This place was never on my radar, and I've driven by it enough, but never heard much about it...I was pleasantly surprised, and will definitely keep it as an option for casual nice dinner spots.  

We rolled in on a weekday night, so there was no wait (obviously this place probably has a huge wait on weekends so plan accordingly).  Start to finish every dish was memorable.  The brussel sprouts almost had a meaty richness to them...I make roasted brussel sprouts at home just fine, and cautious of paying for this at most places, but the reduced balsamic was great.  The mains were terrific as well (pot pie and vege burger), fairly priced and good portions.  I even got desert (pot de creme...holy hell)...if I get a desert at a place, it's because you've delivered on everything else.

It's the same vibe and quality as a Delfina or Beretta.  I find places lately just aren't delivering (hello Locanda), so it's good to find simple food done well.  $65 for 1 drinks, app, 2 mains, and desert.  Done.  Welcome to my rotation list!
author: A A.

description: The vegetable sides: cauli, carrots, and roasted tomatoes were all quite tasty, as was the kale caesar salad and burger.  The noise level was acceptable and the service was just fine.  Vegetarians can be quite happy here, although the chicken liver pate may prove tempting to some.  It's well worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Marshall P.

description: Love this place for brunch! The atmosphere, their Mimosas, french toast, bacon and huevos rancheros! Dang! Kick me in the head and call it dope! Oh! The coffee too! I love this place!
author: Miguelito C.

description:
Loved it! I'd definitely go back. This is a great place for anything from a date to a company lunch. 

Super cute outdoor patio area, and great overall aesthetic. Plating is lovely, and the waitresses are sweet and friendly.

We had the liver paté, burrata, french fries, rice pudding, and the crème brûlée. And ALL of it was great. :)
author: Brooke K.

description:
Two words fits my criteria: Yummy! Bravo! Thanks to 3 of my close friends for taking me out to SF for a nice day of dining, exploring hidden gems of the city, daytime drinking and best of all...shopping! This place definitely fulfilled my tasty tastebuds for some good ol' brunch before enjoying the rest of our day of festivities. 

I absolutely love the simple decor of this restaurant! Starting from the farm-style tables to the very well-lit lighting and some sunrays to filter inside and the back outdoor patio area, I already knew I would be a returning customer. The staff was superb! All the finishing touches really came together after being seated and eyeing the whole establishment but it was the food I was looking forward to checking out.

Skimmed through their short list of breakfast/brunch items; seems that everything off the menu would be more than just good. I knew it would be amazing! Of course, I wanted something different. I went with my gut; chose the Sunnyside Joe's dish. My friends got the chicken and waffles, loco moco, a side of truffle fries with a trio of sauces, Dynamo donut (yes they serve it here) and simple eggs, sausages and roasted potatoes dish. Sunnyside Joe's really hit the spot. The dish came out beautifully crafted, prepped and tasted like the best comfort food I've always imagined. Starbelly offers a pretty large portion so my friends and I were able to share our food tapa style.

A good meal to start off our day, mimosas, lavender-like lemonades and planning our full day ahead; this place is a keeper. Not overly priced, good portions, inviting atmosphere, and delicious food; how can you not like this place? I'm a FAN!
author: Fraulein C.

description:
Had little dishes to share with a friend, the chicken liver pate was the highlight, Brussels sprouts were good and my goodness toffee pudding was to die for if you like sweet desserts. I liked if better than the salted caramel. 

Service was friendly and efficient.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Stopped in this awesome place after a tip from a friend... we don't get down to the city as often as we'd like and when we do, picking a restaurant is always overwhelming because of all the choices. We popped in here at about 2:30 on a Saturday and say on the patio which was GORGEOUS. It was light and airy and breezy and we loved the rustic wood with all the succulents hanging down. Our sever was so adorable I just wanted to take him home in my pocket, and he was incredibly helpful and knowledgable of the menu. As for the food - our suggest-y friend raved about the Starbelly pizza: bacon, jalapeño, arugula, and green goddess dressing, and it by no means disappointed. It was bacony deliciousness with a hefty pile of my absolute favorite greens and just the perfect amount of jalapeño. My husband ordered the butternut squash pizza which just blew my mind. It had some very autumny flavors which surprised me right at the beginning of spring, but I am obsessed with squash and those sorts of flavors so I didn't mind one bit. Roasted butternut squash, ricotta, black garlic, and roasted pumpkin seeds. To DIE for. I also had the asparagus soup with lump Dungeness and I loved it so much - it was perfectly light and refreshing and the Dungeness was just the right rich touch. Like I said, we don't get down to the city much but whenever I am looking to eat somewhere whenever I'm there, I almost fear I'll never try anything else because I'll want to go to Starbelly every. Single. Time. Go there - you won't regret it!

P.S. Anything - I repeat ANYTHING - that ha their goddess dressing on it: Eat. That. Shit. Immediately.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I use to love coming here but they took away the bleu cheese and fig pizza, ate here at least 3 other times and feel that there isnt anything that stood out, will have to bump down the stars and remove this from my regular list.
author: Tiff W.

description:
I loved it.
We went here for our anniversary after going to the movies. 
Perfect spot when you are not all dressed up and just looking for a nice spot to go to.
I went with the veggie burger, my husband had the ranch burger. While my patty was a little dry, it still tasted really good. The ranch burger was amazing! 
The service was great, they were fast, friendly and we had a new beer every ten minutes. 
Would return anytime, loved the atmosphere.
author: Caroline K.

description: Me eh, the staff is weird and kinda snooty. The pate is awesome. The food is pretty good, I dig the burger. The drinks are good. The atmosphere is nice. But yeah the staff, hmm, I'm just not sure. I'll have to try again here.
author: Viv R.

description: Ordered the homemade chicken liver pate and it was sooo delicious! Glad I stopped by to try it. Bartender was really a nice guy.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
Brunch review:

Rolled out of bed and called Nopa (around 11am) to see how heinous the wait was. since it was two hours, and we're reasonable people who don't wait two hours for anything if we can help it, we started looking around for other options. I called Starbelly, and she said they had a table for us if we came by right then. We get there, and get seated immediately at the bar. So far so good. 

Then the food came.... And it was phenomenal.  I had a fried chicken poboy with a jalapeño slaw, and she had a burger with everything (literally everything in the kitchen) and a mimosa. I'm realizing this is more of a lunch review now as I type it, but it was the brunch experience so whatever. 

The fried chicken was so tender, maybe the best I've had in the city. Black pepper and cornmeal breading maybe. Next time would do the chicken and waffles though. 

Burger was the best I've had here too. With bacon,avocado, cheese, it comes out to 19 but it was perfect. Bun had a great texture. 

Service was solid, we made small talk with the bartender Kyle, who was cool. 

overall: superior service, short wait times, amazing food. Would not go to Nopa and come here instead again.
author: Patrick T.

description:
How have I missed this place.  Had a dinner reservation and we were seated promptly on the patio, as we requested.  The server was really helpful with recommendations that we took and were very happy.  The menu is diverse enough that anyone can find find something they want.
We had the pate (delicious), Nettle Pizza (added bacon) good but not over the top, brussel sprouts (more bacon) as good as anywhere and pot de creme (a little on the small side).  Looking forward to visiting again to try more items on the menu.
author: Gregory H.

description:
This place is just so damn good, I have to share. It's even taken me a few days to compose my feelings about Starbelly. I came here with a friend and foodie, love the new experiences and tastes of different places. 

Our neighbors at the bar were just finishing up their meal and being the talkative person that I am - I wanted to know what they had. Inside scoop, I took their suggestions and was very pleased with my dinner.

Drinks - Beer and Wine Only, but their Champagne Cocktail was not only beautiful but very tasty. They also have quite a selection of really nice beers, which they let me sample - I'm a little picky when it comes to beer.

Appetizers - I ordered the mini corn dogs, they were so cute, tasty and I loved the homemade ketchup and mustard. Very good. We also ordered a salad with butter lettuce, apples, goat cheese and walnuts. It was really great as well. 

Meal - I ordered the Roasted porchetta, salsa verde & salsa calabria, market greens - it was fantastic, I was floored by the savory taste of this dinner. My friend ordered the half rotisserie local chicken, blistered romano beans & fingerling potatoes - which was incredible. 

Dessert - I chose the Salted Caramel Pot de Creme with Rosemary Cornmeal Cookies. I sat there sucking on my spoon savoring every moment of that dessert. It was truly incredible and I can't stop thinking about it. 

The place is really that great, I am not surprised that so many people have given it 5 stars. It was very reasonable for the level of service and quality of food.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Made reservations at around 11am on a Sunday but it didn't seem like we needed it, though we weren't able to sit out back (it seemed pretty packed out there).  About 30-45 minutes later, the line was out the door.

My wife got a mimosa after seeing how delicious it looked when someone else ordered it, and she quite enjoyed it.  I got the loco moco which was done really well but is more of a gourmet take on it (no gravy).  My wife's chilaquiles were amazing.

The only downside was that our dishes didn't come with avocado even though they were supposed to, although we sort of blame ourselves since we changed our order at the last second after it had already gone to the kitchen.  Our server had to rush over there to make the change for us, which we appreciated.
author: Ken L.

description:
If you want a decent restaurant that you don't have to get all, "Gussied" up for then I would recommend Starbelly! (Yes, for the record I said gussied up)  This is a good restaurant but not a great one.  Their menu is slightly eclectic and for me it is kind of, "Trying to hard" but having said that,  I actually come here for the burger.  It's fucking delicious and if it was socially acceptable, I would rub the fries all over my body :)  The pizzas are okay too but I have never found the rest of the menu too appealing.  It's definitely not the spot to take the traditional eater. 
 
Also, I won't go so far as to call the staff here rude but they aren't extremely friendly either.  I hope the ship's captain takes a redirection soon :)  It would be a shame if this place sunk like the titanic.
author: Brian S.

description:
Good food find in the Castro. Our meals were tasty, served within a reasonable time and were just enough not to be able to quickly whip up at home. 

We came for brunch and my companions and I ordered their chicken and waffles, french toast, scramble, one of their pizzas and their tacos and everyone one of us were pleased with our order.  My only big gripe was our drinks took longer than our meals. Considering the bar takes up 1/3 of the restaurant, it was surprising. 

Would I come here gain? It was good but nothing that really wowed me for another try at brunch. There are plenty of wow places in the city for that. Perhaps, for dinner?
author: Beverly R.

description: Very good to excellent. The brussel sprouts were the best I have ever had and I have eaten a hundred varieties. The pizza sauce was a bit spicy, which was confusing since they served it with a side of red pepper flakes. The modern trend of adding spiciness to everything including mixed drinks is infuriating - it should always and only be an option for those with muted taste buds. My extensive travels have taught me that hot spice is most often used to mask mediocre products like old meat, tough meat, unfresh seafood, etc. After all, why would you want to overwhelm the tastebuds when you are being served the highest quality products. You wouldn't. The menu did not make clear that this was to be a spicy pizza. Everything else was excellent.
author: Josh K.

description: Really nice folks there, friendly and fun. Food a little uneven but generally good to very good. Fun night out.
author: Diane S.

description:
Told me food was ready at noon, show up at noon, am told it will be ready after noon...

Tell host it's past noon, says it will be an hour. Just a little feedback for management. I won't be making it back here again.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I had dinner here the other night after a busy Sunday evening.

The host was spectacular. A large party of slightly inebriated men decided to go elsewhere since they were not able to be accommodated. She apologized to them and asked them kindly to return. Excellent service! It may seem very minimal but having worked in restaurants for years I have seen hosts/greeters who lack the passion and level of service she provided. 

After being sat our server greeted us and answered a few questions. I don't recall the servers name since it came across incredibly casual. I don't recall any specials being announced or any introduction. It was essentially "Do you want sparkling or flat water"? I was interested in ordering a beverage but the impatience shown by the server didn't give me much time to order. 

I ordered my burger medium and it was red/pink/bloody. I was starving so I didn't want to wait anymore and just ate it. The bottom bun was soaked completely through and it fell apart while I was eating it. It was good but to me medium has a little bit of pink on the verge of being completely brown. 

The ambience is nice. The tables looked like they were made from old shuffleboards. The lights were made from cardboard. I couldn't quite grasp the overall concept or theme but it's got earthy tones and is a little dimmer than most places. 

Overall, I would give this place another try but would hope for better table service and will try something other than the burger.
author: Richard B.

description:
Sunday Brunch seems to be the religious observance of San Franciscans. This is among the temples. It's always crowded, which is a plus or minus depending on how much you want that festive feel. Very nice outdoor space in the back, with a tent ceiling. 

Patrons skew toward the young and hip and gay groups (some of which are old and hip; a bunch of bearded guys hugging, that sort of scene). 

Breakfast pizzas all great.

Loco moco is fantastic but presents a heart attack risk.

Donuts are a specialty.
author: Frank W.

description: Made a reservation. Waited a few minutes thereafter to be seated. No biggie. Sat down and waited...and waited...and waited to have anyone acknowledge we were there. Busy day, but maybe take our drink order? Ended up walking out and going to Manos Nouveau around the corner. Way better service and very tasty food.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
After my fourth visit (spread over three years) I've decided to never go back. There are just so many good restaurants why bother with less than mediocre food and service? Stopped in on Saturday Oct. 12 at 1pm, ordered the Fried Chicken and Waffles and my companion ordered a grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup. The waffle machine had broken down (only one machine? No back up for a specialty item?), so I ordered the burger.

The grilled cheese sandwich arrived cold, and the soup tasted good, but was an unappetizing fluorescent orange. The burger came out extremely well done though it was ordered medium,  It was dry and tasteless, the onions and tomato looked and tasted like they had been prepped the day before. The onions were so acidic, the plate stunk of them. The worst burger I have ever been served.

The caesar salad was served untrimmed on the bottom and the croutons looked and tasted like they came form a turkey stuffing package from 1995. Shortly after my meal arrived, Chicken and Waffles started appearing at nearby tables. The Chicken looked dry, flat and overdone. Those patrons looked unhappy.

The server forgot to bring a soup spoon, and though nice, lacked professionalism.

The cost of the meal with drinks and tip was over $70.00.
author: Richard L M.

description:
I came here on a Sunday, after Bay to Breakers 2012 for brunch with some friends.  Well, 5 friends and 1 not-so-much of a friend, ANYWAY there were 7 of us total.  Starbelly was able to accomodate us without a reservation, but I would HIGHLY recommend making a reservation in advanced especially if you want to sit in the patio.  We arrived shortly prior to Starbelly's opening time of 10:30, and although we were first in line, there were two or three parties that arrived shortly behind us.

I had the Loco Moco, and it was DELICIOUS!  The proportions look small, but it really filled me up!  The ground beef was high quality, tasted fresh, and was cooked perfectly to my requested medium-rare.

I was kind of bummed that they did not have the patte and bread on their brunch menu.  The two previous times I've eaten at Starbelly, I've always ordered the patte and was looking forward to it during brunch.  Definitely give it a try if you are there for dinner, probably the best patte and bread combo my taste buds have ever experienced.

I've also done a birthday dinner here for 10 in the past, and the staff was really accommodating and friendly.  Just be forewarned that they charge you a cake-cutting fee by the head.  I believe it was almost $2-3 per person!

Starbelly is a great place to take a date or for a group dinner.  The venue is contemporary, the food is delicious, and I can't complain about the service!
author: Matt S.

description: Really fun and delicious spot. My sister use to live walking distance so we ended up here often. The burger is fantastic and the best thing! I love the ambiance and the food is so consistent. Staff is very nice and deal with ya busyness of the restaurant well.
author: Priya S.

description:
Came here before the July 1, foie gras ban.  Needed to try the duck and foie gras sausage.  The flavor is no unbelievable.  It's out of this world.  I was tempted to buy the remaining 5 sausages they had left.  Imagine a sausage filled with duck and foie gras, topped with caramelized onions, and a port reduction.  

For beer lovers -  they have a beer flight; you get to try 4 different types of beer for just $12.  Awesome deal.

Starbelly also serves napoletana pizza, one of my favorites.  We got it topped with blue cheese, baby arugula, and sliced Serrano ham.  

The spiced steak is really good too!
author: Edward N.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, but it was just mehh. I've come here 2x in the last couple months: once for dinner and once for brunch (just yesterday). Mostly because I live a block away and I heard it's good for brunch. I enjoyed my brunch experience more so than my dinner experience, but I still think there are way better places to check out in SF.

Brunch:
Roasted Porchetta (2.5 stars): Sounded good on the menu, but the actual dish wasn't as appetizing as I thought. Bread was nice and toasty, but the porchetta meat was a bit bland and the salsas/arugula that were also in the sandwich did not bring out that much additional flavor. Wasn't horrible if you're craving a sandwich, but not spectacular.

Chorizo & Eggs Pizza (4 stars): Was tasty! I liked the tomato sauce they used on the pizza, chorizo/egg/cilantro were a genius combo... But for $15, I think they could've hooked it up with a bit more eggs or learn how to spread the egg love a bit more. I'm pretty sure that there were only 2 eggs for the entire 6-8 pieces of pizza. 

Dinner: 
Smoked Eggplant (1.5 stars): Was not that tasty. Eggplant was kinda chewy rather than soft, it was too smoked to the point that it tasted a bit burnt, and the marinara sauce was a little too overpowering for the eggplant.

Roasted Butternut Pizza (3 stars): Not nearly as good as the chorizo & eggs pizza. The pizza didn't feel cohesive... just a bunch of ingredients thrown on top of the pizza. But I do like chevre cheese, so I still managed to eat a few slices and pack a couple to go.

Fresh Spaghetti (2 stars): The texture and look of it reminded me of Chefboyardee spaghetti because the noodles looked really soft and the entire thing was really saucy. This dish was pretty salty, especially since it also has bacon in it. Overall I think it was just too thick, salty, and fatty for me... which was a bit misleading since the name sounds so refreshing.

Service was ok (better for dinner than for brunch). The back patio was pretty cute ... I would suggest eating out there if it's a semi-nice day. It's heated, and it has cute lights over the canopy. But I probably won't be coming back again, unless I'm really in the mood for that egg & chorizo pizza.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The excellent burrata small plate alone was worth the visit to this place. We also had the bean dip starter and the albondigas small plate - both very good. We shared a great mushroom pizza, too. That was plenty of food for two people. The back patio is a relaxing place to have a meal.
author: Morris R.

description:
Great place for groups. 

Really enjoyed dinner at starbelly - the food was great. The kale caesar was delicious and the pumpkin dumplings were super tasty, but light. The portions aren't too generous, but they have a fair amount of different things on offer. 

Great atmosphere - casual but nice.
author: Stephanie M.

description: This place was definitely worth taking a subway for! It's a very nice and cosy restaurant with a great atmosphere. My boyfriend and I both ordered the cocktail of the house and the burger with fries. Both were delicious!
author: Jarco B.

description: Solid menu options for both brunch and dinner. I've been multiple times and have had everything from the pizza dinner with sides to brunch. A great perk of starbelly is that it's possible to get a reservation last minute.
author: Lauren S.

description: I had the Starbelly salad which had fresh fruit, and an amazing tangy dressing.  Appetizer was perfectly blistered, they called it padron peppers I think. The meal was a fresh, tasty seared halibut. The plating was pretty, the environment was very sleek and stylish. My waitress was very friendly, and chatty when appropriate.  This would be a nice place for a date.
author: Shane N.

description: I went here with some friends that rave about this place, so there was a lot of buildup and my expectations were high. I started my meal with a sangria. The sangria was watery and bitter and full of "fruit." So naturally I let some of this "fruit" down the hatch during my first big sip. BIG MISTAKE. The lovely wine soaked apples, etc that I was expecting, turned out to be straight up orange rinds. Rinds only. No orange even attached. TONS of rinds. Bleh. On to the meal. I ordered the Starbelly salad which was drenched in a pool of dressing and pretty plain. The chickpea fritters (actually just mini falafel balls) were tasty little things. The fries were also addictive. I tried some pizza that was ok, and had a bite of a veggie burger that was less than impressive. Dry and not very flavorful. Not my favorite place. Very cute interior and back patio though, good service and good with our large group.
author: Kristina K.

description:
This is my go-to neighborhood dinner place. I love their food and their drinks - yum! They stop taking reservations at a certain point in the day, but you can still call ahead and leave your name with the hostess for a certain time (... kind of like a reservation!).  They also have a super cute outdoor area in the back, and a fun community table. 

The waitstaff is nice, though they sometimes forget stuff, probably because the place gets pretty busy (so if you don't get your drink after 10 minutes, definitely ask to make sure). Because it gets busy, it can also take a while for food and drinks to come - so definitely don't come here if you want a speedy meal.

It can also get pretty loud, but it kind of suits the atmosphere. The decor is modern chic, with lots of wood and dark colors.

Overall, great place to hang out with friends and much on delicious food. Definitely try the Starbelly 75 cocktail!
author: Julia O T.

description: You know you ordered the right things when the waitress compliments your order.  We pretty much wanted to order everything on the menu so we decided to order lots of smaller dishes for more variety.  Got the sardine (one very large sardine), fries, burrata with grilled bread, liver pate, mushroom pizza, and pot de creme.  My favorites were the liver pate and the mushroom pizza.  Those I can eat all day.  Wish they had a full liquor license like their sister restaurants (lolinda and berreta both with amazing cocktails).  Ended up getting a flight of Spanish wines instead, which fyi has pretty generous pours for a flight.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
This was a sorely needed addition to the Castro food scene when it opened years ago and visit after visit it does not disappoint.  I have never had anything but outstanding and friendly service even when it has been insanely crowded.  This is my go-to restaurant in the neighborhood to bring out of town guests on the first night when we don't want to stray too far away.  

The jalapeño pizza is something I crave and miss every time I go for too long without it.  The salads are all consistently yummy.  The boring sounding menu items that I sometimes force myself to eat when I've had too much pizza in my life have all been surprisingly tasty and full of new flavors.

They have always been very accommodating to any special diets at our table including celiac, garlic-free, vegan, and pepper free.  

Oh...and they have Calimochos  (on the menu!)
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
No, i am sorry. 
This place looks very nice and stuff but it's way too expensive for what it is. Food is not exceptional to me. 
Be ready to be starving and out of money by the end of the night. Plus we had some red wine from Portland that wasn't good. 
Too bad :(
author: Marion P.

description:
I have been to this place a few times before, and when we come here we usually order their pate first which is delicous. it comes with sweet carmelized onions, and baked or toasted bread. you can ask your waiter for more bread if you ran out too soon. 

yesterday i came in here for a late brunch, we decided to sit outside since it was a beautiful day here in San Francisco. I love their outside dining area, you are surrounded by plants all over the wall, the there is a tent which cover you from the sun so its not too hot. 

This time i ordered their smoked fried chicken which came with a cole slaw salad and cornbread. Also ordered sangria. 

okay, i heard some rants about this smoked fried chicken, but in all honesty, it is NOT even all that at all! it had no flavor at all, the chicken wasnt juicy, the batter had no taste. i feel like its just regular fried chicken that has been left to cook longer to give it a darker color. Popeye's and KFC chicken tastes better than this, and this is a disapointment. it needs to be seasoned well, what i bit into was nothing but flavorless. 

next is the cole slaw salad which had slices of raw jalapenos. ok, the taste salad dressing is good, but adding raw jalapenos to it was not a good idea at all. a cole slaw is supposed to be a refreshing cold salad to eat. Because they added raw jalapenos, those jalapeno slices made the whole salad taste like i was eating raw chillies and mayonaise. The jalapenos were OVER POWERING in spice that i did not enjoy what is supposedly "refreshing cole slaw". but they should have done was, make the jalapenos into smaller bits instead of slices. it was just a wrong combo, i ended up picking out the jalapeno slices one by one. and dont get me wrong, i can eat REALLY REALLY SPICY food (Thai spicy from Thailand kind of spicy not american thai spicy). lol 

moving on folks, to the cornread.. i thought it was a bit on the dry side. i think it needed more butter and or milk. it would have been great if they did a jalapeno and cheese cornbread instead of a tasteless dry corn bread. 

Okay so i had a bad experience by choosing the wrong meal for me.. Absolutely no biggie. Like i have mentioned before, i have been to this place several times before, and such foods like their Pate will keep me coming back for more. 

cheers :)
author: Steve S.

description:
Starbelly is a cool, little spot, good to take a date to and sample the fare.

There are so many drool-worthy descriptions on the menu so it can be hard to decide. We opted for the salumi sampler and Starbelly salad to start, both were very tasty. Then, we split the infamous Starbelly burger. Fries were nom nom yum, burger was solid but definitely more in the middle range of excellence. 

All in all a good meal, I'd recommend to others.
author: Rachel R.

description:
Not crazy about the seating because it gets super loud in there and you are too far across from your date that I can easily talk to strangers next to me but can't hear or talk to the person across from me. 

I was craving burgers so this hit the spot. I couldn't even finish more than 1/2 my burger. It was tasty, juicy, and flavorful. Great side salad and the french fries are the skinny stick and crispy kind. I liked their garlic dip or whatever that was. 

It reminded me of a place in New York. Great service! Wished I read the Yelp reviews--would've ordered the pate! 

This was my "Old" neighborhood--lived on Prosper so I definitely would've been walking to this restaurant for food to go! 

BTW, they only served wine and burrr BUT they do get creative on mixing what they have.
author: M C.

description:
I love this restaurant; went here for dinner with my friends while I was in town. 
We enjoyed the shishito peppers, the prawns, free range chicken, the mackerel and a few other dishes. I love their craft cocktails and hipster new american decor. The service was friendly and prompt. 

It's nestled right in the Castro and I was loving the hustle and bustle at night, which I miss dearly. 

Great times at Starbelly.
author: Mika D.

description: Really good fried brussels sprouts! The balsamic-honey glaze gives it a hefty dose of sweetness to cut into the grease combo of bacon and oil. (Then again, I don't think I've ever had a bad version of brussels sprouts when fried. ;P) Pizza was also good; crispier crust in the middle than say, Zero Zero, but just as thin, with a chewy blistered crusty outside ring of crust. Price of the pizzas are also a little more reasonable! Specifically, we had the pizza w/ roasted butternut squash, black garlic, local goat cheese, sage & pumpkin seeds. This had good little chunks of squash everywhere, and the goat cheese flavor was quite prominent. Would come back again.
author: Linus W.

description:
So I went for din and thought, okay, this place is packed with pretty gays of the male and female variety, I'm right at home -- but the meal was only average (pizza, pasta, veggies all sounded great but fell short on flavor), and then I went on a brunch date here when the sun was shining and everything was glorious, and oh Lord, Starbelly might be some of my favorite brunch in the city.

Rolled in at noon on a Sunday, waited for 15 minutes, and was then seated on their outdoor back patio -- again, lots of pretty gays -- but this time the tasty food matched the eye candy surroundings. The chicories pizza w/ bacon was rich and carby, and my gazpacho w/ dungeness crab and avo was fresh and delightful -- oh, and the greek yogurt with honey and fruit is a breakfast wonder. The service is fine, if absent -- um, the only downside was our drinks were a bit weird. Lavender lemonade is better in theory than in practice, as it jasmine/sagey ice tea.

Brunch pour deux was abt $26/pp (incl tip).
author: Rachel N.

description: I came in for lunch on a Monday afternoon, per recommendation of a local, and I was not disappointed. The Starbelly bacon, jalapeño, and arugula pizza was delicious, and Pimm's cocktail was a great pair. The mixologist was exceptional and NOT just another bartender--very detail oriented and friendly. I would suggest this place to anyone who is looking for a good, sit-down lunch.
author: Mandi W.

description: Good service, good food, and good ambience.  What is not to like?  The back patio looked very comfortable but it was booked up when we went.
author: Bob C.

description:
Came here this past Sunday night for a nice dinner. 
We had 6 people in our party and the woman at the front was so nice and willing to accommodate us.
The ambiance of star belly is rustic and very "pintrest" like. 
We ordered drinks...I got the calimochto which is called "poor mans sangria" absolutely DELICIOUS and the way they presented it was creative as well.
We ordered bread which was 2$ for 6 small slices...it was gone in 30 seconds. Kind of a rip off there
5 of us got the ranch burger and loved it. It starts off at 12 dollars and every add on is 2$....which if you want cheese bacon and avocado you're looking at an $18 burger. Sort of expensive for us.
Another member of our party got the swordfish and had zero complaints. 

All together we would definitely go back...except next time well try to limit our burger add ons.

This restaurant is better suited for coupes or parties of 3 and less. It's small inside and has an intimate feel
author: Annie C.

description:
Let me start by saying we had brunch at Starbelly this past Sunday, when the menu is different. It had been recommended to us by a number of people and the place was jam packed, so we had high hopes. We sat outside on the front patio because there was no wait and it was a nice day. We ordered the basic farmhouse egg breakfast and the Sunnyside Joe.

The farmhouse breakfast was very plain (as expected), but it lacked any type of distinctive flavor. It was extremely boring and dull. Even for eggs and potatoes, the meal lacked discernible taste.  The Sunnyside Joe was a bit better, with nice flavor coming in from the onions and spinach, but overall was not as good as it could have been. Given the same ingredients, I could have done better at home. Starbelly needs to step up its meat game in these dishes: the farmhouse dish had fatty undercooked bacon without much flavor and the Sunnyside Joe used groundbeef that didn't add any flavor or dimension to the dish. The service was friendly and helpful, if a bit slow, but overall no problems.

Overall, we did not enjoy our meal as much as we enjoyed people-watching on the corner at this spot in the Castro. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. We could have made this meal better at home for a lot less money.
author: James B.

description:
I really wish there was 3.5 stars because this place is better than 3 but not quite 4.
We started off with the local sardine app, a cheese plate (which I didnt try since I wasnt in the mood for cheese), and a pea fritter of some kinds.
  Local sardine with shishito pepper was an A
  Cheese plate:  Didnt try but seemed to have an interesting selection,
  Pea fritter was an B .  It was somewhat dry

Our mains came out.  I got a margherita pizza.  It gets a B or maybe B+.  Crispy thin crust but dough lacked development and sauce + topping was good but not great. Im a pizza snob though.  Many people may like it better.
My friend got a smoked fried chicken which was interesting but a bit dry.  I would give it a B+ .  The cocktails were good and interesting. And the service was very good.

Overall, a solid 3.5.  Maybe if you picked out their best menu items, it would hit a 4 star.  I would come back again though it might not be at the top of my list.
author: Alan B.

description: Really casual and comfortable neighborhood vibe, and the food here is amazing.  (Especially the bacon jalapeño pizza!)  They have outdoor seating and some communal tables, so it's a great option for parties of all sizes.   Service has been great recently, after not being the best in the past, so definitely the moment for a 5 star review :)
author: Marc B.

description: Cute place, it has it all - good warm atmosphere, nice drinks, pretty good food and a great location. I had the Pim's cup cocktail - Not too sweet and not too strong served with a cucumber (nice bonus).
author: Mashav S.

description:
No matter what the "trendy" reviews say, Starbelly is still one of my favourite restaurants in SF - even if it's been around for longer than 6 months. ;-)

We came here last night and split one of my favorite appetizers of all-time: 
* house made chicken liver pâté, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard

For my Entree, I selected a Burger (since I mostly can't eat beef on the East Coast, since I have yet to find Cows that are grass-fed, raised without antibiotics, and run freely - learn about Prather Ranch: http://bit.ly/JIQpoJ). Now that I'm back in SF/NorCal this week, I took full-advantage of my ability to eat quality beef:
* Prather Ranch burger, house cut fries & pickle, grilled sesame bun with Pt. Reyes blue (see photo)

Service and Ambiance were superb, per usual.
author: Sally M.

description: Went here recently for a birthday brunch with a decent-sized family party. The staff was exceptionally accommodating and welcoming. Our server had a great attitude and gave our party his full attention and nothing was missed. Our drink and food orders were fulfilled in a timely manner and everything was delicious. I shared Chilaquiles and a customized pizza with one other person and they both hit the spot. Definitely recommending to friends and coming back.
author: Tim G.

description:
Just amazing food and service here every time...no doubt...the staff here makes the food taste that much more enjoyable. 

Must try's...

Brussel Sprouts
Liver pate
Sardine
Ask about their deserts...they have this huge desert plate that just blew my friends and I away...and I ain't even a desert person!!
author: Patrick C.

description: Atmosphere was nice, food (Chicken & Waffles, Burger, Moco loco, Saisons & Herbal Tea) was delicious and.. The staff were very friendly...
author: Ricky A.

description: One star for the food poisoning I got from this place! And the terrible service. I actually love the owners other resturant "lolinda" and "beretta" but honestly this place is a hole in the wall in disguise in my opinion. They should make some changes!
author: Kayla C.

description:
Sunny Sundays call for brunch. We were meeting up with my friend in San Fran and she recommends that we try out this place. 

Located in the Castro district, this place was nicely tucked on 16th Street. The space is large, the large communal table in the center caught my eye. I like the lime green accents, and the modern hanging lamps. The patio in the back is like a little garden. We were seated near the back. I like the brightness of the place, with its high ceilings. 

Pretty cool menu, split up into eggs, breads, sandwiches, salads, and pizza. We got a wild mushroom stratta, with local goat cheese & leeks; the sour levain french toast, with Mariquita Farms strawberry & blackberry preserve,with starbelly bacon, and a mexican chorizo, sunny eggs & fresh cilantro pizza...(Eggs on pizza!! Woohoo!)

Lots of non alcoholic drinks available, which was perfect for brunch. I got the Lavender honey lemonade-light and refreshing, this was a great drink. 

Sampled some of the French toast-light, fluffy, and the preserves were so fresh! The pizza was also very interesting. Nice crisp thin crust, with some spiciness from the chorizo, and 2 eggs! 

Great service on a busy day. Good selection of food...and I really enjoyed my 'breakfast pizza'!!
author: Vincci L.

description: Nice outdoor patio, good atmosphere, excellent food - especially the Prather Ranch burger!  Service was good, not great (a little slow considering how few diners were in at the time - lunch on a Monday).  This place needs to be able to serve real cocktails!
author: Conery W.

description:
Organic, locally produced diet soda delivered in a hipster container can be found here. It's awfully tasting too.

I'm obviously not the audience of this place because usually I'm left underwhelmed by the food, the ambiance and the price, but judging from the people around me who  rave about this spot I am sort of alone. 

To me this is just another pretentious restaurant that tries to improve on everything but the food and charges you accordingly. I'd suggest you try it but you may end like me trying to avoid it and just ending here out of peer pressure.
author: Bartholomew F.

description: Very cute restaurant with a nice covered patio, which was cozy on a cool fall Monday evening.  We had the little gem salad (good but personally I like a little less dressing), burrata di Stefano (loved the combination of the burrata with squash and pumpkin seeds), and grilled bavette steak (very good).  Service was good and it was a nice, relaxing dinner.
author: J M.

description:
Great ambiance, service, and food.

Went to dinner on a Saturday night without a reservation. The three of us were seated in 5 minutes! 

Ordered mussels and fries for appetizers which were both great. I would probably skip the mussels next time and try something else but that's because I'm not a huge mussels lover. Loved their fries and the basil mayo. We split the bacon and jalapeños pizza and the spaghetti. Both were fantastic! I almost prefer their pizza over berretta's.. But maybe not over delfina's..
author: Michelle K.

description:
Chicken Liver Pate. Is this real life? Yeah, definitely real life... definitely amazing. It's served with a sweet onion marmalade and grain mustard and is amazing with or without these toppings. When all three are combined on a piece of crositini, it is comparable to a party in your mouth.

The mussels and chorizos was also delectable. Roasted pork shoulder served on top off of aged cheddar grits and collard greens is also a must. Everything on the menu seemed amazing. Great selection. It's all moderately priced and definitely worth it.

The wait wasn't bad for dinner but then again it was a tuesday night. The service was nice and quick. Not to mention their staff was super attentive. 

I love this place. Go here and order the pate. You can thank me later.
author: Patricia B.

description:
YUM! Loved their burrata! I've never had pate but my friend insisted we get it and it was delicious! Their fries were OK, but the sauces made them better. 

I didn't get the spaghetti but it looked mouthwatering.
author: Jessica J.

description: Great choice if you're looking for a lively venue and a high-endish, casual meal. Enjoyed the pumpkin dumplings and lentil soup with a cabbage/apple salad. Reservations recommended but you can usually pop in if you don't mind waiting 15-20 minutes.
author: Mike G.

description:
Cute atmosphere (sit on the back porch!). Generally attentive service. 

The food was OK but didn't wow me. We had a mushroom and onion pizza which was passable but a bit greasy, and soggy in the middle. The Starbelly salad was good but did not contain fruit as advertised.
author: Jenny V.

description:
I went here for brunch once (wasn't really anything special) and dinner, which i was able to try a lot of food.

Atmosphere: even though there are construction next to it, when you walk inside, it completely opens up and you forget you just pretty much jumped over a construction site to get here.

Food
Pate: pretty good size pate, but the bread was super hard. I ended up using our pizza crust with it. 
Bacon pizza - oh the bacon bits were so good. The arugula (least i think it was arugula cus my friend and I was arguing who was right) was overpowering though
Half chicken - really tender and can't go wrong with even more bacon in it

Overall - i didn't see anything too special to want to go back and pay the price for it. Nice place to take someone on a date for sure, but I'm sure you can find other options just a few blocks away like Luna Park or Andalu.
author: Nam T.

description:
I have been meaning to write this review for MONTHS!  

This place is amazing for so many reasons:  
1. The food is so tasty!  I absolutely love so many of the items on the menu.  The menu does change for lunch/brunch week/weekend and also seasonally.  Not to miss:  The Starbelly Burger, The Starbelly Salad, the brussel sprouts (dinner only!) and don't forget to save room for dessert!  If you order the burger (as I often do....) ask for a side trio of their special aioli!

2. The ambiance!  How cool is it that their bar/community table is actually an old "lane" from a bowling alley?!?  The outer patio, the inside dining area - and bowling lane dining are three different "feels" in an overall spacious dining area for San Francisco standards.

3. The people of Starbelly!  Yes, I saved the best for last!  The Starbelly staff are all so delightful - I will tell you about my favorites.  First, there is Robin Rodriguez.  I believe he is the owner/manager of the place.  He is just friendly and accommodating in every way.  (I dine here at Starbelly often) and one time there was a brand new hostess in training who greeted me.  I had a reservation - and she didn't know me as a "regular" client.  She told me there would be a twenty minute wait (even with a reservation?) and I was NOT happy about that!  She asked if I would like to speak with the manager - and I said, "yes."  Robin recognized me, greeted me, apologized for the misunderstanding - and sat my table right away.  He even gave me his business card and reminded me not to hesitate to contact him for any reason.
