LOVELY and cordial!  I have been in the restaurant several times since, each with yet another pleasant experience.  The day shift hostess, Jordana is just delightful.  She has a radiant smile and also a super sense of fashion!  She is sweet and always makes me feel like a VIP.  There are also:  Nick, Niles, Adam, & Francesca!  Each of these wonderful Starbelly Superstars is a hard-working, friendly, efficient professional.  

DO NOT hesitate to stop in for a late lunch either!  I keep a mental list of ALL the restaurants nearby that will actually serve lunch between 2pm and 5:30pm.  NOT many, by the way, but Starbelly is always happy to see me - even if I come in for lunch at 3pm.

Hooray Starbelly!  thank you for your wonderful food, ambiance, and service!  Five stars because I cannot give them eleven.
author: Amy P.

description:
Great Californian cuisine, great service, lovely setting. The first time, we arrived a couple minutes before they opened and we were seated with a smile anyway. I had the arugula, jalapeño, and bacon pizza with Green Goddess dressing. Awesome. Perfectly crisp thin crust, wonderful twist on the classic Green Goddess flavors. Second time I had the chilaquiles, very flavorful. 

Starbelly has an assortment of house cocktails, both quirky fusion drinks and classics. Of the non-alcoholic drinks, the lavender lemonade and the virgin bloody mary are both good. The Pimm's cup is something I never thought to see in the US; it's tasty and refreshing.
author: Cage H.

description:
Over the last year, I've been here several times.  Through these visits, I have eaten almost everything on the menu.  Therefore, this review is, I guess, a synthesis of all of those visits.

Ambiance:  Starbelly has a fun, sleek feel to it.  I recommend that you try to attend on a sunny weekend morning, warm enough that you might be able to sit outside on the back patio.  The inside is nice too, but I think that it is more appropriate (and intimate) if you sit inside for dinner meals.

Service:  Never one to rack on service, I find this to be the main reason for a -1 for Starbelly.  Yes, they serve you your food and drinks graciously, but some of the servers for the dinner/night shift have been particularly aloof as to simple manners.  This has not been the case, however, for daytime waiters and waitresses (and I don't really know why).

Food:  Some is very, very good; some is impeccable; some is just okay.  I particularly recommend the home made chicken liver pate or the levain french toast.  One item that I feel needs work is the porchetta sandwich; it has a lot of potential, but I found it to be a little dull.

All in all, I find that Starbelly is a place that I have no reservations about returning back to time and time again.  It's location is ideal for Castro-goers and it has (many) more pros than cons.
author: Bryan H.

description:
3.5 stars.  Came here for an early dinner/snack with a group of 5 after the Grease Sing Along.  Since it was only about 5, we were seated in the patio area after a few minutes.

I had the pate, lentil soup and the Betty Draper (sparkling wine, bitters, citrus liqueur).  The pate was very good, and large, so sharing it was no problem.  The soup was not as hot as I prefer, and had a bit too much of a cinnamon flavor for my taste.  The Betty Draper was very refreshing and I wished I had room for more.

I got a margherita pizza to go for Tintin, which he enjoyed.  I thought it was good, but like the pizzas I've tried at Beretta, it was lacking something in the crust.  People at the table had the mussels, veggie burger, fried sardines, and micheladas which they enjoyed.
author: Seong P.

description:
I just ate here on Sunday with my bf and we had an amazing experience even though they were slammed with the remaining Pride crowd.  Although they were super busy, they found us a spot and seated us promptly!  Our server was super nice and attentive, keeping our water glasses filled the entire time and the bartender Jordana gave us some amazing food and drink reccommendations.  

I had the Mussels with Chorizo which were amazing and super fresh.  Lately the mussels I've been getting around town have been super chewy but these were soft, sweet, and delicate which was a great compliment to the spicy chorizo!  The broth was so amazing I wanted to lick the bowl but instead, soaked it up with the crostini.  MMMM...  I also had the zuccini and squash salad, which came with toasted almonds and goat cheese, I can't wait to attempt to recreate it because it was delish and I destroyed both dishes like a champ!!!

My bf had the spagetti which he said was amazing and since I'm trying to drink my carbs, I was laying low on the pasta.  He did wake up in the morning saying he wanted more spagetti though, which is a good sign?

For drinks we had the Starbelly 47 or some other random number and the Pimcup with basil and cucumber!  Both were super refreshing after a long day at Delores!  I can't wait to go back to order the same things and sit outside, because based on everyone else's reviews, we got the best things on the menu!
author: Brandy B.

description:
I like that they're open from the morning until evening without a break, though they switch from lunch to dinner at 4pm. I was there on a weekend at 2 or 3pm and got seated without a wait.

The food and price just don't correlate. Yes the decor and food presentation are great, but everything else fell short of expectations. I thought the service was a little slow, my food was not worth the price at all, and my friend and I both left still hungry.
author: James T.

description:
Wasn't happy when I first sat down. Took over 10 minutes for the waiter to take our drink and food order. That's a no no and the place wasn't even packed.

Chicken Pate is the best I ever had here. It's AMAZING!!!

Got the salumi and cheese plate-not bad at all, but the selection wasn't anything special.

Beet salad-Not bad

Mushroom pizza-not a huge fan of pizza anymore, but it was pretty yummy. The crust was good.

Spaghetti with bacon, japapeno, and tomato sauce-very yummy.
author: Karen H.

description: We got there at 3:45pm. The place wasn't crowded, which was nice. We ordered fries and bacon pizza. Both are delicious. Fries tasted like they're made from fresh potatoes. Pizza crust was crispy and the toppings were rich. The service was good in general, except the receptionist was somehow impatient.
author: Shuang J.

description:
Finally made it there last night! (I live a block away).

- Split Pea Fritters with Curried Yogurt dip = good
- Margherita Pizza subbed with Burrata (why not, if it's available) and topped with 
  Arugula = really enjoyed it except for the fact that the arugula was topped with salt 
  (why?)
- Starbelly Salad = good
- Burger = husband had it and liked it

Love the back patio.  Servers were good, atmosphere was good.  So, overall a good local neighborhood spot for me.
author: Pavarti B.

description:
Solid spot for brunch and dinner. Love the pizza and burger. 

Nice decor and patio out back.
author: Loren A.

description: Have been a dozen times and always left happy with the food, drink, atmosphere, and service.
author: Anton E.

description:
Perfect night!  Got seated at the bar on a Friday night and had the best service.  I mean best... wine tastings, pairing suggestions, menu advice, chit chat, and she even shared her chocolate bar with us. 

The wine was so well priced. $36 for a really nice rose that went great with the mussels, pate, shrimp, and burrata. The meal was mouth watering, and a great price. Everything was clean and delicious.  The stand outs were definitely the pâté and shrimp. Incredible. Also loved the burrata with grilled peach and arugula.  We'll be back and it will be hard not to have the exact same order. 

Next time, I'm saving room for dessert!
author: Eileen F.

description: Needed a place to grab a GOOD lunch, glad we stopped by!!! We ordered the loco moco, BLT, and the starbelly pizza with egg!!!
author: Mina S.

description:
Food: 2
Decor: 3
Service: 4

Came here for a dinner date around 9pm. They had some seats open, so we were able to grab a table without a wait.

1. Pimm's Cup, 8
~Okay.

2. Grilled Little Gems, 10
Market oranges, raw goat's milk feta & oregon hazelnuts
~Okay. The feta with oranges was a bit odd.

3. Market Mushrooms, 16
Cave aged gruyere, thyme & roasted onions
~Disappointing. Really didn't like the pizza at all, and any other pizza on the menu probably would have been better. Bit surprised that the server recommended this one as the most popular pizza.

Service was good.
author: David L.
Natalie M.

description:
I liked Starbelly. Not tripping over myself to come back anytime soon, but it was a lovely meal in a great setting.

Saturday 8:30p - holiday weekend and it was not crowded. Seated immediately.

Wine selection was extensive & fabulous, mostly in the $35 - $45 range. The cocktail list looked very yummy too.

Menu... I actually didn't know it was pizza/ flourey stuff dominant (later found out owner has Delfina links). We opted for something simple - Butternut Squash dumpling, Starbelly pizza and the toffee cake.

There were moments of brilliance...
- Dumpling was DIVINE. Dumpling skin was like a wonderful al dente ravioli skin. The filling was balanced sweet, savory. Brown butter with a hint of heat from fresh black pepper. Score.

- Toffee cake! Reminds me of butterscotch pudding. I am a sucker for anything caramel/ toffee notes and it was warm, gooey, tinge of salt. Brilliant


Not so brilliant was the star of the show! I suspect the Starbelly Pizza spent a bit too much time in the oven. It was strangely very crunchy with very little chew. If this was the intended texture, then it's just not my preference. The topping was very nice and balanced though.

In my world this is a hung jury. Let's see if I have another chance to come back.
author: Joyce L.

description: Came here for dinner with good friends.  We sat outside at the covered and heated patio.  Hubby and I shared the harvest salad....good sized and fresh.  Hubby ordered a margherita pizza, which was very tasty.  I had the seared scallops served over beets.  I was a little surprised to see two not overly large scallops.  They were really good though!  Our table also shared the bacon and jalapeno pizza, which was not spicy, but very tasty.  I'd recommend wine or beer, the cocktail selection was sort of retro and didn't pack a real punch.
author: Chris K.

description: Met up with friends for dinner.  Got there early so there was no wait (even though we had no reservations).  One reason we picked this place was we weren't set on the time to meet up and this place makes a policy of only reserving up to 50 percent of their capacity. A definite plus for folks wanting to go out last minute and have a reasonable chance of getting seated. We decided to share everything and ordered a bunch of appetizers and a couple of mains.  Split pea fritters, starbelly salad, smoked trout, and white bean puree on flat bread.  All very yummy, I think my favorite of those was the smoked trout.  Then we also ordered a burger and the spaghetti.  Burger was good, though I am pretty picky.  I liked the brioche bun they used, and the spaghetti was standard fare.  The restaurant also sports a decent wine selection and the waiter seemed pretty knowledgeable about the various wines they had.  Overall quality of the food good, the service very friendly and the prices reasonable. We sat out on the patio and it was quite enjoyable.  The dining areas overall are very nicely done.  Will definitely go back.
author: Lori H.

description:
I have lived in the city for 4 months now - on Sates and Castro.

In London where we lived for 25 years i have long had my favourite places for each type of night - quiet local to big ticket night out.

SF is too full of good to great restaurants for me to have landed any real default choices - except for Starbelly my new favourite local.

Its a surprisingly lovely space behind a deeply unpromising exterior - its all open and wood and barnsy - big tables but still lots of space.

We dribbled 8 people in at random on a wednesday evening last week - including a load of jet lagged kids - staff were completely lovely and accepted itty bitty distracted ordering with great grace.

The menu is lovey - not trying to be anything it isnt - lovely thin pizza with interesting topping, great mezze style little plates of which the white bean puree was particularly delicious.  Salads and pasta - all good nothing duff

Although I was eating out later - I managed to basically put together an extra meal here.

Wide variety of diners and drinkers all having lovely time
author: Max A.

description:
Not sure how some of these reviews are 5 stars..

The food was very mediocre and sub-par. The only thing we liked out of the several dishes we ordered was the pate. But when we ran out of bread with about 2/3 of the thing left, we didn't get more bread until we were almost done with our dinner. Super slow service! Friendly, but incredibly slow. At least the bread refills were free..

The spaghetti was just spaghetti. I can make tastier, more flavorful spaghetti than that. The pizza had like 3 pieces of chorizo and fresh cilantro (who can't make that either?). The squash salad was terrible. I couldn't eat more than one bite because it tasted like raw squash. The pork belly was rough and chewy with some odd flavors/sides that didn't really blend. 

Parking is terrible. It took us around 20 min to find something. Some jerk also took a knife and carved out a ton of paint on my driver side door, which made the situation worse. 

Spend your money elsewhere. If you want pizza, go to Papa John's. If you want spaghetti, go to Olive Garden.
author: Ellen C.

description: I wasn't that impressed, unfortunately. Came for a friend's bday dinner and splurged by ordering too much, as always. Bf and I shared fries, pumpkin dumplings, burrata, and a chorizo/jalapeno pizza. Of those, I liked the pizza the best, especially with the added sunny side up egg. The fries were a total let-down though - they were either overcooked or undercooked, and the 3 sauces that come with it weren't anything special. The dumplings and burrata were okay, but nothing I feel like I need to try again in my life.
author: Kathy L.

description: Good food.  I hope to go back.   I believe we had a pizza and also some pasta.
author: Michael E.

description: I came here with a group of girlfriends before a night out. It's a really cute location and setting; feels very hipster SF. We ordered a couple pizzas, a pasta, and a salad. Everything was good. The menu is pretty standard, as are the prices. You won't get hearty full here, but you will get classy full. Drinks are good too, we were bummed that they didn't serve any kind of sangria pitchers though. Instead, we opted to just order a bunch of drinks. Huge shout out to the bar staff for charging my phone behind the bar for 2 hours :)
author: A L.

description:
Before going to a show yesterday, hooked up with a long time friend and we ate here.  I must say, Starbelly's a charming little social restaurant that's pretty well priced with very good friendly service.

Since my friend made the arrangements with Startbelly to assure that we could get seats (thru an apparent 45 minutes in advance phone reservations available option), the logistics of eating here was pain free.  Also to my surprise, if you eat here at around 7pm, there's plenty of parking around.  I wasn't too far away.  Coming from the East Bay, I was expecting that the biggest problem would be finding parking, but twuzn't the case.

As for the food, the liver paté was very good.  It comes with toast and two interesting sides of French seeded dijón mustard and minced carmelized onions.  What is cool is that if you put the paté on the breads and top it with the carmelized onions, it can almost play a joke on the palette and taste like peanut butter and jam!  Sounds weird I know, but if you're a paté lover, you won't be disappointed with this side (5 stars).

The salad wasn't that great.  It's the kind of salad where you can not pick it up with a fork and requires skill just to put it in the mouth.  Besides, no tomatos or salad charm to be that great (only 3 stars for that).

Next we split a....I cannot recall what it was called....but it was essentially a meatball that wasn't meat but outshell fried texture meatball shaped thing that had an inner explosion of cheese.  It was very delicious, but I have to doc off one point because had it been steaming hot, it would've been perfect.  Unfortunately it was only warm on the verge of luke warm. ( 4 stars)

The Cabernet I had here was pretty lousy considering it was $9/glass.  It tasted like a cheap Merlot (2 1/2 stars)

For the final dish, the waiter recommend that goat cheese and butternut squash pizza.  It wasn't spectacular only because a normal pizza with tomato sauce, mushrooms, garlic, and pepperoni would've tasted better.  But, it was interesting.  Guess I just wasn't ready for something that adventurous or maybe I was full from the appetizers.  One positive is that this place definitely mastered the texture of the pizza which was perfect.  Just would've tasted better with a more traditional pizza topping.  Note to self: next time I come here, try a tomato sauced based pizza. (4 stars)

All in all, it's a 3.75 star place that I don't mind rounding up to 4 stars.  This place could even turn into a 5 star place, but it's falling into that trend of SF restaurants that cooks with too much sugar or honey or some kind of sugar based flavoring.

A word to Chefs: sweet is ok in dining, but if the eater notices the sweetness, that means too much was added (case in point: the minced onions with the paté).
Portions were very good here.  2 drinks, 3 appetizers, and pizza split between two people's gonna cost around $80 which is pretty reasonable for SF. (5 stars on price).

All and all, Starbelly's a viable place to eat at in the Church/Market St. neighborhood.
author: Tony U.

description:
This was a nice restaurant and the food was overall pretty good. What lost the two stars for my review was the service. 

It took about 4  minutes after walking in the door for anyone to even greet us. After being sat, the server took our drink order after sitting and waiting for her for another couple of minute and told us "let me get your whole order in because this big party behind me is going to take up a lot of my time."  You dont say that, even if you are completely under. 

Our check was dropped, and it was another tables' check, not ours. The server never acknowledged dropping off the wrong check, she just rang us up for our food and thats it. 

The food was good though, if i go back, im sitting at the bar.
author: Erick L.

description:
They say "cellar door" spoken aloud is the most pleasing arrangement of sounds. They obviously haven't encountered the phonaesthetically superior word "Starbelly."  They probably haven't had their pizza, either, which is a shame. 

Very much in the same spirit of Delarosa (another dulcet tone!) 

If you're torn, go to Starbelly for their beer selection, and Delarosa for their amazing cocktails.
author: Dan B.

description:
I don't do long reviews. My sisters and I went for lunch this last Saturday.
My sisters ordered the fish tacos and the chicken po'boy. The chicken and the fish were fried excellently, except one of my sisters said the chicken wasn't seasoned. So, although the batter was crisp and the chicken was juicy, it lacked salt.
I ordered the Nicoise Salad. I was expecting a few slices of seared ahi tuna. Instead it had canned tuna. Gross. I can't believe a "nice" restaurant would serve canned tuna. 
That is all.
author: Jillian H.

description:
I had dinner at Starbelly a few weeks ago with a friend and the service was incredible, the waiter had a great knowledge of wine with appropriate recommendations, and the food was very good (if you are a fan of tomato soup and grilled cheese- get that if it's on the menu!).  

Heading back there for lunch in the coming week- and can't wait!
author: Eric R.

description:
The food is great. We bring everyone here and they rave as well. The space is beautiful inside and out with a private garden and the wait staff and kitchen magicians never disappoint.

We often go for late lunch when tables are easy to get, the pace is more relaxed, and it feels like a great break from whatever ails ye!
author: Shawn N.

description: Had the salumi platter on my most recent visit here... the house made mortadella is delicious and highly recommended.  The service I received was friendly and attentive (I sat at the bar this time) and I will definitely come here again in the afternoon for future impromptu happy hours when it's not so crowded.
author: Joel L.

description:
Frigid.  Fucking frozen.  My god, are those propane heaters (suspended precariously overhead) turned all the way up?  When I overpay for dinner, I expect a modicum of comfort.  Call me crazy.

Star belly did not provide this.  Unfortunately for them, hardship during dinner does little to improve one's palate.  Remember the Donner Party?  Yeah.  They got so cold they didn't realize they were eating EACH OTHER.  With that being said, I don't remember much of the meal.

The things I do remember, are less than flattering.  Our waiter, a young peppy Filipino chap, was generally flippant and unresponsive.  When I asked about the "Lonza" on the charcuterie plate, he declared it was, "Good.  A little fattier than other meats, but house-made and delicious."  It was, in fact, not delicious. It was 90% fat, 10% lean; exactly the opposite of what a lonza stagionata should be.  House-made or not, it tasted like crap.

The mussels were pedestrian and unimaginative.  Fresh, but slathered in an oily "house-made" chorizo (suddenly the most ubiquitous meat in San Francisco), jalapeno and cilantro.  Zero imagination.

Even the pizza failed to live up to expectations.  Squash, sage, and pepitas (another omnipresent SF menu item, as chefs ride out their Fall gourd stocks), sounds a whole lot more interesting than it actually was.  The crust was overly salted, the flavor profile unoriginal.

In fairness to Starbelly, the arctic temperatures are out of their control.  However, proper heating elements and placement is certainly not.  If you, as a restauranteur, book reservations and seat people in an outdoor environment, their relative comfort is a primary concern.  Heat deprivation does nothing to enhance my appreciation of your restaurant.  Rather, it gave me ample opportunity to focus on the other aspects of the dining experience that I didn't like, elements that no doubt I would have overlooked had my tootsies been warm.

So, will I try Starbelly again?  Most probably I will be forced to: my girlfriend loves this place.  But next time?  I'm wearing fucking electric socks.
author: Sean O.

description: First time back in a long while. Had the goddess salad with a margarita pizza which was great!
author: James P.

description: The food was amazing! Very accommodating with reservation, even though I was about 15 mins late. Server provided great recommendations.
author: Genevive C.

description:
We hosted our wedding reception at Starbelly and could not be happier!  The food and cocktails were fantastic (we did the whole roasted pig...we highly recommend it), and the staff was absolutely incredible. We dropped off decorations and they set everything up just as we wanted.  All of our guests complemented us on the great atmosphere and food. It made for a very relaxed and joyous evening. We highly recommend using Starbelly for private events.  

- Gabe and Michaela
author: Gabriel L.

description:
I love the heated back patio. So quaint, yet elevated in style. I was with friends, and we ordered a variety of dishes. I had the spaghetti with bacon and the buratta salad. Yum! I tried a few of the fries as well, and they were perfectly salty and delicious. Wines by the bottle are reasonably priced, and as a native Pittsburgher who is used to never being able to get anything decent by the bottle for a decent price at a restaurant, I love this about San Francisco.

If you are looking for a fun spot to try with friends and you love sharing and sampling different things, try Starbelly! You won't be disappointed.
author: Carly K.

description: Great food. The place is a little cramped up . I couldn't even get in my chair , since the tables were too close to each other !
author: Lovish A.

description:
Every time we've eaten there, the food's been great.  The dessert even better.  And the environment, staff, etc...all great.  And a good location/views of a popular Castro corner.

Very much recommended.
author: Ara L.

description: A great restaurant! The Veggie Burger was fantastic! I also tried the Lemonade which was one of the best I ever had ... it wasn't too sweet and very refreshing!
author: Angelika R.

description:
There is finally good food in the Castro! 

I love this place. The food is always great, they have a nice wine list, and the staff is always friendly. 

And thankfully there is none of that hipster-attitude BS or four-hour wait list nonsense that you run into in those trendy Mission restaurants just a couple blocks away.

This is our go-to restaurant whenever we just want a nice, simple yet upscale meal and a good bottle of wine.
author: J D.

description:
Great ambience (though I fault them for the fake candle), fantastic food and surprisingly reasonable prices. Starbelly just became one of my favorite SF eateries.

We shared a honey-balsamic roasted Brussels sprouts and chicken liver pate as appetizers; both were the best of their kind I've had. I followed that up with a curious entree of spaghetti with jalapeños, basil, bacon and tomato sauce, which was also pretty great. Not as sublimely great as the appetizers, but still a really enjoyable dish.

Can't wait to come back.
author: Mike D.

description:
Foodie Lunch Date: November 18, 2010 @ Noon 

Starbelly is my foodie buddy Heather's pick  for our monthly girl-bonding lunch. I didn't know much about Starbelly except that if Heather had chosen it, then I am in good hands. 

Walking in, I was immediately impressed. Starbelly is a cute, bright and airy neighborhood restaurant in the Castro.  A long wooden bar that also serves as the communal table is the focal point of this eatery; along with the display of wine bottles neatly stocked up in the contemporary wooden cabinets on the wall by the bar. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=BdleQIOwww3ee8d3HJARww http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=bZu__fPGDD5M3C7Q-6RYNw

I caught a glimpse of al fresco dining at the pretty wooden patio in the back.  Heather and I opted to seat at the casual 2-4 seater table with metal chairs in the main dining area. 

The whole place has a casual and cheery feel to it. Service was friendly and very efficient. As soon as we sat down we were given a choice between regular or complimentary bubbly water. We chose the bubbly, nice touch!

Once again, Heather and I ordered family-style to be able to enjoy and "critique" each dish. 

1. CRAB LOUIE SALAD: Since it is the very beginning of the crab season in San Francisco, we thought it was best to try this dish. And we were rewarded with big chunks of sweet Dungeness crab meat on fresh lettuce wedge and not overpowering dressing. Divine!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=IF1g91EGuRqO-TrejZhq6A

2. SQUASH THIN CRUST PIZZA WITH GOAT CHEESE AND PEPITAS: I love pumpkins and squash but I was not so sure about them on pizza. At first bite this pizza put away all my worries. I thought that squash, goat cheese and pepitas on pizza would be a brave culinary attempt that could easily fail but this was a well executed dish. The result was a harmony of earthy fall flavors on a thin crust. The pizza was nicely grilled and slightly charred (but not burnt) in the wood-fire oven. A delicious autumn dish! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=48ZW8X4GOVcEDWDb8ZQfrw

3. FRIES WITH 3 DIPS: Uneven cut fries. 3 dips including ketchup. Nicely salted. I've had better fries but these were nice fillers. They give you a lot! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/J7_-faNq_Ag9qTOlDn81Pw?select=e7YtXlHDsaXNJr8NCmW8yQ

The dishes at Starbelly are seasonal. The chef makes use of fresh ingredients. They are most delicious in their simplicity but combinations of flavors are amazing and refreshing on the palate.

Once again, Heather and I had a wonderful "girl-bonding" lunch in the City in the midst of our very busy work day. Starbelly is highly recommended for such diversions.

Tab: $42.00 including tax, $1.99 Health SF Fee and 20% tip. ($21 per girl)
author: Leah E.

description:
3.5 stars for food - It was typical brunch fare.  I had a bite of the donut and didn't love it, the grilled cheese bite I had was no better than what I could do at home, but the dipping sauces for the fries were delicious.

+.5 for good drinks and a friendly bar tender

+1 for the staff holding our table.  Our friends had just finished the Nike marathon and we did our best to guess what time they would be able to meet up with us.  There were 6 of us total, and just before my friends showed up, the hostess said she gave away our table.  (They had held it for us about 30 mins. past what we had originally given as a time).  Needless to say,  I was bummed we would have to wait another 20 minutes, but somehow they ended up giving us the table!  The waitress was friendly and attentive.  

There are many brunch choices, and while the food here was nothing exciting, because they went out of their way to accommodate us, I would definitely come back!
author: Shelby B.

description:
Finally, I've been enough times to write a heartfelt, insightful Meredith R. official review. Drumroll please...

I dig it. Their floor needs a little work but overall, Starbelly is on to great things. What I do like: let's start w/the process. The hostess is *always* friendly whoever she may be. The last time I went our table wasn't ready so she handed me and my girlfriend a glass of champagne. Wow. Kinda floored. Never would have expected that, we weren't even huffy or anything. Once we were seated, as usual, the service is always great. Kind, happy, helpful servers. 

So far I've had the buffala with black garlic (heavenly), collard greens (or something like that for health's sake, delicious) squash pizza and margherita pizza (add prosciutto) and both were divine. The issue apparently is the wait time between apps and pizza - I've experienced it. A lot of others have complained. I don't think it's that big of a deal when you're with wonderful company (and why would I come to Starbelly with bad company?) - but I guess if people are complaining - and I'm an ex server so I get it people - timing in the kitchen must be a bit floozy. 

Whatever. Keep working on it, kitchen staff, but until then, you still have my belly's complete and utter attention. Ya'll are supremely talented. And at the end of the MEAL, isn't that what truly matters...?
author: Meredith R.

description:
I recently moved to the neighborhood and thought I'd check out some of the new food in the area. We had my dog with us so we sat outside on the patio. It was pretty chilly (maybe just because it's in the shade) even though the weather was nice. Heat lamps would be a huge improvement!

We started with the corndogs which my boyfriend was really excited about. Those were just eh... I'm not a huge corndog fan to begin with so maybe best to ignore my opinion on this.

Then we had pizzas. MMMMMMMM....The pizzas are worth a visit to this place for sure. I had the bacon, jalapeno, and arugula and he had the chorizo, sunny egg pizza. We could have shared one though, we had leftovers for breakfast :-)

Service was really good and the wine list was pretty solid too. 

I have a feeling when I'm done exploring the area I'll be returning to this place frequently!
author: Rachel E.

description: Terrible service and the waiter doesn't know the difference between tomato juice a drink bloody nary mix.  Seriously!   Tried it once,  won't return.
author: Kelly B.

description:
Too trendy for it's own good.  I waited for a table twice - both times were around 45mins and I wouldn't wait again.  This restaurant serves good food and it's something unique to this area in the Castro beating out it's old predecessor Askew Grill by a long-shot. BUT it's not good enough to continue holding up our lives for 45min waits.  If only they offered some wine or snacks to eat while you wait.

On to the food... The corn dogs were a hit but I see they don't serve it on the menu anymore. pizzas aren't bad but this isn't a pizza joint so on to the entrees. Wait... only 4 entrees?  Well this place is definitely better for sharing small plates until you've stuffed yourself completely but the small plates need some updating.
author: Kevin J.

description: Thank you, yelpsters, for guiding us to check this place out.  Great atmosphere, great service,excellent food.  Definitely get something with the star belly bacon.
author: Leilani A.

description: Terrible! I paid $19 for the "lamb" and was served a tiny portion of overcooked sausage. Another memorable experience.. My friend visiting tried one of the small green peppers they put on your plate (I had eaten one and it was mild) and it was horribly spicy- he was almost dying from the spiciness and it was a humiliating experience for him. He asked for a glass of milk after clearly, publicly almost having a heart attach from this misplaced ultra-hot pepper.. And they charged us for the milk! I was polite to the waiter only because my friend insisted... Terrible service and food!
author: Micah P.

description:
I ordered takeout from Starbelly this evening and was disappointed with the experience. We ordered two margherita pizzas including one with add-ons. When we got home and found out that the add-ons hadn't been put on yet we has been charged, the hostess (Jessica) was completely unapologetic and didn't ask what our preferred solution would be (refund on the toppings or make a new pizza). The food was OK, but the hostess left a lot to be desired and really left a sour taste in our mouths. 

I'll revisit this review if the customer service improves.
author: Natalia B.

description:
Food: Great food and probably the best restaurant in the Castro. Everything is very tasty but it's too bad the portions are not a little bigger because I could definitely eat more.
Service: Always friendly and helpful. The staff is great.
Decor: Warm and comfortable. I love the big long table in the middle. A great covered patio in the back for extra space is good for groups too.
author: David S.

description: Lots of vegetarian options and a fantastic outdoor patio. Great atmosphere and a nice beer and wine selection!
author: Natalie C.

description: I love this place! My mom loves this place! The partner loves this place! It's good, fresh, California-style, farm-to-table food. And the price point is great! Go here if you have 2-4 people. I've only been for dinner (multiple times) and it's never disappointed.
author: Bianca E.

description:
I attended Starbelly as a guest for my roommate's work function and we took over the patio.  Starbelly sits in the heart of Castro and it was poppin' even on a weekday night.

We tried a selection of cheeses, charcuterie, and other nibbles as starters.  Round it off with some nicely tossed salads and an assortment of pizzas (bacon, margherita, and mushroom).  All were good, but I was really itching to try dessert that night!  The dessert selection of salted caramel pot de creme (my favorite), rosemary cornmeal cookies, toffee cake, and rice pudding were good enough to satisfy any sweet tooth.

For any company function, the highlight of the night was the necessary consumption of the most expensive bottles of wines and Starbelly has an excellent selection!  My favorites were the Malbec "Maucho", Casa Patronales and the Cabernet Blend "Borderlands," Desperada.

Overall, this Starbelly is a solid choice for a get together, but none of these food items kept me drooling.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
I was rather impressed with the appetizers here at Starbelly. Ordered the liver pate, which was very tasty, with very little "organy" taste and the oven baked pizza.  My main entree however was a bit disappointing. I had the roasted half chicken. Flavors were meh......   I actually enjoy the $5 rotesserie chicken from Costco much more to tell you the truth. My friends steak dish looked really yummy though.  

I'd be willing to give them a 2nd chancejust because I was so impresed with the appetizers, but I had to knock off a few stars for my chicken
author: Kenson K.

description:
This is a pretty cool place that I think is under-appreciated.  I have been here a couple times.  The staff is all friendly and the atmosphere is trendy, hip, cool, etc.   They even have a romantic covered patio in the back of the restaurant.  

For starters, we ordered the burrata di stefano (with cherry tomatoes, basil, grilled bread) .  Of course, let's face it, when is burrata not delicious?  For my main course, I ordered the albacore fish plate which was decent, but I would try something new next time.   I actually don't think it's on the menu anymore (they seem to change it often).  Anyways, dinner was going pretty well up to this point....

...until.....we decided to order a pot de creme for dessert.  A small spoonful of the salted pot de creme caused my taste buds to have a dance party.  But the best part was that it came with rosemary cornmeal cookies that you can use for dipping.  The rosemary combination with the salt and the carmel creaminess created an amazing moment in my life.  I never wanted that moment to end, so after basically licking the bowl, we ordered another pot de creme.  

After a good dinner and two pot de cremes, we both left with a wide grin, a happy tummy, and new favorite dessert.




Fun fact: Starbelly was created by the same team behind the popular restaurants Beretta (mission) and Delarosa (marina).
author: Juliana K.

description:
Starbelly is a great place to have certain dishes. When we went, the dishes that stood out were the chicken liver pate. It was sweet and did not have a irony taste.  The onion jelly worked well with the pate and the crisp bread.

The chirzo, egg pizza that we order was excellent. All the flavors worked well together. Who knew that a soft cooked egg on a pizza really works?

The entree that I had was the halibut with shrimp.  This was the most undesirable dish. The halibut was overcooked and dry. The shrimp was overcooked.  Yet hungry, I ate it.  Bad mistake. I should have sent it back for a new dish.  

From this experience, I gather that the appetizers and pizza's are the choices to choose from the menu. I look forward to eating the chicken liver pate again.
author: Marck N.

description: Not sure what the fuss is about.  It was fine, not excellent.  Service was really great and they were patient with our party, where some were late and we had an unruly toddler.  The food itself was fine for brunch, but nothing out of this world.  I had the chilaquiles, which were just okay.  Not really that flavorful and I thought the salad part was kind of odd.  I think there are a lot of other brunch places with more unique and well-prepared dishes.  They also didn't refill coffee, which is pretty odd for brunch.
author: Michelle C.

description: Went for brunch, with a reservation it took a little bit longer than I wanted to seat us but once we sat down it was solid. The coffee was good, we ordered the pistachio and the pumpkin spice doughnut, the pumpkin spice was delicious, I wish the pistachio had more pistachio on/in it. My chicken and waffles were pretty good, not great but not bad either. A good experience overall
author: Brian B.

description: First things first - sit outside of you have the chance...there is some great people (and dog) watching to be had.  Eric, our server, was really attentive and friendly -- felt like we were hanging with our friend.  More than anything though, the food was impeccable.  We ordered a ton of food, my favorite being the flatbread pizza.  Simple, delicious and full of taste.  The scene was so chill that our 1 year old was easily entertained (she liked the food too!).  Will come back again and again...
author: Shaina K.

description:
I love my Castro trips. Something weird always happens. Our weird afternoon started with a "must-try" pizza from this fine establishment.

The layout and general decor is quaint and stylish with a hint of hipster, which is the case with many places in the area to be fair. The patio definitely takes the cake in terms of seating so aim for spot there if you can.

We chose the weird pizza, of course, and ended up with a beautiful presentation of chorizo and egg pizza ($15). However, even though I'm a fan of thin pizzas, I found the plate to be mostly crispy bland bread crust on the edges, rather than the actual flavorful center. In fact, I'd say 30% of the slice is just plain bread and 70% is the good stuff. The chorizo was a great idea but I wasn't so sure about the egg. It made the piece messy and undelicate, which is the opposite of what a thin-crust pizza should be.

I hear good things about the desserts here but alas, they only serve donuts during lunch. Bummer. Like I came to a restaurant to order donuts...

-----

Distinguishing factor: Intriguing menu and a delightful enclosed patio with lots of plants. You like plants right?
author: Nick A.

description: What does Starbelly actually mean? Who cares! The food is terrific, the service was considerate, professional, and good-humored. Most important of all, I know of nowhere else on planet earth you can get pâté on a burger.
author: Majel C.

description:
The chilaquiles were pretty good, the french toast was delicious, the bacon (very savory), and the maple bacon donut was fun.

The wait was very reasonable (which, based on what I've heard about the area, is reason enough to go.)
author: Kyle S.

description: Went here with some friends and we enjoyed the food and the wine.  The back patio was really nice, too.
author: Gavin M.

description:
Came here for the first time on Sunday for a late dinner. 

Service: The hostess greeted us when we walked in, something that surprisingly doesn't happen at most places here in town. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. The right balance of checking back with us without being overbearing. Food came promptly.

Food: We shared the beet salad----so good. The cheese really makes the dish. I had the steak, it was cooked exactly as I like it with a little bit of gristle. Yum. We also shared the mushroom pizza. The thin crust just nails it!!

Drinks: Had the champagne cocktail--good balance of bitter and sweet. And I loved the old time champagne glasses. Totally felt classy.

Ambiance-Good vibe from staff and crowd plus chic interior with good lighting. And the bar area is a good place to meet up with friends for a drank or two.

Side-Note to Management: the blurb at the bottom of the menu about the "3% mandate surcharge" is a debbie downer. All restaurant owners need to just move on already. The mandates are here to stay. Just raise your prices accordingly and stop putting a "surcharge notice" on the menu/ bill to make a political statement.
author: Timoteo K.

description:
Eh, taking two stars off on the third visit. Friday night, waited FOREVER for service at every point: taking order, drinks, appetizers, entrée service, check. Probably spent about twice as much time there as I had wanted to because service was so slow. 

Not worth it when there are so many better options for food and service in the neighborhood.
author: Mandy H.

description: Great cocktails, great decor, indoor outdoor seating. Close to Castro Theater. Food is Yummy. Only con is the general noise volume is a little loud.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Great decor and ambiance but just OK food.  Nothing to really write home about...neither super creative or super farm to table fresh... just pretty solid Cali-American cuisine that I think LA does better than this place.  

Everybody said to get their spaghetti which I did but it was just average.  Maybe it was an off day with bland tomatoes but the dish certainly didn't pop.  Was kinda bland all around.   

I would come back to this place as its a fun place with good service and decent food.
author: Dennis Y.

description:
Was treated to my first time to Starbelly as a birthday dinner the other night, and it just felt right. The ambiance, the food, the service, it was all on point. We dined on the back patio and with the heat lamps on in the evening, it was just right. 

We ordered the white bean puree with eggplant as an appetizer, the bread that came with was the perfectly warmed grilled, yet soft with a slight saltiness type and the puree was smooth and quite tasty and even though I'm not the biggest eggplant fan, even that part was enjoyable. 

I ordered the asparagus and crab cream soup - nice light asparagus flavor, substantial pieces of crab. The only tiny dislike here was that the soup got cold a little quickly as we were sitting outdoors, I think it would be safe to assume that if we had been indoors, this wouldn't have been a concern.

He ordered the meatloaf, it was warming, hearty and brought back memories of childhood. 

We shared the pate because he is a fan and I was willing - it's difficult for me to place judgement on this dish as it was only my second time having pate, but I'd certainly order it again if I was to head to Starbelly. 

So, that all being said, food was good, enjoyable. 

The service was attentive but soft-spoken in a charming way, from the host to the waiter to the busser. All appropriate for a Sunday evening dinner. 

One thing to note is that the spot is much larger than it appears as you walk through the front door - the patio out back is very substantial so don't miss out on a nice meal if, as you peer through the front window, it appears busy. You might want to check in with the host first.
author: Littany W.

description: Went to Starbelly for brunch and sat on the back patio--4 adults, two kids and one baby. Incredible service, super warm, informative and kind, and very delicious brunch. Dealt with our ridiculously big stroller like it was no problem. Very lucky to have SB in the neighborhood. And our British guests loved your in-house Pimm's Cup, so bravo! Thanks for exceeding expectations and making brunch what it was meant to be.
author: E W.

description: Excellent service! Great teamwork from the crew everybody attended to our needs even before we ask for it. Food is wonderful. Try the butter bean with lardon and truffle oil. Silky texture went wonderful with the rich lardon and cream sauce with a hint of truffles.
author: Prince T.

description:
So, I've been here a few times and never had anything I didn't like, but I must say, We had the BEST meal here saturday!  My friend's buddy Julio is a chef here, and he hooked us up.  And there were 4 of us, so we got to try a few more things than usual.  It was all so delicious, I can't wait to come back!
we had:
- cheese plate: delicious selection of 4 cheeses with yummy compotes and candied nuts and relishes.  one of the cheeses was humboldt fog, which is my fave.  there was also something with black pepper that i loved.
- pate: silky smooth and yummy, with mustard and fruit compote, on warm toasty bread.  
- crispy brussles sprouts with bacon:  these can't possibly be good for you, but they're worth it.  so tasty and caramelized...
- cauliflower: nice and light and a great compliment to the other heavy stuff we ordered
- mussles with chorizo: brothy and just the right amount of spicy, with bread.  I was getting pretty full by the time these came but i just couldn't stop eating them anyway
- spaghetti with bacon and jalapeno:  unusual and extremely tasty!  nice thick chunks of bacon, just the right amount of jalapeno
- salted caramel pot de creme with rosemary cornmeal cookies:  my favorite dessert.  I wanted to grab it off the table and run away with it so i could keep it all to myself!
- chocolate mousse: no surprises, but decadent and yummy
- sticky toffee cake with marscapone and dates:  moist and delicious

If you haven't been, go.  It'll knock your socks off!
author: J W.

description:
Arrived, checked in, sat at the bar to have a drink before my dining partner came. It was my birthday, and last night we wanted low key, and that's exactly what we got. The bartender was great, offered plain or sparkling water within seconds. I got an Apple Cider on ice (I guess ice is how they do it, so I had it the way they suggest). 
Dining partner came, we instantly moved to a table in the rear of the restaurant, on the window side. I like it there cause its away from everyone, and you get a glimpse of the patio which promptly closes at 9:30PM. The lights were dimmed there, and we started our service. 

Pizza and Brussels sprouts with bacon (sorry but you cant go wrong there, except the bacon was a bit over cooked, however, it did add a nice flavor and crunchy texture that Brussels sprouts usually lack, so I cant complain on that nor mark off points), and crab garlic pasta with garlic bread. The garlic bread was so good, I almost wanted a whole loaf, spread with melted cheese just so I could make my own pizza out of it. Hands down, it was the best flavor, crispness and quite honestly, not overpowering nor greasy. The crab pasta, fresh, had a little chewy pasta texture unlike Ive ever had before, not quite al dente style, not underdone or overdone, just so extremely fresh and cooked to perfection you actually got to feel texture wise what pasta SHOULD be! The whole thing was great, though I wish they could bump up the amount of crab in the dish just a little bit more. However, again, no points off and no complaints cause frankly, the flavor and texture made up for it. 
Our server was great, very attentive, not overbearing, she liked my Christmas light backpack - so thats instant points there, even if my backpack is tacky, and I know it is, compliments and smiles go really far for me in a restaurant. She was very professional yet welcoming and casual at the same time. Which I think makes an experience! Her water bottle trick, which I commented on, not a single drop outside my glass, was stellar! Seriously! I want to come back again real soon so I can try the spaghetti next time. HELL YES!
author: William D.

description: This place was okay. I went in an in-between hour where they had a really small menu.
author: Shaughni N.

description:
Came here for brunch - no line at around 11 am.  Eggsellent.

Ordered the chilaquiles & pizza with butternut squash.  Both dishes were great but the butternut squash pizza was srsly on pointtttttt, na whaddamean?

I want to come back and try all their pizzas.  The crust is so thin/flat/perfectly the way I like it.  

Service was also great - attentive but not too much.
author: Christine B.

description: I usually like this place but the service blew. We waited 15-20 for a waiter to even acknowledge us and when we asked the hostess for help she bit my friends head off by saying "I'm seating someone right now!"  The only saving grace was our waitress.
author: Mario D.

description:
Excellent little place to come for brunch, absolutely loved it here. There is a great outdoor seating area in the back. 

The french toast was absolutely delicious as was the crab scramble. Delicious french press coffee.
author: Christy D.

description: Have been here for both brunch and dinner. You can't go wrong with any of the pizzas, sangria is also very good. Kyle took great care of us the last time I was here-- was very attentive and helpful with suggestions.
author: Tracy K.

description: Fun place to go without being too serious. Service was prompt, friendly and helpful. Ambiance was very tight compact and very loud. Food came in a strange order short rib pasta came before the charcuterie salad came after that. But all in all a cute find. Go with friends don't judge It too hard and I am sure you will enjoy it.
author: j M.

description:
First, to be fair this used to be the place I would take people that came to visit. It's an easy walk from my house, the food is decent, and service is ok. So when a bunch of my friends from back home came to visit, I naturally thought, hey lets go to Starbelly. 

Since it was kinda a last minute thing, I called them up on a Saturday morning and asked if it would be possible to seat about 10 people that night around 8pm. The first girl I talked to said it would be no problem, just to call 45 to an hour before and they would put my name in.  She also said she would let the hostess know that I was going to be coming in with a big party. So everything seemed good to go. 

I called about 7pm and the hostess picks up the phone, I explained to her that I had called earlier and wanted to come in with 10 people in about an hour or so. She had THE WORST ATTITUDE. She said, "Well no one told me, I'm going to have to get manager approval." she put me on hold and when she returned she told me that they WOULD NOT seat me. I explained that I had called in the morning specifically to make sure that it would not be a problem. She then said, "Well good luck with your night. Bye." and just HUNG UP ON ME!

I was almost dumbfounded that they would treat me like this, someone who has brought thousands of dollars into this business and always talked highly of them. No matter what I thought of them before, this left a VERY SOUR taste in my mouth... 

That night Rouge Ales Public House got upwards of $500 in business from our party alone. Needless to say, I will NEVER go back to Starbelly if this is how they think they can treat their customers. Instead of this place, maybe think of trying the new Slider place across the street...
author: Allen V.

description:
We had the pizza with the egg - yummy - and the fish tacos, which were good, but not over the top delicious.
We also sat out back, which was a mistake as it got pretty hot (in SF, can you imagine ?) and we were sweating by the time lunch was over.

It was a fine experience, but I'm not sure I would put it in my top ten.
author: Whitney D.

description: We loved our Starbelly Sunday brunch! The pizza with bacon, arugula, goddess dressing and jalapenos (we asked for extra) was great- spicy, salty, and full of yummy goodness. Now if they'd only work on their crust so that it isn't so dry and bleh. We also quite liked the chicken po boy sandwich with a spicy slaw and thick juicy pieces of fried chicken. Overall a delicious meal.
author: Amy D.

description:
Whenever a friend comes into town, I always feel this sudden pressure to choose the perfect restaurant which will ideally result in a perfect experience -- nerve wracking! In this case, a friend was in town and wanted to try Foreign Cinema, but I wasn't ready for a fancy schmancy dinner on a Sunday (good thing we didn't go, it was actually closed for a private event). He happened to be book shopping in the Castro so I searched for options nearby, and that's how we came upon Starbelly.

I've enjoyed each visit to Beretta, so I was looking forward to a similar-ish menu and heard good-ish things about Starbelly. I knew beforehand that the reviews for this place were mixed so I wasn't expecting an outstanding food adventure, but something good. It was fairly open when we arrived and were seated easily. Really nice interior (loved the wood paneled walls) and an outdoor patio that I wasn't able to check out, but comfortable and inviting vibe. 

What we ordered:
English pea burrata crostini - there's a pea crostini at Beretta that I really enjoy, but I can't say the same about this one. Even with the addition of burrata, the crostini was fairly bland and forgettable.

Chicken liver pate with marmalade and mustard - the combination of pate, marmalade, and mustard was heavenly. Generous portion of pate as well that was well-shared amongst 3 people.

Mussels with chorizo - not a fan of chorizo in general, so I probably shouldn't judge this dish. There was also a sour flavor (perhaps lemon or lime?) that didn't really blend well with the mussels for me.

Wild mushroom pizza - not bad, but not great. Pizza at Beretta or even at Zero Zero is better.

Beef burger with swiss cheese and fries - the fries were the actual star of this plate, but the burger was still solid.

Glad I crossed this off my list, but I'll stick with the sister restaurant. Overall, 3.5 stars. Oh and props to our waitress for putting up with our indecisiveness -- I know it's not easy so thank you!
author: Johanna L.

description:
Finally stopped in for a visit on xmas eve....was always intrigued by the vintage wine bottle décor on the outside. 

The place was comfortably full but it's probably safer to make a reservation at a place like this. We were seated in the outdoor patio area on a chilly day but it quickly warmed up after the heat lamp was turned on.

I enjoyed mostly everything we ordered, including:
House made chicken liver pate, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade, grain mustard (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)
Fresh spaghetti, starbelly bacon, jalapeno, tomato & basil (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)
Starbelly bacon, jalapeno, arugula & green goddess dressing  pizza  (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)
Grilled little gems, market citrus, raw goats milk feta & Oregon hazelnuts
Heirloom apple cobbler, oat brown sugar crumble Harvey milk ice cream
Panna cotta, huckleberry  
Salted caramel pot de crème, rosemary cornmeal cookies (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)

Food: Was delicious (esp the ones I noted specifically).  The starbelly bacon is something...has a very distinct flavor and texture unlike any other bacon I've had. 

Service: Ehh....this is why I'm giving a 3. Both the menu/waitress failed to mention a few things.  We also ordered oysters.  She asked us if we wanted 3 or 6 but be aware that the menu price is only for 3. She also asked if we wanted icecream with our dessert. The menu price for the heirloom apple cobbler is a la carte even though the icecream is mentioned together. Lastly, she asked us if we wanted extra bread for our pate...which was also an additional cost (when we thought it was complementary).
author: Emily Y.

description:
i had buttermilk chicken & waffles, and it was amazinggggg!!!!
love love loveeeee it!! i think i can still taste it in my mouth :)
also i fell in love with their calimocho!
love how they serve it in a coke bottle.
staff are nice and friendly. food came fairly fast as well.
overall im loving it!
author: Ru C.

description:
Yummy pizza (make sure you add a runny egg to any pizza you order for a-mazing flavor, though the chorizo one already has it). The butternut squash (vegetarian) was interesting and tasty but might not be for everyone - it's sweet, as you might expect.

Also ordered the DELISH side dishes - the beet salad as well as the honey glazed brussel sprouts - though they were smallish portions.

Easily made last minute reservations on a weekday.
author: Jolene T.

description: A friend & I went to Starbelly for Sunday Brunch. We made reservations for 1:00pm, which worked out fine.  There was a table ready for us, unfortunately, not outside as requested.  However, the hostess & waitress are very friendly.  It is a beautiful, inviting space.  I ordered scrambled eggs which came with toast, potatoes & bacon; very good..  My friend ordered the hamburger which came out perfect; it was served with nice salad toppings & French fries.  Too full for dessert.  We will go back for lunch & dinner as the menu has more of a variety. Great neighborhood spot, nice area to walk around, close to many things.
author: Pam R.

description:
Starbelly has a bright, open, interior which is a major reason I keep coming back.

I've been here too many times to count now and while I enjoy it enough to keep returning it's not quite the level that I think they aspire to be. The food is reliable enough, but it doesn't reach new heights.

I enjoy the pizzas, salads, and other options enough to keep coming by for a relaxing brunch.
author: Ennis O.

description: I went here for brunch and was blown away by the delicious dishes. My friend and I split two dishes, a savory and sweet dish. The first thing that stuck out was how impressive the food was displayed. We had two huge slices of challah transformed into french toast with a dollop of mascarpone sweet cheese and sprinkled with bits of walnuts and slices of banana.   For savory, we had the Dungeness crab scramble with fresh avocado, aged cheddar, and lightly beaten farm fresh eggs. I would have been jealous of my friend if she had didn't share. But hey, we're friends still so we shared.  Exquisite breakfast with huge portions. I walked away full and happy.
author: Melissa P.

description: Great patio. Simple, tasty menu made awesome by the details. I went on a Friday at lunchtime - so it wasn't crowded. Can't wait to go back.
author: Marcus C.

description:
I'm surprised that this place only gets 3.5 stars--my experience was excellent.

Came for brunch--we did the call ahead thing and were delighted to find that there was no wait once we arrived. We sat out back in the patio area. It was a bit chilly, but then--this was also the coldest week in a long time. The coffee was excellent, and I liked that they gave you the option of still or sparkling water, gratis. 

My party of three shared the margherita pizza with added eggs and arugula, the caesar salad, and the two eggs with bacon breakfast. And everything was excellent, fresh and flavorful. 

Service was good. Not rushed, but I never felt abandoned. 

One star off because it really was cold back there--another heater was in order.
author: Allison S.

description:
Cool name, shitty service, mediocre food, overpriced.  

Went to this place a few weeks back and found it to be a pretty horrible experience.  My girlfriend called ahead to put our name on the list.  We showed up on time and then were made to wait for another 45 mins.  I don't fully mind the wait but we literally stood waiting next to a vacant table for 45 mins and watched as no one ever was seated there.  At one point we inquired about the vacant table and the hostess told us it was reserved for someone else.  After the 45 mins passed my gf received a txt from the restaurant saying that our table was ready (despite the fact that we were literally standing right there).  The hostess offered us the table the had been vacant for 45 mins that we had already been told was unavailable.  I simply scoffed and should have known that this place was a waste of time but we sat at another table and had our meal.

The waitress was really uninterested and couldn't wait to leave our table.  

We had a good cherry and greens salad.  The one positive.  
I had the pasta with jalapenos and bacon, it was meh.
My gf had the steak, it was overcooked and also meh.

I think this place needs to re-evaluate things.  

Oh yeah, also the price of this meal was silly.  Don't waste your money!
author: Dave D.

description: Food was solid, but didn't blow me away. I had high expectations of the place, and enjoyed it, but I can't say I'll be back. Too many of these places in SF to go here again.
author: Dimple B.

description: Fantastic pizza and burger with delicious sides to start. Not to mention - great people watching when sitting outside. We had Eric as a server and he was great. Very attentive. Would recommend to everyone stopping by the Castro.
author: Mark J.

description:
This is still my go-to spot in the Castro. Since I work in the neighborhood, I love meeting friends here for lunch. It's a really good lunch with good quality ingredients and incredible flavor. 

The sandwiches, salads and soup are all really great. I love the porchetta sandwich- it's very meaty and moist. The steak salad has a vey generous-sized, well-seasoned steak with some salad greens, blue cheese and tomatoes. It is simple, but tasty. 

I like their burger- it's good. I rarely order the pizza although it's also good, it's just not my favorite thing on the menu. 

I had their spicy pasta for the first time with big chunks of crispy bacon. I loved it!

I also love the ambiance- it's very light, airy and bright. I love going out on the patio on a sunny day. Lunch doesn't seem to be very busy which is nice for good conversations and the food comes out in reasonable time for a lunch hour meal. .
author: D. F.

description:
What happened to this place? It's gone way downhill. 

Yesterday's dinner: Fritters were over-fried, french fries were under. Pizza crust was tough. Dumplings were all out of whack. Caramel pot de creme had a grainy texture. The scallops were excellent and the burger was good, but overall well below par and not worth the $110 tab for two.
author: Teo W.

description: This place is not worth the wait for breakfast or brunch. Uncomfortable seating. Nothing special food, and terribly expensive . The only redeeming quality was the wonderful server that checked in twice.
author: Rickey T.

description:
We had friends visiting from out of town so we wanted a memorable dinner experience; Starbelly did not disappoint. We tried to get a reservation but they were full until 10pm--too late for us. Instead we put our name on the list for the communal table. About 75 minutes later we were seated. The group was loving the decor and the vibe, though it was loud.  Our server was nice (even after we ordered a bottle of wine then changed our minds and went for glasses), which was great since some of the reviews suggested the service here can leave something to be desired. 

We shared both the Starbelly salad and the curly kale Caesar, as well as the white bean purée, the cauliflower, and the salumi plate. Everything was fresh, the flavors all had an edge or a little something unexpected to make them quite interesting. I had the County Line Pinot Noir, which was a dream come true--a big, jammy party in my mouth. 

We had a great time and will probably take other visitors here (Great location)!
author: S H.

description:
This a good, fun restaurant that has reliable food and an exciting setting.
 
We ordered a ton of food and everything ranged from good to really good.
 
Cheese Plate: A really good selection of different kinds of cheese with a drizzle of honey and accents of cherries and pecans.
 
Salad: I had the Starbelly Salad, which was quite flavorful considering it was just a salad - it was very fresh and not loaded with too much dressing .
 
Pizza: I had a pizza with sausage, broccoli and lemon zest - fairly different from what one would usually expect, but it really did work - really flavorful with a refreshing finish from the lemon zest. 
 
French Fries: Good, straight-forward fries.
 
I think the overall rating of 3 1/2 stars is pretty accurate...the food is good and the atmosphere is fun and lively.  I'll definitely be coming back here for an evening of enjoyable dining.
author: Ken G.

description:
I initially learned about Starbelly when they participated in SF Chefs 2011 Grand Tasting. They had a cream soup with a stewed cherry on top that was the most unique pairing of flavors! Can't believe it took me a year to visit Starbelly, but here is what I ordered:

- Lambrusco (one that NYTimes recommended but I couldn't obtain through the SF distributor without special ordering a case)
I liked the pairing with my food. It tasted like a slightly carbonated sangria. It's not the most complex rose I've ever tasted (V. Sattui's Gamay is more complex) but it's definitely good for the price at $7 a glass.

- Chicken liver pate
Tasted just as good as foie gras.  It's made with 17 ingredients and was extremely fresh. The bread, grainy mustard and preserves complement this dish perfectly.

- Pork Sugo
The handmade noodles were so soft, just like at Delfina!

The prices here are totally reasonable such that most could go frequently.
author: SiliconValleyShoeGirl L.

description:
This place came highly recommended by a friend who lives in the Castro and he made reservations for a group of us for brunch. 

After we were seated, we noticed that some of the cups were dirty, one still had lipstick prints. We asked for the cups to be replaced, which the waitress did so. We also ended up waiting nearly 40 mins. for our food to be delivered. 

Food-wise, this place is quite good, although not very vegan friendly. I ended up ordering the french toast and replaced the side of meat with fruit. The toast was very fluffy and delicious with bananas and pecans. Sadly, they did not coat the toast with enough syrup so we asked for more on the side. 

All-in-all, good food and average service.
author: Leslie C.

description: One of my favorite spots in SF. The menu is always changing and the food is always fantastic. Their salads are amazing and their mussels are to die for! Great ambience and friendly staff. The only downside is they don't have a full bar.
author: Sheena C.

description: Had a solid meal here on a Wednesday night. Our table ordered the burger and spaghetti and everyone really enjoyed the meal. The service was very good and the space was nice
author: Kyle W.

description: This was a great experience. The food was satisfying and tasty. The best was the service and friendliness all the way from servers, hostess, and general manager. I have a service dog and they were super laid about my dog and did not hesitate about letting him sit in the back patio. I've had other experiences where cafes and restaurants were very unhappy about my dog, despite him being a service dog, and this really ruins your restaurant experience because you feel unwanted even though you are not doing anything wrong. So thank you star belly! Continue being awesome :)
author: Yana N.

description: Although we had a reservation, we probably would have been seated without one, as we were at the beginning of the dinner hour. We were placed on the patio with its pleasant decor (and water-saving plant system). Our server was prompt and pleasant, and so were our cocktails. Our orders came in good time, as I think they waited for the pizza to be done before bringing everything out at once. The other two of us had burgers, which were sizable, well made and had plenty of add-ons (the shoestring potatoes and avocado were generous). Our server kept a good check on us without overcrowding, and the meal was a pleasure in the patio atmosphere. Next time, I will probably ask to try out the dining room, and I'll be trying other dishes. I had no idea this find was this close.
author: Gary A.

description: Amazing place! Some friends took me, and I am so glad they introduced me to this place. I got the pork shoulder with cheddar grits. Being from the South, I'm very very picky about grits, and these were amazing! The pork was tender and flavorful! I'm so glad this little gem is such a short walk from my home.
author: Bradley V.

description:
We love the Prather beef hamburger and veggie sides at Starbelly.  Last night I was so very hungry, hadn't had enough water to drink during the day, and downed a few cocktails before going to Starbelly.  Soon after ordering, I started to feel a little light headed and I passed out at the table.  Good for striking the fear of god into the Husband. Our cute waiter and the management was so sweet and kind.  They called the first responders, who after passing out a second time, I was quickly removed from the warm dinning room.  The staff wrapped our hamburgers to go, and comped the whole meal!   What mensches! 

Burgers were still awesome even after a few hours in Kaiser ER.

Thank you Starbelly staff.  We'll be back and I promise not to pass out in your dinning room again!
author: EC N.

description:
starbelly has been on my list for a long time. i'm glad i can check it off.

the food was really good but nothing to write home about. 

the service is where it lost stars for me. four of us went to celebrate a birthday. i didn't mention that when i made the reservation bc i wasn't sure if they did that sort of thing but when i saw another server bring a birthday dessert to another table i let our server know we also had a birthday. 'oh i'll totally bring something to your table for her, no problem!' not only did he bring a dessert with a candle, he also brought another one - a salted caramel pudding that was delicious. awesome! 

then we saw the bill. we had been charged for both desserts. ok, it's NOT about the money. have you ever been charged for a birthday dessert? in addition to another dessert that you didn't order? i've never experienced that at any restaurant whether it was michelin rated or my neighborhood go-to. and if you're going to charge us at least let us have our pick! it was weird. not the ideal way to end our dining experience.
author: Emily C.

description: mmm pâté. house made chicken liver pâté, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard. couldn't pass it up. pizza: house-made chorizo, sunny eggs & arugula instead of cilantro was yum. the fresh spaghetti with starbelly bacon, jalapeño, tomato sauce & basil was sooo delish. total carbo load. we also had a really yummy salted caramel pot de creme!
author: she q.

description: Hip place to dine with a friend, a group or even a hot date. The food is good and the menu covers a lot of ground, so everyone in your party should find something appealing to order. Great pizzas and very interesting seasonal small plates make sharing fun. Make this the launching pad for a fun evening in the Castro!
author: Mark N.

description: I think this place is great !! Perfect spot to gather for drinks and small bites !! I really love the outside patio seating :) my boyfriend and I met some great friends here and had a lovely time. The service was great and we were checked in on several times by out waitress. I always love asking what the servers favorite dishes are since they've probably had an opportunity to tryout most if not all of the menu. We shared a handful of plates together which was great to try lots of their favorites and popular dishes! I ESP loved the liver pate ,the burrata dish, split pea fritters and balsamic honey glazed Brussels with BACON !! Yummmm !! Oo but don't forget the mushroom pizza it was a delight !! I wish I'd saved room for dessert but I most definitely will be back!! Thanks Starbelly !!
author: Chantel G.

description:
One of the few summer nights in the city were your not freezing. Went to Starbelly for the outdoor seating and relaxed ambiance. Wow was I pleased. I called about 45 minutes before I wanted to be there and was able to get a reservation for two (this may not work for larger parties). We did not wait to be seated once we arrived, this is a big plus for me considering the number of places you go to that still make you wait 30 minutes despite a reservation.  We sat in the back patio, the area was clean no flying creatures in site, heat lamps were in abundance around the dining area. Our server was pleasant and attentive. 


We ordered the white bean puree, cucumber, chili oil and grilled flat bread to start. If I hadn't known it was a white bean puree I would have thought I was just eating hummus. The dish in my opinion had either not enough bread to go with the puree serving size or too much puree to go with the  two 1 inch triangular pieces of toasted bread. We went with the latter idea and asked for more bread. 

For the entrees we ordered the  blackened catfish  and ranch burger.  The portion sizes of the entrees were good. The burger was perfectly cooked to medium rare. The Challah was fresh, soft and toasted. The burger was fantastic! great flavor. The fries were really tasty with the extra cracked pepper kick they added. 

As for the catfish, who would have thought it would go so well with andouille sausage risotto! So good. The catfish was crispy on the outside but still had great flavor and wasn't dry.  

All in all it was a great dining experience!
author: Joel Z.

description: I've been here several times for both brunch and dinner. The liver pate is a must order. I loved my crab and garlic noodles this past time. I've also enjoyed their pizzas and bacon pasta before. Love the back patio. The food isn't always amazing, but it's solidly good and Starbelly gets an extra star for ambiance and consistency. A great place for a catchup dinner. It's somewhere you want to linger for sure.
author: Melinda C.

description:
4 stars for food 5 for ambiance 3 for
Value but ZERO ZERO ZERO for beyond excessively salty! Overwrought
Menu construction and I question the taste of the chef if they could serve food so unbalanced towards salty. Not coming back.
author: alex v.

description: They were super accommodating to our very large group for lunch this past Saturday. They were able to grab more seats and split up tabs. Thanks a ton!
author: Patty C.

description: I really enjoyed Starbelly! My friend and I beat the dinner rush and got an awesome seating outside with the heat lamps. The atmosphere is so relaxed and comfortable. We shared the french fries with 3 dips and the butternut squash pizza which was very satisfying and flavorful. I would definitely return to further explore their eclectic menu.
author: Allison S.

description: This place was really good. We came here for an impromptu Saturday brunch, and didn't have to wait long. Actually ended up with a great table on the patio (get a table on the patio!). A solid brunch spot in the Castro.
author: Shannon O.

description: I went here last weekend.  The ambiance is nice.  I found the service to be so / so and a bit slow.  My catfish was well cooked but under seasoned, as were the fries which we also ordered.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Went on a date here, and though the date wasn't great, the food wasn't either.

Sat on the patio area, next to a young couple desperately trying to keep their baby from being fussy. They needn't have bothered. I actually like the sounds of life when dining. Dinner here was overpriced. Mostly tasty. Somewhat bland. Largely unmemorable. They did have a decent wine list. And my fork was clean. So there's that.

I suppose if I came here straight from the opera, still wearing my Phantom costume, and starting bellowing "Christine" as loud as I could, they would probably throw me out of the place. Not sure what you want to make of that, but if it helps you decide whether to eat here or not, you're weirder than I am. So call me. No, seriously, call me.
author: TJ P.

description: I had the starbelly bacon pizza and it was delicious. I loved the green goddess dressing!! The decor and patio is also super cute.
author: Anna H.

description:
Been debating whether or not to post this review considering I have had positive experiences at starbelly.  

Bacon pizza which is my staple, waiter never warned us it was blistering hot, literally was blistering. The bacon used to be thicker and abundant. Now it's fairly thin and sparse.

I'm hoping the standard and quality of this restaurant doesn't continue to dwindle.
author: Billy K.

description: Absolutely amazing fare! Pate and Brussel sprouts with the chicken pot pie were just perfect!
author: Ex Mil G.
