description: Love this place!  Great for lunch, brunch, dinner and friendly staff (a rarity in SF!). Love the fried chicken po boy and chicken and was addled for brunch!  Pizzas are great, pate is excellent!
author: Dave C.

description: I'm sure I reviewed this place before, but Yelp doesn't seem to know about it. In any event, I'm reluctantly 'updating' my review. Previously, I gave it 4-5 stars. On our last visit (MLK Day), everything was awful. The food was bad. The pizza was bland, like somebody forgot to add salt when they made the crust. The fries were cold. We ordered a burger medium-rare and it came out well done. Service was spaced-out: we didn't get everything we ordered, and when we asked for ketchup and mustard for our fries, they never appeared. It seemed like they were unusually understaffed, which might explain some problems, but there was absolutely nothing positive I could say about anything we ordered. I will give them another chance, since based on past experiences they were always consistently very good, but one more visit like this last one and I wouldn't recommend them to anyone ever again. :(
author: Sam Z.

description:
Had an amazing lunch on the patio, cozy under the striped awning with the space heaters and the huge planter box of herbs in the rear.  Great atmosphere, perfect for catching up with friends, not noisy and not stiff.

I had the prochetta dip sandwich - with au jus, yum!  And the side salad was expertly dressed with tangy soft cheese, cherry tomatoes, and greens.  My friend liked her chicken salad sandwich too. We split the sea salt butterscotch pot de creme, which included two cornmeal rosemary cookies. I love savory buttery cookies.
author: Vanessa H.

description: I should have written a review while I remembered what we ordered but I can't stop thinking about how delicious the food was here. I believe we got the black mussels with chorizo, the jalapeño and arugula pizza with some kind of meat and the fries with the 3 dips. I usually get grossed out by mussels but these mussels were so well prepared and the presentation was so awesome that I forgot about the bad feelings I have towards mussels. They provide wonderful service, as well so this is a place I'd recommend to go if you are in the Castro area.
author: Trina C.

description: This place is adorable.  Takes reservations but they get very busy. Sit in the back covered patio- there's heaters so you wont get cold.  What stood out the most? The cheese board and lavender lemonade!  The menu changes to stay up to date with whats in season but the fig pizza was amazing.  I'm definitely going back soon to try brunch!
author: Gabbi d.

description:
This would have totally been a 5 star review although it seems that I failed to review it the first six or ten times I was there. The good is great, the atmosphere is great and the service is top notch(particularly  the waitperson whose name I have forgotten but she is awesome and I am embarrassed that I can't remember. She's a math major and always wears clogs.)

So, everything was great. Until last night. The first time that we ever actually planned to go here. Didn't just run by. I called and made a reservation. Or so I thought. Until I got there and the rather snotty and unpleasant hostess informed me that what we were in was the wait list and that if you call for reservations after 5 that's what you get- the exact same wait time as the person in front of you -45 minutes. I suggested that it would have been nice had the person on the phone had given me that information rather than saying "we have space at the community table" and then confirming our 8 reservations. Just a suggestion. That was the point it got weird and she got overly animated and smiley tilted her head and very fake nice and in an uber obvious super  fake way said...  I can't recall her exact words but I left somewhat stunned. "I'm so sorry." would  have done the trick. But obviously she wasn't. She was just smug. 

I like this place enough that I will go back. But I will go at 9 and if she's the hostess (long hair, glasses) there are plenty of other places where my business is appreciated.
author: Sarah P.

description: Had the Foie Gras burger off the secret meńu. It was off the hook!
author: Christopher H.

description: Awesome restaurant with great food and a good vibe.  My friends and I use to come here almost every Friday a few years ago.  One of our friends even ended up having his wedding reception here and the food was incredible.  Highly recommend!
author: Sara P.

description:
I'm glad I didn't look at Yelp reviews beforehand, because I thought this place was fab-u-lous!

My friend and I weren't that hungry, so we split these items:
- Chicken liver pâté, with sweet onion marmalade & grain mustard ($10) 
- Pizza with squash, goat cheese, pumpkin seeds, and omg deliciousness ($14 or $17..?)
- Salted Caramel Pot De Crème with cornmeal cookies ($6)

I like how this place doesn't give you that much "filler". The pâté came as a big block, with a little bit of bread on the side. The pizza was mostly all toppings on a very thin cracker-like crust. The caramel was literally a pot with two little cookies on the side. It was like they didn't want you to fill up on the "sides" or "distractions" to the star dish. But everything was so darn rich..... so very naughty.  I almost kinda wanted more bread, and more cookies!  Am I just supposed to start eating the caramel directly out of the jar??? Naughty indeed... 

Service was great. I think I got here right before the dinner rush. (7pm on Halloween). The prices were great and very reasonable. I'll defintely be back.
author: Jeanne L.

description: We had dinner, pizza and spaghetti. It was really good and not too pricey. Great service. Great area in the city. About 1 mile from BART (we still chose to Über it).
author: Lee B.

description:
What a cute little restaurant. I love the indoor/outdoor patio in the back! The food for brunch is pretty good as well. My favorite was the sweet corn soup- just delicious! The French toast wasn't too sweet, which is a good thing, but could definitely use more bananas. Unfortunately the pate wasn't available.

The 3.5 star rating seems accurate. It may be because of the indifferent service from the hostess and waitresses. And the food came out slowly and at odd intervals.

Nevertheless, it was super easy to get a table on a Sunday afternoon so I'll be back.
author: K V.

description: This is a staple spot for me.  I could probably live off their bacon jalapeno pizza and chicken liver pate.
author: Leland H.

description:
I've heard about the friendly service here but I must have got the one poor server. Rude, uninterested in our table, and hard to find.  Tried flagging down what appeared to be the manager to no avail.  Cramped, uncomfortable table.

The food was pretty good though, otherwise I might have had to give my first one-star review.
author: Mara S.

description:
Great location in the Castro.

Things to note: 
+ Starbelly is wine and beer only.
+ I had the mushroom scramble, which was nothing specatular but nice and hearty. 
+ The fries are nothing to write home about.
+ Mushroom pizza was great!

+ I also tried the chocolate cake donut, which I found too dry.

Starbelly is perfect for big groups! I booked this place last minute for a celebratory brunch for ~15 people the day before, and they were able to accommodate us inside. The outdoor patio is also nice!

Overall, 3* is about right. Starbelly is A-OK!

# vegetarian review
author: Eric H.

description:
Everything that has to be said has been said. This is my neighborhood restaurant - Its posh without being pricey (mid 20's for a two course) , great ambience - can be a little noisy at times with a spacious (high ceilings) feel and a cute garden seating area - The garden seating is quite decent.

They also have great wines and even better waiters - Its a very relaxed, casual, friendly place with GREAT food - The steak, sloppy joes, breakfast pizza and gazpacho juice make them stand out - None of your standard fare here  - which makes it a fun place for something different !!
author: Anand D.

description:
Lovely solid restaurant! I called in for a last-minute dinner reservation for a party of two last night, and we got it without a problem. A college classmate and I had a tasty dinner while catching up, and we enjoyed ourselves immensely! 

We shared a plate of Dungeness crab hush puppies with Louie dressing - you have a choice of having 3, 4 or 5 of the hush puppies so we opted for 4 - it's nice to have that choice. She had the pizza with asparagus and hard-boiled eggs (looked yummy!) and I had the Ranch burger with house-cut fries & pickle on a grilled sesame bun - I added roasted onions for an extra $2, and it was juicy and delectable! I had a large Anchor Porter (nice, smooth local dark beer) and then a small one a bit later (good times!). 

We shared a salt caramel pot de creme - heavenly! We were so full before dessert, but we just couldn't help ourselves, it sounded too good to pass up! 

Really nice, attentive service with a very cool environment. I easily arrived on Muni and took the F Line home. Lovely, just lovely! 

Shared small plate+hamburger+large & small beer+shared dessert+tax +tip = $40 (not bad, not bad at all!)
author: Maile N.

description:
The mushroom pizza with gruyere and carmelized onions was belly delicious.  The chorizo pizza with egg and cilantro was really good too.  (I didn't like the butternut squash pizza very much.) 

2 things bothers me about this place - the cobbler desert is not served with vanilla ice cream (how can you not!), and the metal chair is super cold.
author: Wakako U.

description:
Love this place! Consistently great service and really really awesome food always keeps me coming back for more. The servers are sweet and the ambience is wonderful as well, both on the inside (cool open layout and open kitchen) or the outside covered back patio is fun too.

Absolute must haves:
- Mussels with chorizo
- Chicken pate w/grain mustard, sweet caramelized onions and the best grilled bread in the world
- Bomb burger with everything on it
- Pasta w/bacon and jalapeno
- Pizza w/mushrooms gruyere and thyme
- Pizza with chorizo and an egg

So so good, definitely my fave neighborhood spot!
author: A J.

description: Came here with a big group for brunch  during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend and was very pleased with the food and the service. I loved the decor inside and we were sat a long picnic table in the back patio. Ordered the Italian eggs with a side of bacon for my meal. The dish was very tasty and my bacon was crispy. I liked the unique combination of eggs with Italian flavors. My one complaint on the food is that I remember the portion being a little on the small side for the price. Also ordered a few mimosas and a Pimms cup. The drinks were all very good as well. I'd recommend this place to anyone in the Castro area looking for a casual but nicer sit-down style restaurant. The next time I'm in the city I'd definitely check out it again and have dinner!
author: Brandon H.

description:
Not bad for a place named "Starbelly."

Went for a friend's bday; we had reservations for 9 and they were pretty close.  We only waited about 10 minutes for the previous party to finish up.

Draft beers were big.  That's good.  The food was pretty decent - my credit card statement shows $38 and I remember being pleasantly full.  I even took some pictures for your viewing pleasure.  Their pizza stuck out as being particularly delicious.  That and the size of their hefeweizens.  I may have said that already.  Again, feel free to peruse the underexposed images, especially if you are a connisseur of grainy, high ISO pictures.  Lighting was was not optimal for picture taking.
author: Chris H.

description:
**The law of diminishing marginal returns does not apply to this place.**

I don't know which economist came up with that law, but he never ate at Starbelly, that's for sure.  I tested the theory last night and I have to give another nod.  Din-din number two was even better than the first!

With that said, I'm scratching my head reading all of these mixed reviews.  What's not to like?

Here's the five-star low-down:
1.  Little Gem Salad.  Scrumptious!
2.  Mushroom Pizza.  Muahh!
3.  Squash Pizza.  Savory perfection!
4.  Caramel Pot De Creme.  Sweet and salty fabulosity!

I'm sorry Yelpers, if you follow these orders and still don't think it's fab, I don't know what to say...dare I say that you must not have taste buds?!
author: Angella S.

description:
Answering the oft-posed, great philosophic question of the late 1990s-"can you ever just be whelmed?"-the answer is that yes, you can, at Starbelly.

I had a psychic inclination that this would be the case, which had more to do with seeing that awkward orange-yellow 3.5ish rating, and less with my telepathic abilities. Starbelly was not my first choice, but after being thwarted at three nearby eateries we threw in the towel.

The solemn truth is that everything tasted fine, but so solemn that the meal was hardly one to yelp home about. We had dungeness crab salad which was too bland, a wrought-iron mini-pot of pan roasted mussels with cilantro and chorizo and chile which was definitely not bland, and a generous serving for the price. The pizza with mushrooms and gruyere was okay-definitely filling, but not a memorable pie. A side of brussel sprouts was okay-not the best and perhaps under-roasted. The dessert-a salted caramel pot de creme-was the answer to my prayer to be more than whelmed. It was divine, with a perfect rosemary cornmeal cookie to scrape that salted caramel cream right out of the jar. Interesting and fairly priced wine by the glass selections so we toured the vino world to fly away from this milquetoast dinner. A glass of Malbec, then a Cabernet Sauvignon from Paso Robles were my lifeline, with that dessert, of course.

Service was great, and put a positive spin on just being whelmed-not overly attentive nor negligent. Just there. I'm not surprised that this place is owned by the same people as Beretta and Delarosa. There's something just lacking from both of those places in terms of both soul and substance, and a bit too overwhelming on 'style'. I will definitely consider returning for a glass of wine and dessert, which is definitely the new black.
author: Joanna M.

description:
As promised, I've since been back multiple times. I still love this place and recommend it, but (for me at least) the honeymoon phase is over.

Ambiance and service are still great. Pate plate is still to die for (though seriously, only order this if you have 4+ people in your group, or someone really loves pate, or you plan on taking pate leftovers home - it's a brick!). The rest of the food is still pretty good. Dranks still be tasty (cocktails highly recommended). But I've had the chance to try more things, and I can say that not all menu items are created equal -- my green goddess pizza was drenched in dressing, and pumpkin dumplings, while totally delectable, were way too few for the price paid. I was a bit disappointed when I brought my friend from out-of-town here and things weren't as flawless as I'd hoped. Still a solidly good restaurant, just lacking consistency of wow factor.
author: Julie D.

description:
Starbelly is a big restaurant+bar in the heart of the castro. We went for dinner on a Friday night and the place was packed! Loud, full of people, and everybody was having a great time. I was very impressed with the service. Prompt and friendly. We were expecting to wait awhile given how packed the place was, but we were pleasantly surprised. For dinner, we had one of the pizzas and the burger. The pot-de-creme for dessert. It's often difficult to manage expectations when you're eating at a restaurant that is also a bar -- you expect a better drink selection (which Starbelly features), but the food isn't usually that great. I was definitely wrong. This was high-quality food. The burger was probably one of the best I've ever had, and I LOVE burgers.

The place does get a bit loud, so don't eat here if you're looking for a quiet dinner. Eat here if you love fine food! I should also add that the cocktails are excellent and they have a good beer selection. Solid restaurant/bar!
author: Laurent L.

description:
Probably my favorite and one of the only places that I eat in the Castro.  Great spot for a date or for a small group of friends looking to wind down and have a few glasses of wine and beer while having a tasty meal.  

The spaces is really beautiful and I really enjoy the patio/outdoor seating that they have available.  Perfect spot to sit when we have our Indian Summers in SF!

Definitely recommend coming here for dinner or brunch on Sundays.  The homemade chorizo and eggs pizza, burger, Starbelly Salad, brussel sprouts, fries with dips and the loco moco are some of the many standouts on the menu.  Try to add bacon or order anything with bacon...it's that good!

Service and food is always consistent...definitely worth going to if you are looking for a solid meal at a nice sit in restaurant in the Castro.
author: Joel C.

description:
This place is so inviting! I was visiting my cousin who lives in the area and we went here for dinner. I love the modern ambiance of this restaurant! There are dim lights, some communal tables, and an open kitchen. The place was happening on Saturday around 7 pm and it only got busier as the night went on. 

We had the opportunity to try the fries and brussel sprouts. I thought both were pretty good - the fries were too much batter, not enough potato, though. I also ordered the Butternut Squash Pizza, which was super creamy! I did not think that the crust was all that great, however. 

Overall, this is a great neighborhood gem. If I lived in the city, I would come back to try some of the other dishes.
author: Tiffie L.

description: Always one of my "go to" restaurants. Dependable, consistent, delicious food and attentive and unobtrusive service. Everything on the menu is delicious; dinner and brunch alike!
author: Gregory W.

description: Starbelly's weekend brunch remains one of the best choices in the city. You can make reservations on their website (no OpenTable), but even at the busiest brunch times, the wait for walk-ins is usually 10 min max. They have a delicious traditional brunch/lunch menu with options such as eggs, pizzas, french toast, salads, and granola. The space is beautiful and there is a covered back patio. But in an increasingly non-service friendly city, the following are real pluses in my book: they will cheerfully seat incomplete parties, they have free coffee refills, and there are 2 unisex bathrooms.
author: Marie F.

description: There's nothing fancy about this place, but the understated simplicity is what makes it great. The food is always delicious and we've never had a problem getting a table, even same-day. Their staff is attentive, the space is cozy (ask for a patio table, if possible) and the reasonable price point makes it a regular in our date night rotation.
author: Mia C.

description: Love Love Love this place!  Great staff and great food.  I love coming here because the food is simple and always consistent.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  I personally love the floor manager.  I believe her name is Jordana.  She's always smiling, and being helpful.  There was a hick up with our bill one time, and she fixed it without any hassle.  I will always come back to this place.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Took a couple of friends from out of town to Starbelly, since Eureka was way too busy, even for a Thursday evening. It had been about a year since my last visit, which, as I remember, I enjoyed somewhat.

It was embarrassing. With all of the really wonderful restaurants that WANT you to dine with them, Starbelly doesn't seem to understand that concept.

The service from the hostess was minimal. She mumbled something about "This way..." and then started through the restaurant so quickly, we had to jog to keep up. She pointed to a table on the patio and then turned and walked away, ignoring my question of which table she wanted us to sit at. Still not sure, we sat. Just in time to have a waiter come by and tell us we were at the wrong table, and he rushed off. Still not sure where to sit and never having been asked if we wanted to sit outside (especially when the interior had only 5 tables full and plenty to spare), we left. The hostess didn't even look up from her station as we walked by. Nobody seemed to care one way or another.

We strolled down to Barracuda Sushi and were treated with respect, warmth and stuffed full of terrific food.

What really confuses me are the myriad of 4-5 star reviews for this restaurant. Are we visiting the same place? Do the staff suddenly change as I walk through the door? Is it me? Is it imperative to show up drunk, or get drunk quickly upon entering? Are the folks writing these rave reviews, just too embarrassed to admit they sat through a horrible meal and actually paid for it? I really don't get it. 

Well Starbelly needn't give another thought as I wouldn't darken their doorstep for the winning ticket for the Super Lotto!
author: Doug W.

description: Went here for dinner everything ok  - lunch was a disaster  - they forgot an entree and didnt tell us the fries with the tiniest po boy were extra  very disappointing  - not the great restaurant we were expecting  dont bother going
author: Andrew F.

description: All I can say is wow!!!! Great host, First impression was great, We were in the patio area with the heated lamps for the Central Coast Wine Maker Dinner. This was a great event, the Salad aux Tardons was exquisite one of the best I have ever had, Roasted Chestnut soup, I have been thinking of you all day...amazing amazing!!!!!!!!!!
author: Dee D.

description: Lunch was decent and satisfying. Paid and tip the guy.  Only to have him come out while waiting for uber and asked if there was something wrong with the service.  I said no and asked him why he felt that way.  He said we tipped him 14% and not at least 15%. WTF.  Never had this happened to me.  What happened to being grateful.  2 stars deducted for that.
author: J T.

description:
Been meaning to come here since it opened. Used to be sad about Askew's departure. "Used to" big-time.
I kinda, sorta loved it. I met with some colleagues in the industry I work in here and we had a blast. We sat at the communal table. Normally I don't like, but here, no problemo. We ordered family style. We had:
Rotisserie Chicken
Beets and Chevre
Mussels and Chorizo with crusty bread to sop up the juices
Apple Fennel salad
Crab Hush Puppies
and for dessert:
Toffee Cake
Humphrey's Slocombe "Secret Breakfast"
and Pot de Creme
The beer selection was also great!
Honestly, I could go into describing each dish for forever, It was all outstanding; as good as each thing gets. The flavors were spot on. Nothing was overly greasy. Everything was the right temperature. 
I kept thinking, "Next time I come here, I want this..."
Why did I wait so long to go here? I love!
author: Andrew K.

description:
They have a seasonal menu, so don't be surprised if you cannot find some items that fellow reviewers mentioned. My friend was looking for the corn dogs but apparently they weren't offering them anymore...

We came here for Friday dinner with a reservation, and they're pretty flexible in accomodating our changing party size. The menu is tapas style. Pretty small portions. The great thing about tapas though, is that you can always order more if you feel like it.

We had the french fries with 3 kinds of dips. The dips were great, especially the basil one, but the fries were disappointing...they were pretty ordinary. Fried oysters were amazing, as was the grilled peach salad.

We were running out of time at that point, so we got the remaining 2 pizzas to go. One was the margherita with burrata cheese, the other was the fig pizza. Both were amazing pizza with great crust -- the burrata cheese was creamy and it's definitely a plus over the mozzarella.

I also got the jasmine green tea mocktail. I was expecting the normal restaurant "green tea with flavours" thing, but it came out in a nice cocktail glass and tasted wonderful. It's a must try!

The service was a bit slow but our waiter was great at accommodating our tight schedule. I felt a bit bad for leaving the place in such a hurry!

Honestly, this place isn't very different from other new age tapas place in the city, but I liked what I had. Definitely a place I'd come back to try again, especially with the changing menu.
author: Alice C.

description:
So good!!!! 
I wish there were more vegetarian options, but all the ones I have tried were delicious.
The waitstaff is super friendly. I have  5 stars in my belly!!!
author: Nana W.

description:
Food: 4 stars
Service: 5 stars!!!!!!

I LOVE how this place cures their own meat!

(1) House Made Chicken Liver Pate -- MUST GET THIS. The pate is soooo delicious, and there's a side of sweet onion marmalade that is to DIE for. Spread the pate onto the nicely toasted bread, then a little bit of the onion marmalde and your mouth will go nuts. **BEST PATE I HAVE EVER HAD**

(2) Burrata -- not Di Stefano, but the other one -- it was pretty good... tasted like a big cheese puff, deep fried and put in marinara sauce.

(3) Starbelly Bacon Pizza -- Pretty damn good! They make their own sausage/bacon and it tastes delish. The pizza is thin-crusted and very crunchy, and comes with egg on top. The egg is runny....so if you're not a fan of that, beware!

(4) Pan Roasted Black Mussels -- A little too salty and the mussels weren't very tender... but overall the flavor was still good.

Service -- our waitress was SOOO nice and fun! She suggested most of the plates we ordered to us, and they were great suggestions! On top of that, we had complimentary dessert wine and a sample of their apple cider. :) Thanks!
author: Liz W.

description:
Starbelly is my go to place the minute I land in San Francisco.  In fact, I've made it a tradition now to stop here for my first meal in "the City."

The restaurant has a great local feel and a hip vibe.  The servers are all welcoming and knowledgeable.  No matter when I've shown up, I usually get a table within a few minutes or less.

Best is to sit in the back patio.  Orders come out in timely manner and usually taste better than their descriptions in the menu.

I won't review a single item, because it's all good.  Just point and pick and enjoy.  I did like the butternut squash pizza I had last year though.  And the loco moco, a great brunch selection... Rice and eggs is something my mom would make when I was a kid, except the one at Starbelly is amped up.
author: Juan F.

description:
I would say about half the items on the menu could be put under the "exciting" category and half under the "safe" category, and starbelly does a nice job of trying to zest up the safe items and make them interesting. Unfortunately, they tend to do the opposite with the exciting items. 

Example: Loved the jalepeno in the spaghetti and the thick cut bacon (pork belly?). While the bacon was a little too fatty and turned out not to be great, I totally approve the use of any bacon product so I can't fault them too much. On the other hand, a couple interesting looking salads and the burrata were fairly bland in the end. The margharita pizza was delicious.

As far as drinks, excellent beer list, but they dont' have a liquor license so instead they serve non-alcoholic cocktails which were...boring. I mean, they're good, but paying $8 for cherry soda with crushed blackberries isn't exactly ideal. 

It's a solid neighborhood place that feels very relaxed and good for a casual night out, but I don't think it'll make your top 5.
author: Louis D.

description: Good performance in the plethora of fine eateries in SF. Reasonable prices, nice decor, and tasty food
author: G K.

description:
Just to preface, this review is largely on my experience vs. the food (since we weren't really motivated to stay and eat more.)

We came in early after a hike, right before 5pm and sat down as the place was gearing up for dinner. Most of us had burgers on the brain but then we saw that they had fried chicken on the menu we all pretty much made our decision.

Then our waitness came back and apologized and said we had the wrong menu, and replaced it with another that was missing the fried chicken and a few other items that sounded tasty. I guess it went downhill from there.

Regardless, we ordered some fries and bread to sustain us and some mulled wine to warm us up while we reconsidered the menu. Nothing catastrophic here, just some annoyances that put us further down the disappointment spiral. 

First, we all got carded when we ordered mulled wine. We're all over 30, which I guess is a big compliment, but it got kind of weird when one of our 5 didn't bring her ID and then the waitress had to mull it over whether to serve her. I fully understand the implications of servers risking their job to serve underage people, but all I'm saying is that it didn't help our motivation. Second, the mulled wine was $9 a glass and literally was 3 sips. More like a wine taste vs. a full pour. Led to instant banter on the staffs' concern we would get drunk because they didn't believe our ages therefore deserved a sip. The wine was also served in a wine glass so it became cold instantly. Pretty much a miss there.

We also ordered bread, which came with 3 small pieces and a few ladles of olive oil. It was $2. Again, not a big deal but there were 5 of us, and it would have been nice for each of us to get 1 piece, or at least told we should probably get 2. Again,  I'm not expecting free breadsticks and salad here, but it's a bit of a cheap move. The fries were fine, and they came with a few dipping sauces which were good. 

I guess we just simply couldn't recover from the loss of the chicken, then the small snafus that followed. I would like to return again to really try the food and give this place a proper chance, but won't be soon. I'll get my mulled wine elsewhere in the meantime.
author: Kelly R.

description: I LOVE this place!!!! What a gem. Delicious fresh food, adorable environment, and super peaceful. Best gazpacho I've ever had, maybe with the exception of my mom's. Also try the creamy tomato soup and grilled cheese sandwich. I'll be back!
author: Danielle L.

description:
Squash pizza and chicken breast were both excellent. 

Service was good and friendly.

Sat on the patio and had a great meal - really liked the playlist too.
author: Nicholas T.

description:
The only things that will get me out of bed before noon on most weekends are:

1)  Delicious brunch
2)  Gorgeous men
3)  Delicious brunch with gorgeous men.

I got lucky and had #3 at Starbelly today.

The delicious brunch started off with strong coffee served up in a bright orange French press and olive green mugs by a friendly and attentive server.  I tried the Wild Mushroom Stratta with locally made Goat Cheese and Leeks.  We liked its flavors but they were somewhat dulled because it was served room temperature rather than warm.  (Damn you Bar Tartine!  You have ruined me for all other savory bread puddings.) 

The potatoes that came with it were nicely roasted, buttery, and sprinkled with chives.  Luckily we asked for ketchup which tasted homemade and had a spicy kick to it.  The side of fruit was like a colorful bit of edible art made up of slices of yellow pineapple, orange persimmon, red strawberries, and blackberries.  Like running into a good friend, I was happy to see Dynamo donuts on the menu.  (Yes, donuts are my friends.)

Gorgeous men make delicious food taste even better.  (Or is it that I get to eat more of said food by stealing it off of their plates?  I stole tasty bites of Sour Levain French Toast with lip smackin' Strawberry Preserves and Spicy Breakfast Sausage.  Mmm!)  Either way, love to my brunch buds, J, S, and L for making my trip to Starbelly even better with your always delicious company.

Note to self:  Come back to try out Starbelly's dinner menu and see if the pizza is just as good as big sis Beretta's!
author: Amy C.

description:
I've been here twice and both times I was underwhelmed with the food.  Last weekend I went in a group of 6 for brunch and was promptly seated.  The atmosphere of the place is nice and the service is above average.  Unfortunately the food is lacking in any interesting flavor.  I ordered the loco moco, which was a mistake.  The presentation was great but the portion was exceptionally small (I went home and ate a proper meal after I left) and there was minimal flavor.  The egg needed salt and the hamburger was bland.  Rice is rice so no complaint there.  Definitely pricy for what I received.

Nice space, good service, but skip the food.  I hear the drinks are nice (just beer and wine and some other concoctions).
author: Shane E.

description: I went to Starbelly yesterday with a friend to get the Dine About Town special. We both commented about the fact that there were not many people there, so having a leisurely lunch would not be a problem. I specifically told our waitress that we wanted to take our time, and to please NOT bring one course out while we were enjoying another. She assured us that that would not happen. I was only halfway through my pate course when our fried chicken sandwiches were brought over. I did say that I had specifically ask for that not to happen, and was told that they would be sure and not bring the dessert out while we were eating our sandwiches. A cold dessert would not have been a problem anyway. They could have taken the sandwiches back, but really didn't care. If I had been eating the salad, it would not have been as much as a problem, however eating the pate with its accompaniments didn't work, while eating the fried chicken sandwich. They also just handed me the plate, and I had to take it in my hand, and move everything else around. I quickly tried to eat the pate and move on to the sandwich. The fried chicken sandwich. I guess to not lose money on this deal, they had cut the chicken extremely thin. So thin and small that it was hard to find underneath all of the slaw. The sandwich was mostly slaw and roll. In addition to this, I had ordered a side order of fries, asking if they could be extra crispy. I was assured that they could be, but they were not. I did not want to seem as though I was complaining in front of my friend, so I said something to someone on my way to the restroom. He asked if I wanted another order, but I turned him down. They did end up bringing a bowl of still not crispy fries to the table. I took them with us, thinking that I could leave them for a homeless person after that. After all of these problems, I still left a very generous tip. I foolishly gave more consideration to the people at this place than they gave to me. It's a shame, because I was going to go back with my husband next week to enjoy this special. Now, there is no reason to go back ever again.
author: S. G.

description:
I was excited to visit here as a tourist to the city with friends who live in SF.  We chose Starbelly for its outdoor patio, which they neglected to tell us we could not use past 8PM, despite inquiring about that when we made our reservations (??).  

Our waitress was friendly enough, but acted like it was culinary heresy to change the cheese on one pizza from bleu to goat's cheese since no one at the table liked bleu cheese.  She said she could not recommend that we change anything about any pizza since their chefs specifically design the flavor pairings.  We informed her that despite the fact that the pairings were "specifically designed," we would "specifically hate" anything with bleu cheese, lol.  I get the pairings thing, but none of us like it, is that a crime??  

We ordered cocktails (which were delicious!  I highly recommend the one with blackberries muddled in it), and a side of summer squash with hazelnuts that was delish, but it took SO LONG to get the three pizzas we had decided to share.  It was over a half hour until we got our food (I KNOW it doesn't take that long to wood fire a pizza and it wasn't that busy).  Good thing we had a lot of catching up to do with our SF hosts!  

When the pizzas came (let me be clear, TWO of the THREE came together, the third took an addition TWENT MINUTES - is this a joke???), they were delicious, despite our having messed with the "specifically designed" flavor pairings (lol, still can't get over how yuppie that was).  

I should also say that the tables are very close together (but who are we kidding, it's San Francisco, EVERYTHING is close together!), and that if someone near you orders the pizza that was "specifically designed" to be smothered in gruyere cheese, you will spend the remainder of your meal wondering if your eating partner removed his/her dirty gym socks nearby.  Ick. 

BOTTOM LINE: The service was below average, the food was good, but not good enough to return.  If you're living in or visiting a foodie paradise like SF, you can do better.
author: April C.

description:
Awesome.  Small plates were all unique treats-- grilled gems, mussels, and pate.
pizza was solid.   service was excellent and unobtrusive.  best SF food experience in months.
author: Rich I.

description:
I am so happy to report that my latest experience at Starbelly was an incredible hit! I have no idea if my first visit was just a fluke or if there was a systemic problem with getting food out to diners but whatever it was, that's seemingly solved.
Had a wonderful meal and the service was excellent. Devon, our handsome waiter, was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed.
Five stars, folks! And I'm really happy to upgrade my review. You deserve it.
author: John A.

description:
Starbelly is tucked away in an inconvenient spot near 16th and Market, but once you find it, it's a gem.

The wood paneling, the bar and the gorgeous light fixtures make it a really attractive find. We were there for brunch. Great service (I think we beat the rush, arriving at 11:30 a.m. on a Saturday) and everyone's food was excellent. My friends especially liked received a french press full of coffee. Nice touch. 

My one complaint is that the brunch menu is very meat-heavy, narrowing the options considerably for a non-carnivore. Luckily, I eat fish, otherwise, I probably would've been stuck with a salad.
author: Kim C.

description:
this place is amazing. 

my friend and i sat in the cute covered (and heated) outdoor patio area. super cozy. 

we were able to call ahead and put our names down and get seated right away for lunch. service was good. 

food was delicious: 
-lavender honey lemonade: yummmm. a bit sweet, but delicious. i would've liked more lavender and less honey, but i'd def get it again.
-chilaquiles: yummy. 
-fries: good. comes with 3 dipping sauces.
-chorizo/egg/cilantro thin crust pizza: amaaaazing. one of the best pizzas i have ever had. chorizo is delicious, sauce is really good, egg is a nice touch and changes the texture and taste of a regular pizza. def coming back for this. 

this place is also close to Hot Cookie, so it's fun to get a penis shaped coconut macaroon (or some other awesome cookie flavor) as dessert.
author: Sedora T.

description:
Came once for brunch, got a pizza from take out twice, and stopped in during happy hour for some drinks at the bar. Each time the staff was friendly and fun and we loved what we ordered! I can't wait to enjoy the patio during the warmer months.

LOVE the Calimocho (mexican coke and red wine are my two favorite things put together!
author: Nikki M.

description: I've been to Starbelly before and had good service but the last time I went in was absolutely horrendous! First we were seated an only given an "afternoon menu" then the table sat after us with more people in their party were served before us. Also they had received a dinner menu with actual entrees which our table was completely unaware of. We had to flag down our waitress multiple times and repeatedly had to ask for bread for our liver pate which is made to eat with bread. It was so bad to the point we walked out just waiting for our bread. Safe to say we will not be back and recommend you go somewhere else if you want actual customer service
author: Josh N.

description: Soooo good!!! Margherita pizza with burrata (sp.?) cheese was off the charts. The PO boy was perfect. Great atmosphere on the patio. We had a great date at Starbelly!
author: Matthew M.

description:
Fun and intriguing flavors!

Great place to catch up with old friends.  We had a party of 4 and enjoyed the scallops at the server's recommendation.  IT was so delicious!

Then we had fried oysters, pizza with black garlic, the spaghetti was so amazing and comforting to me.

YUM!

I loved the lavender lemonade.  The PIMM's cup was incredible.

Lots of good things about this place.

Good attentive service.

Super fun place and looks like they have an awesome patio too!
author: Joanne L.

description:
Based on the mostly positive reviews, we decided to give this place a try...

We arrived early; there were plenty of open tables.  We were seated in the back patio, practically on top of another occupied two-top, which we thought was odd considering there were many other open tables.   Back patio is very nice, btw.

Appetizers: french fries and chicken liver pate.  The french fries were not great: we got the dregs -- a basketful of just tiny chips of broken french fries.  The chicken liver pate was served with toast, spicy mustard and onion jam/jelly, which they called "marmalade".  It was good, although ordinary.  

After we finished our appetizers, we waited THIRTY minutes for the mushroom/gruyere pizza and the applewood smoked chicken breast.  As we were just about to ask our server to bring us the check for just our appetizers so we could leave, our entrees finally arrived.  My dining partner didn't like the chicken at all.  And although I also thought the smoke flavor was a bit overpowering, I didn't think it was that bad -- but it wasn't great.  The mushroom/gruyere pizza was HORRIBLE.  It was literally dripping with grease and the crust was a soppy, soggy mess.  Very unappealing.  Just way too much cheese --  couldn't even taste the mushrooms, onions or artichoke hearts at all, the cheese was so overpowering.   Note to staff:  go easy on the cheese.  Although I love gruyere, a little goes a long way...

On the way out, we walked through the main dining area, which had filled up by the time we finished our meal.  The "vibe" inside is nice, if you like very loud.  It's a big, open room with lost of hard surfaces.  There a couple of big, very long tables which would be shared with other diners.   There are also a few two and four tops scattered around.   The overall atmosphere, to me, seems to be an overly self-conscious attempt to be hip and trendy.   

Bill was about $70, not including the tip.  We had no drinks or wine.  $70 is simply too much for less-than-mediocre food when there are so many wonderful places to eat in the city.
author: Johnny G.

description:
Usually I like the original versus the spinoff.  Mary Tyler Moore over Rhoda, All in the Family over The Jeffersons - you know how it is.  But in this case, I am a much bigger fan of Starbelly than of this group's original restaurant, Beretta.

I had lunch there with a friend a few weeks ago and it was a great experience.  Starting with the friendly service, and a large and well thought out beer list, I immediately felt the casual,down-to-earth vibe of the place.  We were on the same page.

We started with a bowl of beautifully roasted padron peppers with olive oil and sea salt - perfect in its simplicity.  Followed by the chicken liver pate, which was smooth and tasty with a thin layer of fat for extra flavor, it was off to an excellent start.

For our mains, we shared the porchetta sandwhich and the oyster poorboy.  Poor oyster poorboy was a little bland, but the porchetta was very tasty.  Made in house and slow-roasted in the old world tradition, it's a great way to treat pork and lends itself well to a sandwich topped with 2 different salsas and nutty arugula.

Dessert was pretty good - a pot de creme and 2 cookies, but I think there is some room for improvement here.  i will happily go back, sample some more desserts, and report back.

The decor is light and cozy-modern, with a nice outdoor space in back.  Lots of room at the bar, too.

In a neighborhood where the old standby restaurants seem a little bit  dated and worn, this is a welcome addition, and I look forward to my next visit.
author: Liz S.

description:
Overall  I thought the  food  was very  good but some of the portions  were small and dishes  overpriced.

Food 4 Stars
Service  3  Stars
Value   3 Stars
Decor  4 Stars

Apple cider-  The  apple cider actually tasted watered down and  to make matters worse  they  added  a lot of ice to it.  My waiter  did warn me about this but I decided to give it a try.  I then had to flag him down and  I asked him to replace it with something similar to a blue moon.  He chose delerium tremens which was good but for $10 a bottle I would  have preferred  a blue moon  for a few dollars  cheaper.

Liver Pate-  Really good and highly recommend with an awesome relish.  Only problem is when they gave  the dish the server said let us know if you need more bread.  There were five of us there  and they only gave 4 slices  of bread so immediately we had to ask for another slice of bread.  

Persimon, duck porciutto frisse salad-  This was a huge disappointment.  Only 4 of us ate this  and my portion was a a shaved dime size piece of porciutto and persimon and 3 frisse leaves.  The flavor profile  was good but not great and portion way too small.

Spaghetti-  This portion was  good  but  the spaghetti was good but not great.   The ingredients and pasta were  fresh but I prefer more al dente  thinner pasta.  The bacon was good but I wish they made it  more like my mom's carbonara style with beef  egg onions and mushroom and cheese.

Chorizo  pizza-  Highlight  of the meal.   Great  chorizo  sausage nice and spicy  and I liked the runny egg.


Butternut squash Pizza with goat cheese-Had some  from the table  next to me and it was  great as well.


English Toffee  Pudding Cake-  Great  but way too  small  to share  value was poor.

Creme de pot-  Rosemary  Ginger Cookie and Creme by itself were good  but together the  rosemary ginger cookie overpowered the creme.   

Overall  the food was  great and I would definitely come here  again for the liver pate and pizza  but  the other dishes were either not memorable or lacked in value.  I would also probably eat dessert somewhere else such as sweet inspiration down the street.
author: Christopher T.

description: I came to Starbelly for brunch and found the place quite agreeable!  The curry chicken sandwich and margherita pizza were both fresh-tasting and well balanced. The atmosphere is slightly fancier than a typical brunch spot, but still chill enough to just walk in and be seated - at least on a weekday. i would love to go back and try their dinner menu.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
Been here twice. First time was so highly mediocre for the hype, the second time was better but the real problem is the service. Pretentious and fake. Stressed out servers and disorganized hosts. 

They also serve the kind of pizza that makes me want to invite the chef over for a real pizza at my house. Big pieces of dry dough with three little pieces of whatever your "toppings" are, all clustered in the middle. 

Wine selection is overpriced and underwhelming. 

By the way, it's definitely $$$ not $$ as indicated on yelp here.
author: Tyler M.

description:
Isn't The Experience a lot of what dining out is all about? Not here...or at least not last night.

I arrived first (of 2) and the water guy asked if I wanted Still or Sparkling. I took Still and told him I didn't know what my friend would like so he left both bottles.  Friend arrived and Waitress (Elizabeth) comes by and grabs the first bottle of water and chugs his glass full (no inquiry of which water he wanted - so why bother offering two types?)

Waitress was instantly ready to be taking our order. Geez, we had barely been seated and hadn't seen each other for at least 2 years (dining out is a great venue for people to connect). I understand that waitstaff folks earn a lot of their income from tips and table turns are important (how many times have we all read this?). Rushed from the get go and Elizabeth's agenda was already getting in the way of my attempted Dinner Experience.  So all of that is a ONE Star.

Who in this City serves a poor burger? Medium means NO CHAR but that's not what I got. No inquiry about the food. Sometimes you just have to let it go.  Oh, and my fries were the bottom of the barrel. I had to nestle around to find a fry longer than 1".  That's a ONE Star too.

The check came and I gave her my CC (I didn't look at it because it is what it is and I can't see without my glasses). When she returned with the bill to sign, I saw (with my glasses on to give her the tip) that it wasn't our check. Accidents do happen but barely an apology. She seemed annoyed I had noticed as this added more time to occupy the table. Or, just more work for her. 

As a Gift, I still left her 20%. I know it's an expensive City and we all have bills to pay...but said waitress just felt plain down and out GREEDY to get her tips.

It's a nice restaurant (despite the constant dimming of the power surging lights over the table - will they never address that since their beginning?). The Hostess was very pleasant and accommodated my last minute table request. But there was NO Experience to be had here.  ...and that is about a FOUR Star (but sure not enough to pull me back). Too many restaurants in SF are elegant and beautiful. Having a pretty stage isn't enough if there's no follow-through at the table.
author: A K.

description: Really nice meal. Started with the wonderful chicken pate shared with a friend, then the chicken breast with white beans. Very tasty and reasonable prices. They need a Chardonnay by the glass on their wine list though. Only real downside was it was very noisy, which made catching up challenging. Still, I'd definitely go back.
author: Kergan E.

description:
We started off with some wine and cocktails. The star belly cocktail was uniquely crisp and refreshing. Ask your server for recommendations they have quite a few unique options!

For appetizers we had the chicken liver pâté, which was so rich and decadent. Brussels sprouts with bacon was perfectly blackened and sweet. Fries with dipping sauces offered no surprises, the basil aioli was my favorite. The scallops with beets and orange was good too but nothing surprising. Pumpkin dumplings were soft and well done, but not terribly inspiring.

Beef short ribs were  juicy and tender. I would say fall off the bone but there was no bone. The blackened catfish was mediocre. The two pizzas we got were crisp and awesome, comparable to its sister restaurant beretta's.

Finally, the pot de creme was a perfect combination of smooth, creamy and not overly sweet. Arguably the best pot of anything my friends and I have ever tasted. A must order for dates :)
author: Anson C.

description:
Definitely a star in a neighborhood known for mediocre (at best) dining.  Doesn't shine as brightly though when compared to other trendy comfort food competitors across the city.  Probably the type of place that can become a local favorite once you know what to get and what to avoid on this uneven menu.

Popcorn Clams: Just the strips, not the whole belly.  A lighter batter compared to the dense shell you'll get at most seafood shacks.  Appreciated the herbs in the coating.  Was digging the Old Bay remoulade... always good to see Old Bay being embraced!

Crab Fritters: More like crab-flavored fritters as it was pretty light on the actual crab meat.  Too bready for my tastes and dry without the dipping sauce.

Cheese Plate: A good selection of local cheeses.  What really struck me was the care put into the accompaniments.  We're not talking a simple sliced pear... how about preserved kumquats, honeyed pistachios and huckleberry jam!!!  

Rotisserie Chicken: Not necessarily better than anything you'd get Safeway or Boston Market.  Soft and tender, but could use more flavoring and/or some sort of innovation on this boring standby.

Lamb Chops: The two lamb chops were great: perfectly seared with medium rare on the inside.  I don't think there was much seasoning on it, but it really didn't need it.  Was disappointed in the cheese grits since they were pretty bland and reminded me of plain polenta.

Porchetta: Roli Roti has ruined me since I expect restaurant porchetta to just as good as street porchetta.  Sadly I found the meat section too dry, the fat section too chewy and the skin overly crisp.  The salsa was a nice touch, but acted like a mask rather than an enhancement.

Brussels Sprouts: If only parents learned to cook this way, you'd have fewer domestic disturbances involving finicky kids.  The leaves were braised so the outside was crispy while the inside was chewy.  It wasn't overcooked so you avoided the nasty sulfur taste.  And the bacon, wow, love the big pieces.

Caramel Pot de Creme: I'm all for salted caramel, but they took this to the extreme.  My blood pressure must have jumped a few digits after all that sodium!  The creme itself was enjoyable, but tasted more like butterscotch than caramel.  Wasn't a fan of the dry salty cookies, but they did add a good texture contrast.
author: Adam B.

description:
The food was good, but not quite as spectacular as that at sister restaurant Beretta.

We shared a bunch of appetizers/small plates and a pizza.  The burrata with tomatoes and pesto was good, but nothing set it apart from similar burrata dishes you find at other restaurants.  The white bean puree, while delicious, was served with two laughably small triangles of grilled flat bread.  The kale caesar was way overdressed.  My favorite dish was definitely the brussels sprouts with honey balsamic.  The sprouts could have probably been served with less balsamic (they were kind of drowning in the bowl), but, in the end, I enjoyed dipping my bread from our salumi plate in it.  The chorizo and egg pizza was okay...the crust was pretty soggy in the middle.

It's a fine place to go if you're in the neighborhood, but Beretta, it is not.  They do accept reservations, which is nice.
author: D E.

description:
For our latest dinner club we went to Starbelly.  This place has been getting some amazing press recently for their picnic Tuesdays.  We didn't go there for that but it did give us some good ideas on the types of food they were going to have.  The setup is like a lot of new restaurants with the entrance and then a long bar leading back to a sitting area and also a nice sized outside dining area.

We had quite a bit of food and booze and it was relatively inexpensive which is always good thing.  The beer selection was pretty good and I had some beers that I had never heard of before and they were very tasty.  As for the food, we did a lot of sharing and I would say the best thing which wasn't really on the menu but we saw another table have was a side of bacon.  Now no one can turn down bacon anyway but their bacon was delicious.  We also had the salumi platter and sausage appetizers and both were awesome.

For the main meal I had a pizza which was good but a little undercooked.  Other folks had the steak which they said lacked a little flavor otherwise I would have given Starbelly a 4 rating.  The pork with apricots was really tasty as well.

For dessert we had the secret breakfast and salted pot de creme which were good but didn't particularly stand out.

While the restaurant was busy it didn't seem too cramped or loud so definitely a good spot to check out with friends.
author: Blake B.

description:
Another restaurant I was stoked to try and overall I walked out satisfied!  The restaurant is located in the glorious Castro on 16th, not too hard to find... definitely quite busy and popular so reservations are a must. Upon checking in, our wait time wasn't too long for the table but the space is very small so be prepared to be sitting close to other tables... you can definitely hear other conversations so if you are looking for a romantic spot- this probably isn't the best choice... Atmosphere and decor has that hipster trendy vibe to it....   Our server was awesome- super personable, funny, and attentive. She was prompt with our "first course"- maple bacon doughnuts and our bubbly! The doughnuts were very tasty and I recommend starting with one or two to share at the table (don't spoil your appetite!)... However, the main course seemed to take awhile and what we all ordered should NOT have taken that long to cook. We ordered the Starbelly Pizza for the table to share and it was SOOO good, definitely a must!! However, the smoked salmon scramble my bestie and I ordered to split was ice cold. NO BUENO! We sent it back immediately and they probably just re-scrambled the eggs so it wasn't really super great. My other friend had the basic egg/potato/toast dish and she seemed to like it and another friend got the margarita pizza subbed with burrata cheese and some sort of italian meat, can't remember which one... It looked a little oily to me but that could have been from the meat... Again, at least for me, the Starbelly pizza was the best- the green goddess dressing and bacon really complimented the pizza so well! Good crust and right amount of sauce and cheese.... I definitely want more soon!

Side note: Two of my friends kept complaining about some fish smell, perhaps from their fish tacos? (it was before we ordered our meal)... I didn't smell it though. 

Overall, I would recommend this place to check out and your tummy will be smiling!
author: Deb K.

description:
I was here recently with a big group for lunch and the patio was great. Half of our party was 30 minutes late coming from the airport and they were cool about it. We started with some fries and a salad which were excellent.

Service was really good except one star off for my wife's entree coming out 15 minutes after everyone else had been served.
author: Jang K.

description:
I always forget about Starbelly but when I come, I am always thoroughly impressed at the design, service, and the tastey food.

Met up with some of my friends for Tapas. They were apparently too busy for us so we had to sit on the high tables. I didn't have a problem with this initially until I saw that through the length of our stay there was plenty patio and lower tables. That was a little frustrating...

Anywho, our very kind and lovely server made her kind recommendations and we ordered the following:

Crab Cakes: Very tastey!
Flank Steak: Cooked to perfection
Muscles: Amazing! (However very messy! I ruined my white shirt but it was worth it) 

Overall a great restaurant! OH! Their Sangria was pretty good too!

The only other thing that bothered me is while we weren't allowed another table far off, they were having a staff meeting on the same high table as we were and it was kind of distracting : /
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Went last night for a friend's bday. Love the interior!!! Great ambiance. Really cool outdoor seating, although we sat inside. 

We ordered a bunch of sides and pizzas. We really liked the beets and feta, the spicy white bean dip and bacon pizza. The pizza slices are small, so we all have about 4 each and were full with the sides and wine. The butternut squash pizza was also really unique and tasty. I would like to come back to try the burger and the mushroom pizza. Actually.. like everything else. The salads sounded pretty bomb too.

Oh the complimentary salted caramel dessert was soooooo good. The rosemary cookies complimented it famously and I wish we had 2 birthday people so we could get another one. 

Really nice servers, good service, fast and attentive and really decently priced. Our bill for 8 people was less than $100. Kind of a shocker. Will be back!
author: Katie P.

description: In the couple times I've been here I love it! Food is always great (the pizza and burger are my favorites)! The drinks are always super refreshing, and I love the outdoor seating with the great lighting! Service could be a little better, but overall a fun place for dinner!
author: Juliana O.

description:
the burrata stuffed arancino and butternut squash dumpling starter were amazing.
skip the sphagetti with bacon -- it was too salty.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
We only went for libations, so this review focuses on the AMAZING staff and the GREAT beer selections.  

First off ... Beautiful space.  I used to perform here, back when it was Josie's Cabaret and Juice Joint.  Every inch of that space brings back a fond memory.  It was hard to imagine anything but Josie's in that location, but I love what they've done. 

Second ... The staff is uber-attentive and ultra-pleasant.  My kinda folks.  Not too pushy, but always making it clear that they will help you get your quality drink on.  Yessirreeeeeee.  

Third ... The beer.  The beer selections are incredible.  Well-chosen and some rarities.  Our bartender recommended a few that caught us off guard.  

We lurf this place and will definitely be back.
author: Joe W.

description:
Grrrr I really wish I could give it more stars.  The location and atmosphere are great.  But my most recent trip was a bust.  I have had several good experiences, but the last one was pretty bad..... average of 3 stars.

The waiter messed up each of our bills, the chicken was SO dry and lacking flavor and the bread salad was just pathetic.  The white sangria was a nice try, but also not very exciting.

My friend had the steak and it was done very well, medium rare, good flavoring.  

Sadly, not a great experience.  The waiter never came back to check on our bills, so we just paid and left.  I haven't heard back from a call or email that I left for the manager/owner.
author: Kellan M.

description:
Friggin Delicious & Nice Portions too : D

Cool date or group place.  I'd like to checkout the back patio next time.  

We decided to bite the bullet and wait for a table here on a weekend night.  The wait for two was about 45 min. (without a reservation.)  We were seated at the common bar in the middle of the restaurant which made for a pretty lively seat.  

We ordered as everyone has recommended & loved it.  I always say that if you are going to try a restaurant as raved over by Yelp, then you should always order what people are yapp'n about (quick tips, common review words, etc.)

That said here is where the magic's at:
-Chicken Liver Pate (A Must)
-Grilled local jumbo sardine, roasted shishito peppers, preserved lemon & chile oil (Um, just ok.  Kinda stinky)
-Bacon, Jalapeno, Arugula & Green Goddess Dressing (Much Yum)
-Prather Ranch burger, house cut fries & pickle, grilled sesame bun (Yums)

Yay for portions!  We were so full & happy when we left (with a box half full of pizza leftovers which were so good for the hangovers we had the next morning.) 

Love ya Starbelly.  Another fantastic neighborhood find for us.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Had a chance to spend a lazy Sunday at Starbelly for some brizzzzzzzunch last weekend, and it was a pretty fun hang.

Speaking on behalf of the brunch only, Starbelly is definitely in the umbrella food genre of 'New American,' as they have everything from pizza, to fried clam poor boy sammiches, to doughnuts (from Dynamo!). While solid options to start off the day, I'm a breakfast guy through and through - so no first quarter meal is complete without eggs... which is precisely why I ended up ordering the fried egg sandwich. This baby is nothing like what your momma used to make, it's a modern twist on an American classic. It comes open-faced on an artisan bun, with thick ass Starbelly bacon (some of the best I've had since reintroducing it back into my diet) and two-year aged cheddar. Couple that with some home fries and a breakfast salad of mixed greens, goat cheese and cheery tomatoes... and you've got yourself a pretty respectable first meal of the day.

One thing that kinda chaps my hide is when restaurants advertise "brunch," when it's simply breakfast on a Saturday or Sunday morning. I understand it's special because Starbelly isn't typically open in the a.m., but it'd be swell if there was some kind of incentive like bottomless mimosas or something. A singular price for multiple rounds of bubbly is my idea of a Sunday brunch, but maybe that's just me.

While on the topic of adult beverages, they have some pretty creative concoctions available for your drinking pleasure. Stuff like Mexican beer and tomato juice with a chili salt rim, Starbelly Shandys (beer and lemonade), Pimm's Cups and sparkling wines with a shot of vermouth. All are definitely worth a try, if you're down for some day drinking.

The atmosphere is pretty cool as well. It's not a hectic greasy spoon type place, and it's also not overly bougie either. They make great use of the sky lights above, creating a very casual and comfortable setting. The tables are a little small, and the communal table can be fun (granted you get seated next to some cool people), so try not to order too many different things at once, as it gets a little bit cluttered.

Can't wait to try dinner sometime!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Service is prompt and polite. Entrees were ok, I ordered a mushroom pizza which was delicious, but my friend ordered the sausage and mashers which was "ok" . If you go stick to the starters, the pate was to die for!!!!
author: Ariele L.

description:
We (my husband and I) came here the beginning of February on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks. 

This place rocks! I would have given them 5 stars for their Calimochos alone! We had three different appetizers including the fries with three different dipping sauces (all good) and tried a few of their great beers. Awesome beer selection. 

We came here around 6:00pm on a Friday and it was not terribly crowded (although we were there early). We sat at the communal table which was a refurbished bowling lane, really cool. Waitstaff was so nice and friendly. Sort of a hipster vibe although in the Castro. I loved the modern feel- lots of succulents and wood tones.

Will come here again!
author: Melissa N.

description: The French toast was delicious but the coffee was lukewarm. Very pleasant atmosphere on the outdoor patio. It got a little noisy at one point but it was just a lively good time. Service was prompt. I'm a man of few words.
author: Kartik H.

description:
Really REALLY disappointed. 

 My boyfriend and I decided to give this place another try since we have heard good things about this restaurant and apparently it's Michelin recommended. 

My first time I ordered a burger and it was bland and not very warm, but the service was good so hey, maybe we caught them on a bad day. 

So we decided to give it a second chance. We get there and the hostess says it'll be 5-10 mins to be seated at the community table. Well 20 minutes goes by and she finally takes us to our seats, the ones that have been vacant and ready since we got there! But alright, not a big deal at least we are seated. So then we both decide to order the Sunnyside Joes and we were both extremely disappointed. The only thing I could taste was metal from the metal pan it was served on. It had absolutely no seasoning or flavor. So we ordered something else, (feeling bad because we hate too waste food but that dish was awful) I ordered the Banana and walnut French toast because you can't go wrong with French toast, right? Wrong. My French toast was cold, along with my bacon and I literally got one end piece of a banana on it. I had to also ask for a napkin, silver wear, syrup and more water. My boyfriend got the chicken and waffles because we noticed a lot of people ordered that, but his chicken was very dry and his waffle was burnt! He too had to ask for syrup and coffee and water refills. And it wasn't only us, the people next to us had to ask for their silver wear, more water and syrup too! 

I don't know how this place is Michelin recommended. Terrible food and bad service. I've eaten at a few Michelin starred restaurants and never have I had an experience like that. I definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND this place to anyone. There are plenty more and far better restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Karissa C.

description:
This was my 2nd visit to Starbelly. First trip was to lunch and I had a burger. It was really good., service was great.

Due to an issue at another restuarant I wanted to try- I ended up here for dinner.

The food and service were really really good. 

However, this evening was evidence of a changing Castro. I understand that it's becoming more and more families and they've got to keep these establishments in business. But please folks, if you insist on bringing your toddlers to the venue on pig roast night- keep in mind you are in a place where people are looking to chill and relax, enjoy a quiet evening. Not hear you playing peek- a-boo. Thanks for chasing me off early so I wasn't able to have dessert.

I'll be back, maybe just my timing of the evening.

Food is worth a return visit.
author: Tom M.

description:
The food and ambiance of this place deserves about 4 stars, but my overall experience the last time I ate here was completely unsatisfactory and is deserving of no more than a 2 star rating!  First of all, we waited for a ridiculous amount of time before anyone even came for our orders.  Mind you, while our waiter appeared to be entertaining his friends who were just finishing up their meal at the table adjacent to us.  Then a bit more endless waiting, and to top it off.. we were told that our pizza was delivered to another party by accident and that another one was being made immediately.  

The waiter did seem somewhat sincerely apologetic, and did give us a complimentary custard but he should have been paying more attention to the other tables than leisurely focusing his immediate attention on his friends.. at our convenience.  I will probably go back to try something else, and probably for lunch instead of dinner, but my experience here did set a really fowl taste in my mouth.
author: Ty T.

description:
arrrghhhhhhhhhhh..................

Thre services here  I can say this.

the atmosphere and design are great.

The food is good.

Why 3 stars?

the service is sooo slow.  Not sure if its the service or the kitchen but two out of three times we waited nearly 30  minutes for our food, and over 10 minutes for anyone take our order

Thus far Ive had the Margherita Pizza and Mushroom Pizza.  Both delicious.

The Chorizo pizza for brunch was a soggy forgettable mess

The Steak salad for brunch...one.. the server never asked me how I wanted my steak cooked.  I usually want it medium rare I got it medium to medium well.   

The Porchetta sandwich was pretty good but about just as good as the one at the embarcadero

The dumplings were good but on the tiny side.

The grilled sardines were great.


If they could fix their major service issue I think this place could be much better.
author: Spanky M.

description: Front of the house has an insufferable attitude problem. And the food is mediocre. Better options all around in the neighborhood.
author: Michael F.

description: Great bartenders, inventive pizza, sublime pot de creme!
author: Virginia T.

description:
Starbelly is solid across the board. The eclectic menu features pretty much something for everyone - at our table alone we had mini corn dogs, porchetta, lamb cheeks, pizza and a burger. Yes, I ordered the burger...and it was delicious! The meat was cooked a perfect medium rare and while the fries were crispy they arrived a bit lukewarm. This made me sad.

Unlike big brother Beretta, Starbelly is beer and wine only, although both lists were long and impressive. Whether in the mood for a Delirium Tremens or a bottle of Albarino, Starbelly has you covered. 

The scene on a Tuesday evening was bustling - we were lucky to grab a table for five at 6:20 before the madness ensued. Service was friendly and efficient, though dirty side plates and silverware weren't swapped out between courses which is a bit of a pet peeve for me.

Overall, I really enjoyed our meal at Starbelly. I don't know if it's "wait an hour" worthy yet but if you catch them at an off hour and are able to get a table without the long wait then it's definitely worth a shot.
author: phil h.

description: Food is excellent, venue is a bit small.  Shared apps, the pate platter and a meat platter, fried chicken, a burger and two marghereta pizzas, one with and one without egg.  Platters were superb, pate was incredible and the burger and chicken moist flavourful and satiating.  The pizza was enjoyed by all, recommend the egg addition as it clearly worked for all of us.  Would go back and enjoy something else or the same items again.
author: Keith S.

description: I frequent there a lot with friends and families. Nice setting in the patio area.  Pizza(most of them ) taste good. Home made limonada is a little bit too sweet for me. Ginger sth tea is way too sugary.  The salad is the safe way to go but probably not enough for a starving stomach. Overall, a nice place to brunch on a sunny Sunday :)
author: Alanda B.

description:
I'd never heard of Starbelly until today when the BFF & I ran smack into it en route to the Castro Theater. These are my thoughts:

Before eating at Starbelly:
Any place cool enough & ballsy enough to serve mini corn dogs is a place I want to try at least once....So this is the restaurant that took the place of the old Askew...a nice upgrade, for sure. 

During our dining experience:
Where's the salt & pepper? Love the decor, which is sophisticated. That bar sure is long & sleek. It sure is taking an awful long time for our food to be brought out...here it is...ohhh, that looks yummy...

- Me- small caesar salad with buttery croutons & avocado. The dressing was had wonderful, strong garlic & cheese flavors. And pizza margherita- simple & delicious. 
- BFF- Prather Ranch burger & side salad (his butter lettuce looked great) & a glass of white wine (an '08 Verdicchio.)
Total $44 without tip 

After our meal: 
My taste buds are dancing! I will be coming back. I hope it's sunnier next time we come so we can sit in the garden. Hey, prices were freakin' awesome. I like that we had two people taking care of us. Hey, I never even ordered the mini corn dogs! Next time...

Now, get outta my head & go experience some Starbelly yourself.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Consistent quality and unbelievable taste and staff..what else can you say about a place that is pretty much perfection..besides have the simple salad with bleu cheese, have the beets, have the fries, have the bavette, have the pot de creme, have the double corn cornbread,ESPECIALLY have the arborio rice pudding, the Gruner Veltliner is fantastic, and if you don't have the chicken liver pate with the grilled bread, onion jam, and whole grain mustard...all of which are delightful alone, let alone together on the bread...you're shorting yourself. If it's too much fat for you, I sincerely send you my condolences.....I have worked in the food and service industry for fifty years and a place like this is rare at any price point..go and enjoy..
author: Chris D.

description:
I've eaten here three times so far and each time has been quite enjoyable. The place has good vibes and a somewhat cozy feel though it can be loud. 
Just a few tips:
The outside heated patio is great and somewhat quieter than inside.
Order a beer, the list is fantastic!
All vegetables are amazing but too often covered with cheese. Push cheese to the side and you are good to go.
The late summer menu is better than the fall. 
If your dining companion likes cheese or New American food, this is the place to go.
Don't get the fries. They are not worth the calories.
author: Valerie L.

description:
Seeing double.

There were two of us. Two homemade veggie burgers (dried pea & quinoa patty, white bean puree, curry yogurt) were ordered.

Patty was nice and crispy. Bean puree added a unique touch. Yogurt made for perfect dipping. Good burger.

Especially on a warm day while sitting out back. Great patio.

Without a side $9 felt a little steep. You can add fries or salad for $2 more.

Fortunately the warm weather and patio came at no extra charge.
author: Jason B.

description:
I really liked this place.  I hadn't checked the reviews of this place before I went there, but now I'm surprised to see this place only have 3.5 stars on Yelp.  I'd say it's 4 or 4.5

The interior decor is pretty nice.  It's a great dinner date spot as there are many small 2 person tables and the lighting just creates a nice romantic atmosphere.  We got some liver pate as an appetizer.  That was actually the first time I've had pate so I can't say if it's exceptionally good but I really enjoyed it.  My entree was blackened catfish which was delicious.  Dessert was pot de creme which was just average in my opinion.  Service was pretty good but not great.  Our waiter did his job but just wasn't that warm and friendly.  1 appetizer, 2 entrees, a bottle of wine and dessert ran $100.  I only have very minor gripes about this place.  I'd definitely go back!
author: Steve l.

description:
I went with a group of seven friends just recently. The space and location is wonderful! Sadly the food and wait staff were lacking. The food was really bad. We actually sent back our mussels because they were slimy and had a very strange odor. Our waitress would disappear for long periods and we had to ask other waiters for refills. 

I wanted to like this place but it's the third time I've been there where it's been just a little off. I will not eat here again.
author: Steven F.

description:
When you put bacon on 75% of your menu, how can a restaurant fail? 

And Starbelly did not disappoint. The menu has a mixture of appetizers, pizzas, and  small & large plates that won't break your bank. 

We had a huge group of 9 and they were able to accommodate us on their heated patio on a freezing SF night. But after a couple of delicious sangrias and kir royales, i finally took off my jacket and was able to enjoy the deliciousness that was about to come. 

We ordered for the group, and a few people got their own entrees; but overall, it was worth it to try everything and share various small plates and pizzas. 

For appetizers, we ordered:
- Fries with three dips (oh man this dish was gone in a blink of an eye.. because I ate it all)
- Mussels with chorizo: the sauce for this dish was again, delicious. we dipped our bread in it after all the mussels were devoured. 
- Cornbread: awesome starter for such a cold night! I think there was maple butter too.. drooooooll
- Butternut squash dumplings: butternut anything is great for winter, but this dish was really tiny and my least favorite out of everything we ordered

For pizzas, we got:
- House-made Chorizo with sunny side up eggs: absolutely delicious, even the next day
- Margherita: super fresh tasting, not to heavy like other pizzas
- Starbelly bacon: interesting with arugula but still tasty

Large Plates:
