- Burger: both of my friends enjoyed it 
- Monk Fish: wrapped in bacon and served with pasta... delicious!
- Chicken: flavorful and huge portion

All in all, very good gathering place. This place definitely seems "New American" and I would come back because again, it doesn't burn a hole in my wallet and food is definitely up to par.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Went here for a late lunch.  Nice space with potential.  Still need to work out the kinks.

They have seating up front, an extended bar with community seating on both sides, and a patio out back.  Nice ambiance.  Open kitchen.

Started off with the pulled chiken, jalapeno, and endive slaw sandwich.  Sounded wonderful in concept.  However, execution left a lot to be desired.  The chicken, jalapendo, and endive was drowning in mayonnaise, so much so that one could barely taste the distinct ingredients.  No hint of jalapeno flavor whatsoever.  I mentioned to the waitress that they may want to scale back on the mayo in this sandwich, and she said she's heard that from a number of people.  Then change it Starbelly.  Nobody orders this sandwich for the mayonnaise.  Let the stars shine, and don't drown them!

The fries accompanying the sandwich were pretty good, and the (presumably) house-made ketchup was fantastic-tart yet sweet.

Now then, the star of the meal was the squash and sage, black garlic, fresh goat cheese, and toasted pepitas pizza. This was a bit of a revelation, with unexpected flavors--bright highs, and deep lows--finished off with the crisp pepitas.  Might take a bit of getting used to for some, but I enjoyed it.  A tad oily, but other than that, a winner!

Service was friendly, unobtrusive, but fell a tad short in not offering anything in recompense for our unhappiness with the sandwich.

I may return for the interesting pizzas, or for brunch or drinks.  The bartender was very friendly and was preparing a honeyed mixture for a tasty-sounding lemonade as we were leaving.  

But they need to refine their ingredient mix for certain dishes, and perhaps upgrade the cooking staff.

Good for groups.

Food: 3 (2.5 for sandwich, 4 for pizza)
Value: 3
Service: 3
Ambiance: 3.5
author: Ethan R.

description: I hosted a private event on the Starbelly patio. I crafted the menu with Bryan and Lauren, who were so professional and accommodating. The charcuterie, pizzas and salads are so delicious, the entrees so well prepared and the beer and wine pairings were perfect. Thank you Starbelly for a wonderful event!
author: K C.

description: I've been to Starbelly a few times and have always enjoyed myself. They have a great outdoor area in the back which is awesome for brunch. The food is pretty good as well. I recommend their Bloody Mary - they put a unique spin on the drink.
author: Mike W.

description: The margarita pizza and veggie burger was really yummy ! Good place to eat on a business meeting or with friends I love the decor
author: Sophia W.

description:
Let's start out with the good - service was on par with 3 stars.

Now on to the bad and worse.  I got the burger, which I ordered medium and with blue cheese.  I was served a burger cooked medium-well with white cheddar.  The meat was overly peppered and I had to ask for condiments, rather than it being assumed a dish consisting of burgers and fries would need condiments.

My date got the flank steak which he said was good but overpriced.  I tried a piece and the "Santa Maria" rub tasted oddly plastic.

SKIP the $7 berry cobbler.  It was served so molten hot that it oblierated any flavor it could have had and the sides of the dish were actually burnt.  We didn't have the luxury of time to let it cool to a point where it may have been enjoyable.  The crust on top just tasted like Bisquick.

It was our second time there and we won't be returning.  Chow serves similar food with better options, better prices and better variety.
author: Mike F.

description:
Loved, loved, loved Starbelly.

The second you walk in the entire place makes you feel so comfortable and so relaxed. We sat at the communal table, drank micheladas and other spicy beer cocktails, and indulged in some of the best pizza I've had since Ragazza. We also ordered some of the best donuts I've ever had the pleasure of tasting - fresh and glazed and dense and perfect.

Service was wonderful, the food was divine, and the best part is, everyone looked happy and sated. I can't wait to go back to Starbelly and try more and more of the menu. A great addition to the Castro, the place really brings the area up a notch in sophistication and indulgence.
author: Lisa P.

description: The spaghetti plate w/bacon, basil and jalapeno in a tomato sauce and also the dessert we had, the salted caramel pot de creme w/rosemary cornmeal cookies, were both so tasty!  The spaghetti portion seemed a bit small at first glance, but it turned out to be just the right size and the pot de creme dessert w/cookies was a nice compliment too:-)  The interior/ambiance is nice, though it can get pretty loud at times.  Never been to this place until just recently, but a friend had heard about it and I was happy to have tried this place out!
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
I heard really great things about Starbelly so my fiancee and I decided to try it out one day.

It was pretty busy for a Sunday evening but they were still able to take us in as a walk in.

Extensive wine and beer list. I don't really like reds so I got a glass of the rose which was good.

First look at the spring menu, the entrees didn't really wow us. Was your typical: burger, steak, fish, etc. so we decided to go with small plate.

We started off with the green bean salad. It was actually really small for the price and was over drenched in dressing. Was more meh.

Next started with the cheese platter. It came with a red hawk, a hard cheese and a blue cheese. I've had red hawk before which was good. The hard cheese (which I can't remember what it is) was really the best out of the three types. It came with some wheat bread (although I'm trying not to eat too many carbs) so I ate most of my cheese with the pear slices. It also came with some really good toasted almonds and pumpkin seeds.

Our next dish was the chicken liver pate which was the best out of the evening. Very savory and just melted in your mouth. It came with some really great caramelized onions and bread (more carbs!) which just sealed the deal. It also came with some handmade mustard but we didn't touch it since it was alright and failed to comparison to the caramelized onions.

We finished the night with the roasted octopus and some baked crab thing.

The octopus was cooked just right and a good size portion. It also came on top of a really good chickpea salad (highly recommend unless you don't like octopus).

The crab dish looked like it was baked in with some egg and cheese or something in a baking dish and served with bread (again!?). It was alright but nothing to rave about.

All-in-all, the place was great. The food was good (although some hit and misses), service was really good and the atmosphere was casual (a little noisy though). I would most likely come again, but would take a look at their menu first before checking it out.
author: Kameron K.

description:
------------------------
The Quick:
------------------------

Hot on the heels of an enjoyable, yet uncomfortable (way too loud and crowded) meal at sister restaurant Beretta, I was bent on trying the similar new American/Italian eatery Starbelly. I enjoyed my experience a lot and I must say this is my new favorite American/Italian eatery in the entire city. 

------------------------
The Details:
------------------------

Food - 

Appetizer #1 - Housemade chicken liver pate, buttered bread, sweet onion marmalade, and grain mustard

Oh so good. Given the fact that I usually do not order pate, just the combination of the various components of this dish worked well together and provided a great start to our meal. The sweet onion marmalade was especially delicious. 

Appetizer #2 - Housecut fries with three dips

Good, but typical fare that you can find at most modern American eateries in the city. Nothing special here. I must admit I do not remember the dips offered to us and maybe that is all that is needed to be said.

Entree #1 - Pizza margherita with burrata and basil 

Strictly based on a comparison with the same dish at Beretta, it was practically the same (with maybe Beretta slightly better). The burrata was still very creamy and complimented the rest of the pizza ingredients well. 

Entree #2 - Fried chicken (i apologize, but i don't know any other further description given that the item is not listed on the online menu)

The fried chicken was really, really good. I normally prefer the dark meat of chicken based on its moistness. On this occassion, however, I have never tasted such moist and tender white meat in a fried chicken meal. I was initially reluctant to order this dish because I had more than my fair share of failed signature fried chicken dishes all over the city.  

Service - 

It was good and sufficient for a lunch meal. The wait staff was cordial and polite and I have no complaints. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my lunch at Starbelly. This place was so tasty that it made me appreciate (and maybe even order) dishes I usually don't care for, such as pate and friend chicken. I will definitely return here for another meal in the coming future.
author: Nathan T.

description: My favorite dinner in the Castro. I love the back patio. The burger is fantastic and the salad is my favorite starter. Nice place to go to catch up with a friend and enjoy a nice meal without waiting two hours to sit down.
author: Kara D.

description: Starbelly is my new favorite restaurant in SF. The pizzas are incredible, the staff are amazingly nice, and the atmosphere and decor are beautiful. I'll be back soon!
author: Eliza D.

description:
The restaurant is lovely on the inside, the outdoor seating is just as nice. They have heaters! Beer selection is alright, but the most expensive I've ever seen. They offer a smaller sized beer, which was super exciting for me, but I paid for 8-10 oz. as much as I would pay for a pint elsewhere. The food is fantastic and i believe it's worth trying. 

The employees are so.. so very unfriendly. I would have enjoyed this place much more had they not been rude.
author: Jamie M.

description:
Came here last night with the bf on a whim and I must say we were both pretty disappointed by our experience.  It was as busy as you'd expect for early-ish on a Wednesday evening, which is to say, not very.  Nevertheless, they stuck us in a dark corner, even after we requested another table.  The other table wasn't reserved or anything, and they sat other couple at it minutes after we sat down.

The food was pretty meh. We got three small plates and a mushroom pizza to share.  Small plates were: fried calamari, sweet pea fritters, and the grilled sardines.  The calamari was delicious - by far the best dish of the night.  The fritters were way too overcooked for the lightness of the insides.  Almost tasted burned.  And the sardines were two whole grilled fish, each roughly eight to ten inches long.  They were surprisingly pretty bland and awkward to eat.

Finally, the mushroom pizza.  Undercooked and bland - not much more to say.

The desserts were good, though.  We shared the toffee cake with mascarpone, and the salted caramel pot de creme with rosemary cookies.  The bf thought the cookies overpowered the pot de creme.  Both dishes were delicious, though.

The beer is quite good, as well.  Very impressive list of both draught and bottled.  It took our server forever to notice that we needed more drinks, so we finished our second beers well after dessert was done.

The service was pretty poor.  It almost seemed like our server was intentionally ignoring us - spending a lot of time on the table right next to us, and leaving us with no drinks, no check ins, no water, etc.  Seriously a little odd.

All in all, I might return to try entree dishes (maybe the small plates and pizza aren't their thing?) but otherwise I won't be returning.
author: danielle p.

description:
It was a rainy afternoon and we met up with some friends who lived nearby for lunch. They chose this adorable restaurant called Starbelly. 

First off, I loved the name of the restaurant. It's fun and whimsical. 

Secondly, I adore the drinks that they have! Such a fun and eclectic mix of drinks that you just have to try! They also have some good non-alcoholic versions too. 

Thirdly, I adored their food! I had their burger and it came out so fresh and juicy. Eating this and sipping on some white sangria was one of the highlights of my day! 

We didn't even have a wait for brunch. Just walked in and was seated 30 seconds later (2 seconds to say hello, 5 seconds to say Party for four, and 23 seconds to walk to our table!). 

Amazing! I think we need to have another brunch with my friends again. Soon. Very, very soon.
author: Julia W.

description:
Starbelly is a really cute restaurant. Great ambiance with an adorable porch. Other than that, it doesn't have much going for it. 

The service was terrible. The waitress was kind, but forgetful. She served the coffee, forgot the cream. Brought the toast, forgot the jam. We were often left at the table for long periods of time without be checked in on; and there might have been 2 other tables occupied. 

The menu does an honorable thing with all organic and local foods, but the entrees for brunch were limited. At 10:30am, we almost all got pizza because the 5 breakfast items offered just weren't that appealing. 

A real bummer, because it had a lot of potential. A friend of mine also had a similar experience, almost 2 years ago...perhaps Starbelly needs to take note?...
author: Allison B.

description:
Starbelly is fabulous. The decor is trendy and the staff makes you feel comfortable as you begin your dining experience.

Starbelly is exactly the kind of restaurant the Castro needs more of. The tacky eateries that make the Castro what it is are great, but this place steps up the game. The food I've had here has never disappointing. 

I would highly recommend going for brunch, it was phenomenal. They are known for their bacon, so make sure you get something WITH it. I ordered the spaghetti once and I believe waffles the other time. The drinks, food, and general experience are always great. 

The only reason that keeps this place from getting five stars is that I had higher expectations after enjoying pure food and service bliss at Beretta, which are the owners/creators of Starbelly.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Long wait, but the chicken liver pate was worth it. The decor is enticing, but nothing that I haven't seen before (Californian-urban-rustic).
author: Judy Z.

description:
**This review is for brunch only**

There's a ton of amazing restaurants in the city, but I've been to this place about once a month since discovering it, which says a lot. The food is amazing and I love the decor of this place. The patio is amazing place for brunch as I have sat there 3 out of 4 times I have been there. It's wooden and reminds me of sitting in someone's backyard if they were rich, earthy, and eco-friendly.

I've had 3 of the pizzas here. 
1. My favorite was the seasonal butternut squash pizza with pinenuts and goat cheese. The crust was perfectly thin and crispy. The ingredients were all super fresh as well. 
2. My second favorite was the bacon pizza with arugula and the special "goddess sauce". Yes this sauce deserves to be called "goddess sauce" because it was a delicious mix of herbs with a lil kick to it. My favorite thing about this restaurant is everything tastes fresh because they use local ingredients (I think). The arugula totally balances out the bacon in sweet carb harmony.
3. The third pizza I had was the gruyere mushroom pizza. While it had a thin crispy crust - the usual components to a good pizza, the cheese was overpowering and a lil runny ? Pass.

My other favorite here was the sunnyside Joe's. mmm. This bad boy comes in a skillet so it stays nice and hot the entire time. The ground beef, cheese, spinach are cooked into a skillet, and then topped by 2 sunnyside eggs. When you eat it you slice your fork and let the yolk ooze onto it, mmmm drool. The beef is super flavorful even thought it's just ground beef. The spinach and cheddar do a nice job balancing the dish out. 

I'm not a huge cocktail person, nor am I one to drink before noon, but I always manage to have a Pim's cup when I'm here. It's refreshing and the perfect summer drink. 

I just moved out of SF and I'm already missing this place :*(
author: Grace Y.

description:
The last (and, undoubtedly, the best) meal my bestie and I had in SF before we departed for the Midwest.  A salad of pink princess apples and celery root with creme fraiche dressing--not as apple-forward as I had anticipated, more savory, but delicious--followed by grilled peaches with Humbolt Fog on lavosh and thin crust pizza with blue cheese sauce, mission figs, and arugula.  Oh, and a house-made ginger soda.  And I mustn't forget the delectable dessert: toffee cake with dates and mascarpone.  Are you hungry yet?

The place itself is adorable.  The enclosed patio is a delighful place to share a meal with a friend or six, and you get to see where some of the food on your plate is grown.  So fresh, so tasty, and our server didn't seem to mind that we giggled every time he asked us how we were doing.
author: Keely B.

description: Great service, amazing fries, pretty good pizza, even the water was good, but the German beer.....the best! Spot is nice for a romantic spot. Will definitely come back again!
author: Benjamin F. P.

description: Great food and experience.  Staff were attentive, food great.  On the short list for next trip to San Francisco.
author: Jim W.

description:
I like you.  I really like you.  After just a handful of visits I have decided to make Starbelly a standby for special and not so special occasions.

The small plates are highly recommended. The burrata and chicken liver paté are both memorable.  I'm not exactly a paté fan but ended up eating more than my friend who ordered it. The spaghetti with bacon and jalapeño is surprisingly delicious.  I have steered clear of ordering it for myself (knowing that it will induce heart burn) but after trying my friend's plan to one day gobble down a whole bowl. The steak with Achiote was good but perhaps a little over-priced.

Brunch here is good if you prefer more "unch" and less "br": there are only three egg dishes and they all have meat.

The decor is modern but cozy (just the way I like it) and the back patio adds a little extra ambiance both day and night.  Service is consistently good and I've been pleasantly surprised twice showing up without a reservation and getting seated in a timely manner.
author: Cliff C.

description:
I came here for their out back BBQ. Not only was I blown away by the adorable outdoor atmosphere the staff was unbelievably accommodating. Our waitress was able to put together a pitcher of sangria for us even though it wasn't on the menu. 

The food was beyond incredible. The menu consisted of an entire pig that the chef carved for you on the spot, yummy grilled veggies and polenta. Everything tasted homemade and was the definition of comfort food. Our waitress even heated up our raspberry and peach pie slices. I ordered a side of bourbon ice cream which took it to a whole other level. I will be coming back here again!
author: Joanna V.

description:
Went earlier this year for dinner.  Tried their cheese plate, salumi plate, sunflower sprout salad, seared scallops, and a pizza (though I can't remember which).  Everything was good, but not great.

Atmosphere was good with a nice covered patio in the back.

I don't regret going, but will probably not go back anytime soon; there's just too many better options in SF.
author: Bryce L.

description:
Fresh ingredients. A bit of a wait, but you can make reservations. The prices weren't bad. They have a choice of sparkling or flat water. 

I had the sunnyside joe's cheese thing. I was sort of expecting something else, but it was still good. I was thinking that it had the beef patties. I could have used some more meat. It tasted fresh (stated above) and was served in a skillet. 

Maybe it was what I ordered, but I was a bit underwhelmed.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Cute place in the Castro. 

One of the reasons I love SF for its foodie scene. 

Came here at lunch during the week and surprisingly was not really busy at all. They had an outdoor area in the back that's covered but you still get the feeling you are outside because of the wood benches. 

Would be awesome if they opened that up when it gets sunny in SF (which is rare I know.) 

I ordered: 
- Gazpacho soup- oh so fresh with avocados in it 
- Fish Tacos- so delicious 
- Tried the Margarita Pizza that my company ordered- very fresh with the mozarella 
- Rum ice cream! 

I'd love to come back and try other things.
author: Anya R.

description:
This was my third visit to Starbelly. While I had awesome experience the first 2 times. My last visit, tonight, was very awkward. I decided to take my dad and his wife, during their very first day in the US to this restaurant, as I thought I was going to get a great experience of Californian food, not far from where I live in SF.
Well, I am sorry to say that I was soon disappointed. Once we walked in and set to our table, the waitress completely forgot we were there. I had to call for someone to come and pick up our oder. Once the order was taken the food arrived, but it was completely mess-up. A regular burger, all the sudden, become a veggie burger ?!?!
When I ask for clarification, they decided to make a new burger immediately, but that escalated in a no-stop stop and go from our table with questions from different waiters and waitress  if we were enjoying the meal, checking on us every 2 minutes, keep interrupting conversations we were having.

Dear Starbelly staff,
I understand you understood you mess-up the table, but there are other ways to recover something so crazy!
We were not even ordering cheap wine. We oder one of the top bottle of wine from your menu, and expensive dishes. We were not there to save money...

In the past I suggested starbelly to friends. While I will see them during these holiday season, I will make sure to let them know not to visit this place again, as they don't really care about customers.

The overall feeling was that as our table was mess-up from the very beginning the waitress didn't really care about us any-longer . She was probably thinking we were not going to tip her, or something.  Well not only i left a tiny tip, but also this ugly review as I don't think this is honest neither professional, as I am coming to a business to spend money and expect a quality service at the price I pay for!
author: Ygor S.

description:
If you love the Mushroom and Gruyere sanwich at the Grilled Cheese Co. you HAVE to try the mushroom and gruyere pizza at Starbelly.  It ws heaven on a pizza crust.
Seriously, I cannot say too many great things about the food here.  The beer list was all local, and I love trying new things so the opportunity was not lost on me.  The crab cakes and butternut squash dumplings were fantastic.  And as you may have already read...the salted caramel pot de creme is absolutely delicious!
author: Kristal D.

description:
This place is great, the croque monsieur is BOMB!!!!!!!!  with gruyere oooooozing out of it...damn, i could probably just get a gruyere cheese sandwich and have been happy but the ham is good too and the bread, although i would have preferred a french roll or something, the butteredness on the sliced bread was delicious...really can't complain.  The fries were good too although a little salty for my taste...but, america loves salt so i wasnt exactly surprised.

the outside back patio is really pleasant, was here for a brunch and on a nice sunny warm day you could spend all afternoon in the back patio drinking and talking with friends.  also, they have a great urban garden going on with little tomatoes growing from the dividers between tables and succulent hanging gardens along the wall.

the place is a little pricy for basically getting a ham and cheese sandwich, but it's the castro in sf so really it's pretty average in price.  The server we had was nice, polite and considering there was a group of us kind of not paying attention he did a great job.
author: Jocelyn W.

description:
Oh how the mighty has fallen.

Let me count the ways.

Your hostess foolishly blundered my reservation for three, resulting in an unnecessary 30 minute wait on a Tuesday night.

Your false promises of free appetizers to rectify the situation was a cruel gesture since they never made it to our table.

Last but not least, the curiously short piece of curly, black hair interwoven between my creamily dressed dungeness crab salad was the straw that broke the camel's back. 

Mind you, I have long, dark brown hair.

I can safely say Starbelly will never be frequented by me again.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Gone are the days when every Tuesday I look forward to eating a menagerie of ridiculous portions in an all you can eat summer buffet. Le sigh. Gosh I miss those. 

Despite the fact that Picnic on the Patios are now very few and far between, Chef Adam still does a pretty nifty job at making great fresh food taste really really good. Brunches are great. Lunches are yummy. Dinner is still okay: it's usually too noisy, and the price points for the dinner entrees are not completely in line with the rest of the menus offered. 

The decor is cool, and the staff is quite attentive and nice. Oh yeah, another food tangent - I highly recommend trying the soups. And the terrine is amazing. And so is the gaspacho. Ah man, I do like this place. Also, the wine is well priced, so split a bottle, or two, or five. It won't kill you (or the bank)

Cheers!
author: Anthony B.

description: My daughter brought me to this restaurant.  I liked the modern mid century decor.  The host was pleasant and offered a room table in the back, away from the breezy front door.  Our waitress was pleasant.  We loved the roasted Brussels sprouts.  The white bean humus paired nicely with a slightly crisp flatbread. The water comes chilled or sparkling. The lovely chicory greens combined with the classic blue cheese, crisp apples and glazed walnuts combo made for an interesting updated salad.  The ranch burger ordered as medium rare came out medium rare.  The burger was sandwiched between a sesame seed challah bun, which was soft, tasty and slightly buttery. It comes with pickles, sliced tomatoes, red onions, and lettuce to add to your own desire.  A mountain of crispy, but not greasy, fries fills out the platter.  Upon exit the staff was friendly and courteous, which on a Friday night make any working stiff feel warm and comfortable after a hard work week.
author: K C.

description: I love the ambiance and the outdoor patio so much. There was a wedding party out on the patio while I was there so I'm assuming that this place is good for large groups/reservations. The food I tried was pretty good, although I only sampled a few of the appetizer plates (cheese plate, starbelly salumi) and desserts (sorbet, salted caramel pot de creme). I also tried a sip of a friend's drink (starbelly 75) and it was so so good. I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Lauren F.

description:
If I had written this review a few months ago, it would have been a lot higher than two stars. Listen, the menu is solid, and the food is tasty at times, and for the Castro there a few other peers.

But I have a three strikes rule, after 3.experience in the restaurant, I generally don't go back. The service has really fallen off here in the past few months, and i have had some pretty atrocious meals. Not that there's anything wrong with the food, but the service level just hasn't been there.

I'll revisit it again in a few months, but right now it's in the doghouse for me. Since it has few peers in the Castro, I hope it isn't a place that thinks it can get by just based on that.
author: Ken p.

description: One of my favorites in Castro. Healthy twist to usual intercontinental American hip foods. Hard for talking though as it gets super noisy you kind of have to yell to hear.
author: Griselda Z.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE!  We came in on a recommendation from a co-worker.  It was an extremely cold night and we sat on the heated patio which was lovely.  The service was great, the bathrooms were clean, and most importantly, the food was amazing!  I'm a vegetarian and their menu had so many options/small plates for me.  My boyfriend and I split the Brussels sprouts (amazing), hearts of palm salad (amazing), white bean dip (also amazing) and he ordered a pizza (can't speak to the taste bc it had bacon, but he didn't look like he had any complaints).  Their menu changes, and what I saw online was a bit different from what was actually being offered, and their dessert menu is lacking, but the actual food was great and I plan to go back here!
author: Jake H.

description:
Mediocre

They forgot our 2 orders of appetizer scallops twice.  I can see you forgetting it once then we remind you then you forget again?!?

I like Starbelly and I really wanted to like it as much as my friends from Canada liked it.  The food is good and probably above average, but how hard is it to make pizza, french fries, hamburger, and chicken?  That is a bad question because I have had bad burgers and pizzas before.  The only thing that really impressed me was the asparagus risotto that came with the Chicken.  It's a great place to dine.  Very cozy, nice ambiance, service was good.  I would come back here again.  I like how they have two options of waters, distilled and carbonated.  

The Castro is not known for such restaurants like this so it is a great addition. But.............is it good base on default?  

Will have to come back.
author: jason g.

description:
Been here twice so far, once for dinner the first week they were open and we went back for brunch last Sunday.  I don't get what all of the complaining is about, both of my meals were pretty great.

It's a beautiful space and I was very happy with the service.  On both occasions the staff was friendly and attentive.  I guess we timed it right because we didn't have to wait.
author: Bill L.

description:
This place is superb!  I love it.  The decor, ambience, food, patio, staff, I love it all.

The food is moderately priced and delish.  We had the chicken liver pate!  It's a must try.  The bread is soft, and the onions and mustard were perfect compliments.  YUMMY!

We had the mushroom pizza and the starbelly pizza.

Mushroom pizza- you can definitely skip, greasy and lacked flavor.

Starbelly-pizza beyond good.  We added farm fresh eggs, the bacon was amazing(house cured), and argula was fresh.  It was a very yummy pizza.

This place is definitely worth a try.

1 ice tea, 1 app, 2 pizzas, 51$ and we were stuffed.
author: Jessica H.

description: Well, in my previous review I only gave this place 2 stars...that was when the restaurant first opened. I've been back here many times since and have had amazing meals. Most particular the spaghetti...which for the most part, I'd never order. This spaghetti is special though...the home made bacon and the jalapeños rule the dish.
author: Matt V.

description:
Starbelly still has some work to do, but it has a lot of potential.

The decor is lovely and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  Not a spot if you're looking for a quiet conversation - its very loud and always busy.

The food is pretty inconsistent.  On my visit last night I ordered the "caesar salad with avocado and buttery croutons".  The salad arrived sans croutons and with a ridiculous amount of dressing. (And I'm not one of those "dressing on the side" kind of girls, either.) I had to send it back.  The second one came with croutons, but no avocado.  Being that its a salad comprised of only 3 items, it shouldn't be that hard to execute.

The cream of tomato soup was excellent, and I love the homemade ketchup and mustard that was served with the burger and fries.  They have an impressive wine & beer list, and the staff is helpful in making recommendations.

Brunch was a bit of a letdown - the french toast was incredibly bland and wasn't served with any kind of garnish, though they have since added some fruit so that will probably help. The egg sandwich didn't seem to match the menu description, but maybe the kitchen staff just forgot some items as they did with my salad.

I'm optimistic they can work the kinks out if they pay more attention in the kitchen, but I'll probably give them some time to do that before returning.
author: Rachel R.

description: One of my favorite restaurants for brunch or dinner. Delicious food, great ambiance and delicious drinks. If you can get an outside patio spot it makes this place even better!
author: Jody N.

description: I went here recently for dinner with a friend and it was so good. The atmosphere was low key, noise-level was low, staff was friendly, and the food was on point. Can't wait to come here again.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Oh Starbelly, how you failed me.  Where to begin?

We went in and asked for seats for 2.  45 minutes was the response.  Ok, so a walk around the neighborhood and we were just about there.  When we arrived we still had to wait to sit at the communal table.  The communal table is a big wooden bar.  We were put towards the end of the table, right in front of the open kitchen.  This meant every time a server went by I got a bump.  Fun!

We decided on our order and were about to place it when our waitress arrived.  She stated they were out of three things.  We replied "Oh, that was three of the four things we were going to order."  Our waitress's response, "Sucks to be you."  You read that right.

We ordered a caesar salad, margarita pizza as an appetizer, the chicken dish, the pasta with house marinara and a side of broccoli.  The caesar said was completely over dressed, it was swimming in dressing.  

Next up with be the pizza, or so you would think.  Our side of broccoli arrived.  We were completely appalled and were not sure how this happened.  Not wanting our broccoli to be cold when our entrees arrived we politely asked the waitress to please bring it back to the kitchen since we wanted it as a side with our main course.  As far as I know that is the definition of a side.  From that point on our waitress was no where to be found.

Someone else brought the other courses. The pizza was ok, but I felt the crust was not charred enough.  It tasted doughy to me.  My pasta was interesting, it had jalapeños in the sauce, which was just plain weird.  It also featured large pieces of bacon.  Half of them were under cooked and rubbery.  

The broccoli when it arrived on time was actually pretty good.

As a service recovery for our early side they sent us another salad.  It was ok, but did not make up for all that was wrong.  Our waitress finally re-appeared at the end of our meal, but still seemed scared of us.  

Our water was neglected for most of the meal.  At no point were we asked if we would like another drink.  On two separate occasions we saw two separate kitchen staff members ask when the last table would be done.  Having an open kitchen may not be the best choice when your staff does not want to be there.
author: Megan P.

description:
The good: Jalapeno and bacon pizza was a great addition to our table. The scallops were good in the corn puree, but kinda small; flavorful and tender nonetheless. The Buratta on heirloom tomato and crostini was yum. Oh, and the press coffee was very good, and enough to share. The atmosphere is also a lot of fun. 

The Bad: The crostini was too thick to bite into, so one had to cut it with a knife, where it became messy and fell apart (but still good). The service was decent, but not busy enough for me to be 'ok' when not checked on. But in all fairness, my water glass was never empty...

Not too shabby overall, and worth the walk in, but nothing really stood out... and when things aren't memorable one writes reviews that are, well, forgettable as well.
author: Vittorio L.

description:
YUM! Had a great meal here when visiting SF on vacation!  A guy working at a deli stand on Castro reccomended it, and I'm glad!  I had an awesome, yet strange, mango beer with a chili powder rim.  It was very unique and a combo of savery and sweet and refreshing. 

Instead of any of the yummy apps we had all 3 of their veggie sides: AWESOME! Cheddar grits with whilted winter greens was cheesy goodness, beets with chevre were AMAZING, and the chili brussel sprouts kicked butt!  Then we had the mushroom, onion, gruyere pizza, which was to die for! Thin crust baked perfectly... yum!

A lot of reviews said that people stood in line for a long time, being New Yorkers we went later on (closer to 10) for dinner and only had to wait 10 minutes or so for a server.  All in all, a great dining experience!
author: Stephanie M.

description: LOVED this place. Great atmosphere and phenomenal pizzas. Perfect to go with a group of friends and share a number of pizzas and cheese boards.
author: melina d.

description:
Such a disappointment.

One of the worst meals of my life.
I hate writing terrible reviews, but I still think about how bad my experience here was and we ate here months ago.

Our waiter was beyond rude, uncaring, and perhaps inexperienced?  
The food was lacking.
Half our order came out late or not at all.  One of my dishes came out cold!

At the end of our meal (while eating dessert) our waiter crudely told us to pay up our bill because he needed to finish his shift.

What a shame.  I really wanted another restaurant in the 'hood that I could like.

I will sadly never return.
author: Andrea F.

description:
For Brunch:

My husband and I stopped into Starbelly Saturday at 1pm (prime brunch time) and no wait. I loved the open, airyness of the space immediately. We were seated towards the back near the patio area. It was a bit chilly outside so we opted to sit inside (hello, SF in Feb!) but will definitely be back on a warmer day to take advantage of the patio.

Food was good- quick, lots of flavour and well priced for brunch. Latte was overpriced ($5) but was decent. We are on a no-booze stint at the moment so didn't get to indulge in mimosas or bloodies, but both looked good!
author: Seema M.

description: Stopped in late after getting out of an event. The staff was great about getting us in and taking our order! From the hostess to bartender can't say enough good things. As others have said the chicken liver pate was awesome. The burger a bit overdone but we ordered that way. Really liked the vegetable sides. Giving the 5 stars to acknowledge the staff.
author: mike w.

description:
Tonight was my third visit and again Starbelly did not disappoint. 

Thumbs up on the house made pasta plate with bacon and basil.My only snip is that there was not enough bacon.  That said I did not feel deprived of any  porcine goodness.  

The Prather Ranch Burger is a reliable option (go rare to get the full range of flavor from the beef). The fries are solid but don't ruin them with the ketchup ( Its Heinz) as the fresh aioli is a better compliment to them. 

Tonight, my dining companion had the blackened catfish which she enjoyed thoroughly. The best part of the dish (in addition to the sizable fillet of catfish) was the huge mound of risotto next to and under the fish.It was studded with tasso, okra and flecked with cajun spices that acted as a good counterpoint to the creamy rice. I wish they would offer it as a stand alone side dish. 

Seats fill up quickly so if you don't mind the communal table reservations for prime time dining hours are a good idea. My favorite seat is against the North wall on the back patio. Its comfy with a nice ambiance that allows you to take in the whole scene. 

Service is warm and smart without being too casual. 

This is a great place to come with friends or casual date.
author: Joshua W.

description: I love Starbelly for brunch on the patio with a Pimm's Cup or for dinner at the communal table.  We recently did a big group birthday dinner for 18 and they were great about letting us bring in flowers and cupcakes for the birthday girl.  We ordered a bunch of food and wine for the table and had a great time.  I'm not sure the rest of the restaurant enjoyed it, but we had a blast.
author: Caitlyn M.

description:
There wasn't much left on Urban Spoon, but as they have a bar area and do reserve some seats for walk ins, we decided to take our chances.  Even on an 80 degree Saturday in September (around 7pm), we were lucky enough to get a table right away (though the restaurant remained packed the rest of the night).

They don't have a full liquor license, but they get pretty creative with the cocktails: 
- Starbelly 75: Like a French 75 but with a ginger kick. 
- Champagne cocktail: prosecco and bitters, probably my favorite. 
- Pimm's Cup: pretty and pink, fresh with cucumber and basil.  
- Calimocho: cool presentation, served in a Mexican coke bottle.
- There was another champagne cocktail with some orange in it, which was also good (can't remember the name now)

And they have house sparkling water, which I love.

Onto food..
- Chickpea fritters: like very crunchy falafel, nice and salty
- Albacore tuna: seared, pink in the middle served with cucumber and avocado, light and good for summer
- Seared raw beef: like a carpaccio, loved the summer fruits on top (the meat itself was well seasoned, too)
- Burrata and heirloom tomato on crostini: loved their burrata, and this was probably the favorite starter
- Chanterelles: lots of flavor, topped with a small amount of cheese - this would have been great with crostini or over polenta
- Fig, blue cheese, arugula pizza: definitely add the serrano ham!  Thin crust, served on a high platter, good combination of flavors
- Prather Ranch Burger: with white cheddar, and we added an egg, which made it much better.  I actually really liked the challa bun since it soaked up lots of flavor but wasn't too heavy.  Fries on the side were ok (needed a bit more salt for my tastes, but I also enjoy way too much sodium)
- Pork sugo: served over baked polenta with lots of cheese.  The flavors reminded me of a lasagna, and it had a comforting, hearty flavor. This would be great on a rainy day.

Desserts:
- Warm toffee cake with medjool dates in thin dried strips, mascarpone.  This was the favorite dessert, though I think ice cream would have made it even better than the mascarpone cream
- Salted caramel pot de creme: not as rich as I expected, loved the rosemary cornmeal cookies!
- Humphry Slocombe ice cream: jalapeno bacon.  Not really spicy or smoky, but salty and sweet, which was good.  I'm not sure what happened to the jalapeno and bacon, though.

In the end, for 3 people, it was about $75 per person after adding in tax/tip, which wasn't too bad considering how much we ordered.  The menu has a good variety, so there's something for everyone. The space isn't huge, but it can accommodate moderately sized groups, especially out back on the patio. Parking wasn't too bad on 16th street.  Even though we got lucky, I would recommend getting a reservation.

Starbelly is not a place I hear a ton of hype about, but it has a strong following for a good reason.
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Unconspicuous restaurant, superb food and very reasonable prices.
the steamed mussels with home made chorizo is a must have.
author: Christophe B.

description:
I LOVE this place. The location (right in the smack dab of Castro). The vibe (it's bright and open and airy with very nice staff).  And the food (what I had was DELISH!).

We came here for brunch.  

I had the Asparagus scramble & fresh chevre, toast & choice of potatoes or salad for $11.  It was a DELICIOUS egg scramble with asparagus and yummy chèvre cheese.  The toast was also amazing and their strawberry-blackberry jam was to die for!  It came with a salad that was good although I could only eat a small amount of it.  

My sister had the nonfat greek yoghurt, seasonal fruit & honey for $7. She said it was very good.  She also got a side of the yummy toast with jam!  

I will definitely come back here the next time I'm in San Francisco--- shoot I might even go back before I leave - I have 6 more days!

Come here - it's worth it!
author: Jeremy R.

description: Food was great!  How could you make fried chicken better?  Make it smoky and real!  Asparagus soup was fantastic, sangria was good, definitely worth coming back to.
author: Roni L.

description: Great trendy restaurant right in the heart of most everything Castro. Great food and great service abounds in this restaurant from the smile at the door or the pizza, the only thing lacking is comfort!  I can only imagine the motivation behind the most uncomfortable seating ever constructed is they want you to eat and leave. Didn't McDonalds cover that design concept in the 70's.
author: Stephen F.

description:
I think I'm in love!

Today, we had a most awesome brunch at Starbelly. The service was friendly and the food very yummy.

I asked about a white wine varietal I had not tried before: a Picpoul de Pinet. Our  waiter, who was also running the bar, told us it was one of the most full-bodied whites they have. That sounded nice and it was great.

I had the most delicious sandwich: the crabcakes po' boy. The sandwich had a perfect balance of flavors and texture, with nicely ripe tomatoes and served on a sweet, soft roll. So yummy!!
author: José C.

description:
Went over lunch during Thanksgiving week.  The place was very quiet and the service was attentive.

The sandwiches were very good but I was most impressed with their drinks.  They don't have a hard liquor license but I had one of their tea drinks and they put as much care into making it as any cocktail.  It was super delicious, inventive and complex.

I would come back here just for the drinks.
author: Jean K.

description:
I'm just not impressed. 

I want to be impressed. A lot of my friends like you. I should like you too. But every experience has been blah. 

We came here for brunch this weekend and were sat pretty quickly. It wasn't too busy, yet our order felt like it took forever. When we asked if we could get some bread to snack on while we waited, the response was "you can order toast." I can't blame you for not offering a little snack, but the tone just didn't feel very friendly.  

I ordered the chilaquiles and was VERY CLEAR to ask if there was cheese in it. "Nope, no cheese." "So no dairy?" "Nope." So imagine my surprise when it comes out and there's a HUGE glob of sour cream in the middle. 

(Here's the menu description: "chilaquiles, house made chorizo, corn chips, chile sauce & cilantro, house salad 12.")

So if I asked you twice about dairy, why didn't you make the connection about the sour cream? And why isn't it marketed in the first place? There was a good chunk of my meal I couldn't eat because it was doused in this unwanted ingredient. 

My friends ordered the fruit plate and we weren't sure what to make of it when it arrived with the meal. Along with 2 pieces of an orange, there were 4 slices of an apple, all of which looked slightly brown and still had seeds in them.

Final Word to the Wise: Clarify carefully, skip the side plate of fruit, and get the fries instead.
author: Jared S.

description: Went here a few years ago and loved it.  Definitely plan to make a return trip some day. Great decor and fresh, simply prepared dishes.
author: Justin H.

description:
This is why I love the city.  This is why I miss the city.  I am very happy to be married and to have moved to the south Bay after being born and being raised in San Francisco.  But it's those little restaurant, neighborhood gems that I miss most about my city.  San Jose has a few, but definitely no where near city styled food.

I went to Starbelly with my brother and cousins during the holiday season.  I was not on my diet at the time, so cheating was just eating.  I ordered the burger with bacon (which is what they are known for, the bacon/pork belly) and we had a salad and chicken liver pate, savory and smooth and flavorful, and everything I tasted, tasted goooood.  I'd go back there except parking sucks (what's new in S.F. right?) so I'd try to go on a none-busy night and make sure to make reservations.
author: Susan C.

description:
My new love. Starbelly rocks my socks and it will rock yours as well :) I ate to my hearts delight - portions were appropriately sized, price was good, & the food quality was EXCELLENT. 

Things that i had that were AWESOME:
Fries (get these, SO good)
White Bean Puree
Starbelly Salad
Pizza - w/ a fresh farm egg
Seared Albacore Tuna
Pear Cobbler
Panna Cotta

Def one of my new regulars that I'll be visiting on a weekly basis. Everything on the menu looked amazing... you will not be disappointed!
author: linda t.

description:
I am always curious to read the negative reviews of a normally well-praised restaurant.  Do they sound like crazy people?  Do they complain about the inherent nature of humanity in unreasonable ways? Do they assign stars in a manner inconsistent with their own narrative?

Really?  I cannot give much weight to a review from someone who complains that a house-made, well-executed $9 quinoa burger is overpriced because it didn't come with enough sides.  You are either 20, regularly eat at Subway, or both.

Starbelly is transcendent.  Meltingly perfect pate with onion jam so good, I asked if it were available for purchase.  It was not, but our ever-kind waiter filled a pint soup container and packed it up for us gratis. 

We ordered other small plates.  Butter lettuce salad was clean and lightly dressed with perfection. Also fantastic were the pumpkin dumplings with brown butter, sage, lemon, and goat cheese.  My other half does not eat goat cheese and I asked that it come sidecar. After the dish arrived, our kind waiter spotted the cheese on top which we hadn't noticed.  Rather than taking it away, he left it for me to enjoy, apologized, and said he would bring another order out as requested. So thoughtful.

Also great was his recommendation that we forgo the pork shoulder we chose and opt instead for the pork "sugo", a shoulder stew with mozzarella over polenta.  He shared that since we were sharing, it had more pork to enjoy and was a more unique dish.  

A salted caramel pot de creme with savory-sweet cornmeal and rosemary cookies were a perfect finish. This was perfection. Again, the waiter steered us to this over the equally appealing arborio pudding with smoked almonds. 

Wine and beer selections were thoughtful and interesting.  Prices were very reasonable for fine food in SF, and the service could not have been more gracious. We had 3 'small' plates which were not that small, 1 entree, 1 dessert, and coffee, plus 2 drinks and the total was $90  Are you kidding?

Even the positive reviewers for this place say, "It's great for Castro."  Get over yourselves.  It's just great!
author: Joel D.

description:
This is a straight forward, relatively simple, Californian cuisine restaurant.  It has fresh ingredients, smart recipes, and consistent plates.  I go here at least 4x a year for a casual, but nice, dinner.  Consistency is key for this place.  I've never received a dish that has strayed from the mark.    

I'm surprised by the low ratings, but I think it's due to expectations that Starbelly is like a sack of stankywanky (magic) 'shrooms, which will bend your mind into understanding string theory as it relates to Ayn Rand's objectivism.  Check it people, this place is a standard Californian cuisine restaurant.  It's not trying to out-smart you.  It's giving you a straight forward meal that will leave you smiling.
author: Joel A.

description:
Let me begin by saying Starbelly is one of the few restaurants I justify commuting to the city for.. I was recommended this joint by a co worker because I love a good beer and burger.. I became a regular upon realizing the impressive beer and wine selection was far too vast to tackle in one visit.. 
My most recent visit has turned Starbelly into my number uno go to date spot. 
My server Nicholas patiently debriefed the beer, wine and cocktails and I opted for a Starbelly 75, a delicious concoction of sparkling vino grapefruit and elderflower.. First drink- my date and I ordered the same drink, bad news is one did not satisfy my pallet.. Good news is 3 more did.. 
4 cocktails deep my appetite started to kick in and I tried a recommendation from my server/ life coach and got the Pizza with fresh burrata being that's it's easier to share than my the burger I usually indulge in. 
Hands down best pizza in SF and you're a liar if you disagree.. or just too unfortunate to have tried it. 
I'll wrap things up with saying I had the burger for dessert and the lady got pot de creme which sealed the deal and made her agree to see me again! 
Do yourselves a favor and treat yourselves to a good drink and delicious food with out the annoying pretentious bull sh*t from other sf restaurants.
author: Kyle B.

description:
Tonight's dining experience at Starbelly was a nightmare.  I have never experienced anything like this in 10 years San Francisco dining.  Starbelly's staff was unable to handle a very small group of unruly customers, who through their obnoxious hand clapping, one-upping shouts of "ole!", and attention-calling clanking of silverware with glassware, had ruined the dining experience for over 60+ patrons in the restaurant, who were previously enjoying a decent dinner.

After 15 minutes of futile conversation, the six of us had to request the check and pack our food in the middle of dinner!!!  The wait staff was well-aware of the situation, and management had several opportunities to remedy the situation, but offered nothing but profuse apologies and paralysis.  We left the standard 20% tip anyway on the $200+ mid-dinner bill, but it was not deserved.

For a restaurant of this caliber, I would expect this type of situation to be managed.  As we left the restaurant, I overheard other patrons requesting the staff to "send them home".  We also received a few sympathetic head shakes from other commiserating patrons as we left the restaurant.  To end on a positive note, the spaghetti with bacon and jalapenos was pretty good!
author: David W.

description: Went for the first time last night, on a Tuesday around 7p. It was busy, we waited maybe 15 minutes but it was so we could have our own table instead of communal seating. I had the blackened catfish with risotto. Originally from South Carolina, I had not seen catfish as a menu option in awhile so I was excited. It was delicious, moist and the risotto with okra was thick and warm. My friend had the burger and said she would definitely order it again. They didn't skimp on the avocado either, which was great. I'd go back.
author: Ashley W.

description:
Very pleasant lunch today in the back patio area.  I have always liked Starbelly's thin crust, minimalist pizzas.  You can actually taste the components and not just a jumble of sauce and cheesy grease.  

Today's mushroom pizza was on point with fresh interesting mushrooms (not sure what type but they were tasty!), red onion and tangy gruyere.  The steak salad -- yup, get your red meat and veggies piled together -- was also delicious with medium rare hanger steak and crisp greens that were not overdressed.

Not too busy at lunch, so the hostess and servers were all very nice.  Yes, I have been in the evenings and sometimes service suffers when it is crowded.  But overall, the food is solid, the inside light fixtures are very cool, and the place stays open late even on school nights.
author: Yan L.

description:
Been there a couple of times the past month and have enjoyed each visit.  If you are not for sure what to drink, have your server suggest a beer.  The past two I have had have been excellent.  

The Flounder - AMAZING and I will have it again.
author: Ryan A.

description: What a shitty service was that. I didn't like the hostess at the door. Also the lady was serving the wine and good was rude. I even wanted to leave but my gf wanted to say in. Anyways the only good thing was ward working Hispanic people (amigos/amigas) in the kitchen they made very delicious pizza...
author: Mehmet D.

description:
OK ... not the best experience.. too spicy ... for porchetta ... too much bacon in the spaghetti.

The place is very nice ... right in the Castro ... service last night was GREAT.

Back to the real important thing ... food ... well ... it is a pity, maybe I was not very lucky and I will try it again soon.

The Porchetta dish I tried was too spicy even if the meat was well cooked and the greens that came with it were very good, but I could not taste the meat and yes, it was also salty ... I can feel both the salt and pepper this morning ... NOT GOOD!!

My friend took spaghetti, not sure which sauce, but he was warned it would have been spicy ... but they were NOT spicy ... on the contrary the bacon was not too cooked ... and a bit too much.

The dinner is actually closer to a 2 stars than a 3, but as I said, service was GREAT!!! I would not advice my friends to visit... but I will again in a while. 

It is actually set at the right price.

Sorry to say.., unluckily it meets the Castro's standards :(
author: Gianguido G.

description:
ive never had good chicken liver pate before but this place has really tasty stuff. The egg yolk over the goat cheese pizza was really amazing topped with some cured meat, fresh figs, and arugula. Finally, found pizza worth eating. if the crust underneath the pizza isnt thin and crispy i wouldnt eat it. they did a great job with the pizza. did i say that already?
the only dish that didnt really have any pizzazz was our antipasto platter. a variety of cured meats some figs, olives, cheese and bread. Nothing wrong with it just didnt fit in with the other creative stuff we ordered. service was average and pretty solid atmosphere for socializing. they ran out of a beer I wanted to try no biggy but hey you should be stocking your inventory properly right?
author: Joe C.

description:
The Rolling Stones have a notorious song called "Star-Star" on the album but the lyrics use a decidedly saltier phrase which describes people who are famous for sleeping with real stars.

I gotta tell you, I feel Mick Jagger after eating at Starbelly.  It's famous, but, honestly, what for?

The experience was a bit of a letdown for us after hearing lots of raves from friends and familiy.  The food was really average for the price and for the clamor and certainly not something I'd reserve far in advance for.

Some examples:  If you're going to feature pizzas on your menu in what has become a top notch pizza town (Delfina, Pizzette 211, Little Star, need I say more?) you need a crust that brings flavor to the party and  you need to top it well.  

Our server steered us toward the Margharita with prosciutto and arugula added instead of the squash pizza which included black garlic, saying it was the better choice.  What came to my table was a lukewarm, average-to-bland pie with tiny, tough little arugula leaves scattered on top, and then too-thick slices of American prosciutto strewn on top of that.  

To me, if you're going to serve prosciutto on a pizza, it needs to be thiiiiiinnnnnnn enough to bite through.  I don't need to be gnawing the ham off the slice or forced to chew an entire piece of prosciutto with one bite.  And why in the world would you not put the meat down on the hot pizza, then add the arugula on top.  You want the prosciutto to get a little heat from the pie more so than the arugula.  This feels like a pizza made by somebody who doesn't care about pizza.

My companion's spaghetti with bacon was ok, but oversauced and a little too sweet.

We started with dungenees hushpuppies which were also served lukewarm, undersalted, and a tiny portion for the price.

Interior is nice, service is quick and good, but I was disappointed by  the lukewarm, bland food.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Yelp's 2 star description about sums it up. Meh, I've experienced better.

I had weekend brunch here a year or so ago, so I decided to come back for lunch this week. Big mistake. Lunch vs brunch food and staffing must be completely different. I gave them a 2 instead of a 1 because they weren't super rude or anything, just not the least bit attentive. Given that we were the only customers in the front room, and there were plenty of staff hanging around the bar, I just expected a bit more. Even the bus boy was more attentive with clearing the dishes than the hostess or waitress was. She never looked over our way until we literally had to call her attention to order food and to get our check. 

The food was decent. The sausage pizza was good but the halibut risotto was bland. For this price point for lunch, I expected better. Definitely spending my money elsewhere.
author: Linda L.

description:
This is a review by a vegetarian

Pizza... for brunch.
PIZZA... FOR BRUNCH.

I hadn't been this happy for morning pizza since I ate a cold slice off a lover's tummy in bed (ok , I didn't do that. She would have woken up and wanted to share the leftovers)

..and it's good pizza. Towards the last two slices there was a little tip sog on the margharita but nothing drastic like the puddle that comes to the table at Delfina. The Neapolitan Nazis may not think it has enough leopard spotting or chewiness or the tomatoes haven't been blessed by enough Italians virgins (like those exist at the ages where they have enough motor skills to make a crossing gesture). It's very good.

Would have been 5 stars but the housemade ginger-honey brew is overpriced at $4 for an 8oz glass filled to the rim with ice. Also, the D.C.'s weren't as thrilled with their more traditional brunchy dishes. 

I'll be back to try the more Californian wacky pies.
author: Bob R.

description:
When they first moved into the space a few years back, I was skeptical. The spot had housed several restos with varying degrees of success but nothing worthy of note. 

My initial meal (shortly after their opening) was adequate but nothing I would rave about. Fast forward to the present and I can honestly say my opinion has turned for the better. 

Starbelly has come to be a neighborhood gem. There is genuine care to the selection of ingredients for each dish. And the desserts...delicious!! The caramel pot is unreal!
With so many eateries coming and going lately, I'm glad this one has not only survived, it's consistently thriving.

Taking one star for lack of full bar.
author: Miss N.

description:
Love the food, but you can't let an obnoxious party dominate the restaurant, and you can't let patrons leave unhappy without making some effort to remedy the situation.  

This reminds me of Gary Vaynerchuck's childhood customer service lesson: always make an effort to fix a bad situation at the moment it happens, or you will never have that opportunity again.
author: Tim G.

description:
So I finally decided to try this place out. I noticed as soon as we got the menu that they served Chilaquiles.  I was a little skeptical about it considering that it's a Mexican dish usually only served at Mexican restaurants, however they turned out to be one of the best Chilaquile plates I've had in the city. The tortilla strips had the right amount of crisp and sauce. I had never had them with chorizo, and that came with no dissapointment.   If you like Chilaquiles, you must give this one a try.

My buddy ordered a beed salad and he was completely satisfied with his meal.
author: Alex H.

description:
I'd heard good things about this place and was really looking forward to trying it out with some friends.  My first concern about this place was when I called to make a reservation.  Our conversation:

Me: Hi, I'd like to make a reservation for 8 on Monday?
Guy: Sunday?
M: No, Monday, May 30th.
G: Sunday?
M: No, Monday, memorial day.
G: Oh ok, 6 people?
M: No, 8.
G: What time?
M: Do you have time at 7?
G: Yeah totally
M: Great, 7 for 8 of us on Monday.
G: 7:30?
M: Wait, 7 or 7:30
G: 7:30, I can't do 7.
M: Ok.....
G: I'll see you at 7:30 on Sunday.
M: No...Monday, right?  Monday, May 30th.
G: Oh...yeah.  Monday for 8 at 7:30

I was hoping he was just having trouble hearing me.  So then we got to the restaurant and while we were waiting for the rest of our party to get there, we ordered some sangria and cocktails as we got there a bit early and were seated first. When the rest of our party finally came he told us that if we wanted a hamburger we'd have to order it now because there were only 8 left.  The boyfriend and a friend ordered one, and then he went off with the rest of the drink orders for the rest of the table.  The rest of the table got their drinks before we got ours.  We had to ask him to bring ours twice before we finally got them...even though he took our order way before everything else.

About half an hour later, about 10 minutes before our food came out, the waiter finally came to our table to let us know that they were out of burgers and the boyfriend and our friend had to re-order.  They ended up getting their food way after all of us.

I don't understand why they wouldn't have known immediately that it was out, especially since he should have put our order in to "save" it unless he just forgot.

I ordered the jalapeno bacon spaghetti.  It was good, but nothing extraordinary at all.

Overall, I'm pretty disappointed.  The food actually wasn't horrible or anything, but the service really wasn't great.
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
The food was good, the drinks were good, but the waitress (not sure her name) was extremely rude.  There was a group of ten of us, so I'm fine with a little slower service, but she was inattentive, and when we had questions she was often sarcastic and condescending (telling us the gin and tonic is zero dollars because they don't serve liquor, and arguing with one of my friends about an order of fries that she missed).  It wasn't in a cute/joking way, it just seemed rude.

The worse part was when we were paying.  We got the bill and it came out to $280 - we ended up leaving a $40 tip (just over 14%) because we weren't happy with the service.  As we were getting up to go she comes back and tells us (in that same condescending tone) "They don't automatically add gratuity like some places do, perhaps you want to take another look at the check" and she returned the check to our table, expecting us to leave a bigger tip.  I had left a tip on the card receipt - so it should have been clear to her that we didn't "forget" to leave a tip.

I will not be going here again, there are plenty of other places that have the same quality food, and much, much better service.
author: Mark F.

description: Came here with one of my girlfriends on a weekday and was seated right away. The outdoor patio is heated which is nice and a super cute space. We split a salad and a pizza and left nice and full. I definitely recommend the strawberry cooler for a drink  ( it  has no booze in it, but hey I had a few glasses of wine the night before and wasn't wanting to drink so I gave it a try and its sooooo delish!!
author: Leanna B.

description: Three stars for the food, drinks, and atmosphere.  Really cute covered patio area in the back.  The food was solid, but nothing to rave about.  Simple thin crust pizzas and other basics.  Note that its also wine/beer/wine cocktails only.  This could have been a four star if our waitress wasn't so rude.  She forgot a dish from our meal and insisted that we hadn't mentioned it.  That's fine, your word against mine, but if you're not into the customer is always right thing, at least be nice about it.  I might go back, but with so many other great restaurants in the city and even within a couple of blocks of this one, I may skip it.
author: Nicole D H.

description:
I'm a function over form kind of guy; I dislike the pretension of the trendy bars, what with their spindly chairs and arugula bisque with heirloom croutons.

So it took a bit of self-reflection to admit that, besides the high volume of the background music (what is UP with that?), Starbelly is really good food and outstanding service. The fried oyster salad with bacon and tomatoes was really good, as was the dry pan-roasted muscles. The white bean dip was okay. 

The cod brandade was a bit of a dissapointment for me, probably because I did not know it was going to be really creamy mashed potatoes without enough cod flavor for my clumsy palette to detect (spouse could taste the fish and loved it - go figure).

Our waiter and the serving staff seem to care about what they serve and our series of dishes came out quickly. They are open pretty late, which is still a challenge even in the Castro. I also appreciated their good use of space: in a small area, they have maximized the table space without jamming everyone together.

I would give four stars except for the price: for that much money, I expect pretty damn good, so it is just above average (3.5 stars). If I end up trying their patio seating, I will probably bump them up to four.
author: Richard H.

description:
Whenever I go to Starbelly, I always leave satisfied. 

It's the kind of place you don't find in New York: organic ingredients, free refills of your iced tea, excellent produce. 

Service is friendly and usually quite attentive. Preparation of the food is fine, so those good ingredients keep their integrity and flavor. 

My usual orders are: the really delicious Prather Ranch hamburger, the as-good-as-France chicken pate, salads and the occasional pizza. 

Starbelly is just a low-stress, high-quality, reasonably priced, casual place. I wish I could find one in NYC.
author: Jacob L.

description: Their green goddess pizza is the best pizza I have ever had! The pea fritters and salad was really good too!
author: Mrinalini K.

description:
4/5 solid, wonderful dinner!

we came here after being just "10 minutes" away. didn't feel like hitting up a scoutmob deal, so we drove over (it's a number of turns from soma, surprisingly), and were seated right after.

great service. a friend who had been here before recommended the pate, and oh goodness it was yummy! it was such a good portion too, with some nice crusty bread and decent marmalade. our server was really sweet and even got us some extra bread on the side, i guess we looked hungry/were indecisive. 

we also got the home-made spaghetti and the home-made chorizo pizza--both were very good. the spaghetti was hearty, but not too filling, and the bacon came in thick chunks and were definitely stars along with the pasta. the chorizo and egg pizza was also interesting, i was tasting some curry-esque flavors in it. i think next time we'd order something different though, because the 2 dishes were quite similar in profile. 

also split a bottle of wine, after our server was really nice and offered to bring out a couple tastings (normally don't get offered this consideration at other restaurants since our group is pretty "young").

overall, the atmosphere was good, the food and service were great. friend and i left talking about the next time we'd come back, and i think that is coming up quite soon!
author: Alvin D.

description: Definitely recommend the white bean puree with the smoked eggplant appetizer, though it was a bit on the small side.  Service was also excellent and friendly.
author: Ronnie S.

description: Simplistic, quality food and ambiance. The grilled peaches and pizzas were fantastic. I shall return.
author: Cassandra H.

description:
Have to rev up the star count to 5 as this place is always always Clutch. 
Been there when busy and not so busy. 
Last trip 3 of us ordered off the winter menu

1. Steak salad 
OMG!!!!!! To die for. This is a must get. 

2. Butter nut squash pizza 
We added bacon so it was sweet and savory and we ate the whole thing, delicious. 

3. Salad with pulled chicken 
Ok, thought the dressing was bland and the chicken wasn't seasoned, so was just ok. No pop. 

Service was solid and friendly even after a big spillage of lavender lemonade (also 4 stars)
author: J H.

description:
Chicken pate and star belly pizza with green goddess dressing is my usual picks whenever I have lunch at this place. 
Casual atmosphere, nice service, and food comes out quick! No complaints here
author: Dennis T.

description:
Good food and atmosphere.

The salad with smoked duck was a hit. Tasty pizzas with a chewy/thin crust - the fall squash & sage, black garlic, fresh goat cheese, toasted pepitas pizza was amazing!
author: Jessica P.

description:
"Your next review awaits..."

Dear Yelp,

I am sick and tired of seeing this on my Y page every single time I log on. I am an adult and can decide for myself what my next review will be.

Sincerely,

VB

Starbelly. I love Starbelly. 

Why you ask? 

The Chef here uses simple fresh ingredients that never over power any of the dishes. A few dashes of salt and/or pepper here and there and Viola! Awesomeness! (I stole this word, sorry about that).

Another secret, the pizza. Starbelly is not known for it's pies and with all the recent additions in San Francisco as of late, Starbelly is lost in the crowd and you never hear anyone ever mention them as being one of the best. Well they are. Again, very simple thin crust Italian style that include your traditional favorites such as the margherita which is outstanding. But there are also a few "weird" selections that I highly recommend you try. The blue cheese and fig which I believe is seasonal, so if you see it on the menu SNAG THAT SUCKER!

And another overlooked little piece of Heaven. The burger! Everyone these days is trying craft a kick butt burger. Starbelly has mastered the perfect burger! Sure Marlowe gets the pub, but Starbelly can hang with it. Are you listening Michael Bauer?

Don't be afraid of the location, as I never have any problem finding a parking spot. I would just suggest not drive down the middle of Castro and look a few blocks to the East. The later in the evening the more of a challenge, but just be patient and I promise you will find one.

Ok Yelp, what's my next review?
author: V B.

description: Starbelly pizza was phenomenal! Their secret sauce was delicious and the jalapeños added a nice punch! Highly recommend! Chicken liver pâté was savory and scrumptious. Cute date spot with dim, casual ambience!
author: Kimberly A.

description:
REDEMPTION!
My sad brown salad experience aside, I am happy to report that several subsequent visits to Starbelly proved to me that someone in the kitchen had an off day when they sent out spoiled greens.
Everything on 2 visits since was all I had come to expect.  Great food.  Great atmosphere.  Great service.
Bonus:  I have always loved their delicious thin-crust pizza, and recently tried a new combo.  I ordered the marguerita with the burrata upgrade and added house-made bacon.  OMFG! sooooo good!
author: Gary N.

description: Starbelly is the best place to take friends to dinner. Hands down. The pizza is incredible, the apps are amazing, and their wine list is fantastic. Definitely recommend.
author: Pat B.

description: Had a really good meal at Starbelly.  The chicken liver pate was excellent as well as the burrata with blistered tomatoes.  I had the fried chicken for dinner and it was good and went really well with Talbot Sleepy Hollow Pinot.  Hubby had the super yummy burger and our friend had the starbelly pizza which was also really good.  We saw a lot of reviews about bad service, but our service was really good, super friendly as well.  We'll definitely go back.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Love this place!  It is a solid regular dinner spot.  Great great super fantatic service.  Excellent food.  Wonderful atmosphere.  We come here every other week.  We live in the neighborhood.  

Love the fresh fresh spaghetti, with bacon and jalapeno, the pizzas are great, the burger is fantastic.  Their brussels sprouts are like candy.  And the toffee dessert with marscapone cheese is to die for. 

It's definitely on the heavy, comfort food side of the spectrum.  I love that it isn't a scene. You can get a table without a wait.  You can hear your dinner date's conversation without yelling.  And the place isn't filled with 20somethings getting trashed.  

All our servers have been super warm, friendly, attentive but not intrusive.  Wonderful!

Why not 5 stars?  Gotta save that for the truly remarkable and outstanding, like French Laundry.  

Would love it if they had a changing table in the bathroom because we often go with our daughter.
author: Jules a.

description: a really good place based on a wonderful design, i recommend the burger with their french fries, it was devastating ^^ thanks Starbelly you will see me again
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Reading my 2 posts, you'll peg me for a masochist...I'm not...just lazy - Starbelly is close to my office.

If Starbelly could get the heck out of its own way it could be PACKED all the time.

I took a pal to lunch recently and suffered...again, the odd-est service experience.  If you order a meal that includes a salad tell the patron to skip ordering the side salad.  If you see empty plates tottering on the side of a small 2-top, clear them.  If you see other patrons not taking the seats at the tall table you're trying to seat them at (while plenty of "regular" tables are open), move them. On and on.  I tallied my business lunches at Starbelly over the last 6 months; I will find another restaurant to spend the next $693.00 in the coming 6 months and beyond. 

Crazy.  Starbelly management - get it together, make sure you get fans to rave about it on Yelp and other sites and maybe I'll be back.  The 2nd star here is for the food - this is what I mean by "get out of your own way".
author: J. Santiago S.

description:
Unfortunately, my last couple of visits are convincing me that the quality of Starbelly's food is really going downhill. The service is usually pretty excellent (though some servers tend to be scatter-brained), but honestly, the food is suffering.

A few items are still great -- you can't go wrong with the pizza, spaghetti or charcuterie. But many of the updated dishes are just kind of, "meh" and the cooks aren't paying close attention to the quality of the food (clean your scallops!).

Step it up, Starbelly! I love you guys, but can easily go elsewhere for a great locals restaurant.
author: Zara E.

description:
There are just some times I feel like I'm not all that hip and classy. I ordered a cheeseburger here. I asked for Cheddar. It was white cheese - I was about to complain I ordered the Cheddar, but was kindly notified by a cohort it's white too. This was a moment I realized I need to get out even more in the city.

Ordered a pink lemonade type drink - was good. Overpriced. The liver looked like cat food and I can only assume is an acquired taste.

I feel like this is one of those places that tries really hard to be a gourmet restaurant - but just didn't cut it for me.
author: Pamela R.

description:
