This is a great place to catch up with friends or have a casual dinner with your significant other without paying too much. One of those rare restaurants where the quality of the food and the price of the food match. 

My Nom-Nom's
Grilled Little Gems Salad w/ goat cheese, tiny orange slices, hazelnuts 
(good; def ordering this again)
Chicken w/ butternut squash bread pudding, black bread & sage
Scoop of Humphry Slocombe Secret Breakfast ice cream
2 glasses of prosecco. 

my tab was $60 w/ tax and tip. 

sidenote: yesterday 4/6/11 was unbelievably windy and cold. Starbelly has a back patio and as soon as they offered it to me I cringed but hesitantly agreed to take a 'tour' w/ the hostess to see if it would work. Surprisingly they had a lot of heat lamps and it was much quieter. So if you're ever stuck w/ the back patio option, remember that it's just is good if not better depending on how you feel.
author: Maria A.

description:
I've been here 3 times (twice for brunch and once for dinner). Its a great spot for both meals.

What to drink:
Starbelly 75 was light and refreshing (I dont know if its worth 8 bucks though)

What to order: 
* You cant go wrong with their pizzas. My personal favorite is the Chorizo/egg pizza (its toooo good! If you like goopy eggs like me, this is your winner!)
* Braised pork with mole sauce... delicious! but I could've used a little more on my plate :)

Stay away from:
I've never had anything bad here, but I'd say the split pea fritters were underwhelming. 

A little room for dessert:
The pot de creme was good. The sea salt added a nice contrast. I think the rosemary shortbread cookie stole the show. I may have to try baking these myself.. genius!
author: Sofia R.

description:
Worst dining experience I've ever had in San Francisco.

The management and staff destroyed any opportunity of pleasurable dining.
author: Michelle M.

description:
A manfriend and I headed to Starbelly late-ish on a Sunday evening.  It was raining out, and the interior seemed cozy and warm and inviting - plus I'd heard about this place and wanted to try it out.

Our waiter was very nice, but we managed to inadvertently confuse and fluster him several times.  First there was confusion over our drink orders, since my first, second, and third choices from the "on draught" beer menu were unavailable.  we did get free tastes of Red Seal (not on the menu), which made up for it . . . and the friend's original beer order, which we didn't realize had gone through, also eventually made its way to the table.

We then confused him by ordering the beets and endive to start, with him only hearing the beets part.  I took charge and clarified this later, so it was again all good.  All told, we shared the roasted beets, endive dish, calamari, and butternut squash dumplings.  The calamari was amazing, and the curry mayo inspired.  I messed up by not realizing there was goat cheese on the beets until too late; we asked for it on the side with the butternut squash dumplings.  Unfortunately I am very sensitive to goat, so my manfriend happily relished the beets - he says they were good!  The endive was enjoyable.  And the butternut squash dumplings were delicious . . . except that it looked like someone had sprinkled some goat cheese on and then picked most of it back off (and tasted that way, too).  Sigh.

I will return at some point and carefully avoid the trendy goat!
author: Pam M.

description: The burgers, fries, and cocktails were really good, I will definitely be back!
author: Lorna H.

description:
We were taken here by a co-worker who was under instructions to take a group of us to a "neighborhood hot spot", and he really hit the nail on the head! This was a fun little place with great food. I was really excited to see the sangria jug as soon as we walked in. Their red sangria had a little spice to it. We enjoyed the fries with the 3 dipping sauces (I can't recall what the sauces were) and a few of us who had never tried liver pate were told that we had to try theirs. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked it. I think the onion marmalade helped. I got a burger for my entree and it was delicious. 

If you're in the neighborhood, I would definitely check it out!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Very good experience! We would definitely come again. The entire operation was quite smooth from making reservations (good availability on a Saturday) to food.

For starters, we ordered the split-pea fritters. The fritters themselves were very crispy and not greasy at all. The seasoning was a bit off and the bitterness of the splitpeas were a bit too pronounced. The curried yoghurt dipping sauce was clearly the best part - creamy, slightly sweet, tangy and savory. The starter was good and crunchy with a nice sauce, but otherwise unremarkable.

We both ordered the burger (mid-rare) with bacon and cheddar. Overall, the burger was excellent; the beefiness came through very well. The proportions of bun to patty were well chosen and the cook on the meat was about right. The thin shavings of pickles were well suited to complimenting the rich meat. The balance of all the elements comes together here. I'd come again just for the burger, but the fries were an excellent side - fried perfectly crisp and well seasoned, almost addictive with the burger.

The service was quite attentive, despite the bustling atmosphere (packed to the gills). We never waited long for anything and even at the end, the service was reasonably fast.

Unfortunately, the atmosphere is the weak point. The tables are awkwardly placed and the cheap aluminum frame seats really don't fit in with the wood features along the walls. The spacing between the tables also doesn't quite make for the most comfortable experience.

The pricing is more than reasonable and comes to around 20$ a cover when all is said and done.

An overall good experience. I look forward to coming here again for the brussel sprouts and perhaps a pizza or two to wash down with one of their cocktails.
author: Charlie H.

description:
My friend and I took in a test brunch today at Starbelly.  I adore the name.  The interior design is lovely - especially the long communal bar table with the bowling alley style counter top.  We sat at a bar height table, which was nice b/c it felt a bit private, but also felt just a tad too small (especially for ordering a pizza).  Our server Nick was super nice and attentive.  

My fresh squeezed OJ was delish and my friend said "ooh" when she took her first sip of iced tea.  She ordered the Greek yogurt with granola and fruit - it was a nice generous portion and she really enjoyed the zest on top.  I had a breakfast pizza with Starbelly bacon and a sunny side up egg.  The pizza crust was toasty and light.  I'm a   
big fan of crisp bacon and sadly the one on my pizza was not.  It still had delicious flavor, but was more of the soft ham texture than crisp bacon.  Now I know to request crispy next time.  BUT speaking of next time, there are so many other things I want to try that who knows when I'll get the pizza next!?  We also had the spiced chocolate Dynamo donut - I loved it, my friend wasn't a fan. 

The prices were very reasonable - about $33 for the two of us.  I'm looking forward to returning to explore the menu more, try dinner and see how they work when everything is in full swing.  Good luck Starbelly!
author: Mac M.

description:
I was here just about a week ago for brunch with some friends on a Saturday morning. We had made reservations the night before just to make sure we would not have to wait for a table. When we arrived they were just about to open and we were seated quickly in the back patio (really cool patio!!). I was afraid that it would be cold because it was a cloudy day but the heat lamps in the back made nice and cozy. 

We all order our food which took a good amount of time to come out, but since I have worked in the restaurant industry I know that the firsts items that are prepared take a bit longer too cook than those ordered once the restaurant has been open (pots and pans are not hot!). 

Anyways, the food looked delicious! and it tasted amazing. I have to say that I was a bit afraid first because I order "Chilaquiles" which is a Mexican dish of tortilla chips cooked with a sauce, eggs and chorizo, but the flavor was incredible. The coffee was really good too. 

The only thing (and that's why I'm taking one star) is that they were not hot. They were only luke warm and after just a few bites they were cold. I was disappointed at this. Perfection got away!
author: Ezekiel G.

description:
Ok, since the last review, the economy has tanked and everyone is unemployed and now Starbelly is just as I said, accessible.  The food is amazing here and I really wish the receptionist would have given us a better first impression but you can't hold on to that forever.
Starbelly is a neighborhood gem and shouldn't be missed.
author: Michael D.

description: I highly recommend the grilled little gems salad here. I have never had little gems grilled before, and they were delicious! I also had the liver pate which was delicious. if you like live pate, you should have it here. We also had the marinated beets which were very good. The only thing I didn't like was how big the chunks of goat's milk feta were. We also had the bacon pizza which was pretty good. By far though, my favorite dish was the grilled little gems.
author: Alycia N.

description:
If someone asked me "What restaurant has the friendliest staff in San Francisco?," my answer would be "Starbelly!"  I went for the first time a month ago and called this weekend for reservations, which they didn't have at short notice, but had the best humor in telling me so, didn't make me feel uncomfortable at all as it can sometimes feel like rejection when there are no reservations available at a restaurant.

As for the food, it was quite good, not four star but also quite reasonable.  The pate on toast, as every other review says, was amazing, however.  The pizza was very good.

I'll definitely be back!
author: Lauren J.

description: Went for brunch...delightful atmosphere, wait staff very nice and up beat.  Recommend this place to anybody visiting the area.
author: Butch C.

description: I just wonder how they haven't gotten in trouble with Dr. Seuss's copyright lawyers... I've never heard the term Star-Belly anywhere else. And given that the starbellied sneetches are sort of elitist (&racist) snobs, I don't quite know why one might name a restaurant after them unless the idea was to mock exactly the sort of folk who eat there.
author: Steven B.

description:
Oh, warm toffee cake with mascarpone & medjool dates, I crave you. 

Found this on 7x7's recommended dessert places, so we literally came here, just for dessert. LOVED the toffee cake, personally, I would get 2 and pass on the pot de creme....
author: Nicole L.

description: Food is good , service sucks ! They should hired people with better experience .
author: Rene S.

description:
i would rate this place 3.5 stars but i decided to round it up to 4 for the food. i will make this review straight forward and simple. we went here for a birthday dinner with a party of 4 people.

you have to the order the pizza, it's a MUST, not an option, it's good. for the drinks, they're o-k, i felt like it was diluted with ice, so i'm not really sure about it. but the food, one word to describe it, it's good. 

so the entrees we ordered are:
applewood smoked chicken: it was goooooood, perfectly cooked, moist and flavorful. and the rice was delicious.
pork shoulder: a liiiiitle bit on the dry side, but flavorful, still good.
bavette steak: one word - delicious. we ordered 2, so one was medium well and medium, perfectly cooked and seasoned. 

i recommend this place for food, since my rating is based on the food (not drinks). the service here is so-so. i just wish the server was more attentive and friendly, it was hard to get her attention when we wanted to order and when we were taking our order, she didn't seem to be knowledgable on what's on menu, or she just didn't care (it was probably not her day, don't know). Will sure come back here again! hopefully for a better service.
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
I've been dying to try Starbelly for awhile since I used to pass by it at least once a week and it was always, always happening looking inside.  I wanted to see what all the fuss was about and finally got the chance to when I was in the hood.  I went here sans reservation on a Saturday night after The Little Mermaid Sing-Along at the Castro theater (another awesome thing you Yelpers need to get your butt to).  As expected, the place was brimming with folks.  There were about 3 big parties ahead of us and we were given a 30-45 minute expected wait time.  I usually hate waiting but decided to grin and bear it.  Luckily a space opened up at the bar and we were seated in 15 minutes flat.  Woot!

The space here is modern and warm.  It's not too small like most SF restaurants though they could use to put more bathrooms in a place that gets so busy.  The bartenders who served us were friendly - they offered us sips of the wines we ordered to make sure we liked it first before they poured the entire glass.  We ordered our food and vino pretty much within 5 minutes of being seated and within 15 minutes, our plates of food were presented to us in all their delicious glory.  Points for serving us quickly on a busy Saturday night, I turn into a monster if I don't get dinner in my belly by 10 pm. 
 
We ordered the burrata appetizer, my friend had a pizza, and I had the fish dish.  The burrata was not the best I've had, but it was up there.  My friend's pizza was good too, but again not the best I've had either.  The fish dish had a creamy yummy sauce that made my hungry belly happy .  We ended our meal with an apple crisp sans ice cream.  Unfortunately they were all out of Humphrey Slocombe secret breakfast so we were a little disappointed - I think the crisp would've tasted better with it!  

The pricing is about as expected for a restaurant like this so I can't really complain about that.  Between the two of us we spent ~$80 for appetizer, wine, entrees, and dessert.  Overall, a great place to go on a date or to celebrate a birthday or anniversary.  While I'm not sure I would go back unless I'm in the neighborhood again as $80 is a bit much for me to spend regularly, this is definitely a neighborhood gem for you Castro folks.
author: Jean A.

description:
Our reservation was made for 11:30am. Due to difficult parking, we got there a little late, which seemed to be no problem. 
Keep in mind, you'll need to find street parking, so come early! 

We walked in and our hostess pretty much sat us immediately. We chose patio seating since it was finally a nice day in SF. Since it was nice I didn't expect them to have their heating lamps turned on, which was definitely a con. It did get a tad too warm over the course of the meal due to seating, but it was expected. 

We started off with a bottle Alois Lageder (Pinto Grigio). Light and very yum! I finished 1 glass before our salad even came out. 

We ordered the Crab Louie Salad, which was extremely delicious. Romain salad lightly tossed in dressing. One egg. Cherry tomatoes. Fresh radish pieces. and a large amount of fresh crab on the top. When I say large amounts, it was chunks of crab meat! I really didn't expect that. 

Next came our Pizza. Wasn't too sure when ordering, but really glad we made this choice. We picked the Wild Mushroom pizza and added prosciutto on top. This was absolutely amazing. The mushrooms were fresh and it was topped  generously with prosciutto. 

Well, they offered donuts for dessert, but we decided to pass since we couldn't find any raving yelp reviews about them. 

Finished the last lick of our wine, and wandered off into the day. 

I highly recommend Starbelly, the food was delicious, the service was on top, and it's a cute place to go for a quick date.  

P.S. Thank you to my boyfriends boss that got us a gift card! :) Was the best experience!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
This place is a wonderful place to have a great dinner with friends.  Their italian inspired dishes seem to all be amazing, their pizzas are killer.  They have a lot of beer and wine to choose from.  I love the ambience, but the highlight of the night was the Pot de Creme.  Basically a salted carmel jar of heaven.  

The location is amazing, pretty much the best place to go in the Castro area right now.  A great place to go for a B-Day.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: I dont write very many reviews on here and this is why:1) Its a waste of my time and yours to write about how a place was just ok or worse(there are plenty of you doing that already). 2) Not very often does it all come together with a restaurant experience. Starbelly, however,  has been able to do just that. A combination of cool atmosphere, over-the-top service, and awesome food complete the trifecta of the kick-ass restaurant experience that indeed deserves to yelped about. Go see for yourself.
author: Norm N.

description:
I'll start off with the positive(s):

Pizza? Love it.
Eggs? Love it.
Eggs on pizza?  Who would have thunk it?  LOVE IT!

It's a great place to reunite with sorority sisters  (because we can be loud)and the best part about this place was there's NO WAIT.

On with the negative(s):
Everything else was just OK for me.  The donuts didn't impress me and the menu was quite disappointing.

Parking of course sucks; luckily I didn't get a ticket for parking a block down from the restaurant in the (faded) painted red curbside (heck, everyone else was doing it!).
author: Thuy H.

description:
Great food, service is average, restaurant logistics is poor. DON'T go there with more than four in a party - they are not capable of serving the table with food at the same time and someone will be waiting for their meal which puts a real downer on the evening.

We should have known it was going to be a problem after waiting an hour for a table despite having reservations. As it turned out, one of my friends eventually canceled her meal because the entire table was pretty much finished.

My friend's husband spoke to the chef/owner and he blamed the customer - interesting approach! No apology and nothing comped but the canceled meal. We should have removed the gratuity and tipped accordingly, but it was already included automatically for large parties.
author: Yamaha H.

description:
Oh my god. The fritto misto. I just can't even. So good. Best fried oysters ever. Not even close. I didn't think you could really make that dish taste any better than your standard fried oysters and stuff out there, but I was so wrong! Also, my friend Jon is the ultimate dining companion because he insisted on counting the oysters in advance and cutting one in half so we both got the same amount. Because you know I would cut a bitch if he tried to take the last oyster when I thought it was mine. 

Everything else was also delicious. (We got the burrata basil pizza and added bacon, the beets, and a bottle of malbec). Great vibes, fantastic and stylish staff, good times all around.

I know I'm being awfully liberal with the five stars lately, but, well, stop being awesome San Francisco. Just saying.
author: vanessa r.

description:
Huge fan! I came here on one of my monthly girl-dinners and this was another wonderful choice! I love the feel of the place--dimly lit with a warm and rustic charm. Service was top notch and the food was delicious! 

We shared the burrata dish and I had the spicy spaghetti. To this very day, I think of that burrata. It was the first time I had burrata, but definitely not the last. It was topped with some black pepper and olive oil and eaten with crusty bread. Can you say heavenly? The spicy spaghetti was another winner. How can spaghetti with bacon in it not be a winner?! Impossible. It was also the right amount of spiciness and the sauce wasn't watery or too thick. It was perfect! 

All this wonderful food came out to around $35/person and everyone had the white wine sangria and an entree. Try this place--it is a winner!
author: Angela L.

description:
4.5 stars for the fried chicken sandwich!!!  Very crispy chicken with a radicchio vinegar slaw and aioli on a soft sesame bun. (5 stars if it was a cabbage-mayo slaw. mmm mayo) I am totally addicted.

(I had a real dinner here once and it left no impression on me. Don't have any clue what I even had.)
author: J. R.

description:
Have since gone back and have a few more tidbits to share.  The Darjeeling tea with lime, basil, and egg white.  Holy crap, it is so, so good!!  One of the best non-alcoholic drinks I have ever had.  Also tried the Madeira Cobbler (alcoholic) at the suggestion of the waitress.  It was good, but nothing so special as the tea "cocktail."  

Service was better this time, so maybe the slowness during our first visit was just a fluke.  Though the hostess did seem a bit overwhelmed, and she seated a party of 4 with reservations (we were in the same boat) before us even though we arrived well before them.  

Tried their popcorn clams and baby octopus.  Both good.  I love the idea of their "snacks" - I want to try all of them!  Also got the Starbelly Salad, which is not as good as their butter lettuce salad (with figs and hazelnuts), but still pretty good and only $5.  

Tried a different pizza - chorizo with sunny side eggs this time.  Also good, but I think I preferred their margherita pizza from the first visit.  Am looking forward to sampling more of their pizzas, particularly the one with wild nettles.

Finally, got their lamb cheeks with white cheddar grits and braised greens.  Yum!  Too bad I was so full by this point that I couldn't finish it all.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Leslie L.

description:
Service here is excellent.  From the hostess to the waitress to all the staff who helped us in between.  The hostess was incredibly polite to the indecisive party with no reservations who made me wait an agonizing 2 minutes to walk up and say, "reservation for 4, Vena."  We were seated immediately and our super hot waitress helped us the rest of the evening perfectly and kept the Sauvignon Blanc  flowing.  Yes, I'm drinking white wine these days, less alcohol.

The food is superb.  The standout for me is the hominy soup with carnitas.  Pan seared scallops are self explanatory.  I heard they have great pizza and sure enough, the starbelly bacon, jalapeno, arugula & green goddess dressing pizza is amazing.   For dessert we jumped into the warm toffee cake with mascarpone & medjool dates and the salted caramel pot de crème, rosemary cornmeal cookie.  Thanks pop for giving me naturally low cholesterol cause mascarpone and pot de creme must have slowed my heart down at least  a couple beats per second.
author: Corey V.

description: This little gem gets 4 stars simply because of the location, the wine list, and the venue. Conveineltly located in the castro with some street parking nearby, as well as a nicely curated wine list allow this spot to be one I will definately be returning to. The food is tasty but not overwhelmingly memorable. Plenty of seating and also has a nice covered outdoor patio space as well.
author: Kelli G.

description: Everything about this place is great. The service, the management, the atmosphere, and the food. I am lactose intolerant and they were extremely accommodating. The manager was attending all of the tables throughout the night including ours and making sure everyone was enjoying themselves. Our server, Juke was very attentive even though she was clearly bartending as well. We ordered the white bean purée, the summer squash, and the starbelly pizza. Everything was absolutely delicious. And the prices were also very reasonable for the quality and location.
author: Rebekah L.

description:
Ambiance - Great.  Perfect place for a date or a group.  Long table is great for groups.  Smaller tables with normal seating available but also those with high chairs and candles.   Outdoor seating available.  Didn't get to try.

Food - chicken liver pate - my favorite.  Didn't expect such deliciousness to come from chicken liver but I was amazed.  Fried chicken fingers - 2 of 5 stars.  Spinach salad - 4 of 5 stars - it was missing a certain pizazz that I couldn't quite put my finger on.  Risotto - nothing special - 3 stars.  

Service - waitress was all smiles and eager to help us and answer our questions.

Great place!
author: Hanna Y.

description: Nice atmosphere (couples at hightops, friends and families at community table) and delicious food. I had the trout, which was perfectly seared, along with the white bean puree and bread/olive oil appetizers. All were great. I was also very pleased with the spicy tomato juice, a nice alternative for those of us who prefer non-alcoholic drinks.
author: David Z.

description:
We had an A-OK dinner here the other night. Service was wonderful, but the food was not very memorable.

Bests:
Burrata di Stefano
Brussels Sprouts

Just OK:
Chicken liver pate
Pumpkin dumplings

Worsts:
Starbelly Bacon Pizza
author: K. D.

description:
I went here for the first time last night to celebrate a friend's birthday. I was excited to try it out and looking forward to a new place to try. Even though we had reservations it took about  15 minutes to seat us.  Unfortunately, the table appeared to be best for 6 rather than 7.  I got the corner seat and was bumped into by the staff frequently.  Our waiter was nice, but it took a long time to get our drink and food orders. The food was ok, but not to the quality I'd attribute to the atmosphere.  This was basically American fare. Nothing to special.  My friends has burgers mostly and appeared to be pinker than what they specified.  Later, we still had to remove our last beer from the order since it never came.  

In the end, the food was just ok, the atmosphere was fun, but the service killed it.  Unfortunately, I won't be going back to Starbelly.
author: Andy S.

description:
What can you say about the worst meal you have ever had in San Francisco? I am so sad to say I have had better food at the airport.
We ordered the frito misto, crab salad and a margarita pizza.
Before I dive into the food after four visits it is clear there is no one home taking pride in their craft, restaurant or neighborhood. With that said I have worked in the Castro for years and it can be a challenge but it can also be a blast. Instead of enjoying the community and their space it is just a turn and burn money making chain.

Frito Misto: I have never had a bad frito misto in my life and I would have never thought it possible. It's like making bad french fries. It was made of the thinnest slivers of onion, tiny green peppers and carrots. Flaccid and super thin veggies. It looked pathetic and I don't know how you could possible remove the taste of an onion and pepper but it was flavorless and unseasoned.

Crab Salad: I absolutely love love love crab and to drown it in a mayonnaise dressing was so very sad.
The frisee was so saturated it just looked like a white blobby mess.

Margarita Pizza: The crust was way too thin in the center leaving the sauce and cheese to saturate to pool in the middle.
author: Gee C.

description: Varies between four and five, but really I can't dock them for anything so we're going with five. The food is great. It's inspired us to make our own balsamic brussels sprouts at home (yes, brussels sprouts can taste good). Yummy thin crust pizzas. The fries are good so is the burger. Other items vary due to season. The service is great and they're always prompt to seat us even without a reservation.
author: Heather R.

description:
This is the best restaurant in its immediate area, so I'm not sure why it's rated so low here on Yelp, and considering that it used to be an Asqew I think the neighborhood did wonderfully. 

Though you need to know that this is a $$$ not a $$ restaurant.  

The food has been great and high value every time I've been in.  

Most recently we had great salumi with pulled rabbit, grits and greens that were really fantastic, awesome chicken liver pate, some really good scallops, plus a really decent pizza.  The salad made with peaches, cheese and hazel nuts is also really delicious. 

Service was a touch slow (but not like European slow), and the drinks were a lot better than you'll find at most places that don't have a hard liquor license.

End game:  If someone asked me "where can I get a nice meal?"  As opposed to say a cheap meal or a quick meal. It's one of only two restaurants near the Castro I would feel comfortable recommending to people I actually like and want to think well of me.

Edit:  Gee, Luke--you dipshit--you forgot to say anything about the desserts.  You should get some.  The toffee cake is outstanding.  And they make really good Mexican chocolate and salted caramel pudding.
author: Luke M.

description:
Good food and passable service. They are good but not quite as wonderful as they might think they are. 
On a side note, for a lateish Sunday meal on the patio, beware the tragically hip 20's, fresh off the plane, train. bus from Boise, Des Moines, so enthused that they are in the city and wouldn't their friends just be amazed at the coolness they have acquired.....all shared at dive bar volume. 
Not just one table, but three.The staff was friends with a few of the yobbers and spent an inordinate of time being amused by the story of someone throwing up - told three times with much gusto, particularly focused on the actual moment of expulsion.
Hence the passable service note above.
author: Seraphim R.

description:
I was excited about this place when it first opened up, but have been there twice now and left disappointed (once without having even been seated) both times. 

The first time, the food was pretty bad. And definitely not worth the wait and the poor service. I ordered a "breakfast pizza," which took forever, and when it finally arrived, I was truly disgusted. I RARELY send food back; practically never, but this was not ok. The "pizza" came out with what looked like a completely raw egg cracked on top. I have no problem with an over easy egg; I'll even enjoy an egg sunny side up on occasion, but this was raw. Like cracked on top of the pizza, placed in the oven for a few minutes, and then brought out to our table as if I was honestly expected to eat it, raw. No thanks. When I asked the waitress to send it back to have the egg more thoroughly cooked, she argued with me about how it was "supposed" to be. 

I should have taken this as a sign and just written Starbelly off my list entirely, which we basically did for 6+ months. But no, I had to go and try to give them a second chance last week, which was a mistake, and we didn't even make it to the table. 

It was one of those rare warm evenings in SF and my wife and I wanted to grab some dinner where we could sit outside and enjoy the beautiful weather. Starbelly, having rightly anticipated that this is what people would be after on such a nice night, decided to impose a prix fixe menu on anyone wishing to sit outside, at the cost of @ $25/person. To be fair, the menu they were offering looked great, but I just wasn't hungry enough to eat my weight in roast pig and mac & cheese. While I'm sure they thought this would be a great way to take advantage of the nice weather and make a little extra money, it just came off as a way to take advantage of their customers. Honestly, they would have been better off imposing a $10 surcharge per person to sit out back.  At least that would have been a more honest approach. 

We left and went and enjoyed a wonderful dinner at Catch, just up the street. We grabbed a prime spot on their front patio - for no extra charge.
author: Natalie N.

description:
I love beretta. I love delrosa. But not a fan of starbelly. Service was terrible.. Our waiter took a good 12 minutes to flag down every time we needed something. The food was simple but lacked good flavor. We had the chicken wings- weird aftertaste and kinda smelled like gasoline, french fries- nothing spectacular but kinda burned, and pizza- just missed that extra kick that I'm used to tasting at other pizza restaurants. 

I'm so disappointed with starbelly.. their sister restaurants are fantastic but it was a waste of time and money eating here on a Friday night.
author: Joy A.

description: You can't go wrong coming here for brunch/lunch. I like their micheladas but they also have really good lemonade and coffee. Food is so good here. Fried chicken sandwich with siracha is out of this world. I had try the spaghetti as well and let me tell you they have the best spaghetti in town. Service is very attentive and friendly.
author: Alex R.

description:
My boyfriend and I needed some cheering up, so we went to Starbelly, in hopes of getting some food love. Starbelly sure put out for us.

 I got the lavender lemonade and it was so refreshing. I might need to try making that for myself at home. For dinner he got the Pork Sugo. It was rich and flavorful. I don't usually like pork at all, but I have to say this was delicious! I got the Bavette Steak, and I was thoroughly impressed. I'm pretty picky with my steak, and I have been disappointed by so many, but this one delivered on the delicious.

Omg, and that ice cream! Then the Pot De Creme! The point is, nom nom nom. 

Thanks, Starbelly! We'll be back.
author: Ginger j.

description:
Service=good! very friendly and informative

Food= Loved the mushroom pizza and secret breakfast ice cream.

Atmosphere= casual and comfortable... interesting lighting fixtures made out of cardboard

Homo factor= it's in the castro so no problems 

Price=Average

Hostess= we were greeted by the chef when we walked in... super nice guy.

Bathroom= clean
author: Annmarie K.

description: Had just finished B2B and the soreness and pain was kicking in and my friends wanted to treat me to a meal before sending me off to SFO. It was a clear beautiful day so my friend Jen L. suggested this place and we ate outside. It's a really cute spot and I ordered the burger, which I inhaled, which running/walking/crawling a 12K will do to you. Fairly tasty. My friend's fiancee's chilaquiles was really good.
author: Jen K.

description:
We walked in on a Thursday evening and the hostess asked if we had reservations, we said no and she was a little bit rude, but just a little bit so I let it go and we were seated at a large and nice communal table. We had to wait a while to be greeted by our waiter who was nice enough, but moved pretty slowly for a waiter in a busy restaurant. 

My girlfriend and I ordered the scallops for a starter and the catfish plate to share; the scallops were really good, but the catfish with risotto was served with tesa (flat pancetta) which I failed to notice on the menu. I don't like pork at all and the flavor of it overpowered everything else, fortunately my girlfriend loves bacon so she ate it. Our waiter never stopped in to check on us so when I wanted to order something else we had to flag him down. I decided on the ahi "salad" instead, which  was served over shredded beets, avocado and some kind of sauce, but it wasn't really a salad at all- at least not a good salad; the tuna was fresh enough and OK, but it was far from great. I asked a waitress for some bread, she said she would and then close to twenty minutes goes by, I've finished my salad and there's no bread. The waitress never brought me the bread. We had to flag down our waiter again to ask for the check,  we pay and ask for change, but then he forgets to bring us our change- apparently he thought he deserved a large tip- we asked for the change and left. I noticed that there were a lot of servers and yes, the place was crowded, but we would have appreciated better service. I really have no desire to go back.
author: Natalie M.

description: Awesome patio, great burgers, nice casual vibe, good beers and the dessert -  Caramel Pot de Creme -  was to die for.  Only complaint - the buns could be a bit better as they tasted kind of like hamburger buns in a bag from Safeway...
author: Paul K.

description: The chicken pate was delicious. It is a MUST try item. I ordered the loco moco and that was well marinated and cooked.
author: Gary H.

description:
Not bad for a $11 Margherita. 
But still...an $11 Margherita.
What's an $11 Margherita?
All about not having the right cheese, tomato and basil.
Easy fix if you don't have high expectations.
author: Dario B.

description:
Had some small plates and a pizza, was all fantastic!!! Thin crust pizza with beautiful mushrooms- Cornbread was warm and delishes!! French fries were the best Iv'e had in a while-
Dessert was brought out by the chef and was top notch- toffe cake was awesome and even better was the pot du creme!!!!!!
Will for sure go back!!!!
author: ryan H.

description:
Went here on the basis that it is a sister restaurant to Berretta and It did not disappoint.  Decor & ambiance were excellent and service was in line with everything else, awesome.  Very attentive waiter that was prompt & offered excellent suggestions.  Please do yourself a favor & order the scallops.  However, everything at the table was excellent.  Highly recommended & I will visit again soon!

I dropped 1 star from original 5 star post because lunch service was very poor and inattentive in an almost empty dining room, however, the chicken liver was great as was our other selections.
author: Zack H.

description: So good! We arrived fro LA thinking all American food was terrible, but Starbelly proved us wrong. Great service and our meals were fresh and innovative and tasty! Thank you!
author: Ryan H.

description: The pizzas here rock!!!! The wines are fab and the waiters are cute. The bathrooms are dark yet clean. The wait staff are very attentive and patient.
author: R C.

description: This place is one of my castro go to's. I've only ever had one bad experience there, and it was a combination of their fault and ours so I didn't think it was too big a deal. The loco moco at brunch is one of my favorite dishes in San Francisco.
author: Luis H.

description:
Food: Delicious

Service: Polite but thoughtless. If I order a dish (the delicious chilaquiles) that comes  with a salad and then I order a salad, why on earth wouldn't the server tell me my dish came with a salad? I was stunned! I didn't complain directly to the server because I was being treated to lunch -- it would have ruined the vibe -- PLUS I SHOULDN'T HAVE TO. What a ridiculous amateur gaffe from a staffer of such a notoriously foodie restaurant. Glad I didn't have to pay for it. Yes, this is a passive/aggressive post. Wish I could have spoken up in the restaurant.
author: David V.

description:
I've been here for dinner a few times on weekends and it's always crowded with a wait of about 45 min. I always thought the service here was pretty great until a bartender decided to splash dish water on the back of my shirt. They attempted to make up for it, which was nice, but I was definitely still put off.

The food overall is decent. Must haves are the liver patte and pot de creme.

Spaghetti (with pancetta and something spicy) were not so good.
author: Marty G.

description:
We've now been to Starbelly twice, both times attracted by the atmosphere and fact it's close by. 

Our first impression was that the food was solidly mediocre and staff was below-average in friendliness and familiarity with the menu. Anyone can have an off night, so yesterday evening we gave it another try. 

Overall a disappointing experience: waitstaff was again unfriendly and extremely rushed; our french-fry appetizer never came out; and our 16-dollar margarita pizza was decidedly cold, sparsely covered with cheese, and overpopulated with wilty arugula. 

The manager apologized after we commented on the food and missed dish, and while no reparations were expected, none were offered or made. 

Hope this place will turn things around both in the kitchen and front of the house. Other than food and staff, It's a nice space in a good location.
author: Haley B.

description: The margarita pizza was amazing! I also had the salumi plate which was a perfect start. Great lighting as well.
author: Stacy W.

description:
Yes, still a fan of Starbelly!

Got ressies the same day for a party of 4 on a Friday night at 8:00pm.  It wasn't as crowded then my 1st visit so we could actually hear each other talk.  

We shared a bunch of dishes and of course ended up with leftovers.
Fries - classic staple.  just enough salt!
Polenta Fries - average
Starbelly Salad  - fresh greens, light dressing - on the small side, but perfect for 4 to share
Burrata di Stefano - delish.  one of my gf's mentioned she wasn't super digging the black garlic but I thought it was fine
Squash Pizza with black garlic, goat cheese, etc - enjoyable
Apple & Blue Cheese Pizza w/ Proscuitto - tasty & potent.  by this time consuming 3 different distinct cheeses was enough.   

For dessert we all shared the Salted Pot de Creme - thanks to friends for this suggestion - it was a perfect way to end the dinner along with french press coffee.  

The service was again on the slow side, but I'd still come back.
author: Meredith K.

description:
Definitely an undiscovered gem in the Castro.

This gastropub is aesthetically pleasing with a lively, upbeat crowd to match. I love the whimsical lighting and the simplistic design of the restaurant. Clean lines, urban hardwood... just really pleasing to the eye. My friend and I were seated promptly in the outside (covered) heated patio as the restaurant was quite busy on a Thursday night.

Overall, the food was good, but like previous reviewers have stated, its not "knock your socks off" worthy. The prices seemed a little overpriced (especially for the pizzas) but nonetheless the items we ordered (bread, burrata, and chicken pate) were flavorful. I must say the house made chicken liver pate was the winner of the night. Creamy deliciousness slathered onto a crispy buttered piece of artisan bread, topped with a caramelized, sweet onion marmalade and whole grain mustard... WHEWEE. Effin' delicious I tell you.

-1/2 point for the server giving our food all at once knowing full well our table was too small to hold everything all at once. Literally, plates were hanging off the edge and it felt like we were playing tetris to make everything fit.

-1/2 point for prices. Being a chef, I know I'm biased, but some of the prices are absolutely ridiculous. I know restaurants need to make a profit but goodness gracious. I was lucky enough to look around at the tables who ordered pizza to know that I wasn't going to pay $15 for something I should be paying less than $5 for. 

Service was attentive and Millie (our server) was quite adorable. She knew when to show attention but also keep her space, and I appreciated that. Overall, a really enjoyable dining experience.

Good food. Great company. Satisfied stomach.

Worth coming back for more.
author: Peter G.

description:
Very cool spot.  Excellent, courteous service, fresh and tasty appetizers, great steak, excellent reasonably-priced wine.

Will def come back
author: Kom A.

description: Well Starbelly, I would have given you a better rating but my party and I were a bit turned off when you brought out various items off your dessert menu for our friend who was having a birthday brunch in your restaurant and then charged them to our bill without anyone at the table asking for them!  While it may be the thought that counts, we had brought our own desserts for our friend and a survey of the table from our server Tom was that we did NOT want dessert... so why you chose to bring the cold donuts and mushy sorbet that no one ate is beyond me.  And then preceded to charge us $12 for them... yeah, not cool.
author: Michael R.

description:
Starbelly is a Castro staple. It's a casual, loud-ish resto perfect for first dates, big groups, weekend brunches and rainy-day carry-out. The fact that we've been there 5+ times in 3 months speaks to the versatility of this joint.  The covered, heated outdoor patio elevates this resto's status in our books. (However, it closes at 9pm for noise reasons). Note that Starbelly does not take reservations for small parties, but you can call 40 minutes in advance and they'll put your name on the waitlist, and a table should be ready by the time you're there.  If not, the bar is pretty big and you can down some red-wine sangria while you wait (its sweet, but not too strong, so don't go overboard or you'll feel it in the morning).
 
The menu changes slightly throughout the seasons, but they don't always update what's on their website, so don't be surprised if they don't have something you thought they would.  Often they'll have a good enough replacement--for example, over the summer they had this awesome Fig and goat cheese Pizza for $14 (add prosciutto for $3--totally worth it), but now Figs are out of season and they've replaced Figs with Pears.  Liked the figs a bit more, but can't really complain.  We've heard of a weekly picnic that Starbelly hosts in the summers. Haven't been to one yet, but we're sure it won't disappoint.
 
Other dinner favorites include House cut fries and dipping sauce; Spinach and pear salad; scallops; Prather ranch burger; Spaghetti w/bacon
 
The brunch is just as good as dinner. Favorites are the Chilaquiles, French Toast, Chorizo and egg pizza (available for brunch and dinner).
 
Starbelly also has a good wine list and above-average beer selection. Our criticism is that most of their best dishes seem to have the same key ingredients: bacon, chorizo, pear, goat cheese. This place is good, but some menu innovation would certainly be welcome. 4 stars
 
-A&L
author: AdamLowell C.

description:
Three stars for the friendly service, but the food is just two stars and since Yelp still does not allow half stars, I cannot give the 2.5 stars I would like to.

I came here on a Friday night with my boyfriend and my brother. We were looking for a place with an outdoor patio since the weather was nice, and I had heard about the big back patio here. We were able to get in easily considering it was a Friday night at 7:30p.m., and the hostess was very friendly. Our server was also nice, though a bit spacey and some of the food was a little slow to arrive.

Between the three of us, we ordered:

+Warm Bread & Olivera Olive Oil: Three small slices of bread for $2? Okay... we finished this in about 30 seconds and had lots of olive oil left over with no bread to dip in it.

+Little Gems, Market Oranges, Raw Goats Milk Feta, Kalamata Olives & Shaved Red Onion: The cheese was very good, but the salad was not very flavorful.
 
+Cornmeal-Fried Oysters: Small portion, slightly soggy, and (again) not very flavorful.

+Seared Scallops: I forgot what came with these, but the dish was (obviously) not very memorable.

+Starbelly Pizza (Starbelly Bacon, Jalapeño, Arugula & Green Goddess Dressing): I really enjoyed this flavors on this pizza. The crust itself wasn't that special, but the combination of the bacon, spicy jalapeño, and dressing was excellent. If I ever ended up back here, I would just order this.

+Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream, Pot of Mr. Espresso Coffee: No complaints here!

Overall, I was pretty underwhelmed by this restaurant. I wanted to like it because the back patio would be a great place to spend warm nights drinking wine and enjoying good food, but there are better places in the city to go to.
author: Lotta A.

description:
Hmmm....not as great as it usually is. 
The chicken liver pate was delish as usual.  The starbelly salad was lacking and a little dreadful looking (basically mixed greens with some pear and goat cheese).  The hamburger was overcooked, medium rare was medium well and the fries it came with were pretty disgusting. The asparagus and arugula pizza was like a little sister version of delfina's.

This place would definitely get 3 stars from my latest experience, but the liver with the jam and the mustard and the bread...makes me still love this place.
author: Skye W.

description:
I was pretty sure that Catch off Market was going to be my favorite in this neighborhood, but Starbelly rocked my world.

Lavender lemonade, an incredible pizza, and pasta that made this traveler actually ask to take the rest just to eat it cold in the hotel room.

True, the place is small, there's construction (shocker...really construction around Market Street), and maybe the staff seems distant because it does get crowded there.  But there wasn't a time when I felt that we weren't noticed, tended to, and appreciated for being there.

I will absolutely recommend this place to any of my West Coast homies & fellow travelers.
author: Laura G.

description:
Starbelly, I forgot how good you were? Must've been because of Delarosa and Berretta...

Anyhow, went here again on friday night with a couple friends. The place gets pretty packed, not as bad as beretta, but pretty packed. The waiters and waitresses are running around mad to deliver great service. The place has a nice feel to it, and we got to sit on the outdoor patio which was warm despite the weather outside. 

Food:

Rabbit Rilettes - Ok, if you like Rilettes you will like this. Don't let the rabbit scare you, its fatty goodness just like any other Rilette!

Burrata- Great, creamy makes you think your life is complete after eating it.

White bean dip - well not particularly my cup of tea, but it wasn't bad if want to be a bit more health conscious 

Mushroom, Gruyere, Onion Pizza - AWESOME. I usually dont' like vegetarian pizzas, this proved me wrong. Oh, and it is absent the tomato sauce!

Pepperoni Pizza - Yeah solid, homemade pepperoni. 

Spaghetti w/ jalapenos bacon basil - not your mamas spaghetti and not your jar of sauce and packaged noodles by any means. It was pretty tasty but I wouldn't go telling everyone how amazing it was. 

Overall assessment: Price is right, staff is nice, food is great.
author: Steven C.

description:
Starbelly. We have history. You sent me off to Chicago with a belly full of warm blue cheese fig pizza, then welcomed me back to the Bay Area with a snug biscuits and gravy brunch hug. Thanks for not saying anything when I unbuttoned my pants at the table. 

See you next Sunday.
author: Manuela Z.

description: One of my favorite places in the Castro.  Good selection of craft beer selection and wines.  The food is great and the staff is helpful and friendly.
author: Chris B.

description:
11 AM. Party of four, we decided to sit out front. The hostess seated us, but didn't leave menus. 

After waiting about 10 minutes, the waiter finally came and asked if we wanted anything to drink. STILL no menus. We ordered some coffee and water.

10 minutes later - coffee and water arrives. Waiter says "I'll be right back." STILL NO MENUS. 

After another 10 minutes, I finally went inside and told the hostess we never got menus. No apology, just handed me the menus. 

10 more minutes - The waiter finally takes our order.

30 MINUTES LATER (Yes, we've been at the restaurant for an hour and ten minutes), I go inside and ask about our food. The waiter is very apologetic, says something about our "ticket not coming up", and says the manager will do something for us on the bill.

Our food finally arrives, and the over-easy eggs I ordered were hard fried, and the medium rare burger patty with the meal was well done, and burned on the bottom (they put the burned side down so I wouldn't see it). I told the waiter my food was incorrect, but I wasn't going to send it back because I was starving. He said they would take it off the bill.

The bill arrived and the manager took off my meal, but only discounted the bill about 30%. It really should have been at least 50%. 

The food was mediocre, and had we paid full price it would have been too expensive for the portions.
author: Michael A.

description:
against our better judgement, we went back for a quick dinner. Boy, were we stoopid. It started out ok. The wine made it to the table before the water. we ordered our food. The soup came out promptly, then the wait began. about 20 minutes for the chicken liver pate. 23 minutes for the two seared scallops. Then another 20 minutes, after we were done eating these two dishes for the steamed mussels. While eating those, we decided to cancel the pizza we had ordered because we were kinda over it and we were told that the pizza was ready. We took it to go. They were good enough to comp the wine, but it was really ridiculously bad service. Friends who were also eating there that evening had the same experience. too bad cause the food was actually tasty, just not mind blowingly excellent enough to forgive the wait. 
Next time we trust our judgement.
author: marc S.

description:
Starbelly has a unique seasonal menu and delivers good food with solid service.  However, the real draw to Starbelly should be their ambiance.

Aside from the outdoor seating the front of the restaurant, Starbelly has a picturesque outdoor patio complete with heating lamps.  The setting is intimate without feeling overly compact.

The chicken winglets were perfectly prepared with a hint of a fruity flavor.  The mushroom pizza combined gruyere and various fungi such that no single ingredient overpowered the others.

The pot de crème for dessert was out of this world.  A jar of salted caramel that neither too sweet nor too sticky.  It is more of a very light caramel pudding, paired delightfully with a crisp cornmeal cookie.  I am glad our waiter spoke so highly of it because it was probably the highlight of the meal.
author: Samantha K.

description:
I have heard an inordinate amount of good things about Starbelly. Michael Bauer, the food critic for the Chronicle, rated their french fries among the best in the City. The Examiner gave it an extremely enthusiastic review back in June. SF Weekly wrote it up as one of their Hot Lunch places back in August 2009. So am I the only person in San Francisco who doesn't get it?

After all the press, I expected to have a very hard time getting a table. I picked a cold, rainy October night to give it a shot and was able to walk right in the door. The waitstaff was kind, pleasant, but somewhat disinterested. After enthusiastically demanding to know our drink order ("Have you decided what you're having to drink?!," he demanded, thrice, within a few minutes of being shown a menu), we were left to stew for 15 minutes with our food orders.

The menu itself follows a pretty classic San Francisco/Nouveau American tradition, namely seasonal food to include the following: pasta, roast chicken, hamburger, salad. All seasonal ingredients, of course. 

I had the duck confit with polenta, grilled mission figs, and a salad. My dining partner had the roast chicken, and we shared a side of the fries. The entrée plates were huge: massive serving platters of calories. What merits this place a three stars is that much of it was tasteless. I expected a rich, dark duck, but instead got mostly gristle and fat. The skin was extremely greasy and oily. The polenta lacked texture and was very buttery. And the mission figs (all three of them! wow!) were all right. Frankly, for the richness of the meal, the salad was overkill and boring.

And oh, the fries. What a fabulous letdown these fries were. After being praised so highly, I expected greatness from these fries. Instead, they were over salted and tasteless. And when I saw over salted, I mean it. They were disgustingly salty. A tremendous disappointment, seeing as how people in Belgium can turn out exceptional pommes frites in tiny shacks on the side of the road. 

For all the praise, you'd have thought that Starbelly was in direct competition with Frances. And while I'm willing to grant an off night, this was pretty bad.
author: P Z.

description:
Service SUCKS here...

I'm sad to say this won't be our "go-to" date spot anymore. The food is still good but dining with bad service seriously ruins the experience. 

Sit at the bar if anything, the bartenders are better than the servers.
author: Anna S.

description: Confirmed it tonight, five stars. Great atmosphere and service, very reasonable prices, and consistently excellent food, from the veggies and snacks to the sardines to the burger to the pizza.
author: Nick C.

description:
Always a great vibe, great fresh food, friendly staff and a nice beer and wine selection.

Starbelly is quickly becoming a reliable fallback for my friends and I. Tables turn quickly but you never feel rushed so it is a great last minute place to stop at for great food. I have only eating dinner but I am keen to try brunch after my great experiences there. The tuna on white been puree is amazing and the chicken pot pie a firm favorite on a cold day.

Only negative is that the bar staff can be a bit distracted at times meaning you wait for your drink but this is just a minor gripe. I would also suggest having a daily specials board so that you would get regulars coming back more often and prevent them getting bored with the small but interesting menu.
author: Brent T.

description:
The service is great, the atmosphere is nice.  I had the pulled chicken sandwich and didn't really like it- the mayo was overwhelming.  (wouldn't recommend it) 
I plan on returning to try something else.. Soon...  Okay, I've been back a couple times and I get the chicken poor boy (or something like that)..it comes with slaw and fries.  It's actually quite good.  The prices are reasonable, food is good, it's in the hood...perfect. I like this place and recommend it.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Starbelly makes me think of Dr. Seuss' Starbelly Sneetches and that makes me happy.  This restaurant has nothing to do with Dr. Seuss or Sneetches but the association (in my head) makes me happy.

On to the food - it was good and the service was great.  My friends and I went and were seated at the community table.  I like that we were able to call in and put our names down.  The woman told us there would be an hour wait but when we got there we were seated in 10 minutes. I'm unsure if I should be happy we were seated promptly or upset that she had no idea what she was talking about when we called 30 minutes prior to arrive.

We ordered and split:
- Pizza, blue cheese, figs, and arugula, added prosciutto (No complaints the pizza was awesome)
- burger w/o any additional toppings (the meat was well cooked and the flavor was great, but it was just a burger nothing super special about it)
- Starbelly salad (small and very simple and I wouldn't order it again because it's something I could make at home and when I'm out eating I want a treat)
- Fried oysters (I wish it came with more than three pieces, they were delish)

Service was great and I don't have any real complaints on the food. The guys next to us ordered pasta and it looked yummy.  They use that extra thick spaghetti that I love.

I wish SOMA had more restaurants like Starbelly- casual, yummy and decently priced.
author: Becca L.

description: It was time for me to write a review, considering how often I eat here. I'm usually here for weekend brunch. The food is delicious (favorites: any pizza, chilaquiles, chicken salad sandwich). Great outdoor sitting area with heating lamps. Good beer selection. One star taken off because of subpar coffee.
author: Evren O.

description:
The wine was overpriced and 1/2 empty
The scallops were $14 for 2 scallops
The only thing I enjoyed was the starbelly salad
The atmosphere was ok but getting our food took over an hour-they were very busy.
author: farah b.

description:
Without going into a predictable boring tirade about "quintessentially San Franciscan fare prepared with local organic ingredients", I will say:

Eat here sometime when you want something tasty & unfussy, but also want to make an event of it:  The atmosphere is pleasant, the service is decent, the beer & wine selection is exciting, and everything tastes damn good.

Don't miss:  chicken liver mousse, the pizza, dessert
Skip:  fried oysters, anything involving hominy puree
author: Laura F.

description:
The Castro has soooo many great restaurants!  Starbelly is not one of them.  I guess you can say that Starbelly is just average compared to the fantastic eateries in the same district.  Nevertheless, it's worth trying as the food is decent.  

I met up with a friend at Starbelly and it was PACKED.  The venue is quite small, so plan ahead.  We had to wait about 30-45 minutes to be seated.  On top of that, parking is quite difficult.  If you plan to meet with friends at 6 pm for dinner, I'd expect a 1 hour time differential from looking for parking to being seated.  

Here's what we ordered:
--Warm mixed olives with chili oil & grilled flat bread:  This was ok.  I'm not a huge fan of olives but it seemed like my friends loved them.  

--Prather Ranch burger, house cut fries & pickle, grilled sesame bun:  The burger was actually pretty good.  The meat was high quality and cooked to perfection.  Everything on the plate was fresh, which I appreciated.  

Would I go here again?  Probably not . . . there are much better restaurants within walking distance.  I recommend you trying it out though, just so you can say that you've been there.  

Beware of hostile gay men!  I was waiting with my friends at the "bar" to get seated and a drunk gay guy literally shoved me (pretty hard) to the side while yelling, "Move!" to make room for his gay friend who was returning to his stool from the restroom.  He's lucky I was only on my first drink . . . if I was on my 3rd, his face would've been french kissing the floor.  Yes, that's how Koreans roll.
author: Manton R.

description:
4 of us visited Starbelly for an early dinner. The wait was short, the service was quick, and the food was delicious and creative.

We ate our meals family style and I was impressed with everything on the table.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Atmosphere: Great.  Classy and clean, lots of great people, and an excellent back patio.

Service: Super sweet and efficient.

Food: Enjoyed a Calimocho as my drink (Coke and red wine) which was good but the presentation a little crazy - looked like a shake.  The flounder was my entree and was great, well-cooked and flavored.  Dessert was the amazing salted caramel custard with cookies...a must!
author: Chad S.

description: This place is ok. Not bad but not great. We shared a pizza and fries. We ordered the chorizo and egg pizza. Liked the egg on top but the entire layer of cheese fell off easily and didn't feel fresh. Fries were good but again nothing special. I don't live in SF and there are many other places I'd rather eat at when visiting!
author: Kim Le P.

description:
Went here for brunch/breakfast today. The food was pretty damn good. 

We had the chilaquiles and the classic 2-egg breakfast with bacon. Amazing thick sliced bacon and crispy tortilla chips that stayed crispy through the whole meal. 

I love the personal sized french press coffee. You can pour your own throughout your meal and it was delicious. IMHO well worth the $3.50 they charge for it. 

Service was great, and friendly. Cute, little patio in the back that you'd never know was there unless you walked in. 
It was a relatively small menu that might not inspire you for brunch, and it ain't cheap ($39 for two people incl tip - no mimosas this time). I'd probably go back, but it would have to be a special occasion (fam in town or something) I think, due to the prices.
author: Mike M.

description:
Had a great meal here with a friend. We came for dinner and ordered the Starbelly salad with cherry tomatoes and goat cheese (yum), the polenta fries, the mushroom risotto with marscapone, and the spicy spaghetti.

The spicy spaghetti was probably my favorite. Just a slight kick. I love spicy food and this was very light. You could eat the jalapenos and they wouldn't burn your mouth.

I love risotto and the texture and consistency of this one was perfect. The marscapone wasn't overwhelming and blended well with the mushroom flavor.

I was a little disappointed with the portion size of the polenta fries.  3 sticks.  Granted, I understand that they're larger sticks, but still.  

I love that you can call in about 30-45 mins. before you arrive and they'll pretty much have your table ready when you arrive.

I'll definitely go again!
author: Genie S.

description:
Starbelly is walking distance from my house.  I went to the soft opening party awhile back, but only just had dinner there last week.  Not sure what took me so long, but I will definitely be a regular here.

All of the food is fresh, tasty and well-prepared.  Some highlights include the steak main entree and appetizers such as house made chicken liver pate  toasts with jam and mustard, cream of marzanotomato soup with mini grilled cheese sandwich and starbelly salad with figs and goat cheese.

My only issue for our first dinner at Starbelly was that all the appetizers came quickly and all at once and then we waited forever until the steak came out.

But we will be back!
author: Kelly A.

description:
On a random warm evening in SF last week, we peeped this place out.  Seriously bustling for a weekday and looks like they were not going to be meeting the fate of their predecessor asqew grill.  yay!  

We had a brief wait for our table, but that was fine because we had a star sighting - if you watch project runway Jay and Anthony from Season 6 maybe were there - fun!  Ambiance is fun, dimly lit, great for a date, and the community table isn't giant.  Like the open kitchen and the backyard patio.  Servers are friendly, though one guy who works there is a little creepy, but maybe it's his intense eyes.  Whatever....

Onto the food
Having just come back from Italy, I was pretty certain I didn't want pizza, but OMG glad we ordered it.  For appetizer we had the chicken pate served with tasty bread that maybe had some light butter on it, seeded mustard, and apple compote.  Would have never put those 3 together, but divine.  Salad with goat cheese was super fresh.  Main was this pizza pretty standard marguerite, though we changed out the cheese and added an egg.  They gave us 2 eggs!  Crust was crispy and not soggy in the middle.  Might have wished the egg the was touch less cooked, but fine.

Only complaint - the wait between the starters and the pizza was for days - ok seriously over 20 minutes between the two and the waiter was like well they have to cook the egg...please don't feed me a lame excuse.  I will accept if they moved it back in the order, but seriously...

Oh another plus, you can get either tap or bubble water at your table!  

Will definitely go back.
author: Denice L.

description:
Came here for the fries.  Oh and the company of course.  Had a very nice lunch with the girls.  Picked this place because of the fries and the Starbelly bacon.  While the fries were very tasty, they were a little too soft on the outside and could be just a little more crispy, but that didn't stop us from ordering a second round.

The pizzas were too big for one person, so they are good to share or have for the leftovers.  While I like the thin crust and the unique toppings, the center of the pie was slightly soggy and difficult to pick up.  

The bacon was thick with a good smoky flavor.  All the dishes tasted as good as they looked.  Very nice presentations.

It took a little while before our server took our orders, but once he did everything arrived pretty fast.  

Since it was "brunch" time, the only desserts on the menu were dynamo donuts and while I love those, I still wanted a dessert dessert.

p.s.  The sangria is good especially if you don't like it really sweet.
author: Mabelle A.

description:
What to do if there's a 2 hour wait at Lime for brunch? Head down the street to Starbelly and pad your belly before the daytime debauchery begins at Lime.

Seriously though, Starbelly offers up a really nice brunch menu with a selection of egg dishes, salads, pizzas and sandwiches. And while their mimosas are not bottomless, they are freshly made with either OJ, strawberry (my fave), or grapefruit juice. They don't have a full liquor license, so if you're hankering for a Bloody Mary, try their version, called the Diablito.

The space is warm and inviting, with a large high communal table that runs along the middle of the room, so if you don't mind rubbing elbows with some strangers, it makes for a fun place to sit. On a nice sunny day (it was pouring while we were there), there's a great back patio with quite a number of tables for you to soak up some rays. 

Our group of six decided to share a pizza to start, and got the one with mexican chorizo, sunny side up eggs and cilantro. It was perfectly split so that we could all enjoy one slice. As it was already nearing 2pm, I decided to do lunch and got their highly recommended Reuben sandwich, which was delicious, but instead of sauerkraut, they used pickles, which I am not a fan of. The rye bread was thick and soft, and the meat was stacked high in there, so I still really enjoyed it. I tried some of the chilaquiles, which were tasty and even better when dipping my fries in the cheese and chorizo. 

We opted not to have any Dynamo donuts for dessert, which was a good call because we had brunch #2 at Lime shortly thereafter, where I ordered breakfast. Because you know, breakfast always tastes better later on in the day!
author: Connie C.

description: This is such a great place with good and attentive servers. make a reservation as they get busy. The best thing about this place is that it is good food at great prices. This place is great for date or with a friend or just to grab something in the Hood!
author: Tyler S.

description: A friend and I had brunch here this past Sunday morning; he'd already dined there a few times, but this was my first time eating at Starbelly.  I must admit, I wasn't impressed with the level of service...although the food was pretty good. I appreciated that they were able to seat us pretty quickly although we did not have reservations.  We both ordered fairly simple breakfast items, nothin' fancy...but it took 20-30 minutes to get our food. I mean, we'd basically finished the two drinks we'd ordered by time our food had even arrived. Then when we did receive our order, my friend's order wasn't correct. He had specifically asked for the bacon to be extra crispy, but it was barely crispy at all AND he'd requested extra eggs and didn't receive those either.
author: U. Sacred M.

description:
Arriving in my favorite US city for a two-month stay (yeah!), luck would have it that my apartment is only minutes away from Starbelly.  Luck indeed.  
We got one of the last small tables on a crowded Tuesday night and the incredibly friendly and efficient servers made us feel most welcome.  The small beer list included Trumer, my favorite Austrian Pilsner (now also brewed in Berkeley), excellent with the wonderful grilled Pimientos de Padrón, a small Spanish pepper.  The salads were uniformly good, the day boat scallops perfectly cooked, rich and sweet.  I tried the special pizza with local blue cheese, mission figs, and prosciutto - a combination that went well together.
A warm seasonal berry cobbler and deep espresso rounded out the dinner - this was a great way to start my SF sojourn.
author: Thor T.

description: My boyfriend and I love the food and have come here often. However it only takes one bad experience. We order some good to go and they tried to give us food that another person brought back because it was the wrong order. The hostess thought that second hand food would be acceptable. She also gave me attitude and was disrespectful when asked her to have it remade.
author: Lady J.

description: Generally good restaurant with occasionally poor service.  I keep going back, in part to the interesting menu and good wines, so they must be doing something right.
author: Ryan S.

description:
I hate talking to people when i can avoid it, so i guess it was my fault when i emailed them to make a dinner reservation for me and the boy. I emailed on tuesday March 1 for dinner on thursday March 3. When we got there, they didn't have us in the books, but we were seated anyway. It would be a week later on thursday March 10 that i would receive a call confirming my reservation for that night, at which point i told them that we already went the previous week. Well, i checked my email and saw that they did actually say March 10. Why they would put us in the books so far in advance is beyond me, but that being said, it didn't really affect our ability to get a table.

The pizza was good and we split a bottle of wine. The waiter was friendly and seemed to like us, so he was very helpful and attentive. I don't think they've got a liquor license though, just beer and wine, and some mixed drinks that are wine-based (think sangria).

I'd go back if i wanted a good sit-down pizza and some wine, and if i was in the area, but i probably won't go out of my way to come back here.
author: Phuong M.

description: This was my second visit to this place in a 1 week holiday. My partner and I  liked it so much the first time we decided to go back before we left. No complaints at all, the food was excellent, nice selection of wines, the staff are friendly and we enjoyed it even better the second time. Recommended food, my friends, partner and I ate: pate, mussels, dumplings, blackened catfish, steak... all really good. I had a chicken dish the first time that was on the specials menu and was devine. It was not offered the second visit but I had the catfish instead, also devine and amazing risotto base. My most recommended restaurant to visit in the Castro! Hopefully I'll be back one day soon...
author: Martin K.

description:
I love that they thought "Outside the box" and installed a lane from a bowling alley for a Family Table....HellaCool.
Been here 8-10 times and service has always been good and the wait for food has always been reasonable. For a good meal that my guests always like I will order:
1) chicken liver pate 2) starbelly bacon, jalapeno, arugula & green goddess dressing pizza 3) roasted porchetta, salsa Calabria, salsa verde, arugula & pork jus sangwich 4) pan roasted black mussels, Mexican chorizo, market chiles & cilantro 5)cornmeal fried oysters,
AND for dessert * salted caramel pot de crème, rosemary cornmeal cookies.
Everyone always RAVES
author: Dan C.

description:
Love the vibe of the place. Like its sister restaurant Delarosa in the Marina, Starbelly decor is easy, modern, clean yet fun. Bonus is that Starbelly offers patio seating, lit and heated.

We were eager to try a few dishes:
- Fritto Misto ($5): fried veggies, or rather onions, broccoli crowns, and lemon slices, were dusted with seasoned bread crumbs and fried. Served with an aioli sauce, I was happily delighted with the fried lemon slices. It wasn't bitter; rather it left a fresh lemon fragrance on one's palate.
- Broccolini with Hazelnuts (~$6): A few stalks of tender broccolini were roasted with garlic seasonings and a light dusting of ground hazelnuts. I liked the unique pairing though overall the broccolini wasn't as impressive.
- Pizza - Starbelly bacon, jalapeno, arugula & green goddess dressing ($13). This was a combination of savory from the bacon and complementary bitters from the arugula leaves, but evened out by the creamy basil dressing. Surprisingly good combo.

We really enjoyed the ambiance and food. Great place for a simple dinner but one that is just a step above the ordinary. I'd happily return to try out more items on the menu. Can't wait.
author: Cindy W.

description: Really great room, good buzz, lights are a bit low - perfect for groups of 6 or even 8.  Food was solid, well executed, and priced correctly.  Pasta with bacon and jalapeno was great!
author: Michael S.

description: Service poor...we took up the issues with the server and resolved the issues directly with him (no need to make a bigger deal then it needed to be)...as we were leaving, the manager asked how was everything? We answered and told her all well except for issue which we resolved directly with server. She then instead of letting it go she proceeded in giving us an argument for not calling her to tell her about it. She used bad judgement, she should not have given us an argument her tone and ego were in the wrong place...  The food wasn't good enough to put up with this... Not going back
author: Mel K.

description:
I've been here three times now, and I continue to love it. The food is so reliably delicious, and every time I've had really friendly and personable servers. 
Extra sorry to our waiter from my last visit, btw. My friend and I were kinda drunk by the end of the dinner and writing you notes on the check. Haha! Thanks for being awesome!
author: Minx A.

description:
So there are many reasons on why I am giving Starbelly 5 stars! This is my second visit which was on May 3rd (nice hot night), both memorable but this one just was a show stopper.

We made a reservation (same day) and asked to be seating in the outdoor (covered) patio.  Soon as we arrived we waited only a moment before being seated. This might be silly to some to point out but I went to West of Pecos on Saturday and waited 45minutes after our reservation time!

At Starbelly, our server was so nice (Kyle), we are super chatty and he took the time to make conversation with us and explain the menu and comment on which food he liked best and why but also what other people find enjoyable. He also took the time to explain where the chef raises some of the food that they serve there. Overall he came off completely genuine and informative. You can alway tell when someone enjoys their job!

What we ordered (there were two of us). 1 bottle of Sauvignon  Blanc - Le Grand Calliou, it was only $32 which is a steal as it tastes great and our server said it was actually a favorite of his. Then we started with the chicken liver pate($10 and so worth every bite). This was great! It comes with a generous amount of both pate and bread. Delish! Then we had the English Peas Crostini with Burrata ($10 I think... amazing), again amazing, two good slices and generous amounts of Burrata, perfect for two. Then we shared a pizza due to the recommendation again from our server. We ate the Starbelly bacon, jalapeño, arugula & green goddess dressing ($14). This was the perfect amount of food for the two of us who came with an appetite...we always do though.

We did of course have the most amazing and a top dessert in my opinion in SF which was the salted caramel pot de crème, rosemary cornmeal cookies ($6). Every bite is simply amazing and worth a review in itself.
We rolled out of there with a huge smile on our faces.

Ambiance was great, noise level was perfect. 

The servers name was Kyle and he was simply the nicest guy who took his time making sure we loved every moment of our visit to Starbelly! Someone give this guy a raise, bottle of wine, something!

This place is hands down a winner. I live very close to a Delfina's which was a favorite spot of ours now, this place is. So much better!
author: Julia G.

description:
My husband and I checked out Starbelly for my birthday this past Wednesday.  I'd been eying the menu online for a while and every time I walked past the place I wanted to stop in and have a glass of wine and a small plate of something yummy.
