Anyway, this was our first experience eating there. My husband made reservations, because we'd seen how crowded it could get, and headed to an early dinner at 6:30pm.  I was not at all impressed with the hostess, who barely looked at us, and when I asked her a question didn't bother to answer or acknowledge me.  That was disappointing.  Even though the restaurant wasn't full when we arrived we still spent upwards of 10 minutes waiting for someone to come by to get our drink order.

After we did get waited on things definitely picked up.  We had a bottle of some lovely Argentinian Chardonnay, and split about every snack/side that was available rather than ordering full entrees.  The meat platter, and cheese platters were delicious, and had great flavor.  We shared a Starbelly salad, which had a nice peppery dressing, but what stood out the most to me was the Hominy Carnitas soup.  It was like eating an enchilada in soup form, delicious.

We had a very nice dinner, and during our actual meal we were waited on llke kings, but after we'd finished everything it took a while to get us out of there because no one ever wanted to come back and check on us.

And while this has nothing to do with anything, I loved one of the servers who brought out our meat and cheese platters, she presented them with a "it's a meat party" exclamation, and she was very animated and fun.  It's too bad the rest of the staff isn't as friendly.
author: Margaret I.

description:
It was once great...but no more!

My last two visits were dreadful.  The portions keep getting smaller and the service slower.

It felt like they were rationing the food in the kitchen to get through the evening.  Scallop dish for two people = one scallop per person (WTF?)

"House cut" fries....like at In and Out Burger!  Fritto Misto...mostly fried crumbs from the bottom of the fry basket.

Highly underwhelmed!
author: paul s.

description:
5 stars all the way for:

Food
Delightful flavors, wonderfully prepared, presented very well.  Both the complex dishes and the simple were exceptional

Service
Friendly, attentive, and appropriate.  Not too hovery, not too distant.  Perfect amount

Staff
Everyone there was a treat, from the bus staff to the barback, to the GM.

Vibe
Comfortable, warm, inviting, and happy.  Yes, happy.  This is a happy place.

Starbelly is a must-visit in my book!
author: Sean H.

description:
This is hands down the best french toast I have ever had. It even beats out Rose's Cafe on Union which was my favorite before Starbelly. It is out of this world! I don't know what they do with it but it tastes like it's soaked in pure ecstasy. 

Other notable items: pizza was solid, coffee was strong and served in a french press, mimosas are served with fresh OJ and they take reservations (!).
author: Julia N.

description: Great food, great atmosphere, amazing and friendly service without being too pretentious or intrusive. Fish tacos are amazing, pizzas are great and the starbelly 75 is delicious! Thanks to Jude and Kyle for their amazing service, quick wit and patience with my vegetarian boyfriend! Cant wait to come back!
author: Stephanie B.

description: This place has great food and cute succulents on the walls outside. Jude was my server and he was far to nice. Great spot
author: R G.

description: This is my first review on Yelp. I hate to admit this as I rely on them so heavily, but this experience compels me to writer   I'm visiting SF from NYC and was looking for a comfortably atmosphere, laid back yet with a vibe and with a taste of CA. THIS FOOD IS SIMPLY AMAZING. IM SERIOUS, I do not work for the restaurant!!  I ordered the Kale salad, roasted beet side and the chicken and each was simply perfect. The server was friendly and engaging. I lucked out with this pick!
author: Ed L.

description:
On a pleasant day in SF, an out-door patio brunch can be a 
wonderful thing. And, so it was. Nice place, decent service,
generally good food, and marginal coffee.

Would totally come back.
author: Max R.

description: Favorite Spot! Starbelly pizza, Brussels, burger, cheese plate (although there should always be a triple cream cow in my opinion), wine, burrata, ambiance, staff! All good!
author: Alicia S.

description:
I didn't want to write a review from only a single visit (any place can have an off night) and so I've eaten here over 5 times within the past month.  I'm a fan of mussels (prepared here with cilantro,  chorizo and green peppers w/ toasted ciabatta bread) and appreciate that they've never been over cooked and shriveled. 

I've never had a reservation and have always been seated promptly in the front (love to people watch), interior (warm and cozy) or the patio (really dig the wood accents of the walls). The service has also, always been prompt and friendly.

My favorite dishes are the flounder and lentils or the roasted, half chicken w/ risotto.  

I would have given them 5 stars, but...

When I did venture away from my mussel appetizer to the scallops, I found the plate to be the biggest thing about it.  3 scallops?  Really?

Price point for two, with shared appetizer has consistently been around $60 bucks.
author: Dwayne R.

description:
this review is long overdue. i've been here many times and it's always great. the food, service, ambiance - all right up my alley. you will get some hipster sightings but not enough to think the Castro has moved to Valencia. hehe.

menu items of note: the pizzas, burger (mmmm), weekend brunch, split pea fritters, chicken liver pate...there must be others but those came to mind first. 

but what gives Starbelly a special place in me heart is this: last August we hosted a big birthday brunch for my husband here and everything was awesome from beginning to end. these guys were so easy to deal with, did not require the entire party to do a set menu (which i did not want to do but most places require it for large parties), and were pleasant and patient each time i called to tweak the reservation size (started out at 14, then went to 20, then 17...you know guests and their commitment issues)

once we were there for the brunch itself, the service was excellent, food was delicious, and we had a fabulous time. i wish more restaurants would be that accommodating. we were by no means a difficult bunch but restaurants these days can be so high and mighty. it's nice to deal with ppl who understand you just want to have a simple gathering without being ripped off or forced to operate solely on their terms. hooray for Starbelly!
author: Jill L.

description:
Looking for a mellow yet bustling spot to take your parents when they come visit you in the city? Perhaps take that girl in your poli-sci class out on the town? Look no further. STARBELLY, located in the Castro neighborhood of San Francisco, is the perfect mesh of sophistication and relaxation. The covered outside patio (complete with heat lamps) was a perfect shelter from the rain, (The patio is open on warmer days). Food was outstanding, service was great, beer/wine selection was also nice, and our server was spot-on in recommending pairings with our food selection. Prices are moderate, but worth the quality of the fresh and locally harvested cuisine. 

For an appetizer, the honey glazed chicken wings are killer (6 per order). We had the "Crimson" pizza with prociutto, ask for "green goddess" dressing if you're a ranch-er. If you save room for desert, I recommend the lavender-roasted fig rice pudding. The only negative feedback I can provide, is that I wish the portions were larger, however, the smaller-bites yeilded for ordering a wider variety of items. 

Overall, had a great time. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Jes R.

description: Wonderful interior. Not the most attentive staff. Had a burger and steak with my husband. Burger went down a treat but the 23USD steak was a disappointment. Pizza looks great there though.
author: Pav O.

description:
Forget about Dine about Town and go to Starbelly on any regular night instead! For $35 each, my 3 friends and I shared a salumi plate, roasted mussels, roast chicken, 2 pizzas, house cut fries, and a bottle of wine! Can you get that off of a Dine About Town menu??? I didn't think so!

I highly recommend the starbelly bacon pizza with a glass of malbec!
author: Sue L.

description:
I feel like this place is close to being really good...the atmosphere is great, the food is tasty, but here is my beef:

1) I ordered a Diet Coke. Instead, I got some weird, not good Cola. I sent it back and said that I'll just have water 
2) My water glass stayed empty for a good part of our meal, I actually ended up drinking a bottle of water I had brought in my bag
3) Our pizza seemed like it had been sitting out awhile. I've worked in a lot of restaurants and if you can't figure out how to serve food right away, you have problems.
4) They left the charge for the mystery cola on my bill

:( Hopefully it was an off day, but that is too many errors.
author: Lance B.

description:
This place is delish and reasonably priced. Our default in the neighborhood -- which says a lot. Butternut squash pizza is always a favorite. 

We live around the corner -- can always get a table at the last minute.

Great, friendly service.
author: Mel H.

description:
I was pretty disappointed with Starbelly. I would say it was a 2.5 star experience. The worst part of the night was the service, by far. Our hostess sat us down without giving us menus. She didn't seem to have the flow down correctly - she waited a very long time before coming back to us, and then there were 2 other servers we interfaced with. One of them was great; the other one seemed frazzled. The worst part, however, was the food runner. She was a younger looking girl with dark hair in pigtails. When she first came by to drop food off, she said, "Will you move that?" She was trying to get us to move dishes on the table around so she could drop off our mussels. I've never had a food runner blurt something out like that. The rest of the night, she'd literally drop dishes onto the table and she had the shittiest look on her face, like she was angry to be at work.

Wish I would've tried the pizza - it looked great. The mussels and chorizo were good, the broccolini was pretty good and the pork chop was a humongous hungry man portion - definitely better for splitting. 

The sound level in the back area is deafening. Probably not good for conversation, but more suited for a fun dinner with friends.
author: Alli J.

description:
Not impressed.  

While this is, I suppose, an improvement over Asqew Grill, and I love what they've done with the back patio, especially the herb garden and the wall garden, what was a pretty empty lunchtime was rife with poor service and an egregiously long wait for any food.

The asparagus pizza should have had asparagus on every slice.  It did not, and the flavor was a bit lacking.  

Our server should have remembered things we ordered (considering he was dealing with less than a handful of tables), and should have visited the table at least once every 25 minutes.  We also wondered if he was stoned.

We let the manager know on the way out that we received very poor service and that the food was lacking.  He was extremely apologetic.  That's why they get 2 stars instead of 1.
author: Evan G.

description:
I heart Starbelly!! I recently moved a few blocks away and have eaten there at least 20 times since I moved in. It's a great place to go with out of town guests, friends, to celebrate, or just for a Monday night dinner.  My favorite dishes include: *THE SCALLOPS* (expensive, but delicious), all of their seasonal pizzas, especially the black garlic and goat cheese pizza which they only have in the winter, the spaghetti with pancetta and basil, the caramel pot de creme, the starbelly salad, and the asparagus and crab soup. 

I always have a great time when I go to Starbelly and even though it is often very crowded (even on a Tuesday night), they can usually squeeze us on within 10 or so minutes.  The service is somewhat inconsistent (and one of the hostesses is pretty rude and totally incensed my friend) but the general vibe of the place and staff is good.
author: Sara A.

description:
My friend knows the ex sous chef here, so we decided to give this place a go because we heard it was good.  Came here for dinner and had to wait about 40 minutes for a table (this is what I get for not making reservations).  Ordered a Pimms Cup (and the cucumber in it reminded me of a coiled up snake so I started grossing myself out).  It was standard, nothing great about it.

Food: 
1). Mussels with jalapenos and chorizo.  This was aaamazing.  The mussels were fresh, and the slight hint of spiciness from the jalapenos coupled with the saltiness of the chorizo really went well with the mussels.  
2). Half-rotisserie chicken with bacon asparagus salad and potatoes.  The thick cuts of bacon were soo hearty with the salad (in a great way).  The rotisserie chicken was moist and well cooked.  
3).  Pork shoulder with cheddar grits, grilled pears, and greens.  It was a bit salty and burnt around the edges so I was not a huge fan of my entree.  All of the pizzas that were coming out looked so good that we had to try them soooo. after an exhausting Sunday Funday  traipsing around Dolores Park and the Castro, we came back the next night for dinner again and ordered...
4). Mussels.  Just as good as the night before, but I felt like the order was smaller this time around.  However, we did ask for more bread to soak up all that delicious sauce.
5).  Fried oysters.  The bff loooved these.  I am not a HUGE oyster fan, but still found these crispy treats pretty good.
6).  Fries with three dipping sauces.  Ehh, I've had better fries before.  The fries were not super crispy, and could have used a bit more seasoning.
7).  Pizza with starbelly bacon, jalapenos, arugula, wild mushrooms, and green goddess dressing.  This pizza was so freaking good.  The dough was fresh, thin, and crispy.  I usually don't eat crust, but I sure made an exception here.  The bits of bacon provided just enough heartiness to make this pizza filling.  The only thing is that the cheese on some of the slices kept falling off, but that didn't stop me from devouring the entire order.

Great, friendly service, decent prices, good food.  All in all, a good dining experience.  Will I be back again? Yes.  Anytime soon?  Most likely not, because really, who do I think I am coming here two nights in a row.
author: Pornsakdi T.

description:
Not a great restaurant for vegetarians - looking to get sustenance.  Mostly its large fresh white bread pizzas. Some have eggs, veggies, and bits of cheese, but most don't have sauce (tomato sauce or others).  


We got:
Little Gems Salad 4.5/5
Gazpacho w/ Crab 3/5
Asparagus, Egg, and Cheese Pizza w/ Arugula 3/5

Service was very good however.  Decor is nice.  In general its very loud and busy. I couldn't really hear my waiter.

I would like this place more if it had more veggie options or fish without sausage and meat cooked in the same dishes.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Love the space. Wood, communal tables and dark metal accents. Food is good but not out of this world. The menu has a bit of everything which makes it great for groups. But apparently everyone in San Francisco thinks the same way because it's packed and noisy, noisy on the weekends. That being said, I would recommend this spot to any friend that comes into town. It's a space that shows the diversity of food and people in the bay. Come earlier than later so that you can easily find parking. 

We ordered a little too much the first time I ate here but I blame that on our waiter who suggested we add a pizza. Things I loved: chicken liver pate (amazing), burrata, thin crust pizzas. Things I could take or leave: corn & jalapeno hushpuppies, blue cheese and fig salad, roasted chicken and the dessert ice cream.
author: Kimmie N.

description: What a great find! This was our first visit and we will definitely come back. We made reservations for a Graduation celebration and you were so accommodating! And the food, wow! Absolutely delicious! Can't wait to come back.
author: Chris K.

description:
This was a Sunday night find which ended up hitting the spot too a tee.

Nothing outrageously, write your mama good where i justify a 4th/5th star but quality, good service, GREAT ambiance and good menu variation.

The main pick - thin crust pizza - had the asparagus with manchego, hard egg and prosciutto.  It was good but a bit lacking in something, just an extra spice or bit more salt?

Spiniach salad to start with almonds, pears, onions - this was very good but again just a bit too much oil in the dressing that knocked it down from a solid piece.

Service was great - let us taste the wine when we were on the fence between two bottle.  I'm sure he is glad we did as ended up with more expensive one.  Not too much pressure from him.

Ambiance is great - community table inside but we were in the back.  Had a retractable patio covering so not too sunny (but prob pulled back on great days) plus heat lamps when it is cold.
author: Sarah G.

description:
I really tried to like it. Its so close and serves late. 
The dishes sound great on menu but were inconsistent (came a couple times in a row) and often mediocre. 
The wait staff can be way more interested in their friends or eachother than clients who could use water. 

A couple of dishes have been great - but the rest were pretty 'eh'
author: tara s.

description: Margaritta pizza was soggy in the middle and really lacked taste. Enjoyed the Argula Salad.
author: Andy K.

description: You can ask any one of my friends what restaurant I'm eating at, and they'll tell you Starbelly. I absolutely love the place. It's affordable, and they have delicious food with a changing menu every month. I've always received fair service (sometimes you get great waiters, other times they're so-so). But for being in the Castro, this place is amazing. I would highly recommend the Buratta (my favorite appetizer), their burger is amazing, and their pizzas are delish (especially the bacon jalapeno with green goddess dressing). Of course, their dessert is great too - get the pot de creme. Soooo good!!!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Getting ready to tear up some Fries with three dipping sauces. They rock!

And it is true.  They do.  The fries are some of the best in town.  The dipping sauces are good - flavorful.  But one of them is ketchup.  I think they need to do without the ketchup and add one with a bit more spice to it.  

Caesar salad is good.  I would omit adding the sliced avocado and add some more lettuce.  Croutons are good, dressing is good as well.  More of a cream based caesar dressing as opposed to an oil based caesar.  Depends on what your likes/dislikes are.

Margherita pizza is good, and I added the home made sausage to it.  The center of the pizza is a bit wet, soft and limp - whereas as you eat towards the crust, that is really where the "oomph" comes in.

Salted Caramel Pot de Creme was awesome.  Not to much salt, not too little.  

No full liquor license, so they have beer, wine and some vermouth drinks.  The vermouth concoctions are quite good - definitely try one (as your server if there is a special one for the evening).

They do take reservations now which is great!  And their late hours are also a plus for the hood..
author: Jason I.

description: Solid, food was great. The server was super slow, thank God I had great conversation. I told the waiter, "Did you forget about me", I least I got comped a dessert....I would still recommend.
author: Jaime D.

description:
Ate at Starbelly last night with a few friends and the food was delicious. We had a few appetizers, three pizzas and a dessert. I thought the mushroom pizza was good but the Starbelly Bacon pizza was incredible. They drip a really good sauce over the finished product that makes all the flavours burst in your mouth!

On top of the great food - the service was fantastic. Even in a crowded restaurant, our food came quickly and with a smile. Our waiter was kind and very attentive (without hovering, which is always nice).

All in all it was a thoroughly enjoyable evening! I would definitely recommend this place to friends and others on Yelp!

Enjoy - but leave at least one table open for me...
author: Preston C.

description: Ok - so I got here a little late after my partner and her family had already been seated. It took 25 minutes for our server to comeback and ask if we were ready order or ask me if he could get me a drink. But the worst part was when they boxed up our pizza and bought us the check....err ... Ok... so I guess we're not having any dessert or another drink? ....oh did I mention I had a hair on my pizza?!
author: rhiannon B.

description:
I'm so over the hype for this place. I called them at 8pm on a Friday, and understandably they had an hour and a half wait already. Luckily they can take your name down in advance and you don't have to stand around the bar area to wait for a table. 

The food here sounded good on paper, but wasn't anything extraordinary. Maybe we didn't order the right things. We got the chicken liver pate, which was very good, but not better than other places. The pizza was good, but thin crust pizza is better elsewhere (Delfina, anyone?) The lamb chops didn't have much meat on them and for $20something there were only two tiny ones. Meh.

I must say, the service was great. And the wine selection was good and not super pricey. But honestly, I wouldn't wait an hour and a half to eat here again.
author: Hannah L.

description: I've only been here once {with a few girls after a wine and painting session} but I'm looking forward to going again!  Between the pizzas and the salads, you will find something for everyone that they are sure to love!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
- patio in the back is great
- this place is ridiculously packed even on monday nights
- the pizza is YUMMY.
author: Sara S.

description:
This place is a total gem, vastly underrated based on our visit this evening. I'd give it 4.5 stars, but the overall 3.5 Yelp!  rating leads me to top it off with the full five stars. 

First off, the liver pâté is worth a guarantee -- and I don't say this lightly: if you like pâté, you won't find any better in the city or anywhere. I've had some dope pâté in my day (including at a French wedding), but Starbelly's has found the magic combination--slather a bit on their fresh toasted bread and top it off with a touch of homemade jam and mustard...and you're off to fatty, contented nirvana.   

Drinkwise, I love the option of smaller beers -- I tried four beers at the equivalent of two pints and the price is right: $3 to $4 a pop. 

The apps were great, though I'd avoid the scallops -- the lone over-priced offering at $14 for 3 tasty, but awfully tiny bites. The kale was salty in all the right ways and the split-pea soup as good as that dish is going to get. 

Both my fiancée and I and our friends had the chicken and risotto as a main dish, which definitely impressed and can easily be split between two people. We also got a mushroom pizza for the table, which we gobbled up despite being already well on our way to stuffed. 

Lastly, the owner hooked us up with a pair of desserts and some Madeira (full disclosure: we were dining with two Marriott concierges), which was the icing on an already delicious cake. The service was very correct and the setting is top-notch, though a bit loud. Overall, we were thrilled with our experience and will undoubtedly be back for more. Come for the pâté, stay for the beers and some great ambiance!
author: Matthew Z.

description:
Fantastic new restaurant in the Castro, from the people who brought us Berretta, another excellent watering hole cum restaurant with a great crowd. The mood is warm and casual, the food is really excellent from Chef Adam Timney, formerly at Bacar and salumi chef at Baccalone. The price point is really right and... I thought the noise level was normal, actually. But I like a place to "feel" busy. The team in the kitchen works hard and delivers a punch with an insane porchetta and great pizzas. Definitely will go back!
PS the picture on this site is from the prior restaurant which looks nothing like Starbelly except that they recycled a bunch of the old wood (from tables etc) to make the hip interior decor. Cool. Green. Love it.
author: Stefano B.

description:
No reservations, just hanging out at the bar eating appetizers and drinking beer before going on to Frances for dinner.

extra bonus, small glasses of beer because Poppy is a total cheap drunk.  

We ate some fried stuff, hush puppies with jalepeno mint sauce and cornmeal fried oysters.  

All the food going by looked yummy as well.  Can't wait to come back and eat a full meal.
author: Poppy C.

description:
This has been a weekend full of just mediocre restaurants. 

Starbelly was one of them. The service was meh.. She was hardly attentive. The food was just ok. The mimosas were good and the pizza with pear and blue cheese was delicious.. Aside from that unforgettable. 

I won't return.
author: Monica S.

description:
I was very excited to try this place.

First impression, the hostess was a little snotty. I shook it off and thought ok maybe she's having a bad day... whatever, people have bad days. Then she sat us at a "communal"  table. Ugh.

I'm small and really don't take up very much room and I was smashed in between two strangers. They didn't look any more pleased about it than I did. I am left handed and the gentleman who was sitting to my left was right handed. Disaster. He, at one point knocked my fork out of my hand accidently mid bite. I have never been so uncomfortable in a restaurant. I couldn't hear my date who was sitting right across from me. There wasn't enough room on the table for our food and drinks.

The food? Yeah it was ok I guess. I liked the pizza, but the "crispy" brussel sprouts were simply "burned yucky" brussel sprouts. And it's totally overpriced. Our waiter was friendly, so there's that least that.

Also- It was about 5:30 maybe... and everyone who worked there looked like they had just rolled out of bed.  I get the whole dirty hipster thing but really, people who work with food should shower.

I really really wanted to like this place.
author: emmie h.

description: Recommend getting there early or making a reservation in advance because it gets quite busy. Atmosphere is nicer in the evening when they turn the lights down. I frequently meet with out-of-town guests here for dinner. The food selection and variety is good, while reasonable.
author: Sabrina S.

description:
After finding this place tucked right off Market on 16th around the corner from a busy Castro Street fair, we were ready to relax and enjoy - and Starbelly was the perfect place for it...

Great ambiance - comfortable, lots of table and bar seating (we sat at the bar) and cool but not overdone decor.

Tasty food - they have an interesting menu, and the combinations on the thin-crust pizza were inspired and delicious.

Great service - the staff were SO friendly and attentive - made us really feel comfortable and at home.  Lindsey at the bar paid particular attention to us, recommended some great food/drink combinations, and was a fun person to talk to!

We will definitely be back to Starbelly ;)
author: Mark S.

description:
Came here after a recommendation from a good friend and thought it was very tasty. The vibe is lively and social but the food was not "blow-you-out-of-the-water" amazing. 

I had the fresh spaghetti with starbelly bacon, jalapeno, tomato sauce and basil. It was really fresh and tasty-- pasta was the absolute PERFECT texture... a little gummy yet firm. The taste, however, was a little mediocre for the price/size of the dish. I do have to give them EXTREME props on their ingredients though-- every veggie, fruit, and meat was ultra fresh (veggies/fruit never fridged or frozen) and you could definitely tell. The basil tasted as if it had just been picked and my boyfriends burger was stock full of juicy dark tomato and crisp red onion. 

We also has some bomb beers. Would definitely come back for group gathering/ family dinner.
author: Sandy H.

description: Very nice restaurant. Good food. I loved the fish tacos. The staff was very friendly. We were a group of six and sat out in the back patio. The michelata was nice and spicy. The portion sizes were average, and the food was well prepared. I'd recommend this place for a nice brunch with friends.
author: Chad S.

description: I am very certain I had heard from multiple people that Starbelly was overrated.  Thus, I came here with some out-of-town friends and got the burger.  I added the Starbelly bacon.  Usually bacon added to a dish is wished for magic, but soggy and limp reality.  Not so at Starbelly.  The bacon was crisp, massive, and perfectly smoked.  Overrated?  I think not!
author: Jeremy G.

description:
After really enjoying Starbelly's sister restaurants, Beretta and Delarosa, I can't help but be disappointed in this place. The food, in my opinion, was way too bland and the margherita pizza, which is how I  measure against others restaurants in the same category, unfortunately, was not satisfactory. The pizza had too much sauce, which made it like eating soup. 

Also, the wine list, for the price point, was to leave something to be desired. We ended up ordering almost an $80 bottle, and we had to force ourselves to actually enjoy it. 

I went to this place as I've heard the atmosphere was fun, with food that's relatively ok, in of course, SF standards. However, after this experience, I think I'll stick to Beretta, which never seems to disappoint.
author: troy t.

description:
We went late night with a group of 6. They were very accommodating to make a reservation for us a week before hand and were flexible to change it that day when we needed to come in later. Very friendly staff, the space was beautiful.

The scallops were delicious, and overall the group seemed to enjoy the night. The dessert was the big hit, the ice cream & the pot de creme was a must have if you are in the mood for something sweet.

It's more modern than cozy in there. They do have pizza, a burger option and a general menu that most anyone should be able to find something on if you need to accommodate a group.
author: Nicole L.

description:
My last great pizza of the 2000s came courtesy of Starbelly.

Mmm... I carry the memory of a slice of starbelly bacon, market peppers and tomato into a new decade. Thin crust. Excellent sauce. Just the right amount of cheese. Wonderful fresh toppings. 

Midnight cravings.

Oh there was also a nice glass of malbec and a delightful bottle of Zin to go with the house cut fries, pan roasted black mussels, half rotisserie chicken, and a starbelly salumi plate.

Needless to say, my friends and I were stuffed. Happy. 

Another Christmas down.
author: Sam T.

description:
Not sure about the other bad reviews. Either they were there on an off night or they fixed the problems......... 

We were there with a large party which is always suicide. But I have to say the staff was awesome. Accommodated the late people and added tables and chairs as they came. Most places would have told them to beat it-hell I would have told them to beat it!! 

Drinks were wonderful. Especially the lavender lemonade. 

Got some appetizers. We had the cheese plate, scallops, white bean dip with chili oil and the Pate. All were very good. And as I saw some people complained about 2 scallops. Well we got 3 so maybe they took notice of the complaints. 

We also had the Starbelly Pizza. It was very, very good. Did not get to try dessert but there is a reason to go back I guess. Overall it was a great place with great service.
author: H C.

description:
This place gets everything right

I have been here three times so far (all for brunch) and each was a great experience.

The menu is interesting and the food is meets every expectation. Unlike a lot of other brunch places the portions are not giant but the prices are reasonable as a result. I hate leaving without finishing my food and I have never done that here. I have also never left hungry.

Their drink options are perfect. They have a great selection of craft beers and brunchy drinks which are delicious.

The staff is always friendly and familiar with all parts of the menu. They really seem to take pride in service here. They are always available and on top of things.

Finally, the space is perfect. I have opted to sit in the patio each time where they have a shade which they can bring out if needed as well as heaters. Unless it is raining this is the perfect place to be. The inside is also very nice while minimalist.

Definitely one of the best brunch places in town.
author: Eric G.

description:
One star is harsh, but after contemplation I must say I will not be a patron of this establishment again. The food is subpar, the service borders on non-existant, the prices are -face it- unreasonably high, and the atmosphere is loud and generally uncomfortable.

To top it all off, the waitress decided to give herself an extra few bucks on the tip. Of course, this fact was only discovered several weeks later with the arrival of the credit card statement. A call to the manager resulted in a correction after several more weeks, but no apologies nor any apparent interest in the matter whatsoever.

In summary, check your statements if you dare to charge your meal... but why even eat here with so many better options in this town?
author: Andrew S.

description:
Now that some time has passed and my frustrations have passed, I'm upping my review as the food here is generally pretty good.  And once you actually get seated, service is friendly as well.

But based on past experience, I don't ever make resos here myself.  But I only go if other friends make them or if we walk in.
author: F. P.

description: Since they expanded, the wait to get the food is longer. Also the cooks don't always wear hats, which is not that hygienic.
author: Lucky S.

description:
We decided to bring baby sister out to a few SF favorites around town since we'd been cooped up in the house for the majority of the holiday. On her last evening in SF, we took her to Starbelly.

Starbelly, sister restaurant to SF staple Beretta, proved to be an ideal location for a cozy Sunday night winter supper. This resto, given its menu of Italian comfort classics with a contemporary and Californian spin, is constantly busy and bustling with small groups and couples filling the tables. The menu is easy to pick from and Starbelly offers a balanced selection of microbrews (draft and bottled - including one of B4F's favorites: Hitachino Nest White Ale), wine and non-alcoholic selections - just don't come here looking for liquor, spirits or Diet Coke because they don't have any.

 Our dinner for six consisted of the following:

Salad: Little Gem Lettuce Caesar with Avocado & Starbelly Bacon ($6)
Artisan Pizzas:
    * Starbelly Bacon, Jalapeno, Arugula & Green Goddess Dressing ($13)
    * Market Pear, Blue Cheese & Wild Arugula, adding Spanish Ham ($14+$3)
Plates:
    * Fresh Spaghetti, Starbelly Bacon, Jalapeno, Tomato & Basil ($11)
    * Half Rotisserie Local Chicken, Warm Potato & Winter Spinach Salad ($16)
Vegetable: Cheddar Grits & Wilted Winter Greens ($6)
Dessert: Caramel Pot de Creme

Bacon, Jalapeno, Arugula & Green Goddess Dressing Pizza. Bacon's the shining star of this pizza.

Starbelly Bacon, Jalapeno, Arugula & Green Goddess Dressing Pizza - The quality of the pizza crust is very similar to Beretta and the green goddess dressing was what really made the pizza memorable with its zesty flavor in combination with one o life's pleasures: bacon.

Spaghetti with Bacon, Jalapeno, Tomato & Basil - perfectly sweet and tangy sauce with the spicy kick of jalapeno and the fattiness flavor from the bacon. Excellent swirl-the-pasta-around-the-fork capability.
Half Rotisserie Local Chicken - few places can make a chicken moist, savory and incredibly juicy and Starbelly hit the mark as  this chicken was definitely tender and well-seasoned.

What stood out about this experience was the hustle and bustle of the overall restaurant, comfort food selections and excellent array of microbrews.. Starbelly is ideal for sharing a bunch of options a la family style and doing so kept costs bearable without breaking the bank.

Would come back again but probably with a group of 4 so you can really share much of the food. What would I do without Beretta and Starbelly?! 

No reservations - but feel free to call ahead and they may just put your name down before your arrival. Street parking.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Much love to this place.

They have a great menu that changes with the seasons as a menu should, great service, serve coffee in a French Press (which is arguably the most well-rounded way to do so...), have a nice variety of beer & wine, and locally grown or made (in the case of the ice cream, for example, which is a flavor from humphrey slocombe) dishes, and a great ambiance.

So, now I'll discuss my visits:

The first one was back in October or so.  There was amazing gazpacho, that I hope will return next year, and really good beer.  We didn't eat a full meal, for various reasons.  

The second was brunch.  There was French press coffee, an amazing open-faced croque monsieur, which was very rich.  Jack had very good French Toast.  (No, it isn't a French restaurant, although this visit was very French).  Our server was very nice and came to check on us enough, despite being quite busy.  We had a great time.

Third, we had dinner! (Yay!).  Sadly, I don't remember my entree right now.  All I remember is the salted caramel pot de creme with rosemary cookies.  So fantastic.  We did sit at the bar, but were still well taken care of.

Most recently, we went for drinks and dessert, after sushi at Domo.  Kindof a strange combination, I guess.  But Starbelly is close to home, and so it was more of a logistics thing, I guess.  They were very busy, and so we sat at the bar again, but this time at the "non-dining" end, which is made up of 6 seats for those who just want drinks, mainly.  Our bartender took care of us, including comping my first beer, which was my "second choice."  (First, I was told that the beer on tap wasn't quite ready, so I ordered another.  Then, he came over and told me that the beer was not going to be available, and that he would comp my beer.)  That was so nice! :)

Anyway, much love to this place.  Additionally, I'll add that they do have outdoor seating, but have a strict curfew, as their resident-neighbors obviously have sensitive ears (and/or like to not have bar noise out their windows all night)...and I can't blame them...but the curfew is 9:30...not 10 or 11.
author: cyndi t.

description:
Oh Starbelly, where to start!? I've been here a handful of times and every time I leave very happy and very full!
 The atmosphere: The vibe in here is great, and there are lots of different seating options, including a raised communal table in the middle and a heated/covered outside patio.

The Food: I've been here for both dinners and brunch and both are equally impressive. The pizza's are fantastic, especially the chorizo w/ egg and the season squash with black garlic. The menu is very seasonal and changes often, last time I went I had some fantastic steamed mussels. The only thing I'm not a big fan of is the pasta with jalapenos and bacon, its good but not crave worthy, don't think I'd order it again. Also the chicken wings with truffle honey are BOMB! A must try!
The Drinks: The drink selection is awesome! So many choices of different and innovative alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.

Starbelly is great of larger groups, the small plates make sharing a breeze, or an intimate delicious dinner! Parking kinda sucks, but that's just part of life in SF! If you haven't tried it yet, you are missing out!
author: Sophie C.

description:
I really wanted to give Starbelly three stars, and may after the next time I go there if I have a better experience. I have been here twice, and not impressed either time. The first was right after they opened. My review is strictly about the food. BAD. Both times. Bland over priced burger that didn't include fries, and a just plain mediocre salad. I wasn't impressed with any of the menu offerings just by reading them so I went with these items thinking they would be safe, and they were just boring.

The staff, the ambiance, the location, the remodel: All amazing. I wish they could just pull their menu together with something that has a little more pizzazz.

I am going to give it one more shot though on the advice of a few friends that still enjoy it.
author: Ryan B.

description: I really enjoyed my meal. I ordered a burger, cooked to perfection. Service was excellent, very knowledgeable about the food and ingredients. I will be coming back
author: Oliver K.

description:
This place knocked my socks off with a simple dairy-free pizza. Yep -- that's all it took. 

The super-fast service (despite the fact that it was PACKED) certainly didn't hurt, either. 

The impressive microbrew list -- that also didn't hurt 'em.

Nor did the clean yet warm, earthy decor, which SuperBF and I agreed was a good compromise for our totally opposite tastes. Except if Starbelly's dining room was OUR dining room, there's no way I'm letting him hang drapes over the doorwall. Not even an effing valance. We can put a window seat in, with a nice, firm cushion. Maybe in an orange, or a sage green. I'll go for that, if he wants something "softer." There will be divorce before there will be drapes. 

But really -- all this aside, they had me at the pizza.

Are you curious what was on it? 

Squash, arugula, black garlic, pine nuts, and olive oil.

Doesn't even sound like it needs goat cheese, huh?

Nope. It didn't.
author: Lisa T.

description:
The three of us ordered split pea fritters (which were pretty close to falafel), chicken liver pâté, and the seafood ceviche (not on the menu right now, I believe) for appetizers. Bread and olive oil was on the house. The general consensus was that all three plates were a little on the small side, but otherwise there were no complaints (though to me the liver was a bit funkier than I had expected).

I had the roast chicken while the other two split the burger. As they ordered it well done, we can safely discount whatever opinions they may have had about it (for the record: good, not great). The accompanying fries that I pilfered from their plate were serviceable, maybe even good; however, we all know that food snuck from others' plates always tastes better, so this opinion is also suspect.

The roast chicken--while quite savory with the crispy skin and chunks of roast potato, asparagus, and bacon--turned out surprisingly dry. Some knife work and letting it sit in its jus for a while solved that problem, but I'm not sure that should have been necessary, considering how quickly it cooled.

Service was affable but... well, not quite perfunctory. Shall we say deliberate? Yes, let's go with that.

I would be willing to go back again, but I would probably end up choosing either a pizza or something that I could specify the done-ness of.
author: Steven L.

description:
Most delicious food I had during my 9-day stay in San Francisco. The small portions were perfect for picking and choosing a 5-course meal, splitting everything with a friend and having your taste buds be delighted without loosening your belt. 
The menu changes, apparently, but if you can, try the peaches with feta goat cheese and bread. SO good. As was the apple and celery-root salad and the fig-and-bleu-cheese pizza. And try their ginger-lime soda, it's the best kind of non-alcoholic drink - complex, bubbly, and light. 

The waitstaff was friendly and helpful and the ambiance of the outdoor patio was charming. (there are tomatoes growing right there next to your table!)

Delightful.
author: Amanda M.

description:
My lover and I made reservations for two on independence day and had no issue when we had pushed it back 30 mins. He wanted to take me to this spot he adored which looked like a cute neighborhood restaurant. 

The host seated us on the outdoor patio as requested. Our server was polite with a lovely smile. I ordered a jasmine green tea which came chilled, perfect for the warm weather. We had greek yogurt with honey and granola and fresh fruit, bibb lettuce salad, and starbelly pizza. The yogurt combination was sweet, tart, and tasty. The salad was tasty with a very subtle dressing to compliment the bacon and chicken. The pizza, which my lover recommended, was fantastic. It had the same light dressing and bacon as the salad along with baby arugula. It was the perfect progression for a 4th of July brunch. 

I found the food pricing decent and would return here again. Definitely check out the business for casual dining.
author: Max D.

description:
Starbelly is a new place in the neighborhood and it's right by the library. I thought I'd stop in for brunch before doing some Sunday reading. This place has a nice friendly feel and even has outdoor seating. I ordered the wild mushroom and goat cheese stratta that came with a fruit cup, and fries. A stratta is basically a quiche and this one was so bland. It definitely needed more cheese and salt. My bf got a breakfast pizza with sunny side eggs, sausage, and cilantro. This was a lot better than my dish. But it was still hovering around average and it only had two sunny side up eggs. 

The Starbelly salad with lettuce, goat cheese, cherry tomatoes and vinaigrette was also nothing special. But it served its purpose since we wanted a little green to go with our pizza. One very bright side of the menu is that they serve Dynamo Donuts! Each one of these babies are $3.50 while the actual Dynamo sells them for $2.00-$3.50 (in case you were wondering). Too bad they didn't have the Apple Bacon Donut because the Cherry Cornmeal I ordered did not compare.

I would love to see more breakfast options here since they only had three breakfast dishes and a whole lot of lunch items like burgers, salads, and pizzas. Starbelly needs to recognize, breakfast is where it's at!
author: Julia T.

description: The brunch was unbelievably poor.  My husband ordered the eggs with potatoes, toast, and breakfast link, and honestly Denny's could have done better.  Taste was ho-hum, and the presentation unbelievably bad: small, overcooked link; 1 small dry piece of toast (no butter or jam offered).  I ordered the Italian eggs, which while good, looked like just a large blob of food thrown onto the plate.  The experience was particularly disappointing, since we had been to the restaurant previously to celebrate a co-worker's wedding, with afternoon snacks and small plates that were divine.  I would not go back.
author: Karen B.

description:
took the pate and Caramel Pot De Crème to go but would head back to dine in.  casual, earthy decor. the guys were really friendly when we ordered to-go. 
pate was huge! came with marmalade, mustard and some bread... the wife loves pate and wanted to try starbelly's for some time now - needless to say, the pate did not disappoint.  
the caramel creme was also good... only hitch is that you have to leave a "deposit" of $3 for the jar and get a refund when it's returned. since we were eating it on the go and driving back to LA the same day, we ended up with a new jar.
author: Anthony S.

description:
This is probably your limited dining option when you are in the Castro San Francisco neighborhood.  Thanks to the fresh ingredients and simple cooking.   The food is typical, fresh with not over powering flavors.  We ordered the Mushroom pizza with white sauce on it.   It's okay.  Not too bad, but nothing to brag home about.  The salad was fine too.  My strawberry cooler is too sweet for my taste.  I had to keep adding water to it.  Over all the food is just "okay".  (BTW, they do not have much vegetarian option.  People seems to like their "Bacon" a lot.  Vegan people, forget it.   They got cheese and cream on almost every dish).  I wish restaurant like this can have more VEGAN and Vegetarian options.  

The restaurant itself is very lively and a great place to have a gathering.  They have a big table for party.  The heated patio is nice, but only open till 9:30PM.

The pricing is not too bad, but watch out for the San Francisco healthy tax.  You will need to pay and tip extra.  Our bill came out to be about $30 per person, which is on the expensive side, since we didn't order much food.  Just a drink, a pizza and a side.

Will not go out of my way to go again.  But consider it was a pleasant experience.
author: jonathan h.

description:
I wanted to love this place so much so that I went back again and again and the truth is that it just doesnt live up to its hype.
When they opened there seemed to be a certain amount of creative endeavor behind the scenes however I feel as they made a name for themselves they just turned into a formulaic almost diner like place.
Now dont get me wrong, I like diners but not when they pose as super great places and higher than diner prices.
I wish for more....
author: Kate S.

description: Best restaurant in the city, Rustic/New American with awesome atmospher/back patio, also all their drinks have non-liquor in them (vermouth, etc.)
author: Allison R.

description:
Tried this spot for brunch on a Saturday late morning. 

Our server was fun and very sweet. We were given free bacon because the food took forever to come out (but that's expected on a busy brunch over the weekend!) so we were pleasantly surprised. Who doesn't love FREE bacon!? 

The Market pear and bleu cheese with arugula pizza was ridiculously tasty. And when I put the free bacon on top I'm pretty sure I had a baby orgasm. Just sayin! 

I tried my friend's chilaquiles after the table next to us ordered them. YUM! Definitely will come back and try that myself because when I eat something, I don't share since I'm a fat ass pig when it comes to brunch (usually hung over) 

For you non-drinkers and too hung over to drink the next morning'ers, try the grape lime or strawberry cooler. They were good!
author: Tyler J.

description:
YUMMY Brunch! Can't wait to go back.

Our group of 8 met for a girls bday brunch - it was lovely. Nice service to start but it tappered off toward the end. They give water bottles and provide plenty of refills - a FAV thing of mine that more places should do.

While we waited for our group they brought us complimentary dynamo doughnuts: lemon pistacio and chocolate chip - AWESOME.

I had the stratta egg dish which is frittata with goat cheese, mushroom and fennel. Very good but the gooey french toast I tried was amazing as well!

Potatoes served with the dishes were ok, but needed that homemade "ketchup" (which is like salsa consistency but tastes sweet like BBQ sauce.
You also get to choose fruit or salad with your meal - the fruit is a nice small diverse plate.

I tried the honey levendar lemonade - it was tart but refreshing. The Diabolita (beer like bloody mary) was great and spicy.

Their bacon is INSANELY good. They homemake their sausage daily - today was a spicy chorizo pattie. It was good but had an overly strong kick.

I can't wait to go back and try their pizzas and sandwiches!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Food was good but we were seated in the patio on a cold day - so would not sit there again when cold.

The lavendar lemonadate & pizza margherita were good. The blue cheese pizza was okay - just too strong. Olives were fine.
author: Mihir M.

description:
A recently noted blip on my radar, Starbelly is one of those places I've been wanting to try. The space is inviting, it's walking distance to my place and the menu looked intriguing.

I wasn't disappointed. We didn't wait for a table (Sunday early evening) and sat down at the bar. The bartender was great: offering suggestions, explaining sources of menu ingredients and mixing up some pretty looking drinks of the alcoholic and non-alcoholic variety. Food highlights were the burrata with heirloom radishes, shaved italian hard cheese, olive oil and rock salt as well as the gruyere grits and wilted greens. The fried oysters with old bay aioli were good but not great. I always think I'll like fried oysters in po'boys but it's never what I envision. The scoop of HS 'Secret Breakfast' ice cream was perfect and the wine selection was more than sufficient.

The space is incredible. The patio out back was calling my name but it wasn't open (I will be back for picnic tuesdays). It's designed to the nines but the acoustics are pretty bad. We had to yell at the bartender to be heard and even then, we only transmitted about 2/3 of the conversation. 

All in all, a good place to grab a glass of wine and share some small plates. It can be casual or fancy depending on your mood but definitely tasty.
author: Corey F.

description:
Great staff and energy! Great for dinner with friends. Perfect to laugh and enjoy your time. Love sitting at the bar or outside. 
Make a reservation!! But there good at trying to get you a table..
author: lorrin S.

description:
I LOVED Porter marinated bavette steak and I thought the truffled spring onion butter was sooo scrumptious. As I was the designated driver that night, I had the strawberry cooler which was surprisingly good - not too sweet and very refreshing. The lavender honey lemonade on the other hand was EH - mediocre. The burger with the Pt Reyes blue cheese was yummy in my tummy as well. Yes, I had a steak and a burger. 

Would go back to take over the long communal table in the middle!
author: Jess M.

description:
I've now been to Starbelly three times. Once for dinner, once for cocktails and once for brunch. I now feel that i'm fully qualified to say that this restaurant is amazing. The atmosphere is fun, the service is friendly and fast, the food is delicious and the drinks are tasty (especially for not having a full bar). 

When I was there for dinner I had the burger. It was cooked perfectly and had a ton of flavor. Their fries are great to; not too soft, not too crispy. I'm dying to try one of their pizzas. The time's I've been there, the majority of tables had pizzas on them and they look and smell awesome.

For brunch at Starbelly I had their French Toast. It was hands down the best French Toast I've ever had. I don't know what kind of bread they use, but it's the perfect texture with just the right amount of cinnamon and fruit topping. I got it with bacon which was fat and delicious, it was a great combination of spicy and sweet. I washed it all down with the perfect sunny Sunday drink, a fresh and zesty Shandy. The other great cocktail we had at the table was their Calimocho which is basically just red wine and coke served in a glass coke bottle shoved into an ice bucket with a bendy straw...spectacular!

I am definitely becoming a regular at Starbelly and I recommend that you do too.
author: Spencer C.

description: Went on basis of the latest top french fry honor in the chron.  Had a beer and the burger and fries.  Unfortunately, the bottom of the bun was soaked and the fries were a less crispy than they should have been.  I suspect it was a result of the food not being brought out quickly enough.  The burger was good, but a bit squat and thick on a small circumferunce bun.  I prefer a thiner and wider patty as it's easier to eat without making a mess.  Real nice giant lettuce leaf and good cheese.  Fries, other than being soggy, were good but nothing outstanding.  I liked the ones at Marlowe better.  Beer selection was good.  I'd give it another try some day probably for possible upgrade.  Nice layout inside.
author: Marc S.

description:
Starbelly aka "Full Belly" is a welcome addition to my rotation of top 10 favorite restaurants in the Bay Area.  They are a part of the same group that has produced Beretta and now the new Delarosa, their food is a mix of American classics and Italian cuisine.  The drink offering is limited, to beer and wine, but they make the most of that limitation with drinks like the Shanty (beer & lemonade) and the Calimocho (wine, coke, vermouth).  The food up and down the menu is one that I have yet to find a flaw.  It is a great modern space with a soon to be added back patio.  Service is attentive, especially for those requests of "can I have another plate of..." 

Don't miss:
Chicken Liver Pate 
Popcorn Clams
House Cut Fries 
Salumi Plate
Mixed Salumi Pizza
Chorizo, Egg, Cilantro Pizza
Chocolate Peanut Butter Sundae (Humphrey Solcumbe Ice Cream)
author: Jason A.

description: Grrrrreat food! Great prices and lovely staff! We are so coming back. My wife had the pasta with bacon, basil & jalapenos, and I the market mushroom pizza. Very good food.
author: Matt G.

description:
After attempting to do a drive by for bar seating at Frances- which was completely full by 6:30 on a Saturday night- went around the corner to Starbelly, a spot we've been to a few times already.

We were promptly seated at one of their high bar seats, and provided with menus.  The waitress was very attentive, and came back to check in on our order frequently.  We (let me rephrase that...) my boyfriend tends to ask a lot of questions, and she was very patient and thorough with her answers.

We each ordered a cocktail- I had the Champagne spritzer which was delicious.  We moved on to the grilled little gem salad.  Interesting and tasty, complete with toasted hazelnuts and orange slices.  

The highlight of the meal was the mussels, served with a great broth complete with garlic and chorizo, as well as slightly toasted whole wheat sourdough bread.  Def a hit.

Overall service was good, and we'll def be back here.
author: Jane N.

description:
For whatever reason our food was late which didn't help its somewhat lackluster appeal. For the prices they charge and the hip vibe they try to emulate, there is little in the quality of the food that could even begin to justify either. (doughy "thin" crust pizza with over-salted sauce and bland pot pie, both of which, judging from their temperature had been waiting a little bit to be delivered) Then the Star or our Starbelly Experience, the waiter was clearly apathetic to us and much more interested in his other tables--the one's with bigger checks. Even so much as complementing a female patron on the softness of her jacket. (Yes, he touched the sleeve.) 

I can forgive late food if the server is at least pretending to be apologetic to make up for extenuating circumstances, but when he is the paragon of efficiency, attentiveness and exuberant charm with every other patron around us ... THAT is insulting. I didn't expect him to touch my jacket, but a little more focus and a simple, "sorry about that guys" and perhaps 10 mins. into the meal, "hey i hope everything's okay?" would've sufficed... but of course that would've taken away from the quality time with that woman's jacket. The people helping him, from the busser, to the expediter or other waiter had way more personality, professionalism and competence. 

Huge notes to MANAGEMENT for your STAFF: when serving people do not reach across the long table to serve or pick-up food.. It wasn't that busy tonight, walk AROUND the big table or is that part of the charm? Being handed plates like you're at some hipster cafeteria? OH and tell patrons that the hooks for the jackets are underneath towards the middle of the table, otherwise they risk touching the big wads of gum also stuck underneath the table. yup, definitely a caffeteria vibe.

Okay, back to chuckles ... so clearly having written us off, when it came time to ask for our check, I had to wave him down and ask, "Are you our waiter?," after staring at him directly in the eyes TWICE  after which both times he swerved to do busy work at other patron's tables. I wasn't mad about the late food.... but his ignoring us pretty much ruined the night. I'm sure in a weird way tipping him poorly only makes him a worst waiter, he'll continue to think that bigger checks = bigger tips, which does make sense, but really he should just learn that great service all around, regardless of the check size = bigger tips. 

Starbelly is lucky that it is popular, but its certainly NOT because of its stellar staff or impeccable food. My recommendation? If you absolutely do not care about the quality of your dining experience, then you have arrived at your premiere destination -- sit down and prepare to be underwhelmed. (this is my 5th time here in a few years and it has been consistently poor to mediocre at best) but then again, I didn't have a drink with my meal. Scratch that -- order a cocktail and a bottle of wine, then you won't care how blah either the dinner or the service was ... AND your jacket will get touched.
author: Jimmy d.

description:
My leg is falling aslep from this metal high chair....and there's TWO birthdays... This ain't Chuck e Cheese...or is it?
Food is ok.
author: Greg H.

description:
This place is trying hard to be too cool for skool!!!  If I could give ZERO STARS, I would.  Sigh.

Right off, the hostess denied our party of three a 3-top, in spite of several open tables.  She explained that the tables were "reserved" yet they remained unclaimed for no less than 15 minutes.  After we sat at the communal table for 20 minutes, the hostess finally offered us one of the several still-unclaimed reserved tables.  That was the highlight of the night because it all went downhill starting with THE PIECE OF CORK IN MY GLASS OF WINE. When I informed the server about the cork, he fished it out of the glass and tried to re-serve the wine to me.  

I found the menu too big for its britches and the execution of the plates pretty mediocre.  The roast chicken was a SALTY, DRY and SMALL-portioned MESS. 

I certainly will not be going back!  There are too many good restaurants in SF.
author: Eddie L.

description: I haven't been to this location since it was Askew, but I was in for a surprise when my friend and I sat in the patio full of sunshine. The service there was fantastic (Bob or John) and the food was great. I ordered the Margarita Pizza with fresh mozzarella & basil while my friend ordered 2 farmhouse eggs,potatoes, toast & sausage for breakfast, which was delicious! I can't wait to go back and have their breakfast instead
author: Marco R.

description:
Seriously good grub.  I came here for dinner after a couple of people recommended it.  I am really glad to have checked it out.  The space is cute, and they have a prettydecently sized back patio that I bet would be great for brunch on a sunny day.  However, we sat inside adjacent to the patio and it was just as fun.

We ordered salad and pate to share for starters.  The pate is a great value for the portion you get--we had to get extra bread, but we had more than enough for the two of us.  The salad was also good....I admit, i pretty much love any salad with goat cheese, but with the mixed greens and mini heirloom tomatoes...it was refreshing and tasty.  The dressing was good without being over powering.

I do have to minus one star for the amount of time it took between courses.  we ordered a pizza and our server told us that it was taking long because I added the egg to it.  Um...ok.... However, that aside, I added their house made bacon (divine) and the egg to my margarita with burrata and basil pie and i was in heaven.  The crust was crisp and the sauce was great.

I definitely need to return to try more items on the menu.  Since we split our food it was pretty reasonably priced, but if I had just ordered solo, the prices were a little high for pizza...but worth it.

One thing worth mentioning, they have a call ahead wait list which was awesome to cut the waiting time down for a table if you can't get a reservation for the night you want to go.

Can't wait to get back there!
author: Lu E.

description:
My friend brought me here about a month ago and I have to say I had a fabulous experience from the delicious wine to the great starters, sides and finally the entrees, I couldn't wait to come back!! 

So, we decided to come back....it started out great we got wine and shared a pizza. We had a great chat with the server who I learned was from New Jersey as am I. We also mentioned to him we were at a funeral pretty much the entire day and just wanted a drink and a bite to eat to unwind..we were really enjoying our drinks and pizza and then all of the sudden we felt like were being rushed my friend wasent done with her slice of pizza and he wanted to take her plate..she told him she wasent and he gave her an attitude..oh I thought to myself here we go..when she finished he offered dessert, we each got a cookie he put the plates down and with that dropped our check..SERIOUSLY??? We both were seriously appalled..I looked at the time and it was 11 pm. Okay fine I understand its closing time but that was so damn rude. So,she got her card back and I told my friend not to sign the check until we are done and so he was walking back and forth just waiting to pick up the check it was so annoying!!! She didnt even finish and we left..Very Very disappointed.

I'am a server too and I have and would never do that ever! If your guests are there past 11 and still eating let them enjoy it!! Its not like your not getting paid as well as a tip so chill out!!
author: Tanya O.

description:
Another case of a good thing gone not so good. Ladies and gentleman, it's not Beretta. Maybe the owners should have enjoyed the success of one good thing while it lasted instead of instantly wanting to branch out and capitalize on their success. In most cases, this means that quality goes by the wayside.

My experience started out with an ordeal making the reservation. The webiste says "email or call for a reservation". I'm at work, so I email. No response. Call two days later, to say that I'm checking on the status of my reservation since nobody emailed me back. The hostess immediately put me on hold for the manager becuase she thought I was mad, which I wasn't. He then gets on the phone and is really defensive and denies the fact that the website says the take reservations by email (go look, it's right there!) Now he says that the time I wanted is gone...and that we have to come at 6. I say 6:15, please? He says ok...

I get there at 6:10 and the hostess tells me I'm late for my 6:00 reservation....Excuse me?

Food was fine, but just fine. Wine was fine, but just fine. $14 for two scallops? Give me a break. 

I'll just go back to Beretta next time.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
If you want to be treated with indifference by your server and eat a bland yet hearty burger, Starbelly is your place.  

If you want an awesome burger and expedient/friendly service at roughly the same price point I recommend:

1) Citizen's Band
2) Mission Beach Cafe
3) Namu
4) Epic Roast House's BBB combo (Burger, beer and brownie $20) in the bar.  

'Nuff said.
author: Emily F.

description: A friend took me here for lunch. I ordered a salad with chicken. I noticed it tasted rather bland. I asked the waiter for more salad dressing and there was a delay in receiving it. Finally he arrived and it was a green dressing and I realized there was absolutely no dressing on my salad previously and I had already eaten half the salad. That is just careless serving with no apologies either. I had previously enjoyed my experience here.
author: Kevin D.

description: Thank you SO much for your seasonal and organic choices!  It's the only place I'll eat bacon or sausage, which is friggin' home made!   awesome!
author: Linda R.

description:
I cannot stress enough how important it is that a restaurant have a skilled and pleasant host or hostess. He or she will set the tone for your dining experience, and if they are rude or inept, your meal is affected. 

Which is exactly what happened at Starbelly. 

We'd called ahead to make a reservation and, when we arrived, we were told by the airhead hostess, 'Oh. I didn't think you guys were coming, so I crossed you off. It'll be about 20 minutes before I can seat you.'

We'd arrived 10 minutes EARLY for our reservation, so we didn't understand why she'd think we weren't coming, but ok. I can wait 20 minutes, especially for a table at a restaurant with the amount of buzz that Starbelly has had. 

20 minutes passed. Other people came and put their names in, and the hostess kept telling us. 'You guys are next to be seated. You're next.' But then, she would seat other parties, people who'd come in after us. We were totally confused, especially because there were only 3 of us, and she was seating parties of 3 and 4 ahead of us. We kept asking her what was going on, and she'd reply, 'You're next! You're next!'

An hour passed. 

An HOUR. Were we idiots for waiting? Maybe. But we really wanted to eat there, and, by that point, we were just being stubborn. And we were getting a huge, bitter laugh out of the hostess, who, by this point, had simply turned her back on us and pretending that we weren't there. 

Finally, a table opened up, and we were the only ones waiting. But it needed to be bussed. Did she bus it? Nope. She stood there, DOODLING, and waited 10 minutes for a busboy to finally come out and clear the dirty dishes. 

She seated us, but apparently didn't tell the waitress that we were there, because another 10 minutes elapsed. Since we were seated right by the hostess stand, I waved our friend down and said, 'Do we have a waitress?' She replied, 'Oh. Yeah. Do you want me to get her?'

Yes, inept hostess. Yes I do. 

The waitress, the food...fine. All fine. But our dinner was ruined long before it was even served. And nobody even offered us an apology for being treated like lepers. 

So no thanks, Starbelly. There are enough restaurants in this town for me to be perfectly satisfied never patronizing you again.
author: Sara A.

description:
Atmosphere is quite cute, the bright, fresh colors and use of wood compliment give the interior that matches their food style. Little touches like communal tables and mismatched silverware and kitchen towels for napkins add to the casual atmosphere. Take a look outside for an alfresco back porch which is heated and covered in cold months.
There were 3 of us, we split a starter of burata with black garlic and olive oil, served with toast... It was amazing, the black garlic gave the burata a wonderful flavor almost like truffle. Three dishes were the fish tacos made with a cornmeal crust and home pickled jalapeño... Which were not greasy and had a nice kick due to the pepper and spicy slaw. The crab Louie salad looked amazing and so did the mushroom and pulled chicken risotto. Overall a great place to eat when you are in the Castro!
author: Ricardo M.

description:
One of my favorite spots to grab dinner in the city.

Here are the deliverables:

Must order:
-Pizza (ideally one with green goddess dressing and bacon... Truly a match made in heaven).  Nice and thin, perfect to start off a tasty meal.
-Burger... Again, add house made bacon.  Do it.
-Pot de creme.  These are addictive and I'm trying my best to not pick one up every chance I get.  You've been warned... Also ask for extra cookies!  2 is never enough.

The staff is usually friendly and attentive, but can be hit or miss some nights.  The beers are local and change frequently.  It's always busy for dinner so you will undoubtedly need a reservation.
author: Dan W.

description:
Hip minimalistic industrial chic. 

Yes. It is the place to be in the Castro. Packed house on a Monday night. I like the communal table as well. 

Order the Romano beans with tomato ragu. Order the spaghetti with bacon and jalapenos. Order the salted caramel pot de creme and leave happy.
author: Natalie S.

description: Great food. A little pricey but love the atmosphere. You are able to either sit at a community table in the middle of the restaurant of have more privacy.
author: Callie T.

description: LOVE! Pork Sugo lasagna to die for as well as the mushroom pizza and grapefruit splash drink is my FAV!  LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.
author: Lena M.

description:
Delicious! The menu is constantly being tweaked which is great and they always have some seasonal treats. 

I would say that the starters, sides and desserts are where they shine brilliantly. The main dishes can be a little dissapointing. They sometimes suffer from being overly seasoned which is satisfying to the palate but doesn't really give credit to the deliciousness of the ingredients.

The mussels with chorizo are always amazing.  I normally prefer savory to sweet, but for Starbelly I will make an exception. The desserts are worthwhile and well thought out. The salted pot de creme is great and  the rice pudding with cherries is perfect. Again, menu changes but don't skip dessert. 

I will admit that sometimes there does seem to be a little bit of a lag in service and kitchen coordination does not always happen seemlessly but it is still great food.
author: Jimi G.

description:
Yummy food, though a somewhat scattered menu. The grits were dyn-o-mite, and the pizza was decent, but not incredible. The space is really pretty -- it looks like they have jazzed it up since taking over what used to be Asqew Grill.

The salted caramel pot de creme was delicious, and came served in an adorable little glass jar, which was almost too precious. The little salty biscuits on the side were kind of random, though.

The service was by far my favorite part. Everyone was SUPER nice and friendly, which is always a nice surprise. A not-so-nice surprise, though, is that they don't serve hard liquor, so be prepared -- their "cocktails" don't pack too much of a punch.
author: Vandana M.

description:
Thank you yelp for guiding my starbelly experience! we shared the chicken liver pâté and the caramel pot de crème as recommended, additionally we had a pizza and a salad (the salad being disappointingly small). Over all the food was 5 star excellent. The lovely waitress was very attentive. And I can't wait to come back and try the patio.

My only gripe would be that the prices were a bit more than the $$ price tag and the salad and bread appetizer was very small.
author: ellen m.

description:
So, I really want to like this place...

But we had the worst service I've ever had in a San Francisco restaurant. Though some of the staff are friendly and accommodating, it's just the whole operations thing that's off.

For example...
Drinks took almost 15 minutes to reach our table (and this was brunch; only one person had a cocktail)...
When my orange juice finally came, there was a hair in it...
(and dishes and silverware in general weren't completely clean...)
One of my dining companions didn't get the right dish (and then had to wait another 15min for the corrected dish to reach him; he was granted an apology but nothing was comped);
And the timing on everything was just totally off.

Okay, the rant is over. I love the physical space and design of the restaurant, food is decent enough, and it's an overall welcomed addition to the Castro restaurant scene. But, they just can't seem to get the service and operations thing down (on neither of my visits), though it's now been open several months. (Also, seems like any of my friends who've dined there separately have experienced similar slipups...). So, until they get their act together, I can pass on the mini corn dogs.
author: Daniel P.

description:
Even though the name makes me think of a Care Bear, I really like Starbelly.  I definitely prefer it over its sister restaurant, Beretta, which is too much of a scene and occasionally has slow service.

Unlike Beretta there is a no liquor, so you'll have to make do with beer and wine.  Luckily the beer menu is disproportionately extensive for a restaurant of this size.  For appetizers on my last visit we had the burrata and salumi plates, which were full of sodium-rich fatty goodness.  I had the burger for dinner, which was really delicious.  Last time I came I had the roasted chicken, which was also very good.  There is so much good stuff here, each time I come here I eat too much, risking a Starbelly supernova.  

Service at Starbelly has been great both times.  The first time I visited we moved tables to accommodate a larger party, and even though we were happy to do it, they comped us dessert for our trouble.  Classy.
author: Aaron S.

description:
I like Starbelly. I really do. I thoroughly enjoy their burger with Pt Reyes blue cheese and I had it the first two times.

I went last week with Miss EB as usual but wasn't hungry enough for the burger so I tried the chicken wings. 

I could not believe what they brought me as chicken wings. There are 3 parts to a chicken's wing: the drumette, which of course is what you think you will be getting, the tip of the wing and the little tiny segment in the middle that has a couple of bones and a tiny little smidgeon of chicken meat. This is the part, along with the tip, that goes in the soup pot. There were 5 of these micro "wings" on the plate and between all 5 there wasn't a whole bite of chicken. I'm sorry now that I didn't say something about it to the wait person, but I didn't. They didn't have much flavor. I think they were supposed to be glazed in honey and truffle.

Stay away from these "wings", or at least be forewarned. They are meant for soup or the compost heap. Oh, and it was $6.00 for 5.

I will keep going there, but I will stick with the burgers from now on.
author: Marcia P.

description: Nice hip place. Decent food with expensive wine by the glass.  $13 for CA wine & pour was not generous. Ordered 3 kinds of pizzas, fries, salad & mussels. Nothing really outstanding. Also, had a mishap with server spilling pizza on my guest's jacket. Situation was handled well & was given money for dry cleaning. No point deducted for this.  Popular place but I have had better else where.
author: Mario S.

description:
Food (4): Very good gourmet pizza. Other imaginative entrees. Solid starters and the salted caramel pot de creme was outstanding. However, some of the food was under-salted. The beer selection was awesome.
Service(3): Competent, but a little brusque.
Atmosphere(3): Stylish, but cramped and loud.

Overall: I'll go back.
author: Yogi B.

description:
I looove Starbelly. The service is always super friendly and the restaurant setup is cozy but still very nice.  I always end up getting the same thing but I'm ok with that because it never disappoints.
To start - corn & jalapeno hush puppies and the cornmeal fried oysters.
To follow -  the burger with cheese, onions and avocado and split a pizza (they are all good so I mix it up here :)
And then to drink... always start with the Diablito and then either move to a beer (they have a decent selection) or continue with my beer equivalent of a bloody mary.
If there is room -  a dessert and coffee.


Thank you Starbelly. Favorite restaurant in the Castro hands down. I'm sure I will be repeating that order in the near future :)
author: shadi m.

description:
I like the layout of the place. The service is friendly and really efficient. We shared the mussels (did I mention I am into mussels at the moment?) and compared to 2223, sorry...it was just okay. 

Had the roast beets. Um. Okay. Needed more goat cheese and a little longer in the oven. 

Had the mushroom pizza. Love thin-crust pizza but...well...I have to say it was all just a little on the bland side.
