The desserts were fantastic, too. The best was the caramel pot de creme (salted caramel is such a hot flavor nowadays, but with good reason) and the pear crumble was delectable, too.

Great beer selections! I got this great beer from a microbrewery in upstate New York and I loved it. $6 for a glass. 

We were very pleased! My parents said it was their best dining experience ever in San Francisco.
author: Jason M.

description:
If i could I would have ordered everything from the menu twice....oh I did
order some plates twice....it was that good.....the service was great also
author: Nikki M.

description: Starbelly is one of the nicer dining options in the Castro. I particularly like the brunch offerings. One a nice morning the back patio area is just about perfect. I wish the dinner menu was a little bit more extensive or changed more often, but what they offer is done well. The staff are always attentive and pleasant.
author: Ryan B.

description:
So good!!

I went here on a Sunday afternoon. We wanted to try so much stuff that we told our server to just keep coming back and we would order in shifts. He was totally accommodating, even when it got really busy in there. He also had grrrreat recommendations!

We started with the mini corn dogs. YUM! But beware, they definitely are mini! Second came the mussels. I don't even eat mussels, but tried them because they looked and smelled delicious. I ended up eating my half! They had chorizo in them that gave them a little kick. Then, we went for the bacon pizza. Delicious- took two pieces home for lunch the next day and they didn't reheat very well, but the original pizza was perfect. We had originally ordered a different pizza and asked to add bacon to it, but the server came back and said that the chef didn't want to do it and it wouldn't taste good. I appreciated that, and we ended up with just what we wanted.

After we had the scallops with yam puree. Again, I don't eat scallops. But this time I did, and loved them. We also had the green beans, which were simple but good. 

Throughout the meal we were trying different beers, since you can get little ones for about $3, making it easy to try a handful of them. Great local selection to choose from. They also bring complimentary sparkling water- a simple touch that makes all the difference.

Our server was Steven, who was cheery, helpful, and around just enough. Love him.

The only thing I would say is the dessert menu looked a little boring. We passed, which is unusual! 

Next time I'm trying the chicken. Nom nom nom.
author: Jenny I.

description: I came here about a week ago with a friend for lunch. I ordered the Butternut Squash Pizza with black garlic, goat cheese, and toasted pine nuts. I've never had black garlic but have always wanted to try it, and it's actually really good! It's sweet and savory and has a nice acidity to it. The pizza flavor combinations was also perfect! Sweet, savory, creamy, crunchy. I'm all about balance of flavors and textures and this was on point. I highly recommend ordering the butternut squash pizza while they have it since it's only seasonal. Yum! Service was good, our waiter was very nice and actually recommended I ordered the pizza. I'm glad I followed his advice! He also gave a side of this garlic/chive ranch dressing that paired really nicely with the pizza. I love dipping things!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Dearest Starbelly, I want you in MY BELLY at least once a month.

I have never had the Meg Ryan experience with food until last Friday night.  I LOVE chicken; so much so that I have even adopted it as my password for many online sites.  And when the chick is local, organic, or grass-fed - even better.  Super moist?  You just hit my g spot.  

My description of the rotisserie chicken wouldn't do it justice.  I couldn't look up from my plate, I could barely give up a bite, and I couldn't get enough of the spinach salad on the side (had a hint of mustard.. mmm).  I am boringly/lazily basic when it comes to cooking at home - but chicken and sautéed spinach are my staples.  You guys rocked my world.  I now have some major upgrades to do.

I apologize to the rest of the Starbelly menu for going straight to the chicken.  I left out all of the fabulous appetizers we had.  I think we ordered one of everything - the beets and hush puppies were my faves - my friends loved the warm (HOT) olives.  

I rarely ever remember a waitress' name so am unable to compliment them personally - but this was a hard one to forget, as her name was the best in the world.  Alexis was fabulous - she was 100% honest on wine selection, knowing that we liked chardonnay, and had little regard for sauvignon-blanc (sweetness, blah!).  She told us though that the chardonnay there was quite sweet and let us had a little tasty test.  Turns out she was right, and we went for her suggestion.  Super attentive, super fun, and a great waitress.

Everyone at my table was extremely impressed with the whole go around.  The décor also deserves a little call out, as it's super simple and charming - and I love the family style dining.  

Stars were in the skies, and bellies were full.  The name does the restaurant justice, and couldn't be more G SPOT on.  Starbelly, GET IN MY BELLY.
author: Alexis B.

description: Excellent service.  Made reservations with special request and served accordingly.  Food was excellent, too.  Wish they had a little bit more seafood on their menu, but understand.  Excellent prices and wines.  Will return.  I have been here 3 times already.  Prices are great, too!  Yes the Chicken liver pate is a winner and the onion jam is superb.  Salumi  and cheeses were fantastic as were the mussels!  Can't wait to go back!
author: Emilia G.

description: Love this place. Reasonable prices, amazing drinks, good beer selection.  The smoked chicken was delicious as was the burger.  Our server was super friendly and attentive as well. Definitely a go-to spot from now on!
author: S. V.

description:
Starbelly is one of those long, slim restaurants.  You know the type.  Bar on one side.  Tables on the other.  Further back more tables.  It has an up tempo vibe suited to eating, drinking, talking.  I liked it..  Service was good and for the most part food was good as well.

A salad of grilled little gems with orange, feta, and some nice crunchy hazelnuts was a great beginning to a meal.  Next a misstep.  Fried dungeness crab hushpuppies were piping hot.  But unfortunately there was no taste of crab.  Only filler.  However, pan roasted striped bass with chanterelle mushrooms and celery root puree was a big winner.  Perfectly prepared.  Lovely to the taste.  I only wished for more on the plate at the price.  However, I suppose good food is supposed to leave you wanting one taste more.  I wanted one or two tastes more for a dollar or two less.

One other thing.  No bread.   I would have liked some good, crusty bread with some good sweet butter.
author: David D.

description: I'm obsessed with this place!  It's great that you can make reservations!!  Also, the pizzas are fantastic - loved the fava/truffle pizza and the bacon/arugula pizzas.  The fava bean dumplings were divine.  I really wanted to like the pork sugo gnocchi but its actually not gnocchi - it's a polenta cake!  Would be so much better if it were gnocchi!!
author: Anna V.

description: After an initial bad experience at this place, I've had many great meals.  The food is consistently good and you get a decent bang for your buck.  One of the better places in the Castro.
author: Scott Z.

description:
I went to Starbelly last night for a work dinner and enjoyed a really great meal with some great company. This was my second visit to the place but since we were a large (14 people) group, I had a chance to try many more of the dishes. 

We started by ordering a bunch of small plates. We likely could have just dined on the small plates and appetizers. The stand-outs were the chicken liver pate and the scallops. We ended up re-ordering the scallops twice, just because everyone enjoyed them so much. The creamed local corn was also excellent.

I had a pizza margherita with ham for my main course, which was quite good. I couldn't resist the salted caramel pot de crème for dessert and I'm glad I didn't. It was just about perfect; the byplay between the salt and the sweet was wonderful.

If you like beer, I recommend the Curieux -- at $26 (for a 750ml bottle) it is the most expensive beer on the menu, but it was also the tastiest.

The atmosphere was noisy but fun and the service was pretty good. It was a little slow in places, but we were there for 3+ hours and didn't really notice the pace. All in all, a great time.
author: Bruce H.

description:
Pork is a vegetable. Therefore the porchetta at Starbelly is one of the best veggies in town.  In all seriousness folks, this place is for carnivores.  My date and I split the burger and porchetta then washed them down with a couple beers, you know, for hydration.  

The porchetta was a juicy, crispety, cruchety slab of swine heaven.  You need to cut it just right to get the right layers of fat, meat, and skin in each bite.  But a little work pays off.  They season it just enough to bring out some flavor but not overpower.  The waitress tried to snatch away the plate before I had finished the skin but I snagged it off her tray as she walked away.

The burger was high quality once they cooked it right.  We asked for medium, they brought out raw.  It mooed when I cut into it.  But they rectified the situation quickly and gave me a free beer for my troubles.  Once properly cooked, the burger tastes like backyard BBQ.  It's got that smoky charcoal flavor to it.  Reminded me of the 4th of July.  God Bless America.

The place (unsurprisingly) is loud and cramped.  Don't bring the Mrs. here for a quiet, romantic dinner on the town.  Do however bring your meat-eating friends to this establishment and enjoy.
author: Tom R.

description:
I really like this restaurant. It is one of my favorites in the city. I like the decoration, location, food, drinks, service, etc. 

I have never been to the other restaurants by the owners but if I had to describe this place, I would say Delfina and Monk's Kettle. Gourmet NY style pizza and french fries with the 3 dippings (I'm sure that's so Monk's Kettle) all in one place. I love that combination. 

I can't wait for the patio to open. On a sunny day, I would love to come and take a table outside. Please neighbours, let this happen.
author: Alexia R.

description:
Winning combination:

- cute design
- cheap menu ($5-15 for most things and $22 bottles of wine, c'mon!)
- organic, local ingredients
- diverse dishes from simple (mini-corndogs) to sophisticated (housemade chix pate w/ pickled french breakfast radishes, and figs)
- cool staff
- chef who used to be at bacar in the olden days
- cute back patio
- and did I say cheap?

Definitely noisy though.  Be prepared.

Only complaint - all the salads seemed to be overly over-dressed.  Soggarama.
author: Melanie C.

description: Starbelly's motto should read, "Where my gays go to brunch"  The menu has something for everyone:  carb free salads (before Pride), hang over eggs (after Pride), bellinis (during Pride).   With a variety of gays from twinks to tattooed hipsters there is a little sumthin' sumthin' for everyone.  Except for me it seems.
author: Monica L.

description:
Awesome place but the wait situation is kinda a pain and I would recommend calling the day of an hour and a half before you want to come in.

The roasted peppers are super simple but a great addition to any pizza there. I also loved their bacon pizza which had the moistest tastiest bacon ever. We also had their pork cheeks which were exceptional but the grits were a little starchy for my taste. The pate appetizer was awesome with fresh figs.

Will def be back to taste more stuff but call ahead so I don't have to wait as long.
author: Katie M.

description: I so want to give this place 5 stars b/c I really did enjoy my food.. However, I was served an order of fried chicken that was mostly raw and pink in the middle.  Unfortunately, I did not realize this until I was 1/4 of the way done with my meal. I was a bit nauseous when I realized this and nervous of getting sick as well.  However, I did proceed to get a replacement chicken dish, which arrived about 15 minutes after my friend was finished with her meal.  It was still a bit undercooked for my comfort, but I decided to take most of it home so I could heat it up and cook it further.  My main disappoitment was that  no manager ever appologized, nor did they offer me any small compensation.. even a complementary coffee would have been nice, b/c it really is the thought that counts.  Needless to say, I had quite the stomach ache that night, but thank goodness I did not get sick.  I am just really disappointed that they would not have addressed this matter in a more thorough and professional manner.
author: Shannon S.

description:
I took my Mom and family here for my Mom's 60 birthday party.  I was a little concerned because I had never been to the restaurant myself, but I was pleasantly surprised because everyone loved it!  The waitress was so helpful.  When we told her none of us had ever been there she recommended lots of great wine, starters, salads, and entrees.  Some of the things were things that we wouldn't have normally ordered but they were definitely great recommendations. 

Only one problem is that it gets very crowded during the "regular" dinner hour, so either go very early or very late or make sure to call well in advance, or be prepared for a bit of a long wait.  But I could say that the food and service were worth the wait.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I think I really want to give it a 3.5 stars... it isn't quite a 4 star but isn't quite a 3 either. Guess I'll round up to a 4. 

The wait wasn't too bad as we showed up at around 7:30pm on the Sunday before Labor Day. Ended up sitting at the bar after waiting for about 25 minutes. 

In short, they got part of our order wrong. I take that back, they got Victoria C's part of the order right, but my salad wrong.  But our bartender/waiter was so nice... I couldn't help but like the experience!

We had the following... 
Mini Corn Dogs - tastes HEALTHY :) - but this was a mistake on the order, so we got the for free!
Fried Clams - sauce could have used more umph
Mussels - Yum (don't think I'm allergic anymore!... what a way to test this theory)
Sweet Corn Soup - really sweet but great for soup lovers
... I ordered the Starbelly Salad.. but got the cucumber one instead. This sucks since I am not a cucumber fan OR an olive fan... 
Mushroom Pizza - good, but could have used more Gruyere cheese... we added the bacon for some extra tastiness. 
Fruit cobbler (?) with Carmel ice cream - YUM!!! the best part of the night. 

The drinks were fancy too. But they ran out of french fries at 8pm on a dinner night... sad. Super sad. 

Overall, an affordable meal - just don't over order we like did... and come early, they don't take reservations.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I want to give this restaurant an excellent review because the squash pizza with goat cheese was absolutely divine.  I want to, but I can't.

The place is incredibly loud, too much of the seating is communal (making it even more difficult to have a conversation), service was slow and inconsistent, and the other dishes weren't spectacular, at least for their sizes and prices.

It's really unfortunate to say this about a restaurant that has clearly attempted to create a beautiful setting, but I think next time I'll just grab one of their pizzas to go.
author: Mike G.

description:
Seating is very hard to come by, we got very lucky the night we went.  

Food was good All-American cuisine with the best scallops I've ever tasted.  A must-try if you can get in.
author: Gary D.

description: Food was delicious and staff was super kind!!! The waiter I had was amazing and patient. They even got some water for my dog. The burratta, the pot de crême and the chicken pâté are simply divine. I will be going back.
author: Sylvia N.

description:
Word to Adam   - food was reasonably good, service was questionable, and your attitude needs some work. Learn to accept constructive feedback buddy!

We had a party of 8 and the delivery of the food was staggered. They need better coordination in the kitchen to ensure that people get their food in time for them to eat together. Good restaurants will watch out for this.

My wife ordered the burger, which came out undercooked, and she sent it back. Everyone else had finished their dinner before we realized that my wife's food had not arrived yet (we were already having a lot of fun so did not notice the time passing). When I called the waitress to inquire about the burger, she said that it would take another 10 minutes because my wife had asked for it to be well done; it was at least 20 minutes since we had sent it back. We canceled the burger and I asked to speak to the manager. The chef (Adam Timney) came by. I explained to him what happened not expecting anything other then an apology. What I received was a defensive attitude and a comment that the delay was due to my wife ordering a second burger, this ticked me off - typically a good chef or restaurant manager will accept constructive feedback when it's given, not this guy. We had a great time but only because we were with a group of good friends and we made light of it all.

I would think twice about returning to eat at Starbelly.
author: John R.

description: Wow.   Great food. Great energy.  We went here on a whim and can def say it is one of the most memorable experiences of our SF weekend.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
I went with a friend on a recent Saturday night after we saw a movie and we were seated at the communal table fairly quickly.  Since we weren't super hungry and only wanted to nosh, we ordered the cornmeal calamari with remoulade (which wasn't remoulade but actually mayonnaise with Old Bay seasoning), the Starbelly salad, and the Starbelly bacon and pepper pizza.  I had high expectations because I love Beretta and was expecting the quality to be similar.  

However, that cannot be said.  Although the prices are in-line with those at Beretta, the food is unfortunately quite mediocre.  The cornmeal clams were greasy and separated from the batter as soon as you picked them up, the salad was totally flavorless, oily, and lacked acidity, and the so-called Starbelly bacon on the pizza was akin to chunks of fat that slightly resembled pancetta, but with much less flavor.  Despite the fact that the food was bland, there wasn't a salt shaker or pepper grinder in sight.  I guess the only good things I can say at this point are that the interior design is cool and the wine list is decent (the Primitivo at $6 a tumbler is quite a delicious value).  

That said, I'll probably be back since they've just opened and will hopefully work out all of their kinks in the kitchen.  Bottom line, I wouldn't travel from my hood to eat at Starbelly but if I were in the neighborhood, I'd definitely dine there again since the Castro lacks good and/or imaginative dining options.
author: Doug V.

description: Starbelly was ok but just ok.   On our luncheon visit the restaurant was not at all busy.  Service was slow and the kitchen was slower.  Hubby and I both had a burger and fries.  The burgers were fine, cooked well and the fries were ok but not as crisp as I like.  We may come again sometime but we won't go out of our way.
author: Russell D.

description:
Went last night with a large group (had reservations) for a Birthday dinner.  Service was good, place was PACKED (aka Overcroweded and loud).  Weird that the lights kept flickering every few minutes or so - waiter said there was a short and electricians couldn't figure it out (hope they do b/f it triggers a fire!).

Food - I had the Corn dogs - very good w/ homemade ketchup.
THen i went for the Burger - usually you can tell a joints skills by ordering something basic the first time you go there.  Came with shoestring fries which had a nice crisp to them.  The burger wasn't so special.  Actually over cooked and the bun was overtoasted.  Looking around the table I should've ordered one of the pizzas.

Not sure what all the hype is about this place (found out it's actually owned by the same group as Pomodoro, i like those places)...if you ask me in SF there is way better out there, Starbelly is fine but again, way better out there with out all the clutter.
author: Brian H.

description:
This place is truly 'cool'. Down to the wardrobe of their servers, everything is meant to provide an upbeat, fun, and tasty experience. 

We were seated outdoors under their natural gas heaters (makes it great for a chilly night). In addition, we noticed they cultivate their own herbs right out on the patio--doesn't get more local than that. 

I appreciated the variety of options on the menu. No complaints from my taste buds... four stars!
author: Adriel S.

description:
Starbelly is a great location in the middle of Castro, just down from the muni station. Wait staff are very very friendly, and helpful if you don't know what to order.

The cocktail and drink selection is pretty diverse, and they always have some interesting beers and wines on the menu. 

I really like the spaghetti with jalapenos and basil, as well as the brussels sprouts with bacon. Pizzas are great too. The chocolate peanut butter sundae with hand made local ice cream is a blast from the past.  

My girlfriend says the coffee is the best she has had - might run a very close second to Ritual IMHO, but still great.
author: Paul G.

description: I came here for a birthday celebration and was seated in the back room which was an outdoor covered patio. It was cosy but had a nice young vibe to the place. It seemed very happening for a Friday night. Yummy thin crust pizza. Good salads and burgers. Decent service and decent food. The parking situation SUCKED. I circled for 1 hour before finding a spot 6 blocks away. Yikes!  Good casual hangout with friends.
author: May B.

description: I encountered this place last night and only went in for dessert and coffee and it was amazing. Me and a friend shared the Indian Pudding and the Apple Cobbler with there French Press coffee. So delicious and a very quiet yet hip and elegant place to eat !! Will definitely be back !!
author: Felicia T.

description:
I count Beretta among one of my favorite SF restaurants so I was more than psyched to give Starbelly a try. I love the wood planked walls and extra long bar, but everything else just seems kind of half-finished and I hate to say it: dated. Why install massive shelving on the walls if you aren't going to put anything on them? Just hang some art instead; it's way more interesting to look at. And the lime green and pumpkin color scheme just seems a little too Ikea. However, what Starbelly lacks in decor cohesiveness, they more than make up for in taste, service, and value. 

We tried a few dishes off the reasonably priced "snack" options list - three perfectly crunchy mini corndogs with a killer housemade ketchup and olives with flatbread. Both were great dishes and a steal at $5. Next we sampled the butter lettuce salad with hazelnuts, figs, and a blue cheese vinaigrette. The dressing was deliciously vinegary and not too creamy, which is just how I like it. 

The pizza wasn't as good as Beretta's but I don't think it's trying to be. The one we picked - with cherry tomatoes, salumi, and mozzarella resting atop a well-sauced, perfectly crisp and slightly charred crust - was great tasting and pretty big for a mere $15. I could have stopped here, stuffed and happy, but we also ordered the lamb cheeks with grits and greens and spaghetti with Starbelly's own bacon, jalapenos, and basil. Both were excellent dishes. I loved the thick tubes of spaghetti and inventiveness of the additional ingredients used in the pasta but beware, the dish is super spicy. 

All this food and a bottle of wine for about for about $100. Totally solid opening, Starbelly. I cannot wait to come back and order brunch from your cute but not yet open back patio.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Catches breath, slips past lips, uses tongue, and experiences intense shudder and fluttering eyelids !  A short description of the dinner experience at STARBELLY. 
"Is it really that good?"    you inquire ..... 
"You bet your sweet ass it is!"    I reply.
If you want to hear about dessert you'll have to be older than 18 and sign a waiver!
author: Mark B.

description:
The 4 stars are for my husband, I'd veer more toward 3 and a half. Food was mostly spot on - the creamy San Marzano soup with cheese toasts, and the spaghetti with jalapeno were particularly good. The second had a surprising bite that made me wonder why everyone doesn't add jalapeno to their marinara. The corn dog appetizer was also a hit. 
The pizza, though, had us divided. It sounded perfect on the menu, with fresh figs, arugula and blue cheese. And when all three of these ingredients made it onto a bite simultaneously, the results sang. But given that there wasn't much fig on each slice, the fig-less parts were too salty and intense. I'm a huge blue cheese fan, but this was too much even for me. 
Service was friendly and prompt. The madeira cobbler was a fruity accompaniment that went down almost too easily. Prices were fantastic. 
Definitely worth a round 2.
author: Purnima M.

description:
In what used to be a less than exciting Askew Grill this cute new bistro has opened its doors. Minimal yet tasteful decorations have turned what was a boring chain restaurant into a happenin' place to eat.

The dinner menu is centered around tasteful paring of strong flavors, with both fare and libations proffering unique juxtapositions. The rim of my mixed drink was not sugar, not salt, but chili powder; this accented the smoothness of the beverage contained therein.
I ordered a pizza of figs, blue cheese and arugula; the sweet/savory contrast was scrumptious, and the crust light crispy and super thin as I like it. My partner's dish was spaghetti, but had a smokey spicy heat to it setting it apart from other spaghettis past or present.

All told, a great meal in a nice location. They  must have cleaned up their act since the bad reviews prior --- nothing to complain about now!
author: Jay A.

description:
Last night went with my sister, both food snobs, and had an enjoyable meal.  Lavender duck salad, grilled local sardines w/pickled peppers & onions basil aioli, pan roasted diver scallops w/gingered yam puree & pepitas, half rotisserie local chicken with warm spinach panzanella & roasted onion vinaigrette, pan roasted brussels sprouts & starbelly bacon, and salted caramel de pot to finish of the meal. All was great but the chicken....was just OK.  The service was knowledgeable, friendly, and on the spot. 

A friend at work raved about the porchetta, he's CIA trained so I take is advise seriously, but will have it next time. 

Check it out...it's a scene but a nice place so recommendable.  Back patio ....watch out in the summer time. ;)
author: Jacqueline A.

description: I love me some Starbelly.  I just felt like the food was delicious.  All I had was a pizza but looking around at other people's plates, everything looked amazing.  I had a bacon and jalapeno pizza, while my bestie with testes, Shea G, had a mushroom pizza.  I think this place is great for a date night, with dimly lit lights (not so dim you need a flashlight to read the menu) and a very warm atmosphere.   I loved it here and luckily its super close to where i live.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Another excellent addition to the neighborhood. Man, hard to decide whether 4 or 5 stars warranted. 

Reservation (or not) - I called in a bit before and a table wasn't going to happen, but space at the communal table was no problem (it was empty at 7pm). 

Food - We had fries with three really solid home-made sauces, scallops in a ginger/yam puree, and a sqaush and sage pizza, all of which were really excellent. the only thing that was uniquely excellent was the sauce on the scallops. Everything else was 4-star material, that sauce was definite 5-star.

Wine - really solid list, though pricey. No surprises.

Service - friendly, consistent, helpful, good.
author: Gregory P.

description:
First off I have to say I've read alot of the other reviews here on Yelp and to all those to gave this place 1 or 2 stars because they couldn't get a table: DON'T WRITE A REVIEW!  Can you really critique a place you've never actually experienced?  No, that's just sour grapes.

OK, onto the real review... I went here for lunch at noon sharp so I think we missed the rush.  We got seated dear the back door because we wanted to eat in the patio but it was close because they were still waiting on some permit.  Our waitress came promptly to take our appy and drink orders.  No appies for us, but the drinks we ordered the Darjeeling tea, lime, drink and the Grape-lime cooler were both very good.  The two things we got, the fried clam poboy and the salad with radicchio and scallops were both very good.  We looked at the dessert menu which looked pretty good too, but it was lunch we didn't want to go too crazy.  So overall, this place was pretty solid and I would probably go back and try other things since the prices are reasonable and there's a good selection on the menu.
author: Ming L.

description:
Starbelly is A-OK in my book.  I forgot what we had to eat--a pizza with green goddess dressing, crab salad, a spaghetti with bacon and a toffee dessert.  The crab salad was really lacking in crab--like, I was fighting for crab with my bf.  The pizza was good until the second slice and then the dressing got overpowering.  The spaghetti was good--one of the few dishes where I really like the bacon in it.  The toffee dessert was overly sweet.

We sat in the back patio on a cool night and it was nice and quieter than inside the restaurant, but still a little too cold under the heat lamps.  Service was really friendly but spotty.  It took them forever to get us our drinks.  I could tell the couple next to us also thought the service was subpar since they finished their food before us, ordered the same dessert as us, but did not get their dessert until 10 minutes after we did and "tsk tsk" at the waitress the whole time.

I would come back here for a casual dining spot and try other things eventually, but it's not one of those places I am dying to go back to, you know?
author: Trinh N.

description:
I've only been to Starbelly for brunch on warm weekend afternoons, and it's a wonderful spot to enjoy great food, drinks and laughs with friends.

Star brunch menu items include the chilaquiles and anything with their delicious thick-cut bacon as an ingredient,   Their homemade yogurt fruit plate was surprisingly delicious -- really something greater than the sum of its parts.   The Pimm's Cup alone is worth the visit alone, and the champagne cocktail is near perfect on the rare warm SF afternoon.  Service ain't the most attentive, but it's never been put off by it.  This is my go to brunch/lunch spot on nice days with friends.
author: Joseph G.

description: I've been to starbelly a hand full of times. Each time the food and service exceeds expectations. I went last night with a friend of mine for a Web project completion celebration. We ordered from their spring menu: mushroom risotto, grilled asparagus, little gem salad with raw goat cheese (OMG, the best thing I've ever tasted) and finished dinner off with the salt carmel pot de creme. Everything, I mean EVERYTHING was delish and right on. I can't wait for summer, please bring back the green gazpacho! Yummy!
author: Leslie T.

description:
chicken liver pate, pear, blue cheese and arugula pizza and salted caramel pot de creme...wooohooo!

I've been here quite a bit and have had nothing but yum yum food! Service can lag sometimes, but I usually go with time to spare...oh and make sure to call wayyy ahead as this place definitely gets busy quick!
author: Sergio R.

description:
Starbelly makes me want to visit my friends in Noe Valley more often just to explore their menu, and not only the Brunch/Lunch/Dinner one at that. They have an extensive and eclectic beer selection, and I'd like to work my way through their 21+ drinks list as well. Their Michelada lime was an interesting exercise: spicy, salty, tangy and refreshing all at once, and their Madeira Hot Toddy was a nice finish to my meal (but they were out of the Spiced Honey Stout which I REALLY wanted to try).

I first heard of Starbelly when it made the Chronicle's short list for the best fries in the city, and because I have a rather large affection for fries, it immediately made my list of places to try. So of course my very first time there, I got the house cut fries with three dips. I'll give them extra points for making the fries in-house, but if you think the perfect fry has a crispy exterior with a moist and almost flaky interior that can stand on its own with a light dusting of salt and perhaps some pepper, you might have mixed feelings about this. In our mix of cuts, some fries were perfectly cooked whereas others were limp and soggy. BUT, the fries come with three dipping sauces: a basil aioli, a romesco, and a house-made ketchup and I LOVE dipping sauces. So while the fries are not at the top of my favorites list on their own, the dipping sauces definitely help to elevate them on my list.

Despite my affinity for burgers, I would actually recommend the rotisserie chicken. It's moist, tender and extremely flavorful at once. This is the epitome of how I think chicken should be served.

And finally, do yourself a favor and get yourself a pizza. On my first visit, I had the great fortune of sitting in front of the kitchen. An unwanted pizza margherita came out, and instead of tossing it or putting it under heat lamps, the waiter decided that we looked hungry and gave it to us. Happiness++. That waiter was a genius, because I now must start off with one. He got me hooked.

As you might imagine, I really appreciate the service here. Service on my first visit was outstanding/superb/tack-on-any-number-of-other superlatives, and while I didn't find the same perks on successive visits, I have no complaints. 

If you're driving, be prepared to walk a few blocks as parking spots are rather elusive. And there may be a wait once you get there, but it's worth it.
author: Brent I.

description:
Starbelly is an excellent and much needed addition to the Castro.  I love the food.  My current favorite item on the menu is the apple and celery root salad, but you can't go wrong with most of the pizzas and entree options, which change regularly.  

The scene is pretty good too.  The decor is modern and fresh.  The crowd is young and hip, gay and straight.
author: Jared E.

description: Although remembering the last visit with terrible service on the patio, we sat at the bar and all was good!!! Great food, attentive, friendly staff.
author: Jack G.

description:
Fun new place in the Castro to pop in for dinner.  Casual and lively atmosphere.  Crowded but not painfully loud.  I think Starbelly raises the bar for restaurants in that neighborhood...
Highlights of the meal:
Lamb meatballs w/ feta & olives
Scallops in a yam-puree
Butter leaf salad w/ persimmons

Service was good. Not over-the-top, but pleasant, knowledgeable and quick.
author: A S.

description:
Starbelly, just south of Market on 16th St., is a really fun, stylish, and reasonably priced restaurant I recommend to be enjoyed by all; families, groups, or single persons alike. Whether you come for a light snack, full dinner or just coffee and desert, the ambience is warm and friendly and it's run in my opinion by a staff of caring and intelligent people which is reflected in the food they serve. 

The restaurant has a number of good appetizers to choose from, many of which are of the vegetable type, ie, grilled local artichoke & lemon aioli or split pea fritters. When they serve their spinach appetizer, don't think, just get it and eat it!  You can also find delicious salads as well, like the asparagus & mixed chicory salad. 

For entree's, the number one entree that I've had is the spaghetti with bacon: to die for!  The pizza is awesome, and the restaurant also serves fish, spare ribs, steak, pot pie, and burgers.

If desserts are your thing, try the warm toffee cake with mascarpone & medjool dates: off the hook! Make sure you order a small or large french press coffee to compliment the cake or any of their other amazing coffee products. 
The restaurant sports a moderately sized dining area and bar as well as back patio with heat lamps. This is a fun place!
author: Dave M.

description:
I went here a few nights ago with my girlfriend for the first time. It looked a little crowded, but we luckily got a table right away... which is always a plus in my book. 
We ordered a couple of "large" beers, which were actually pint size (is this normal in most restaurants, or am I totally a lush? Ha!) but they were pretty good. I forget what I tried but I feel like it was a double IPA or something ridiculous.
Our server was friendly, but didn't know the menu because she "didn't work there", which I found sorta odd, but maybe she normally works at Beretta or something. So basically she couldn't answer any of the questions we had, but she did send someone over to our table to answer our questions... after we had already ordered. 
We started with the cheese plate, which was reasonably good. We each got a salad... I got the Starbelly Salad and my girlfriend got the Little Gems salad... I would recommend either.
The best part of the meal for me were the Mussels and Chorizo that we ordered. This was my first time trying mussels and I was really skeptical, but the broth, chorizo and pepper combination was really good and my fears of the shellfish subsided.
After we had finished eating, our server dropped us the wrong check. Maybe she was just having an off night. 
All in all I would say that I would go here again sometime to try some of the other interesting sounding small plates on the menu.
author: Liane V.

description: I was visiting SF, and attempted to go to dinner at Starbelly, unsuccessfully. We did not have a reservation, while attempting to see if they could accomodate us, the hostess talked to us like we were morons. I'm not one to get talked down to by restaurant help, so we left.
author: Steve K.

description: Great service.  Was able to get seated right away for 2 at 7:30.  Nice decor.  Food was OK and definitely trying to be interesting, but it fell short for my taste buds.
author: Philip F.

description: Seared catfish has never been my thing, but I'm a convert. A bit pricey--but some of the best fish I can remember.
author: B B.

description:
I'm a total fan of this place.  I'll break it down....

Hostess - Although it can be hard to get a table, we called ahead and the hostess was super nice and helpful.  She was totally honest (and accurate) on the timing of when she thought we would be seated.

Service - Our waiter was quick, friendly and knowledgeable.  

Fare - The food was great.  Between the two of us, we ordered a few different things and split.  The warm olives and flat bread were pretty much just mediocre.  We split the little gems salad, which was delicious, but on the smaller side.  We couldn't say no to dungeness crab hush puppies with louie dressing, and I suggest you follow suit - super good.  We finished it up with the mushroom and gruyere pizza, which was equally fantastic.

Overall... lovely dinner.  Was it the culinary experience of the year, no.  But for a fun, scrumptious dinner at a fantastic price, this place rocks.
author: Julie E.

description:
All the variables came together this visit to Starbelly. I like this place. I wish there was something like this in Lone Mountain/USF area. The food was tasty and the beverage was good too. 

I really liked the decor and the less-than-five-minute-wait on a Thursday evening at 7:00 PM.
author: Chris G.

description:
After a recent visit to Starbelly for lunch, I was pleased to see that they now open the back patio for seating and they are open until 4pm for lunch. I also saw a Fried Oyster Po Boy on the menu that day and I just had to go in a try again. Fried Oysters in any fashion are my favorite food. 

The good service and atmosphere were not enough to raise my star rating for them. The Po Boy was supposed to be served on a toasted ciabatta roll but instead came out on a baguette. The bread was way to hard and crusty for the delicate, succulent oysters. Each bite completely smashed and pulverized the oysters and left scratches on the roof of my mouth. The oysters were done right and the bay aioli was lightly seasoned, which I wished were more flavorful. The fries were lengthy this time, unlike the last time when we had a basket of the leftover short ends. And the Caesar salad was really tasty!
author: Foodie F.

description: Butternut squash, sage, pumpkin seed, etc. pizza was very tasty, light, and innovative.
author: Steve G.

description:
Starbelly.  The name intrigued me.  It's another neighborhood gem.  The wine list was filled with many savory wines that will quench any palate.  I went for pizza the first time; delicious.  Went for pizza the second time and was blown away.  The second time around I had the chorizo and egg pizza...yes, I said it!  Who would have thought?   It was the most delicious pizza I have had as of yet!  For appetizers I ordered the mini corn dogs; mouth watering!  

The ambiance is quaint and intimate.  The crowd is a compilation of all walks of San Francisco life.  The waiters and bartenders were very personable and provided my party with awesome customer service and recommendations.  I will definitely be back and will try brunch on the patio next time!
author: Taña Marie R.

description: This is the go to place in the hood for me and the wife.  The menu is meat heavy, but delicious, I wouldn't bring vegan friends.  Who am I kidding I wouldn't associate with the lot.  The burger is awesome and the pizzas are always great.  Finally made it for brunch and loved it, porchetta sandwich ruled.  Call a head to get a seat.
author: Mickey D.

description: Starbelly is one of my favorite places here in the city. It combines inexpensive quality food with a nice ambiance and good service. You definitely have to try the spaghetti with bacon and the chicken liver paté when you go there, just thinking about it gives me a craving. Also, if you feel adventurous with your drinks, try the calimocho. You really can't go wrong with this place. Just make sure to call ahead of time on weekends, since it can get quite busy there at night.
author: Christian O.

description: Super awesome, start to finish. Beautifully prepared food, simple, delicious. The patio out back is great. Go there!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
We enjoyed our lunch...squash and pumpkin seed pizza and the pork sandwich.  The crust was perfect but the pizza could have been a little bigger in circumference. The pork sandwich was homemade pulled pork with a dipping sauce.  Both were absolutely delicious.  They also has hitichino beer, a japanese beer not found in many restaurants.  The host came off a little pushy but warmed up after he found an open table for us.  The server was attentive and not over-bearing.  The guy who brought our drinks was cool, "eclectic" and had huge attitude glasses on.  Total lunch bill for two $50.  Oh, the dressing on the caesar salad was too thick and not well dispersed in the salad but the salad still fresh tasting.
Surprisingly, a friend went there for dinner and hated the food and the service...but won't stop me from going back.
author: H G.

description:
We were tremendously excited to try Starbelly after reading their first posted menu, which included some of our favorite ingredients: nettles, guanciale, and (imagine!) lamb cheeks.  The reviews in the local press were positive, and we saved it for a treat.

To make a long story short, a few things were good, but nothing was worth going back for, particularly considering that the restaurant was so loud that it made my ears ring.  Mind you, I went to My Bloody Valentine last year.

The full story:

We had a party of four and wanted to take the other couple somewhere special.

Starbelly only accepts reservations for parties of six or more.  Everyone else is invited to call up to an hour in advance.  I was sternly warned that 7pm on Friday was peak time and we might not be seated until 8:30.  I called at 6 and made a 7:15 appointment.  To my delight we were seated right away even though one of our party was running late.

Here is what we ordered and what we thought of everything:

0) Darjeeling tea, lime, basil, egg white:  if it's lemonade, call it lemonade.  

1) popcorn clams with Old Bay remoulade:  surprisingly flavorful and gently chewy
    
2) spicy sausage stuffed sage leaves: porky, with perfectly crisped sage leaves

3) warm olive tapenade, chili oil & grilled flat bread:  very balanced yet flavorful selection of olives    

4) pan roasted black mussels, mexican chorizo, market chilies & cilantro:  the mussels were tiny and the chorizo was just plain sausage.   The broth was ironically weak and no bread to sop its deliciousness up?  I'm missing Chow already.

5) grilled baby octopus with fennel & radicchio slaw:  the octopus was not fresh.

6) pan roasted diver scallops with nettles:  OK, so the scallops were (for once!) cooked perfectly and were not at all chewy.  Nonetheless, the nettle puree it sat upon was too weak to impart any flavor.  Disappointing!

7) pizza: guanciale, wild nettles, parmesan:  a few tiny scraps of guanciale, no nettles, and a weird crust that might have been gluten-free.  The sauce was a bit on the zesty side for my native Italian partner, but I thought it was really the pizza's only redeeming feature.

8) Mt. Tam pale ale braised lamb cheeks, white cheddar grits &, braised greens:  we had two orders of this at our table.  Mine had a heavy layer of potent salt which made the first few bites quite challenging.  I probably should have sent it back, the other order we had for the table didn't have this problem.  The cheeks themselves were very fine, meltingly tender, and pleasantly mild in flavor.  My partner and I agreed that the grits and the greens were good with each other but overwhelmed the cheeks. 

9) berry crumble with humphrey slocumb ice cream:  one of our party complained that the crumble was not crunchy enough.  Mine was a riot of flavors, not unpleasant although unusual.

I will say that the service and the pacing of serving the food was excellent, particularly impressive given that the restaurant was full.

Again, the noise level was off the charts.  I'm tempted to call OSHA!
author: Seth G.

description: Great brunch!  Granted, the company was perfect, but there's no denying the French toast was divine and the space itself is great. I wish the noise volume was a bit lower - the table conversation was tough to follow and the waiter was difficult to hear. Great value - be warned though - the drinks are a bit on the pricey side. Overall, it was great and I'll be back.
author: prior O.

description:
First of all, how was this place so freakin' busy at 6pm on a Sunday night?  Was there some sort of early bird special that we neglected to take advantage of?

My dining companion and I ducked into Starbelly to escape rain droplets and fill our bellies.  He opted for a simple salad and spaghetti while I tried a chorizo and egg pizza accompanied by the cheddar grits with roasted greens.

I think I got the lesser meal because the pizza was kind of soggy and the chorizo didn't have much flavor.  Plus, the roasted greens, while nice to get my veggies, seemed to water down the grits.  

The space is nice, though, and it's close enough to my home that I'm willing to give it another shot.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Love starbelly!
their pizzas are incredible
atmosphere is great

Wish servers were a bit more friendly.
author: marco D.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood spot. Food is consistently good and prices are reasonable. Service is always excellent. Great spot for kids too- you can sit on the patio out back, which is nicely heated and decorated. Mussels with chorizo, chicken pate, and salads are my favorites. My kids love their burgers. Nice wine selection, although they could add a few more $7 glasses I think so you can have a few without breaking the bank. Go, go, go. You will be happy you did.
author: Jenny K.

description: This place is delicious. One of the best parts is that you can come here with one person or 10. There is a great selection of food and their pizzas are to die for. The service is always great. my only complaint - like most places in San Francisco it can get pretty loud. Be sure to check out their outside patio - it is heated and so cute!
author: Jessica K.

description: I think this place is great.  You can get a table if you plan at least an hour in advance - I love the call ahead wait list.  I like that this place is both casual and nice - the atmosphere is perfect for a mellow night out.  It is good for friends or a date.  The food is good and consistent - I like that the menu changes with season but keeps an overall similar vibe.  The beat salad with pumpkin seeds and goat cheese is to die for,  They also have a good wine list that is pretty affordable. Starbelly has become a go-to for sure.
author: Rose K.

description:
YES!!! 3rd visit was a charm..
after my first 2 visits I was not impress but they change their menu..

the outside patio garden is very nice also..

I was wowed by the pizza with eggs and drinks...

brunch time on sundays is great in here lots of boys!

:-)
author: Aemar E.

description:
I'm just reviewing the "Tuesday Night Picnic Special" because that's all we have done.

I have a friend who shares her calender with me and when I saw the word "Whole PIg Roast at Starbelly" I knew that we would have to go. Just saying "Roast Pig" to the Oxen One was enough to get her all excited. 

It was the perfect weather for it too, one of those few San Francisco evenings when you really *want* to sit outside on the patio (without even running the heat lamp, ooh la la!) and have a "picnic" dinner. It was simple fare: salad, mac&cheese, corn on the cob, roast pig, and ice cream sundaes. But everything was *exquisite*. The salad dressing was amazing. The mac-and-cheese had artisan bacon in it. The pork came with two fancy (and delicious) salsa-type dressings: a mint one and a chili one with some kind of pickled fruit in it. The ice sundaes had homemade sauces (chocolate and caramel) and included a banana that had been split and dressed with sugar that they caramelized on-site with a blowtorch. There's a server to seat you and bring you drinks but the food itself is buffet-style. You can go back as many times as you like (I saw one guy hit the buffet at least 6 times, we manage to limit ourselves to just seconds). This was $25/person. A half-liter of good rose' was $10.

Totally naughty with the "We're broke and should not be eating in restaurants" plus the "I really am supposed to be on a diet" things, but totally worth it :D
author: Amy T.

description: Wish I had found Starbelly earlier in my long stay here in SF. I would have visited this spot several times. My dining partner and I ate at the communal table... while not ideal, our waitress was friendly and courteous. We had a nice spot at the end of the communal table... if you have a great dining partner as I did, you will quickly forget you are in middle of the restaurant. We had a great peach salad, pizza with blue cheese and figs, spaghetti, and bourbon ice cream. All of dishes were prepared well, tasted delicious.... it was a great night.
author: David C.

description:
Stopped in this morning for brunch and left full and happy. My bf ordered pizza, but there was some problem with the dough so they comped his breakfast which was appreciated. He had the sausage and egg scramble while I munched on the french toast with strawberry preserves. Everything was really tasty and served HOT which is appreciated. The potatoes that came with the scramble were awesome and I loved the fresh fruit that was served. My french toast was awesome and the bacon was dee-lish.

I guess we'll just have to come back for the pizza!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
This restaurant was fantastic!!!  We were seated on the back porch (with heating lamps) which had a really wonderful rustic but still chic vibe going on.  Looking around, we noticed that we were seated amongst herb beds which we were told are used to flavor many of their dishes.  We were  even told that the restaurant has it's own garden nearby where it grows food for the restaurant.  Gotta love the local!
Fernando, the manager, was awesome and gave us superb recommendations.  I especially loved the butternut squash bread pudding, the beets, the broccoli, the mushrooms, and the bacon pizza.  It will be hard to save room for dessert but the butterscotch pudding is a must!  Clearly, it is also important to go with a group so you can eat family style!  Looking forward to returning, definitely highly recommended!
author: Shannon L.

description:
Starbelly has a great ambience, and very pleasant wait staff.  However, I found the food to be inconsistent and overpriced.

The garlic scallop appetizer was delicious...but 2 pieces for $14?  You've gotta be kidding.  

The cucumber salad was excellent, with very fresh ingredients and yummy tomatoes with a light vinegrette dressing.  Very good.

They have signature non-alcoholic tea drinks that were really unique and tasty....Darjeeling tea with a lemon-flavored mix, topped with light cream.  Yum!

But the entrees were disappointing.  My porchetta, which was supposedly a "signature dish"  but was just so-so.  It was quite fatty, and covered with extremely BITTER greens that were uneatable.  My partner's mushroom pizza was good, but a bit dry.  Needs more cheese.  

Although we went on opening night, didn't wait long and they turned the tables efficiently.  The hostess and wait staff couldn't have been nicer.  We had to wait about 15 minutes to get the credit card run through since they mispiaced the bill.  

I'd go back, but be more careful what I order.
I'm saddened they closed the nearby Pasta Pomodoro and I'm not sure the new restaurant is worth the loss.  I went to Pomodoro very frequently because it was very reasonably priced.  Starbelly is too high-end to eat at frequently.
author: Jamey F.

description:
Try the Fresh Figs, Bleu Cheese, and Arugula pizza--it will knock you on your back! There is an option to put  Spanish Ham on it, but I was with a vegetarian that night so I couldn't delight myself. I'm sure if I had I would have freaked the geek out (and gone home a bit bloated). 

Also had one of the domestic cheese plates as a starter--also very good. The only part that marred the occasion was that they got the order wrong on the cheese plate and I didn't get the one I wanted. And when I asked for more water, the waiter gave me a look like I had asked for too much. Great decor--communal tables are fun!
author: Lale G.

description: I came here a couple days after these guys opened and from what I can remember my experience was pleasant. My boss took a bunch of us here after work one night. I remember the drink selection was pretty varied, I had a house lavender lemonade or something like that ... we had almost everything on the menu between us all but I recall the rice pudiing dessert to be good as well as my house made pasta dish mMm I am still craving the one to this day ... All in all nice place to eat little loud yes but stop whining .. :)
author: Anthony S.

description: StarBelly was a sweet surprise! I Noticed that it got only 3-1/2 Stars but i have to say over all the experience was fabulous! Food was wonderful. We had a little of everything.  Burrata melted in your mouth. The pot pie was original, nicely plated, and had a wonderful crust to it.  Being a restaurant owner myself i thought the decor was cute, classic, and comfortable.  I had a great experience with five of my best girlfriend's!
author: Sarra C.

description:
Even though every restaurant these days seems to have the same pizza + a few other things menu, Starbelly stood out. The pasta with bacon was the most delicious thing I've ever tasted; so fresh and yummy. I can't wait to go back and have a plate all to myself.

Service was good, decor is cool, and it's not expensive.

We did wait over an hour on a Wednesday night, but we weren't starving so it worked out fine.

Definitely going back!
author: Allison C.

description:
OMG, Becky!!! Delicious.  I loved this place.  Fantastic food and superb wait-staff.  First of all I never had pate but their chicken pate was so incredible it made me want to slap my mama.  J/K MOM!  The pot pie was delicious and pretty much everything we ate was impeccable.  The cheese plate and small corn dogs were the BOMB!  Serivce was on time and our server was friendly and personable.  Also, I went to Beretta and was soo under impressed that I almost didn't come to this place.  SURE GLAD I DID!!

My food was rather salty but I luv salt.  I noticed other review had the same concern but to each their own I loved it!  But be aware.
author: Spa G.

description: What a gem.  I love their pizza, especially the mushroom one and the autumn one with squash and sage.  I usually hate thin crust pizza, but they pull it off well here.  You can get unlimited sparkling water at the table for free!  FREE!  I like sitting outside because it's really pretty and they have cool plants.  One time my dad poured his water into the plants, which was a tad embarrassing.  There is this one busser who wears polo shirts and I think he's the nicest person who works here.  One time when I was here, a man had a seizure at the table next to me, and about 8 paramedics came in, and the staff just sort of went with it and then the man was okay and he left with the paramedics.  It was odd.  It's a bit slow, so don't come starving.
author: Julia D.

description:
Fantastic food & great location. I especially recommend the pizzas and the spagetti & bacon. One of the few places in the Castro where you have a good mix of food quality, great atmosphere, cordial service and consistently good food.

You can take advantage of the patio, great to be at when the weather is warmer.
author: Pablo C.

description: Salted caramel pot de creme with rosemary cookie is OUTSTANDING!  Can't recommend the wine & beer-based "mixed" drinks, but great wine & beer selection.
author: Rachael C.

description:
I am very mixed about this place. The problem: One meal we ordered was amazing, the other was terrible-terrible.

Overall: The atmosphere is warm modernism, cozy and has a great buzz. We sat at the bar and the service was top notch and very informative.

The apps: Crab hushpuppies and Sardines
Hushpuppies were fantastic  and the Sardines were good-they might have been more flavorful but it was a decent sardine. A purists sardine I might say.

The mains: 

The lamb (at around $22) with grits and winter greens: exceptional on all fronts!!!!

The bass at $22--it was f****ing GOD AWFUL. Seriously, really bad. It was a small, thin piece of fish that was just pan fried to death in butter and oil. It was served the crispy side up (brown) on top of mushrooms (deeper brown) which tasted greasy. This sat next to a divine celery root puree that was so over powered by the fried butter taste that you would never taste the celery root and the mushrooms only exacerbated the problem from a visual and taste perspective. Honestly, what was the chef thinking with this dish when he/she created such a wonderful meat dish? Oy! Brass tacks; you couldn't taste the fish at all due to the greasy flavor.

Side dish: brussel sprouts. Good quality brussels cooked perfectly but bland- they needed an additional oomph with a bit of salt (not available on the bar) or garlic or something. They were served with a shaven parm but that did not really add any flavor.

The dessert: a very good banana fudge sundae.

Overall, I was disappointed because I clearly got the wrong meal which ruined the entire experience. I felt jipped at the price. :-( 

I would go again if someone else insisted and I would stick to meat.
author: pamela h.

description: Delicious! Our waiter was very friendly.  The mushroom soup was so delicious with garlic croutons...pizza and starbelly salad also were amazing.  Very cute inside.
author: Ginger C.

description:
This place is amazing! The food is DEEEEEElicious.  Service is usually top notch for the type of restaurant it is.  Everyone is friendly, even the cooks say goodbye and thank you as you leave :)

They change their menu all the time, but if you ever come across the asparagus soup and the duck fat fried wings, prepare to have an orgasm in your mouth!
author: Emily M.

description: I went to Starbelly on a date and it was a really great experience. I ordered a pizza with squash, pine nuts, and goat cheese (I just checked online; it's no longer on the menu); besides for being delicious, it had a great balance of sweet and savory. Although the name screams hippy, Starbelly's atmosphere is trendy and cool. The restaurant is unfortunately small and it's easy to bump tables/people but cozy is an appropriate euphemism. The prices were good and our waitress was very friendly and prompt.
author: Matthew R.

description: Starbelly is fantastic! They were very accommodating even when our party size kept changing. The service was outstanding even with it being so busy! My entire party was so impressed with the food, we are all coming back! Thank you so very much! See you again soon!
author: Briana M.

description:
I got so excited when I read you could call in to put your name on the wait list, but I'm fairly sure this didn't help our cause too much. We waited for quite a while and the hostess seemed annoyed that we were standing up front having a glass of wine. I get that Starbelly is new and cool and crowded, but that's not a unique occurrence in SF, so I hope they don't develop an attitude. 

Once seated, the service was attentive and food came out quickly. Everything was awesome, from the baby octopus to the roast chicken (moist, salty and delicious!) to the thin crust pizza.

My only complaint (another service detail) is that we ordered a pizza with wild nettles specifically because we were excited about the nettles and when it came, it had radicchio instead. We told a couple different servers and they all acted confused and said they had to check with the kitchen. 15 minutes later, it was confirmed, yes, the pizza had radicchio instead. Um, we know! I just wish the server had apologized when we first brought it up and asked if we'd like something else. We would have said no and enjoyed the pizza, minus the irritation. Hopefully the service kinks get ironed out because the food was great!
author: Crissy G.

description: Excellently prepared dishes and very good service, but the portions were small. When we arrived (with a reservation for 5 PM) we were greeted warmly and taken to the enclosed patio. No one else was out there. We passed lots of available two-tops on our way to the back, but we didn't make a fuss about it. It was odd to sit directly across from two girls with only a window separating us--felt kinda voyeuristic.  Hipster waiter dude (probably doesn't know how cute he is) was very friendly and we gave him a 20% tip. We were hurrying between the Book of Mormon and the Golden Girls 'Christmas Episodes' drag show, so we were in a bit of a rush, but we would go back. A bit pricey I think, but not prohibitive.
author: Skeeter M.

description:
Starbelly transformed the old Asqew location.  I was impressed with the remodel.  The rustic remodel was the perfect marriage to their menu.  We started off with the iceberg salad with figs, hazelnut, and bleu cheese dressing.  My boyfriend got the margarita pizza and I got the burger with 2 yr aged cheddar.  Nothing mind blowing however we didn't order anything groundbreaking either.  I would definitely go back and be a little adventurous.  

I have 3 complaints (all easily fixable).  The staff is very green and poorly dressed (they need uniforms).  Our waitress while very nice was not very knowledgeable of the menu or wine list.  She failed to make recommendation of either.  The bartender kept on dropping glasses and shattering them behind the bar.  My last little peeve with Starbelly is the fact they don't take reservations.  

The kinks they have can all be solved with time.  I will definitely be going back.
author: Peter S.

description:
I came up to visit my friend this weekend, and she recommended Starbelly, heard it's great reviews from friends. We went and we loved it! I would highly recommend calling about an hour before you go to put your name on the list, as there is a good wait to get in, but once we arrived at 8 on a Friday night, we were quickly seated. The cheese plate was yummy, wine great and the service was amazing!!! I believe this is the same owners as Berreta in the Mission, which is just as good and is where we love to eat too!

Enjoy!
author: Allison A.

description:
Order the chicken liver pate and the starbelly bacon pizza (the dressing is key).  I got the mushroom pizza and while I did finish it off, it was too soggy and creamy for me.

Service was quick and pleasant, and the outdoor patio is perfect for a warm day.
author: S L.

description: Im never disappointed by Starbelly! I see some mediocre reviews here, so I thought i'd add my two cents and give it some credit! The ambiance, waiters, wait time, and food has never let me down so far. The Burrata plate is to die for good! The spaghetti with bacon and jalapeno may sounds strange but is also another favorite dish. Not so pricey, but it feels as if it is. Definitely great for a good meal and glass of wine!
author: Meagan B.

description: Loved it. Great service and cozy ambiance. The food was delicious and the bill didn't kill us either. Will be back and are looking forward to it
author: Marie V.

description: Shared the fish tacos and a mushroom pizza with my honey.  Both were boring and lacked flavor complexity.  The tacos needed some fat and the pizza needed another flavor component to compliment the mushrooms and salt from the cheese.  It was supposed to have thyme on it, but I couldn't taste it.  I'll go back for a second meal here, but I'm going to be cautious when ordering.
author: Geoffrey M.

description: The 20 times I have been there I would say 15 times have been great. Recently I have been disappointed - maybe too much of a good thing. I always love their cheese plate (the nuts are always the best) and the pizzas are always good. Regular california american food. I miss the really awesome hostess who I think works at beretta now. I also love the blonde waitress who seems to always wear pearl earrings. She is freaking awesome! It's like if you are going to be in the service industry be a people person like her! -=) Give her a raise management.
author: Jemma L.

description:
It was time to celebrate another friend's birthday.  We were supposed to come here for the LAST bday celebration but never made it since we spent too much time at a nearby bar and my friend ended up drinking a little too much... so finally, I got to try it this passed weekend!

The ambiance was perfect for meeting friends on a Sunday morning for brunch.  We were seated in the back patio area where it was airy and bright.  They have heating lamps which made the temperature comfortable, esp for SF.  Service was good and prompt.  I'm sad that the mimosas were not bottomless though... Everyone's food looked good though... the fries w/ the 3 dipping sauces were fried to perfection -- very crispy!  YUM.  I couldn't stop eating them... And I don't even really like fries!

Nobody seemed to complain about their food, so I'm guessing everyone was happy.  My only complaint was when we finally decided to order dessert, they were out of 2 of the 3 we REALLY wanted.  That sucked. However, the one that they did have did not disappoint.  Highly recommend the salted caramel pot de creme!
author: Jere D.

description: Nice decor and atmosphere. Friendly service. Good food, much of it locally grown and produced. The Prather Ranch burger with aged white cheddar cheese was delicious. Nice selection of California beers. I loved the Lagunitas Pilsner. Will definitely be back. The Castro is in need of restaurants like Starbelly.
author: Geoffrey B.

description: Loud space...don't expect an intimate dining experience or having a conversation without talking really loud. The food was good. I had the creamy tomato soup with a grilled cheese; the flavors were really good. Also the spaghetti entrée was great. Nice complex flavors that build upon each out. Next time, I will try and grab a table on the patio...but a definite go-to  place if you are in the city.
author: TM D.

description: i've been back two times since my initial review. I still love it and the food is great. My only issue is that on my second visit the back door was open and it was freezing. When i asked them to close it the waiter looked as if i had asked him to part the red sea and had to check with a manager. He came back and said that it had to stay open because of some ventilation issue... it was friggin cold so finally they opened the windows and closed the door and it eliminated the draft. I'm not sure if the staff wanted it opened because they get hot or if there was an actual ventilation issue... either way it needs to be addressed. I just won't go back on a cold day
author: Eric A.

description:
I've eaten at Starbelly 5 times since its opening with friends, children, and my boyfriend.  The food has been amazing and they seem quite kid friendly as I see families in there often.  

The interior is beautiful with lovely details.  My only real pinch is that the front staff is not very friendly, or not sincerely friendly. This stinks as I live on this block and would love to make it a regular supper spot.  

It's highly recommended it for the food and table service~
author: Brenda T.

description: Thin crust pizza + Delirious Beer = Good times!!
author: Stephanie F.

description: An interesting menu, full of variety. The spaghetti is thick and fresh but served lukewarm. The cheese on top is probably supposed to be melted but it's not. The salted caramel pot de creme is a good dessert choice.
author: Sargeant T.

description: Good fries - when they're hot. Good chicken sandwich with slaw - when they actually put chicken in it. Good breakfast sandwich - when they don't put it on a crappy hamburger bun. Not sure what happened to this place - when it first launched, it was pretty awesome, but I feel like the food quality is now hit or miss. Recently, more misses.
author: Jesse V.

description:
I'm mixed about this place....two stars for service and 4.5 for food.....so three is a mid-way point.

Well to start off we were seated 40 minutes after our reservations of 10.  The waitress told us that they had to ask the table to leave to.....maybe, maybe not.

My friend made a reservation for 10, however only 8 people showed up and we were seated at a table best suited for 6.  Not great.  We had to go find an extra chair so we weren't squished.

Within minutes of sitting, the waitress immediately brought us four comped  appetizers.  That was nice, considering we were starving.  They were yummy.

We ordered a bottle of wine, couple of non-alcoholic drinks, couple of alcoholic drinks.

We waited a bit to get the order in...and waiting for the food seemed like awhile.  The waitress stated that she was sorry for the delay and asked if we wanted anything stating it 'was on her'.  We didn't.

I ordered the Starbelly Salad..yummy and the butternut squash dumplings.....amazing!   My b/f wasn't too amazed by his hamburger and my other friend got his steak comped because it was too overdone.  I forgot what the others ordered, but I didn't hear any complaints.

Then we ordered three desserts and an additional was brought for my friend's bday.

There was coffee ordered at the end as well.

When we got our bill, it was a mere $152.00 for 8 people (including a bottle of wine) who left totally full.  And I REALLY enjoyed all my food!

Not sure if it was an 'off night' for the staff/kitchen, but considering it has been there for awhile, I was a little confused.  Who knows what was going on that night.

But seriously for $152.00 for 8 people, I can't cause too big of a stink.  We left the waitress a nice tip, I mean it wasn't totally her fault that everything was delayed.  

I'd go back.....just not on a Saturday night.
author: Lara F.

description:
i've been here for brunch and loved it, but came tonight after thinking i'd wait a few weeks for a new restaurants kinks to get worked out.. but Starbelly needs some work...

FOOD - 
MINI CORN DOGS- just ok.. i expected the batter to have a unique flavor.. but was generic...  and the spicy mustard was just whole grain mustard, which is doesn't work for dipping... was expecting a mustard that you could dip and not have to spread with a knife.
SPICY SAUSAGE - was impressed!  well seasoned with garlic and garnish.. we both liked
PEPPERS - had these two weeks ago at flour+water for the first time and loved them, but Starbelly missed the mark... cooked well, but seasoning was lacking and had to ask for salt to season them myself.
LAMB CHEEKS - came with grits and braised greens...   Lamb cheeks, were cooked perfect, but underseasoned.. grits were ok... braised greens were cooked perfect and tasted great...
PIZZA - we went for the bacon pizza with peppers...  LOVED IT!

SERVICE - I'm usually not that picky on service, but I give Starbelly a D for service...  
Hosts were not experienced/welcoming and did not work the timing well... i watched a lot of people leave because they were over-quoting wait times...   
Our Waiter - majorly unimpressed... never checked back with us after anything was set down to see how we were, took our peppers away before we were finished and didn't even hear us as we protested and asked him to leave them....  Service felt very robotic and without personality...   First time in a long time that I tipped 15% as opposed to 20%.
author: Mickey C.

description: Tasty food in a nice atmosphere. Really like the backyard patio, with herb garden. Interesting "cocktails"--they dont have hard alcohol, but you can get micheladas and the like. Great service, our waitress was really looking out for us. Food wise, the fried oysters, corn & jalapeno hush puppies, and mache & local strawberries, served with chevre, mint & hazelnuts, were all yummy. Also very good was the burrata served with radishes, olive oil, sea salt, & toasted bread. And especially good was the pizza with figs, blue cheese and wild arugula, which you can get with Spanish ham. Cant wait to come back!
author: brewgirl b.

description: Brussel sprouts are a winner, as are white bean puree, pizza's, all starters! Love this local
author: Jade H.

description:
Been here a bunch of times for both lunch and dinner, but last night I officially scratched it off the list for a while. I really love the menu and decor of the restaurant but our dining experience was sub par. The food came out in the complete wrong order, the burger was raw in the middle, the fries were cold, the salad never came out, and the grits were way too buttery. It was like pulling teeth to get our bill from the lackadaisical waitress and when it finally came they charged us for something that we didn't order. Most importantly the food didn't really taste that great. 

On the bright side they do have a very generous pour of wine and the manager was nice to us and tried to smooth things over. 

I'll definitely come back in 6 months and give them another try but there are just too many great restaurants in this city to have that kind of experience.
author: Darryn S.

description:
Just came from Starbelly for dinner. Great place, nice atmosphere, great food. The desserts were sinfully delicious. Another successful place from the Beretta folks. Kudos to Deborah Blum! 
Kelly was our server. She is super nice and efficient.
author: Paul K.

description:
LOVED IT. Ate here last week for lunch and can't wait to go back. Definitely the most exciting addition to the 'hood in years. Decor is beautiful wood paneling, light, airy design. Ingredients seemed fresh, seasonal and combined in innovative ways. The wait staff was super friendly and attentive. Looking forward to the patio opening. 

Standouts: roasted mini padron peppers tossed with olive oil and sea salt, creamy tomato soup (can't stop thinking about it!), and the honey lavender lemonade. These are not to be missed. My friend also had the chicken pot pie and it was pretty awesome.
author: Macheeks ..

description: If you're a fan of Beretta, you'll really dig this place.  Although Starbelly's vibe is different, its still pretty cool.  The beers were good (Lagunitas is growing on me), decent food (upscale pizza) and finally a taste of Humphry Slocombe ice cream without waiting in line.  Interestingly, they don't have a full liquor license so the drinks they do offer are pretty cool mixes of wine, beer and other stuff.  Should of tried one, but couldn't wean myself from the beer.
author: samit P.

description:
After I had a pretty good night at Beretta, I also found out about this little place owned by the same people who own Beretta.  

There is a cool system of taking reservations which you call 20-30 mins ahead to put your name on a waiting list, and when you get there, you have your table ready.  I tried and waited not more than five minutes for a table when I got there.  Awesome!

Passing by the bar towards our table, cocktails and the whole bar ambiance looked really nice. Too bad they don't have liqueur license.  That one drink with a cucumber slice looks just like the one on the website picture:  impressive.

Interior is a little strange.  Hard to explain.  It kinda looks like a boy with oversize pants. :)  Seriously, it looks bigger than it should have been.  Tables and decor are so spaced out that the ambiance gets killed.  Lighting was a bit too bright too.  I don't really know which restaurant opened first, but in Beretta, the atmosphere feels just right.

Staff was all nice and professional for sure.  We were notified what they were out of instantly which I always appreciate than finding out an hour later.

We started with popcorn clams, fries and brussel sprouts.

Popcorn Clams:  Not a bad one although the coating felt a bit overkill from time to time that I almost didn't taste any clam.  Sauce was ok.

Fries:  Nothing special.  Sorry.  Sauces were more of a highlight than semi-soft fries.

Brussel Sprouts:  Done just right I have to say.  Yummy!

After apps, we continued with the spagetti with tomato, basil, bacon and jalapenos.  First it tasted great:  proper amount of jalapenos, juicy bacon.  Pasta really defined aldente.  I mean it surpasses SPQR and A16 by the way it was made and cooked.  Hands down.  Then I realized I didn't really taste any tomato nor basil? I guess tomatoes were bland and not flavorful. Basil was maybe overcooked?
