We had the andouille, pineapple, mozarella combo along with the pear, blue cheese, & arugula pie.  Lastly we finished off with a classic margherita, which was okay but even with extra cheese, it wasn't so extra.  I will say they get major points for using fresh ingredients and for the friendly service.  Great place for a small group and not so much strain on the pockets.
Headin' back to try their brunch and kick back on what looks to be a cool back patio..
author: Darren B.

description: Went on a Sunday at lunch time and surprisingly only waited 5 minutes.  Service was great! Everything on the menu was pretty good.  Veggie friendly.  We sat out in the back deck on a nice day.  It was fabu... Average was about $20/person
author: Kazuo S.

description:
it was here that i realized that i pronounce "route" two different ways, depending on the context.  weird.

the fries were pretty damn good.  they give you 3 sauces.  i stuck with the ketchup..catsup?  cracked pepper on the fries...that's a nice touch.

the apple, celery root (not that "route"), pistachio, cherry salad was good...although a bit overdressed.  i don't like that.

the pizza...kinda soggy in the middle.  maybe they don't need to put that much sauce on it?  the crust was chewy and delicious though.  

the salted caramel pot de creme was a bit disappointing...a bit too much salt...which really overwhelmed the dessert...it was in this awkward jar that made digging into it a bit difficult.

the atmosphere is good.  the service is really friendly and great.

promising food, but didn't totally hit the mark with me...maybe it was just an off night though.
author: Miss P.

description: This is one of the few good restaurants in the castro.  The best part about it is that it's not too busy so you can use it as a backup option when you don't have reservations anywhere and the line for everything else is over an hour.  Brunch is good too, and the wait staff is very friendly.
author: Nicole C.

description: If I grade Starbelly on a curve based on the food in neighboring Castro restaurants, I'd give it more stars. For the neighborhood and the price, it's a solid contender but I would not travel on freeways or bridges to get here. I will limit my discussion of food to my recent meal (last weekend). The hush puppies were oily, not spicy enough and limp. The albacore salad was good - the fish was fresh but it was a little too heavy on the mayo and anchovies. The pizza had a delicious crust but suffered under the weight of too much tomato sauce without enough zing to balance out the roasted peppers on it. The garlic on the broccoli side we ordered was burnt. Worst of all though was the undercooked (think hot pink) drumstick that came on a platter of otherwise decent roast chicken. When confronted with the situation, our detached waiter grabbed an equally unemotional manager who told us that the chicken was brined for taste and color was not raw. (The other pieces of chicken on the platter had no such fluorescent color.).  Food-borne illness is serious business so I pushed back and she agreed to remove it from the bill but made no offer to replace the dish with another entree. We decided to skip out before dessert. On previous visits the food was noticeably better but service was iffy then too.
author: Keith R.

description: I love this place!! Shared a pizza that had a delicious crust--thin and crispy. The spaghetti with Starbelly bacon was awesome! I could eat that bacon for days.  A friend had the hamburger which she really enjoyed. And dairy free chocolate ice cream from Humphry Slocomb was a nice way to end the meal! Portion sizes were just right too.  You can't make a reservation but can call ahead to get your name on the list. Host is super nice and so were the wait staff.  I hope to go back soon.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Terrible! I don't yelp very often, but I felt the need to on this place. I understand it's new, however, there is no excuse for bad service and flavorless food. 

Our waitress was very polite......when she came around. We had been seated for at least 10 minutes before we were even acknowledged by the waitress. We placed our drink order and it was a good 15 minutes before we got our drinks. We ordered our food and to my surprise, my friends food came out rather quickly. Both my friends got their food at least 5-10 min before my burger came out. New restaurant or not, the cooks should know how to time the food so that everyone's food at the table arrives at the same time. When I finally got my burger, I took a bite and it was totally raw. It was like they walked the cow through a warm kitchen and then served it to me. I like rare, this was raw. 

I tried both my friends food and it lacked flavor. The best part of the meal was the champagne.
author: Scott G.

description: Not sure what all the hype is about...cool space, nice decor furniture, lively, seemingly fun atmosphere. Nice, attentive wait staff.  And some of cocktails looked fun!  But none of that is able to help the food which was very mediocre (or worse -- badly cooked).  We had a pizza that was supposed to have mushrooms on it, and didn't.  The cheese on the pizza was supposed to be gruyere, but it was more like a white version of American cheese.  We ordered the porter-marinated bavette steak, and it was so undercooked it was basically raw.  To top it off, it is so loud, we could barely hear our waiter tell us about specials, etc.  I won't be going back.
author: david s.

description: This is definitely our favorite pizzeria in the city. We frequent here on regular basis. The menu changes on regular basis, the service has been mostly good (except once or twice, but when 1 out of 20 it doesn't ruin the other time). The consistent service and consistent food quality is what bring us back again and again. Although I have to say getting a table on a busy weekend night has always been a drag. Always call in early to put your name on the wait list...
author: Ronnie K.

description: First off, love the space.  The Castro has needed a modern and airy space (with outdoor seating, mind you) for some time.  Starbelly delievers.  Their menu is diverse enough to satisfy a spectrum of dietary needs.  I had the market mushroom pizza - one of the best thin crust pizzas I've had in a long time.  My dining companions ordered the Italian sausage pizza, white cheddar grits with greens, and the ranch burger.  The grits were a tad salty and the ranch burger was closer in size to a slider.  Those minor points aside, we enjoyed our meal.  An all-around solid meal.
author: Shilpa P.

description: Starbelly is a solid option for weekend brunch when there's more than 2 of you, and it's an especially good alternative to the madness at Mission Beach Cafe. Also, Starbelly will take brunch reservations for parties of 6 or more. For brunch, I'm a fan of the french toast and chilaquiles. I've had the pizza at both brunch and dinner, and I remain unimpressed. This Neopolitan pizza thing is getting out of control. Like its sister restaurant Beretta, the food is good enough, but with beer & wine only, Starbelly doesn't have the cocktails to carry it. With that, I'll keep going back for brunch with a group, but less likely for dinner.
author: Seth B.

description: Like many others, I was looking forward to dining here.  We liked the decor and the hostess was very nice.  The apps were ok, except the over rated fries.  The service, like the pizza, was not very good.  We may try Starbelly again, as it's within walking distance, but not anytime soon.
author: Shez P.

description: their burrata is delicious.  i appreciate that a michelada is on the bar menu.
author: jane d.

description:
I really like the food at Starbelly.  I have been there numerous times and the food is always consistent.  

What is not consistent is their seating policy.  While they do not take reservations there is a way to call in before you might arrive.  When we got there the other night, while there were tables open, we were told it would be an hour and a half wait.  There was nobody waiting.  Unfortunately, I am not a "community table" lover, nor do I like sitting on a backless bar stool while dining.  This is not the first time this has happened.  They really should go on Opentable because it is like playing roulette to get a table here at dinner.

Also, I was excited to bring friends in on a Saturday night recently.  We were sat in the middle section of the back dining room.  The decibel level including their music was deafening.  

They started off with a bang however, now, I am rethinking Starbelly.
author: Eli B.

description: I went to Starbelly for a private party on a Sunday afternoon for the SF International Film Festival. The space is beautiful, the staff is friendly and the selection of food (in this case, plates of food for the party) were quite good. Those Kobe beef sliders are quite large!
author: Shanan D.

description:
I went to Starbelly this past Saturday for brunch with some dear friends. It was my second time visiting the restaurant. I was immediately impressed by the gentleman manager who remembered me from my first visit. Our server was Casey. He was very charismatic and kind. He delivered both excellent service and conversation.  Quite the treat...

I started with the fresh squeezed honey-lavender lemonade and a wonderful and unique donut. I had the sausage scramble with market sweet peppers and arugula. It was delicious. Starbelly also has a great atmosphere and attracts an interesting and fun clientele. Make sure to give it a try.
author: John W.

description: Well people I can say I took one of my friend to Starbelly on Sunday thinking it would be a great first impression and well SO NOT THE FACT! There was no waiting in line got a seat right away by a very wonderful lady but then our waiter handsome but worthless honestly came over and ask what we would like to drink and well we both said coffee ,he said sure and also took our order . But then the fun started , After he brought the water I looked at my coffee cup and he said well its PRESSED coffee I said ok ,, well he left and then 15 minutes passed m and finally I ask the lady who sat us could we have coffee please she walked right up got the coffee and poured us two cups and it was wonderful , then another waiter came out brought our Pizza which was wonderful and then another waiter ask us if the pizza was ok ,, We said yes but this is the funny part OUR waiter we started with finally came around at the end ask us if everything was good I looked at him and said YES can we have the check , he said yes here u r and it was a pleasure .I laughed due to we saw him once and attitude the rest of the time from him which made our totally experience AWFUL so why bother trying being polite if your a jerk.. So starbelly please think about quality and not looks on the waiters ok !!! I left NO TIP! a Penny would be too much..
author: Randy M.

description: Best restaurant everrrrrr!!!!! And thank you to DEVON our server! He provided excellent service throughout the night. Thank you, Devon!
author: Lauren W.

description:
I've been here for brunch a few times, and I have to say, "meh."
 I probably won't be back. 

The Food: Unpredictable--for instance the pulled chicken sandwich is horrible (and the chicken was undercooked last time I was there!), but the fish tacos are excellent. It's like food Russian Roulette.

The Service: Somewhere between bad and terrible--the last time we were there, a friend's order got messed up (see: raw chicken above), so they brought us a "complimentary" side of bacon...which later wound up on our bill. 

The Drinks: Yum--The Pimm's Cup is so delicious and I would keep coming back just for that, if it weren't for the other issues. I'll have to learn how to make my own.
author: Kathleen D.

description: We really enjoyed this place.  The atmosphere and decor was fantastic.  I personal enjoy that they only sell great beer and wine.  The food was good.  We had a mix of flavors I have never tried before (warm beets with shaved horseradish - yummy).  I went with a butter lettuce salad and the scallops which were perfectly cooked and flavored.  M had the roasted chicken/potatoes which was a pretty large portion considering the other plates.  Pretty tasty as well (from M's full mouth).  The service was also great - made a great wine recommendation and always kept our table serviced.  It is a place I would bring friends to for sure.
author: Jessica M.

description: A local Castro eatery with decent food but an unparalleled hip space and feel that leaves it with little competition.    Avoid the yogurt and fruit for brunch (how do you eat orange wedges submerged in yogurt, with fingers or a knife and fork?), but all of the pizzas are consistently delicious.   We went with the bacon jalapeño pizza today that was more mild than hot but satisfying just the same for less than $13.   A very good bang for the buck.   You won't get more atmosphere for less money anywhere in the neighborhood.   Even my favorite Delfina is more expensive.
author: Roger B.

description:
3.5 stars

helpful and accomodating wait staff
warm interior with clean lines
Dessert is the star
the rest of the menu lagged in comparison (at least what we sampled)

The mushroom pizza was missing an element to balance the flavor.  It was a bit too rich and earthy.  Maybe a. balsamic drizzle?

The many apps, were good, but not memorable.  The burger was good but not great as well.

BUT, the dessert, especially the pot de creme, wowwy.
Tasty beer selection too.

I prefer their other location, Beretta.
author: Lauren M.

description: Starbelly surpassed my expectations. Online they say they are not kid friendly but indeed they are!!! Made my 2 yo daughter a part of the table. They got her milk without even asking or charging me which is a plus. Their Mimosas were really good. Staff needless to say was extremely friendly! They rival my favorite place which is Savor in Noe Valley. Thumbs up Starbelly!
author: Allan F.

description: Brunch.  Chilaquiles.  Salted caramel pot de creme.  Nick the server hilarious.  My new favorite spot!
author: Jocelyn K.

description: We were visiting from out of town and a friend suggested we try Starbelly in the Castro.  We headed over and sat at the "communal" tables.  Sort of like a high bar but with chairs on both sides.  We ordered a margarita pizza for all 5 of us to share.  I ordered the burger with Bacon and Roasted Onions. It was delicious! Juicy and perfectly cooked with thick yummy bacon and soft, tender onions on a delicious roll.  So good.  Also, the Pizza was delish.  I could have eaten half of it myself, but I probably would have made myself sick by the sheer amount of the food we had at the table.
author: Anne L.

description: I'm so nice I let my bird have the lamb I wanted and I got porchetta. I should have been mean and made my bird get something else so I could have a whole lamb to myself and not finish off the her scraps. Porchetta was dry and not too tasty. Everyone else's dishes were much better - bastards. In short it's pretty nice just avoid the porchetta.
author: Lager K.

description: I have to say that I loved the food especially the house cured meat platter. Ever thing we had was great, including the service from ALL the staff we encountered. They even took a last minute reservation and the table was ready when we arrived. I feel like to many times I have had to wait in SF for my table for over 30 minutes despite having reservations but not at Starbelly - YEAH!
author: Denise L.

description:
I don't know why anyone would possible give this place anything less than five stars?  Maybe because it can be tricky to find parking around here?  Perhaps because the crowd reflects the "diversity" of the neighborhood?

Dare I make a slightly political statement, but neither of the aforementioned should matter when it comes down to great food, friendly service, and an overall fantastic atmosphere.

I am a big fan of Beretta and Delarosa.  To complete the trifecta, yesterday I took a friend to lunch here.  It was a Saturday around 1:00 pm and we had both worked up a ravenous appetite from our morning of docent training at the SF Symphony.  

First, I have to rave about the brunch menu.  Around here, brunch has grown to encompass things beyond your basic waffles, granola and scrambled eggs.  (These were options, though!)  But if you love the light and crispy pizzas with genius flavor profiles (squash/sage/pumpkin seed/goat cheese, anyone?) there were 4 or 5 available.  Hungry for a sandwich?  I had the porchetta which is not to be missed!  The arugula and jalapeno relish accent the salty warmed pork beautifully.  The had three salads which sounded remarkably fresh and light.

So now matter what you're looking for, Starbelly is sure to serve it up!  With a smile... or at least good style.

And my inner Martha Stewart was totally drooling over their outdoor plant boxes.  The interior is ultra stylish and even the pizza boxes are adorable.  Hard to resist, really.

I can't wait to go back for dinner.  In Beretta-fashion, I would expect the cocktail list to be impressive.  A follow up review is already in the cards.  Stay tuned!
author: Lindsay M.

description: Was there last month. Hard to rate this one because with every hit there was a miss, but overall a good place that I will try again.  Hostess aloof but waitress made up for it with a great personality, atmosphere very nice but too many screaming kids, most dishes very good but a couple misses -  gaspacho was terrible.
author: Richard R.

description:
My girlfriend and I eat here at least once a week. Whenever anyone is in town this is usually the place we take them and they always enjoy it.

Laid back atmosphere, friendly staff, great drinks menu (lots of beers) and always delicious fresh food. Service is prompt without being rushed and on a nice day there is a fantastic back patio complete with herb garden used for the kitchen.

Great for brunch, lunch and dinner. We love it so much as we can walk there from Eureka Valley and are guaranteed a good meal every time.
author: Will G.

description:
Just got back from dinner at Starbelly- Good solid food.

Mixed olives with flatbread - good !
Strawberry Kambucha - delicious
Housemade Pimm's Cup - mmm.. just ok !

Prather Ranch burger - cooked perfect, strong buns (grin) stood up to the burger  drippings and none of that soggy crap !  Great side salad.

Pan roasted black mussels with mexican chorizo were fresh and decent. Sauce made for good dipping with the toasty bread

Affogato - Good although the coffee felt a bit too strong for me !
author: Rooibos T.

description: I've had lunch here twice with the lady, and each time we really liked some of our selections and didn't care for others.  We both loved their soups-- we had gazpacho and split pea, and we had a hard time not liking the bowls.  We also shared a salad with scallops; some of the scallops were definitely undercooked, which turned me off the whole dish.  We also tried the pulled chicken salad.  The flavors were good, but there was too much mayonnaise on the sandwich, and the jalapenos weren't very well distributed.  The mussel appetizer was so good that we ordered it both times we were there.  Their drinks were yummy, the service was good, and we loved the decor.  We'll definitely be back-- Starbelly has potential to be one of our favorites in the neighborhood, once the food is a little more even.
author: Jess P.

description:
One word describes the service: frigid!

Perhaps desultory would be better. My partner and i made crystal clear that we were locals, lived in the neighborhood and that it was our first time. Nevertheless service was cursory, tone and atitude or servers was not welcoming and we felt rushed and slightly pressured. There was no friendliness, only a sort of rushed in attentive speediness.
This cast a pall over our experience. It could have been lesbophobia. It could have been the assumption that since we were locals we wouldnt spend much (Tab was over $60). Yes we got drinks.
I expect much better service. They should take lessons from Anchor Oyster bar which is on the same level in terms of quality. We'll give them one more chance. If it doesnt warm up fast, we will take our regular business to Anchor.
author: Nan L.

description: WOW, a modestly priced meal, with high quality food, in a relaxed setting. Could not ask for a better surprise. If they keep this up, they will put others (with higher price points, uber attitude, zagat, michelin and bauer reviews) on notice.... I will definitely return, even just for the lamb meatballs and figs and hazelnut salad. Yeah, a real food place in the (disas) Stro
author: One P.

description: Loved the pizza as well as the Japanese beer with the owl on it (Hinano-something). The french fries with 3 different dipping sauces are also great. It's usually packed, though I have never had to wait.
author: Malinda T.

description: Very good and the word has apparently gotten out - we had quite a wait on a Monday night for dinner, but got a table in the exact amount of time we were told it would be upon arriving.  The spaghetti my husband ordered was good.  The salads we ordered were also very good.  Service staff was friendly.  The only strange thing was the beer my husband ordered - he ordered a small and got a teeny-tiny.  That mistake was not made the second time however.  We had a very pleasant experience overall.
author: Rise G.

description:
Just the perfect meal. Started with the pate, which was wonderful on the melt in your mouth grilled bread and a sweet apricot chutney, really a treat all the way around, followed by the bib salad, but we substituted the Green Goddess dressing for the Blue Cheese dressing, and it was beyond great. The walnuts and beats played off the dressing perfectly. Then the pineapple and Andouille sausage pizza: simple, fresh, real, wonderful crunchy goodness, just right. And last, we shared the caramel pot de creme, served with rosemary lemon cookies, a great sweet/salty end. A welcome experience for the neighborhood, best food I've had around the Castro in, well, ever. Everything they did they did well, down to the wood plank services and eclectic cutlery and simple and pleasant decor. The large patio looked great, but it was a cool day so it wanted being used. The service was excellent, everyone just worked together and you never waited or wanted for anything.

I've been back, its still good.
author: Eric J.

description: Wow, this place is fantastic!    A little busy, but great.  Our waiter Ed was fantastic.  I forget the name but one of the dishes has crushes corn kernels in a sweet sauce.  I'm still dreaming about it!
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: Service was slow and chaotic. Wine did not come until after the second course the food was tepid. The mushroom pizza was fine, but not as good as a frozen pizza. Persimon salad was boring. Unevenly dressed. Just a lot of style, no substance. If you want drinks...well, even then, skip this place. Take it from me, I'll never get my $50 dollars back. But my disapointment and nausea will surely last the evening. Try harder star belly.
author: Harmon Y.

description: their hours listed on their webpage is illegible. i spent 5 minutes trying to figure out if they were open or not.  are you kidding me?  the hours posted on yelp are wrong.  one star for being braindead.
author: reza n.

description: I was so happy to get a nice looking place that might be a decent eatery in the Castro. The first time I went I was thrilled, had the mussels and started telling everyone about it.  Next three times I went the food was not good.  Love the decor, the staff, the food is just uninspired. Sounds better than it tastes written on the menu I am sorry to say.  I am hoping it will improve.  I want more decent places around the Castro!
author: Joseph F.

description: I've been driving past this place for years and wanting to try it. I finally got to come here on Monday, after dinner with a friend at Bisou. All we got was a toffee cake, but when they found out we were celebrating my graduation, they brought us two glasses of champagne to say congratulations! The sticky toffee pudding was delicious, but the service was excellent! I really want to come back for dinner.
author: J M.

description: A really cool, comfortable and stylish place to eat. Yummy hushpuppies, pizza and salads. Wish they served gimlets, but only beer and wine. Ate there once and loved it. Can't wait to go back for more.
author: Dave C.

description: Great homemade sangria! My table ordered the chilaquile, fries with three dips, bacon pizza, and hoe cakes. Delicious and highly recommended. Make a reservation when possible and try to sit outside in the back.
author: Susan B.

description: I live in the Castro and have been meaning to check out Starbelly.  We put our name on the list and a table right near the window opened up.  It was perfect.  We ordered the burger and the mushroom, gruyere pizza and then for desert we had the warm toffee cake with dates and mascarpone.  It was great!  Definitely hit the spot.  It was a relaxing atmosphere- we had an awesome waitress and the bill wasn't bad at all -  $25/person including tax and tip.  I'm definitely going back there.
author: Diane L.

description:
Came to Starbelly for brunch, since they take reservations, which can be hard to come by for bunch in the city. As someone previously mentioned the door was unmanned and they might want to consider a door host to keep things running smoothly. 

Well, there were BONES in my friend's pulled chicken sandwich. A lot of them. She didn't say anything to the waitress, which she should have, because by the time she checked in at our table everyone had finished eating, and my friend had most of her sandwich with a plate of bones next to it. She noted them, apologized and took the sandwich off the bill, but it was still a bummer. Perhaps if she had checked in sooner she could have gotten something else. 

I had the stratta only because of the wild mushroom and goat cheese in the description. When it arrived I got a block of egg bread pudding with no mushrooms or goat cheese to be found. That's great if you want to mince things or liquidate the goat cheese, but don't put it on the description unless I can find it. So, I had my cube of egg & toast, a cup of ketchup (which I hate) and some cooked fingerling potatoes.
 
Overall, brunch was EH. I understand that they only have 5 or so bunch items, but don't bother doing brunch if you can't do it right.
author: Ally O.

description:
i was excited about eating here. i've heard great things. but the minute i walked in the door and i was told it would be an hour and a half wait for a table for 3, i started having doubts. we got lucky and snatched up two seats at the bar right as a party was leaving, but still waited for our table. i saw two parties of 4 get seated before us even though we had been there a half hour before them. i wasn't happy. we ended up eating at the bar because we were sick of waiting. 
the food: the fries were decent, and my friends enjoyed the pizza they ordered. i had the lamb, and it was a fatty mess. i literally had 5 bites of edible meat. the rest was fat and bone. the grits were tasty, but the whole plate was thrown together and looked sloppy.  i left hungry and unsatisfied. 
wished i had a better experience, but i don't think i'll go back.
author: Jordan R.

description:
In brief- I could eat here everyday. It's the California cuisine of Alice Waters and Judy Rogers filtered down to the masses. Good for tourists, people with kids, locals. 

Without alcohol, plan to spend between $18-$25 per person, (inclusive of tax, tip and healthcare surcharge) for excellent food and presentation. Nice garden. Tables inside  are well-spaced. Two people could be very happy with a pizza and two salads.
author: Rocco P.

description:
PROS: Hostess at Starbelly.  She accommodated our increasing reservation size, including last minute phone calls day of.  We ended up w/ party of 9 on a Sat night and were seated promptly for a wkend.  Sadly, the good service ended at the door (see below).  Food: Really good!  Some standouts: 1) Roasted pork shoulder - yummy combination of sweet (grilled pear) and spicy (salsa verde) which complemented the pork on a bed of cheddar grits perfectly; 2) Pan roasted mussels - served with chorizo, chiles and cilantro.  Deliciously spicy and enough sauce left over for bread dunking; 3) Starbelly bacon pizza - I love arugula on pizza and this pie did not disappoint.  All in all: fresh and flavorful ingredients at very reasonable prices.

CONS:  The service.  We were treated to sub-standard service by three different wait staff haphazardly assigned to our table.  Here are some highlights:  1) We ordered the cheese and salumi combination to start and were given four (4) pieces of bread.  For nine people.  When we asked for more, it was as if we were requesting extra saffron or truffle oil.  By the time the extra bread arrived, we were done with the appetizers.  2) We ordered a bottle of wine.  When the waitress approached me to pour a glass, I asked her to start w/ the person that had ordered it so he could give it a taste, not realizing that he already had done so (again, party of nine and we were on opposite ends of the table).  Major attitude as she corrected me, and if she could have stuck me in a corner w/ a dunce cap for making such a mistake, she would have!  3) When one of the main dishes arrived, we were barked at for not clearing our table to make room.

All in all: Sorry, Starbelly - no more business from us.  Lose the attitude.
author: Andrea D.

description: Good stuff!  We made a reservation and they proceeded to make us wait another half hour....which was annoying.  But they apologized and gave us drinks on the house, which was a nice way to make it up!  Appetizers were tasty.  PIzza was great.  We will definitely be coming back here again.
author: Luci B.

description:
i tried this place for brunch yesterday for the first time. nice decor, staff, etc. unfortunately, i concur with all of the other reviews of their fritatta ... it was lukewarm and yes, it seemed pre-made (is a fritatta supposed to be pre-made or made to order?). i mean, it tasted fine and all, but it would have been a little better if it was hot and fresh.

now half way through the meal the manager asks us to move down a little bit at the bar (we were sitting right at where the servers were dropping off dirty glasses, etc). now i thought this to be a pain in the ass; however, she comp'd our whole meal and got us another round of mimosas! she clearly realized it was an inconvenience to us and she made up for it with this nice gesture.

it seems like they have some pretty affordable bottles of wine here. i think i'll definatley come back and try their pizza and enjoy a bottle of wine.
author: James J.

description: Had an amazing lunch here today.  The burgers are super juicy and delicious.  I also tried the BLT which I highly recommend as well.
author: s s.

description: OK, to give it a fair shake, it opened Tuesday and we went on Thursday & there were 7 of us.  We had 7:30 reservations and after much complaining, were seated about 8:15!  There was not any space at the bar for us to stand, so we waited out front on the sidewalk for our table.  If management can pull it together, they should do well because the kitchen did a great job!  We tried several things and everything was great.  They have great apps and they are all priced at $5 each.  We tried 3 different pizzas and they were all great and tasted quite different.  Skip the desserts.  We tried one of each and we really did not any of them, except for the peaches and ice cream.
author: Jeff W.

description: new obsession (from my late brunch today): wild mushroom pizza + a glass of pinot grigio.. TO DIE, folks! you should take a chance and savour the goodness.
author: Marc K.

description:
We had a wonderful meal at Starbelly's sister restaurant Beretta recently and we were in the neighborhood so we thought we'd give it a try last Saturday.

We arrived at 7:45p on a Saturday and the hostess said it might be 45 minutes, or it might be sooner. We ordered some wine (from a surly bartender - star, but the wine was good + star) and were seated within 10 minutes (+ star).  The waiter who took our order was very nice and friendly (+ star). We ordered the small plates of fries, mussels, wild mushrooms and the entrees of ravioli and lamb chop. The mussels came RIGHT away, like one minute after we ordered them. They were also luke warm/cold, which leads me to believe that they'd been made before, maybe a mistaken order and had been sitting there for a while?  Very disappointing. I'm also disappointed that the restaurant that would serve them like that (- star). Next came the fries. Delicious. Great dips, especially their homemade ketchup (+ star). Wild mushrooms were too salty. Ravioli was ok. The lamb chop was perfectly cooked; however, the sides along with it (wilted greens, cheesy grits, cold yams), were not as good,  still + star for the lamb. Also give them a star for the nice ambiance, decor.

Since the food was pretty uneven, I don't think we'll go back.
author: Sonia F.

description: After speaking with a manager at Starbelly regarding the slow service she promptly she apologized and promptly went to the kitchen to find our order.  After the manager's intervention our order was delivered in minutes and she returned to check everything was ok and gave us a 50% discount!  This restored my opinion of Starbelly and I am revising my rating.  I would prefer prompt service and would be happy to pay full price but the managerial response to my complaint was impressive and the food was good so I would go back and eat there again.
author: Regina O.

description: As a new hot spot they are clearly still working out the kinks and trying to manage lots of patrons, but despite the wait I have to say this was one of the most fun and fulfilling dining nights out I've had in recent memory.  Great staff, diverse menu that seemed really consistent throughout, and most importantly REASONABLE prices.  Nothing over $20 on the menu.  Finally a sensibly priced menu for the times.  Highlights were the scallops and cucumber salad.  Blue cheese pizza was way too salty, but they gave it to us on the house because of the wait.  Can't hate on that.
author: Joe B.

description:
I have been to Starbelly three times.  Today's visit was the one the makes me really doubt I will go back.  My friend ordered a beer, and after his arrived, I decided I wanted the same thing.  It took 10 minutes for my beer to arrive.  We ordered three things to split at lunch.  What really blew this meal was the timing with which the food came out.  Fries came out a full 10 minutes before anything else.  Then salad. Then another 10 minutes later the pizza.  After asking to the waiter to check on the beer first and the food later (after sitting with a bowl of fries) he said he would but basically, he didn't give a s--t.

Some of the food was good.  Fries (hot an fresh and crisp); wedge salad with green goddess dressing (actually dressing was excellent - rich but not too rich) and a mushroom pizza which turned out to be an onion pizza with a few mushrooms.  

My previous experiences were a bit better. The first time was excellent - great pizza, great sardines, great muscles, with appropriately paced and attentive service.  The second time was just ok ... service that didn't suck like today's but the waitress would have helped me have a better meal had she guided my food decisions a little.  

I may go back one more time, but i will check in with the management (if it exists) and let them know about mixed experiences and see what they can do to create a good one.
author: Robert F.

description: went for lunch today(03/30/11), weve been to this resturant a few times before, would rate it average for service and food quality. BUT today i would give it a one star for the service, as we had ordered some additional fries half way through our meal, and of course buy the time they came , our main entrees were finished. A short time later the server comes by to clear the table of earlier dishes and takes away the dipping sauces that comes with the still full basket of fries ,.  I polietly got her attention,and told her to bring some dipping sauces that comes with the fries, also ordering some new round of drinks. When the bill came, it had a charge of $1 for the new sauces.I circled this on the bill, and left a nice tip, but deducted $1 from the tip. If servers want to be this ditzy, they are only hurting themselves, and i for one wont be back, or reccommend this place.
author: michael r.

description:
We went last week. We don't live in SF although that may be changing in the near future. 

I had heard from someone that Starbelly "wasn't perfect, but it was sure nice having a decent, grownup restaurant in the neighborhood." So our expectations were kept in check. 

Perhaps it was just our server. Or Leah the hostess. Or one of the several people that stopped by our table through out the evening, but everyone was incredibly friendly without being cloying. 

I thought the food was quite good and the price-point felt appropriate: not a value-restaurant, but not overpriced by any means. 

We had the pate, the octopus, the clams, the porcetta, and the lamb cheeks. The pate was great. The clams were pretty good (my SO liked them significantly more than I did). The octopus, highly recommended by this site as well as the server, was a bit of a letdown. Not crispy enough, not flavorful enough and not all that wonderful. The lamb cheeks were good. The meat was well-flavored and the accompanying greens and grits were delicious. The porcetta was, for me, a pretty interesting dish. It's basically a pork belly and the restaurant included a good deal of the fat. In LA (and I imagine in most of SF), it's a bit odd to see that much unctuous fat on a plate. I asked the server about the reaction to the dish (I mean, let's face it, there are some very body-conscious men in the neighborhood as well as the restaurant itself). She said some people pick around the fat, others eat it. I thought it was great. Fat doesn't scare me. But I don't think the dish is for everyone. It also was well-received by the reviewers, but it wasn't hard to imagine someone freaking out over it. But the pork was delicious: not too dry and not overly seasoned. 

The chocolate doughnut is terrific. The accompanying ice cream is great and the chiles add just the right combination of interest. 

I have to say, for all the complaints people have had over the wait (it's a new, popular restaurant...call an hour and a half before and put your name on the list...at least they don't make you STAND there and wait for that long), I thought it was well worth the money, the effort and the expectation.
author: Emil W.

description:
all the pizzas are excellent.  it's always in the dough they use - and they do it just right.  

p.s. their brunch - BLT is incredible - their bacon is THICK.  which is rare to find.  

Be prepared to wait about an hour for a table.  Drinks at Lime down the street was a convenient walk down market while we wait for our table.  

if you're lookin for some good grubbin - this is the place to go - can't go wrong.
author: Megan M.

description: Good value and really tasty!  The fried clam po' boy was pretty awesome........Definitely coming back to try dinner and dessert!!!
author: Roger M.

description:
Gotta be honest...the intention was to dine at Frances, but without a reservation on a Saturday night, we were spinning the roulette wheel and we didn't win.  So.........where to go?

I remembered an article I read about the place and their communal table made from a piece of bowling alley floor.  So we spun around to Starbelly and were pleased to hear they could seat us immediately.

The main reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because the wine list didn't work for us.  We tried 5 of the reds by the glass, but none of them met our expectations (and honestly I DO NOT think we're the worst of the wine snobs out there).  We ended up ordering a bottle of Chilean red which turned out to work just fine.  But as you can imagine...this had us a bit worried about the food.

Delighted to say from here the rest of the meal was fantastic!  We ordered:
- grilled baby gems salad
- fried smelt
- roasted beets
- asparagus/crab soup
- pork with wilted greens and grits
- affigado dessert

All really fantastic - but my favorites were the salad, smelt and beets.   Next time I would add the pate and roasted chicken which looked amazing...

My only other issue?  The service was a bit too fast.  Everything must have been put into the kitchen at the same time...so I felt a bit rushed.  Next time I'll ask them to stagger the order so I can enjoy the dining experience even more!
author: Patti W.

description:
My new favorite place!

After eating here about six times in the past two month I have yet to find anything I don't like about this place! The food, the atmosphere and the service are all outstanding! 

Pizzas have a nice, thin crust and are delicious. Several unique combinations as well as the classic margherita. 

Pasta has a wonderful handmade texture and flavor and I like how they use jalapeno for spice rather than red chili. It gives the dishes heat with a fresh flavor rather than the stale heat you get with dried red chili.

The crab louie salad is the best thing on the lunch menu hearty, fresh and tons of flavor! That and a glass of wine is the perfect lunch!     

I have not been disappointed by anything i've had yet! In every dish you can taste the quality of the fresh ingredients! Nice wine list which pairs very nicely with all of their dishes!

The pot de creme is outstanding, with just a sprinkle of sea salt. Its the kind of thing that makes you want to eat forever! 

And the service adds to the quality of the meal. Everyone is friendly and attentive. The one and only problem i had was taken care of quickly and professionally and i couldn't be more pleased; i found a hair in my salad once. The waiter notified the chef who came out  immediately. He took responsibility for it (eventhough it wasn't his fault, the guy was bald!) , appologized and offered to make me a new one, or make me something different. And, they also comp'ed my drinks!  

Dinner time can get a little crowded and the wait can be quite long; but its a good sign that they're doing something right that makes people want to wait outside for an hour to eat here!

My hat's off Starbelly!
author: e p.

description: this place sucks.  crummy, overconfident, snotty service.  overpriced & over-salted food.  and they forgot to put in the order for one of our entrées!  one of the worst restaurant experiences I've had in SF.
author: Saul S.

description: I ate here for the 1st time last night & everything was incredbly great! They made a simple favorite, bread & olive oil better than I've ever had. Great pizza, but what you really must try is the crab hushpuppies! We're still talking about them & dreaming of the next time. One more must try is the Pimm's Cup cocktail - very delicious & different. Enjoy!
author: Tammy B.

description: This is an incredible SF gem.  Dishes are healthful, creative and deliver in flavor and complexity!  Prices are reasonable and the wine list is exciting.  A very rare combination for a neighborhood spot.  Although everyone around us was devouring the unique choices of pizzas, I found that the Prather Ranch burger with avocados and blue cheese was simply a monument!  This is a solid restaurant ran by a knowledgeable and friendly staff, and  is here to stay...
author: Fabrice H.

description: The smoked duck and arugula salad was especially good.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: If you like ribs.....RUN to Starbelly's!!! They were the BEST ribs I've had in years and I've eaten my fair share of ribs. The meat fell off the bone and the sauce was like nothing I'd ever tasted before. We also had sides of brussel sprouts and warmed spinach that were amazing also. I was tempted to try some dessert but I was so full and satisfied I'll have to wait until my next visit!
author: Martin F.

description:
The food was great, we went with some friends and each of us were happy with what we ordered. I had the pizza which was delicious, and just the right amount of food.

They have a nice selection of beers and the space is well laid out. The back patio looked nice, it was too cold to sit out there, but on a warm night, or with some heat lamps added it could be great out there.

Our dessert was truely amazing, we got the caramel cake, it was so good we almost ordered a second one. The service was good as well, I would definetly go back.
author: Maureen B.

description:
Maybe because it's later (around 8:45 p.m.) Sunday night, and wine by the glass is always a gamble, my first experience at Starbelly is disappointing.  I hear it is staffed well, so despite it isn't love at first sight, I will return for second chance.

Parking is always a bitch in that neighborhood, so I make my own space next to a real one in the bank parking lot. (Any officer would see the extra line if he used his imagination.)  It works.

Upon entering, chance serves my friend and I well, and we are seated at a well appointed little table, right next to the giant window that looks onto the patio, which, on a nice sunny day, is the ideal brunch spot, I imagine.  Thankfully, despite the wet and cold out there now, it's warm and cozy inside, even next to our big window.  Bon Iver's "Skinny Love" is meandering on the soundwaves, and my ears smile. Good soundtrack all through the meal. I'm happy I can hear it.

We each order a glass of Primitivo del Salento that is sadly "uncaricato," (uncharged).  We're not starving, but want something to spread the ribs and tantalize the tongue.  I'm an adoring fan of most things Southern, and am bemused when Bay Area chefs attempt a fusion of all-things-fresh and Californian with the iconically heavy, tasty soul food.  So of course, I order the Dungeness Crab Hushpuppies with a louie sauce.  For a fusion, they're perfect! For a hush puppy, they're perfect!  Crisp, fresh out of the fryer, and best yet, filled with succulent crab meat.  They are the highlight of my meal, and worth capitalizing.

My friend orders the roasted wild mushrooms with a great levain crouton and sunny side up duck egg.  Innovative dish, but the shrooms are stinkin' burnt - so long, Flavor! Pity, it's mushroom season.   And dare I say it?  In my opinion, the dish lacks salt.  Two points for texture - the duck egg saves the night.

We share a pizza that also comes out a bit worse for the flame...I'm sure the subtleties of aged blue cheese and pear would come across more clearly if my tongue wasn't so focused on a burnt, dry crust.  Bummer.  The Spanish ham, on the other hand - kudos to that!  Tasty, moist and amply covers the top of the pizza.

Dessert.  Rosemary shortbread cookies accompany a salted caramel pots de creme.  Once some of the abundant sea salt is dusted off the top, the pots de creme is indulgent and everything one can hope caramel pudding can ever be.  The saline theme is a bit over-bearing when it reoccurs too heavily on the shortbreads.  Nevertheless, crunchy bits of rosemary in the buttery cookie keep my mouth wanting more, and as long as I skim below the surface of the pots de creme, I am quite satisfied with cookie and pudding.

Ya get another shot, Starbelly.  Only one try on a Sunday night is not fair.  Here's to a brighter second go-round. May you shine brightly.
author: britney b.

description:
Went back for lunch (have only been for lunch).
- uncrowded for lunch - perfect.  Easy to go to by yourself as well.
- beautiful place with good food and *really* good prices.  I think it's the value part that I like.  I love that you can get $3 10oz beers (I don't need a large 16 oz for lunch, so that is perferct.  Please don't ever take that off the menu).
- Food is solid.  I wouldn't say amazing but with the price point the way it is, I think it's great.  
- Had the side salad, hot-dog, and a beer.  Salad was terrific, hot dog was ok (I'm just not a hot-dog person).  
- This is the second time I've been here where I've left thinking about, of all things, the salads - they are great.
- Nice service.
- This place is *perfect* for someone looking to take their business clients.  I don't know of many other spots in the area that fit that bill.

Suggestions to the owners:
- add some description to that chicken sandwich..sounds dry/dull the way it is written.
- keep in mind the business/client customer lunches as your place is great for that.
- maybe add some specials on purchasing wine during the day - not sure how you're going to sell any bottles during the day at those prices...maybe add more options to the by-the-glass.
- don't mess with the 10oz beer...it's perfect and gets folks drinking and enjoing and buying.
- on that note, your beer selection is under-rated.
- one that outdoor patio is open, hype-it.




Just a solid place, I think.  It's not 'amazing' food but I'm not paying a high price either.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
I have been to Starbelly twice now, and everything has been just top-notch. Let me start with the 

PEOPLE

who are just so damn lovely. There is Malia, the gracious, generous general manager, who comped our table twice for NO reason (maybe because she is just that fabulous?). There is Kris (Chris?), our (hot) server, twice, who was attentive and polite and also had some kick-ass old-school glasses. There was the hostess, whose name escapes me, who sat us within 4 minutes of our arrival even though our party of 9 arrived in bits and pieces. (None of this "we can't sit you until the rest of your party is here" business.) So, the people are wonderful.

THE FOOD

Is inventive and delicious and sometimes adventurous. The octopus...who doesn't like a little polpi? The corn dogs, ditto, and the pizzas. Even the spaghetti with bacon, which I ordered with slight trepidation because I am an asshole pasta snob, was al dente with the right amount of salt and sauce.

THE PRICES

[Starbelly, stop reading now.]...could, frankly, be higher for what you get. I just hope they don't creep up there, as I love this place and I don't ever want to be priced out of its goodness.

Definitely give this place a try. And if you already have and didn't have the best experience, give it another shot. It's a new restaurant, sometimes they have to work out the kinks.
author: Joe D.

description: This was my first time at Star Belly and I have to say, the atmosphere, decor, and service was incredible! However, the food was mediocre at best. I decided to first try the fries with the dipping sauces and found them to be heavy and a little greasy. Although they tasted OK and were plentiful, the price was a little hefty. I also tried the pizza margherita with fresh mozzarella & basil and burrata. At $16, I found that it was undercooked and arrived at our table on the cold side. the waitstaff again was incredible and removed the pizza from our bll after arriving at the same conclusion. Still undecided as to wether or not I'll return.
author: Michael A.

description: Awesome space - reclaimed wood throughout - fun old bowling alley communal table.  Had an amazing brunch on the big back deck, lots of sunshine.  Donuts were delish, along with the tasty mimosas, BLT with Egg - Pizza with egg and cilantro was great too.  Easy to get into...will definitely go back!
author: Lori T.

description:
What a great spot!  
Went there for lunch today. The staff were nice and the atmosphere's fantastic. We sat inside but there's also a really nice outdoor patio area.
I had the pulled chicken, jalapeno & radicchio slaw sandwich which was super yummy!  My friend had a pizza which she loved.  To drink I had the honey lavender lemonade and this was amazing! 
Can't wait to come back for more and I'm recommending this place to all my friends!
author: Sarah T.

description: Start with the pear salad, share the wild mushroom and gruyere pizza and move on to the signature starbelly spaghetti!   Cleanse your pallate with passion fruit sorbet and cap it off with a late harvest Zinfandel! Done.... Definitely a no brainer! Guaranteeed satisfaction every single night!  Service is excellent, and pretty easy to get a table if you're a late eater like me!
author: Toni C.

description: After two visits, I'm still not totally sold, but the fare here is pretty good.  The service has been somewhat inconsistent, but always pleasant, which goes a long way towards making up for long waits/wrong orders.  I'm not convinced the prices are on parity with the quality of the food, but all in all a good restaurant.
author: Kevin O.

description: Overall, I would not recommend Starbelly.  The food I had was decent - except for the mussels which were overcooked and my palate did not like the ground meat, garlic and peppers with them.  Unfortunately the crowded tables, price and lack of originality put the experience below my threshold for value.
author: matt d.

description: I have to report.  I was THE BIGGEST FAN when this gem opened but I need to disappoint my fellow fans.  DO NOT SIT AT THE DEUCES behind the communal table.  For my last three visits (over the passed few months) the service has been absolutely horrible, consistently horrible.  At each one of the visits (always sitting at one of the 3 deuces referred to) we waited for greeting (had to ask for service), waited for drinks (had to ask for service, most recently turned to the bartender as the bottle of wine had been sitting an arms length for 10 min), food ordered was wrong, accompaniments requested were wrong, food always delicious, poured our own water and wine, ran out of sparkling, waited for check to be picked up (had to ask for service).   I must be clear, this is a service issue, the food and bar are outstanding.  Unfortunately, if I am to re-visit at all, it will not be with my partner.
author: Allen V.

description: Better than I imagined. The management was present and approachable. The food was excellent, the pizza was amazing, great thin crust and the bacon was unbelievable!!! I enjoyed a beer on tap that was made for SF beer week, a unique treat. Overall, I can't wait to go back as the menu is fresh and seasonal!!!
author: Ashley B.

description:
Tried Starbelly last night and had a fabulous dining experience. From the hostess who kindly and patiently stayed on the phone to help us figure out where to park (to park for over 2 hrs, next to impossible),  to our server, to the food. Five stars for sure.

Wish I knew our server's name: she was great. Recommended fantastic beer (Samuel Smith's Taddy Porter,) gave a  taste of another she heard us talking about, was attentive throughout  our meal, in spite of increasing crowds, and then brought our friend - whose birthday we were celebrating - a b-day pot de creme (yum!!)

The squash pizza is great, and the three of us had more than enough to eat with the popcorn clams, grilled sardines, and the pizza.

We can't wait to go back to Starbelly.
author: Beth F.

description: we started off our memorial day wknd with dinner at starbelly last night!  we tried the pork shoulder, mussels, mache & strawberry salad, spaghetti, and cornmeal breaded oysters, a bottle of wine and a glass of summer blush (very refreshing)!  we had a great time catching up and eating/drinking in a lively atmosphere.  the only thing missing was a fish entree.  since one of my friends was on a strict diet, the list of items she could eat was limited.  but she made due with the few seafood items on the menu and they accommodated her by removing the chorizo from the mussels.  the staff was great, checking in on us to make sure we had everything we wanted and always making sure we weren't too cold since we were sitting by the door leading to the patio.  starbelly is definitely a place i would go to again and recommend to friends.
author: Vic S.

description:
I have been to Starbelly 3 times in the past two weeks. The pulled chicken sandwich is wonderful! I am also a fan of the bacon and pepper pizza. 

Their beer menu is very unique. If you enjoy tea, the first been on their domestic list (Japanese) is wonderful.
author: Karen B.

description: This is a place to have fresh food you can count on.  Most of what I've eaten stands out for it's flavor a simplicity.  The broccoli rabe with garlic and red chile; a pizza with arugula and goat cheese; and that pasta with fruity-fresh olive oil, chili and a fresh tomato sauce that brought us to........  I tasted the bacon {those pigs musta been relaxed and happy; much more flavor than salt or fat.  The reeeeal deal.  Guess the best part is knowing that I can go with family, consulting clients, best budds, and hip-outta-towners.  Everyone for every occasion.  Bummer?   The fries have been uneven.  Ala carte, they're even and delicious. On our plates, they've been often too well done with too many tiny pieces.  So many other dishes are consistent.  Yet, great fries are alluring......
author: Paula H.

description:
new places always have slow service, particularly if they have good food.

i think what makes this place 5 stars for me is that the food is really on par or better than places that charge much more. i have a soft spot for $10-$15 entree places that put a lot of care and thought into their menu and this place is exactly that.
author: R E.

description: Food was tasty but not incredible. There was so much hype about this place that it didn't live up to it. But when you take away the buzz, it's a good restaurant that is a great addition to the Castro. We tried a little bit of everything and the pizzas are the definitely best tasting dishes. Staff was great.
author: Mike A.

description: The restaurant is really difficult to see from the street, but once you find it and enter, it is warm, has really detailed accents (check out the cardboard lamps, really cool) and a mix of private tables and communal seating. The hostess was friendly and our server was incredibly attentive and warm. We started with the Starbelly Pizza Margherita, which was a thin crust topped with superb extras like bacon and a special aioli- highly recommend. The grilled peaches with Fog Mountain Cheese were good, but the peaches themselves weren't very present in the overall taste. I had the half roasted chicken for dinner, and though the chicken itself was prepared phenomenally, the dish overall was a little bland. I tasted the Starbelly spaghetti and absolutely LOVED it though-a nice little kick of jalepeno makes it a unique dish. Also tried and loved the Local flounder- a light and delicious white fish topped with prawns. Overall everything was satisfying (great portion sizes, appealing menu items) but the flavors could have been a bit stronger. Also had the Zinfandel blend wine- great. I would try again.
author: Jillian R.

description: I just tried Starbelly today for brunch.  One of the most simple dishes was actually the tastiest.  The fried egg sandwich was fantastic.  The clam poor boy was great as well.  Light and crispy.  We were also happy to have lots of affordable wine options.  I'll be back to try dinner there in the next few months.
author: Anthony C.

description: The interior and lay out is great, as is the ability to call ahead and put your name on the list. The food is A-ok like the rating says. The chicken was undercooked, and the pizza toppings slid off the crust and lacked any punch. We commented on the chicken and the waitress gave us feedback from the chef that the chicken was brined so didn't need to be cooked as long (or something of the sort). It was def pink on the inside. The waitstaff was pleasant as was the ambiance and beer selection, but I will continue to visit their other restaurant instead. Another 'hotspot' of the month.
author: david c.

description:
Absolutely loved Starbelly. Have been twice and on both visits left extremely satisfied.

For starters, it's about time the Castro had a first-rate, chef-driven restaurant. When was the last time they changed the menu at 2223? 2003? And Catch? Eureka? They serve a purpose, but it isn't culinary.

Started off with just a taste of the New Belgium 1554 dark beer. All the taste of Guinness and beyond without the weight. 

I had the roasted mushrooms with the levain croutons and sunnyside-up duck egg for the second time and it didn't disappoint. I had a double-order of the clams as an entree along with a side of the brussel sprouts and bacon. To Caroline I., no offense, but honey, if you can't tell the difference between a clam strip, an oyster and calamari the restaurant isn't the problem. 

The salted caramel pot-de-creme was absolutely D I V I N E.  Texture: superb. Intensity of flavor: just right. Slight savory taste of the shortbread- fantastic. What made it even better was the bartender's recommendation of the Italian dry vermouth, Dillon, to go with it. Flawless combo.

The beverages, two starters, two entrees, one side and the dessert came to under $100.  I dare you to eat and drink that well for that much in an "upscale" eatery anywhere else in the city. 

Starbelly. Definitely one of the ten best to open in '09.
author: Lorenzo G.

description: I've been to Starbelly on numerous occasions.  The food is good (the burger is one of the best in the city!).  However, the service was horrible during my last trip here.  The wait staff was extremely inattentive and somewhat rude.  I don't think I'll be heading back here for table service anytime soon.
author: N T.

description:
it was ok. i'd go back, if invited. 
what i liked best about it were the glasses; really nice water and wine glasses. i want them. 
the worst thing about it was the fact that the wooden bench was sticky. if i hadn't been wearing work pants it could've been very upsetting. 
the food was ok. i didn't get to order what i wanted. (i never would've ordered mortadella pizza!) 
the server was fabulous.
author: goevie d.

description: I had brunch here this weekend, and I will be dropping by again sometime in the future.  The pizza was delicious.  Thin crust with a nice texture and good flavor.  I also had the Bibb salad, which unfortunately didn't come with a bib, but it was mmm, mmm good!
author: Peter S.

description:
love, love, love this place!  we live in the neighborhood and frequent this place a couple of times a month and have never been disappointed.  we've never had a wait (but we have gone on "off peak" times).  the service has always been way above average.  and the food...amazing!  brunch or dinner...you can't go wrong.

why only four stars?  my one gripe is that the portions tend to be way small for the prices.  esp. with the small plates.  however...the two desserts we had were both decent size. 

and something else to note...it does indeed tend to get pretty loud in there, so if yr sensitive to that (which i am not), heads up.
author: Sarah and Amanda G.

description:
Alright so let me start off by saying this place would have gotten way more stars had it just been based on food alone.   That certainly was not the issue here.  I had lunch there today and i ordered what i thought was going to be a pretty basic clam po boy and fries.  There was lots of clams with a delicious old bay aioli, on  a deliciously toasted roll.  The fries were also pretty tasty with a delicious dipping sauce.   
The service however left a lot to be desired.  My server once my food was dropped off did not return to my table, even though she walked by repeatedly without even a look or like she was even concerned that i was there.  A mere 5 feet away from me though were 2 guys at the bar that she couldn't go to enough.  I finally had to ask another server for some more dipping sauce for my fries, because  i had been out for almost 10 minutes.  The same server also cleared my plate and asked me if i wanted any dessert.  The only time my actual server came back was to drop off the check and compliment my shoes.  I will definitely go back because the food was quite tasty, but some work definitely needs to be done about the service.
author: larry w.

description: I love this place, from the food to the decor my boyfriend and I have made it "our" place :) I feel like Ive already tried everything on the menu but I have to say the tomato soup with cheesy bread- to die for. The burger was pretty amazing as well. The service is great, always had very nice waiters that are on top of it. I cant wait till the outdoor patio opens up but Im loving the ambiance inside. Great place!
author: Kathi B.

description: Food has been inconsistent lately. Seasoning is occasionally off, but the spaghetti is still a winning dish when you're craving comfort food.
author: Terry P.

description: More like 4.5 stars.  Excellent pizzas, fried mussels, soup, and lavender lemonade.  Great atmosphere and outdoor patio in the back.  Awesome wood walls and common tables.  Also appreciate the cool pendant lamps.  Great waiters.  Only reason why it's not 5 stars is because there were a few soso dishes such as the chicken and pomme frites.
author: Yvonne H.

description:
Really, we hit it on a good night, had superior service, and happened to order the best of the menu.

The porchetta rose among the rest as one of the best dished I've ever consumed. Between the perfect combo of herbs/spices and the perfectly roasted state in which it arrived at our table, it was unforgettable. It makes me want to go 5-stars, but it was really the only dish that was absolutely superb.

The pate, fried oysters, and mini corn dogs were all delicious and unique in their own way. The lamb cheek was good, but left a little to be desired in execution. Both the corn and grits (side plates) were  excellent. I wouldn't go back without ordering them again.
author: Matt B.

description:
went to their menu tasting last night, i gotta say - they nailed it.  perfect addition to this neighborhood - casual atmosphere with amazing food that's bound to leave both your belly and pocket book happy.  reasonably priced and just enough choices that you're not overwhelmed.  this neighborhood needed a restaurant like this.  try the half chicken, the amazing spaghetti, and DO NOT leave w/out ordering dessert.  can't wait to check out brunch! 

ps they grow their own herb/spices - that's pretty awesome.
author: la boca J.

description: Great service and solid value but the food was inconsistent. Soggy corn pizza and a pork chop that was 50% fat is not appetizing. Maybe it was an off night. The grilled peach salad was tasty though. May try it again.
author: David W.

description:
Wonderful new space and great location.  Staff very friendly and gave us good suggestions.  We were there with 8 people at 5PM and loved the Gazpacho, fabulous mussels and Caesar salad.   We enjoyed two different pizzas and the warm olive plate.  The wine from Italy was a bargain at $22/bottle and beer for 10 oz. just $4!
Patio not open yet.
author: Carole K.

description:
I wrote this last week and for some reason it didn't show up on the list of reviews.  Let's try it again........................

My partner and I went to Starbelly yesterday and we were not impressed.
The food came out late, at different times and the waiter was not attentive and barely apologized.   The food that finally did arrive was fine.  I will say, the manager was very kind and apologized for delay and took care of the tab.   When you work so hard during the week you want to make the most of your wkend.  This was disappointing and a waste of our time.  We probably should have just gone to a diner.  Thank you to the manager for being so understanding.
author: Will W.

description:
OK, I'll be frank up front.  I think I'm the wrong demographic for Starbelly...it's definitely something for the 30-somethings (and under.)  It has all the hallmarks of the trendy, youth-oriented restaurants springing up around the city:  no real decor to speak of; reservations only for large groups, so a solo diner is relegated to an uncomfortable backless stool at a communal table; extremely loud (but good for eavesdropping); a mishmash of small plates which are good for grazing with drinks but difficult to build an actual meal from.
The saving grace is the quality of the food.  I had an heirloom tomato gazpacho which was absolutely delicious and a house-made chicken liver pate that was amazingly good.  Unfortunately, the ambiance makes it difficult to enjoy and appreciate the good food in a manner befitting it.
author: Tom R.

description: AMAZING place with a chill vibe and wonderful food.  Came here last night and not only did we have buratta and pate... we had 2 servings of that for 4 people in addition to the entrees and other small plates.  Sit outside if you can... you'll forget you're in the city and be whisked away to a calm garden.  Spaghetti--the noodles were cooked just right (also thicker than normal spaghetti) and the consistency was so perfect (just enough bite).  Chicken with risotto--mmmm... its laced with butter but so tasty.  I love this place.  Its going to be my new neighborhood joint...
author: F S.

description: Though we had an 8:30 Friday night reservation for 5, we waited nearly an hour to be seated.  All the time we waited, the staff kept assuring us that it would be "15 more minutes, tops".  At no time did anyone offer us anything to drink or eat while we waited, but we did hear lots of apologies. As we discussed whether to leave and find another place to eat, the hostess practically begged us not to, assuring us that "I want to make it up to you."  She seemed sincere and she convinced us to give them another chance -- so we stayed.  In retrospect this was a mistake.  The only thing that they did was they brought us a bowl of complimentary cold french fries and 2 other small appetizers that we didn't order, and that was it.  After the fries came nobody stopped by to see if we were satisfied with how they'd turned it around.  Nothing we ordered was comped. Not even a glass of wine.  So disappointing.
author: Adam C.

description: This place is around the corner from me, and I really wish the food and the service were more 'consistent'.  I love the decor, and the menu, and on occasion, the service and the food.  That's the problem, it's really 'hit or miss' with this place.  I've taken friends from out of town here, and we had one of the best meals ever.  The service was exceptional, and everything we tasted (most items on the menu), was really wonderful.  I was a hero, and hit the mark on selecting a great place.  I've been back many times since, and Starbelly has never been able to re-create that wonderful experience.  The food is good at best, and the service is OK, neither being 'bad' but not wowing me in any way.  I'll be back because it is so close, and I really want it to be fabulous, and I think it could be in so many ways, mainly from a management and staffing perspective.  Most of what doesn't "wow" me, would probably be forgotten if the service was phenomenal.
author: Vance P.

description: i stopped by last week after a 6 month hiatus (had some bad opening experiences with them).  had a very good, neighborhood meal.  it's a bit expensive for what you get, but i'm really happy they've ironed out their food and service startup issues and are doing well.
author: Dora F.

description: the pizza crust was a lil soggy. the salted caramel pot de creme, rosemary cornmeal cookies was great. the service and atmosphere was nice.
author: NY Y.

description: I love this place.  The servers were attentive knowledgeable and not intrusive. Good service.  Friendly. Attentative and the pizza was good.  No, not Brooklyn good or East Coast amazing but the quality was fantastic!
author: Alison H.

description: Ok, I have to write an update since I gave this place a second try today, this time for brunch.  My friend's burger was ok, but the fries were freezing cold and had to be sent back.  And, that was the best part of the meal. My pizza (squash with pumpkin seeds and black garlic) was absolutely inedible. It was tasteless and dripping with oil, literally. Don't misunderstand...I'm not one of these people who blots the oil from my pizza or anything like that...what I mean to say is that it was literally as if they took a half a cup of oil and dumped it onto the crust in lieu of anything that might have given it actual flavor. Not wanting to waste it, I took half of it home, only to throw it away after I picked up a slice and the plate was filled with oil. Yuck. Starbelly, a copious quantity of olive oil on pizza does not mean that it will taste good. I will not be back after this episode. My stomach still hurts from lunch...and I'm pissed off at  having spent $14 on an inedible pizza.
author: SL N.

description: While this place looked very hip and very San Francisco, the food was really bad. I've never been so inclined to say how much I disliked a restaurant before. Even the dessert was awful. Don't waste your money.
author: Joy D.

description: This place has a lot going for it, including the relatively low prices.  Its great to be able to order an appetizer of popcorn clams for only $5 and have it turn out to be tender and delicious.   The cesar was a bit disappointing, very lightly dressed and the lettuce had seen its better days.  The spaghetti with jalapeno and porchetta was pretty good although the pasta itself was slightly mushy.  However, all was forgiven when biting into the amazing peanut butter ice cream sandwich for desert. (although I guess Humphrey Slocombe had more to do with this).  Definitely a nice place to drop into when its not crazy crowded, which is possible since they serve all day long.
author: David T.

description: Starbelly has a unique and reasonably priced menu with a great variety to fill your belly and quench your thirst .  The drinks accommodate all, from the underage to the lush, offering a wide selection of refreshing virgin concoctions as well as fun cocktails, and various wine and beer.  My date and I shared the clam popcorn, chicken liver pate, mussels, marinated Japanese cucumber salad, and the spaghetti.  The clam was more of a super crunchy batter than anything else, while the pate was overwhelming in portion as it was rich.  I enjoyed the salad because I love Japanese cucumbers and they paired well with olives, tomatoes and feta cheese.  The mussels were average, since the broth that accompanied them wasn't as praiseworthy as others I've had elsewhere.  However, my date and I both agreed that the spaghetti tasted fresh and delicious, with just enough basil.  As for the drinks, I prefer the champagne cocktail over the calimocho.  My date wanted to try the fig crumble with caramel balsamic ice cream which was interesting but not so indulgent.  Overall, nice space of wood panels, a communal table and a causal atmosphere with an under construction back patio that will be exceptional for sunny days.  Three stars from the belly tonight, but awaiting five stars in the near future.
author: Linda P.

description: Excellent dinner! Very good service! Waiters are very efficient and polite. Nice setting. Not too noisy. You can actually have a conversation over dinner, rare these days, most restaurants are so noisy. What else would anyone need? Definitely recommend.
author: Frances G.

description: Great menu, well-sourced food. All 4 of our servers were surly, impatient, and rude. Long delays in getting even water and our food arrived 40 minutes after we placed the order. We have so many great restaurants in San Francisco, why not go where you  are welcome?
author: Margaret R.

description: Had a great time hanging out on the back patio - cool ambiance and really great food.  We ordered up a slew of dishes and ate family style.  The scallops had a really tasty sauce, the pate was fantastic, and the duck was very tender.  Desserts were a real surprise, the pot de creme was knock out and the toffee cake had an amazing caramel sauce to it.  All in all a great meal - not one dish I didn't like.  Service was a bit slow at times, but we weren't in a rush and it felt very relaxed.
author: Alex K.

description: Convivial atmosphere, good service and tasty food. We came the weekend of the Folsom St. Fair for a friend's birthday and with reservations it didn't take too long to seat 7 of us. Be sure to ask about portions if you're sharing- our server was very helpful in explaining the sizes or salads and appetizers- the fig salad was tiny but the grits w/ greens were so delicious and a nice big size. We shared 3 pizzas as a main course. Warm toffee cake and Humphry Slocombe ice cream for dessert! I agree with another reviewer that you can absolutely have a great dinner at a reasonable price without breaking the bank here if you share and choose carefully. Will be back.
author: Aileen T.

description: This is a great place to put on your "regular" rotation both for dinner and brunch. It is affordable, casual and appealing enough to warrant multiple visits. The interior is attractive with recycled wood and metal shelving features as well as an impressive, long communal table making efficient use of the space (and making it more likely you get seated within a reasonable wait), and the service is friendly and attentive. The food itself is very satisfying (particularly for the reasonable prices) and yet it has a neighborhood-bistro lack of preciousness.
author: Ruth M.

description: been here once. got a burger and a strawberry cooler. both were awesome. the burger is a serious contender, though i still think the NOPA burger is better. i really like the fact that they have a bunch of fun "cooler" type non-alcoholic drinks. very refreshing and delicious. also shared an apricot doughnut. pretty good. in conclusion, if i wasn't moving to LA i would go back here more than once.
author: Geoff B.

description: I had a very lovely and indulgent lunch here a few weeks ago. Whenever I find a restaurant in San Francisco that has an outdoor patio--and a cute one, at that--I get all giddy, like I'm being admitted into a secret club. I had the fried oyster po' boy, which was crisp, fresh, and not at all greasy or heavy. The waitress recommended the herby and sweet jasmine tea "mocktail," which didn't disappoint. Quality food and ambience, pleasant waitstaff, and reasonable prices (for lunch, at least). I would definitely come back to try their dinner menu.
author: Tammy C.

description: Had dinner there last night with girlfriends and we ordered the chicken liver pate, burrata, hush puppies and drinks for starters.  My only criticism is that my drink was too strong (it was orange flavored), but that's really no big deal at all.  I struggled to choose between the blue cheese fig pizza and the chicken rotis ... but the super sweet waitress (short blonde hair) told me straight off to order the blue and it was outstanding.  My other g-friend ordered the spaghetti (another winner), the pizza margherita was ordered by the pregnant one (good but nothing memorable), and the other g-friend ordered the burger which she said was OK because the bread wasn't fully toasted.  But then we ended with three desserts...the Slocombe ice cream, the pot de creme, and the olive oil ice cream.  All were really VERY good.
